original: dang ; dbugs dbyung ba dran pa'o //
analyzed: dang ; dbugs dbyung ba dran pa'o //
translated: and mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation.

original: mkhas pa'i dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mkhas pa'i dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the object of the learned?

original: de yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: It is also fivefold:

original: phung po la mkhas pa dang / khams la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: phung po la mkhas pa dang / khams la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: the aggregates, the elements, the sense-fields, dependent origination, and what is possible and impossible.

original: nyon mongs pa rnam par gcod pa'i dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam par gcod pa'i dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the object of the elimination of the defilements?

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is twofold:

original: 'jig rten pa'i dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'o //
translated: mundane and supramundane.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The mundane is twofold:

original: sa 'og ma rnams kyi zhi ba nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sa 'og ma rnams kyi zhi ba nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: the calmness of the lower stages.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The supramundane is fourfold:

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: the noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of the origin of suffering, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, and the noble truth of the way leading to the cessation of suffering.

original: de ltar dmigs pa bzhi po de dag ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur ba'i thabs kyis dmigs pa yin pas na /
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa bzhi po de dag ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur ba'i thabs kyis dmigs pa yin pas na /
translated: These four objects are the objects of the means of freedom from attachment to the mundane and supramundane paths.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba'i thabs kyis dmigs pa'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba'i thabs kyis dmigs pa'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called the objects of the means of perfect transcendence of all suffering.

original: de dag na sems gnas pa'i dngos po de dmigs pa de dag la dmigs te skye ba nas /
analyzed: de dag na sems gnas pa'i dngos po de dmigs pa de dag la dmigs te skye ba nas /
translated: The nature of the object of the mind's abiding on those stages is as follows:

original: des ni dmigs pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni dmigs pa bstan to //
translated: This explains the object.

original: sa de dag na dmigs pa de dag la dmigs te skye ba sems gnas pa'i dngos po de'i ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: sa de dag na dmigs pa de dag la dmigs te skye ba sems gnas pa'i dngos po de'i ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of the object of the mind's abiding on those stages, which is the object of those objects?

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa ste /
translated: It is the knowledge of the four noble truths.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: And what is that like?

original: rnal 'byor ba dang po dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la zhugs pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba dang po dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la zhugs pa /
translated: When the beginner yogi cultivates the four establishments of mindfulness, he enters the four noble truths.

original: de nyid yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhis brtan par byas pa des rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgoms pas ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de'i ngo bo nyid ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa yin pas na /
analyzed: de nyid yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhis brtan par byas pa des rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgoms pas ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de'i ngo bo nyid ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa yin pas na /
translated: The essence of that is the knowledge of the four noble truths, because that person who has stabilized those four right efforts by means of the four bases of supernatural powers cultivates the four bases of supernatural power and perfects meditative stabilization.

original: de'i phyir sems gnas pa'i dngos po de'i ngo bo nyid ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems gnas pa'i dngos po de'i ngo bo nyid ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the essence of that basis of mental stability should be understood as the knowledge of the four noble truths.

original: de la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of the four noble truths?

original: sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa dang / lam bsgom pa shes pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa dang / lam bsgom pa shes pa ste /
translated: It is the knowledge of fully understanding suffering, abandoning its origin, manifesting its cessation, and cultivating the path.

original: de yang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis bsdus @108b pa'i sems gnas pa'i dngos po dang / sems gnas pa'i dngos po des sdug bsngal yongs su shes par byed /
analyzed: de yang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis bsdus @108b pa'i sems gnas pa'i dngos po dang / sems gnas pa'i dngos po des sdug bsngal yongs su shes par byed /
translated: Moreover, that is included within serenity and insight, and by means of that basis of mental stability, one fully understands suffering, abandons its origin,

original: kun 'byung spong bar byed /
analyzed: kun 'byung spong bar byed /
translated: manifests its cessation, and cultivates the path.

original: 'gog pa mngon du byed /
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon du byed /
translated: One realizes cessation.🔽One cultivates the path.

original: lam sgom par byed pas na de'i phyir de ni bden pa shes pa zhes bya'o //🔽de la re zhig yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po sdug bsngal gyi bden pa shes pa'i yongs su shes pa'i dngos po bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: lam sgom par byed pas na de'i phyir de ni bden pa shes pa zhes bya'o // de la re zhig yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po sdug bsngal gyi bden pa shes pa'i yongs su shes pa'i dngos po bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, it is called the knowledge of the truths.🔽In this regard, the three aspects of the object of knowledge are taught in terms of the object of knowledge of the truth of suffering, which is the first of the four truths.

original: de yongs su shes pa'i dngos po ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid so sor rig pa dang / de la gang zag bdag med pa dang / chos bdag med par shes pa'i yongs su shes pa'i dngos po rnam pa gsum ston to //
analyzed: de yongs su shes pa'i dngos po ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid so sor rig pa dang / de la gang zag bdag med pa dang / chos bdag med par shes pa'i yongs su shes pa'i dngos po rnam pa gsum ston to //
translated: The object of knowledge of the truth of suffering is taught in terms of the three aspects of the object of knowledge: the knowledge of the characteristics of the truth of suffering, the knowledge of the person as selfless, and the knowledge of phenomena as selfless.

original: de la yongs su shes pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgom pa'i gnas skabs kyi shes pa gang gis sdug bsngal bden pa'i mtshan nyid so sor rig pa dang / de la gang zag bdag med pa dang / chos bdag med par shes pa bden pa shes pa'i yongs su shes pa gang yin pa shes pa de ni yongs su shes pa'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la yongs su shes pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgom pa'i gnas skabs kyi shes pa gang gis sdug bsngal bden pa'i mtshan nyid so sor rig pa dang / de la gang zag bdag med pa dang / chos bdag med par shes pa bden pa shes pa'i yongs su shes pa gang yin pa shes pa de ni yongs su shes pa'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: The object of complete understanding is the knowledge of the four truths, which is the knowledge that arises in the context of cultivating the four bases of supernatural powers, that individually cognizes the characteristics of the truth of suffering, the selflessness of persons, and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de la phyin ci log gi gnas yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la phyin ci log gi gnas yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The complete understanding of the basis of error is🔽the knowledge that arises in the context of cultivating the four bases of supernatural powers, that individually cognizes the characteristics of the truth of suffering, the selflessness of persons, and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa 'di phyin ci log bzhi'i gnas yin pas bden pa shes pa'i yongs su shes pa des sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pas so sor rig pa gang yin pa de ni phyin ci log gi gnas yongs su shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa 'di phyin ci log bzhi'i gnas yin pas bden pa shes pa'i yongs su shes pa des sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pas so sor rig pa gang yin pa de ni phyin ci log gi gnas yongs su shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The complete understanding of the basis of error is the knowledge that arises in the context of cultivating the four bases of supernatural powers, that individually cognizes the characteristics of the truth of suffering, the selflessness of persons, and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: des ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid so sor rig pa bstan to //🔽sems can du 'du shes pa las brtsams te phyi rol gyi sems can rnams log par sgrub pa'i gnas yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽sdug bsngal gyi bden pa de nyid la gang zag la ming du byas nas phyi mar 'byung ba'i rgyu'i dngos po sems can du 'du shes pa las brtsams te phyi rol gyi sems can gzhan dag dang gang zag gzhan rnams la bya ba phyin ci log dang /
analyzed: des ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid so sor rig pa bstan to // sems can du 'du shes pa las brtsams te phyi rol gyi sems can rnams log par sgrub pa'i gnas yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba ni / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa de nyid la gang zag la ming du byas nas phyi mar 'byung ba'i rgyu'i dngos po sems can du 'du shes pa las brtsams te phyi rol gyi sems can gzhan dag dang gang zag gzhan rnams la bya ba phyin ci log dang /
translated: This teaches the discernment of the characteristics of the truth of suffering.🔽The discernment of the basis of the error of sentient beings, beginning with the notion of sentient beings, is🔽the discernment of the basis of the error of sentient beings, beginning with the notion of sentient beings, in regard to the truth of suffering itself, which is designated as a person. The basis of the error of other sentient beings, other persons, in regard to the future, is the five appropriated aggregates, which are included in the truth of suffering.

original: 'dzin pa phyin ci log dang / dga' ba phyin ci log dag gis log par sgrub pa'i gnas ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus pa yin pas /🔽bden pa @109a * //
analyzed: 'dzin pa phyin ci log dang / dga' ba phyin ci log dag gis log par sgrub pa'i gnas ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus pa yin pas /🔽bden pa @109a * //
translated: The discernment of the basis of the error of sentient beings, beginning with the notion of sentient beings, in regard to the truth of suffering itself, which is designated as a person. The basis of the error of other sentient beings, other persons, in regard to the future, is the five appropriated aggregates, which are included in the truth of suffering.

original: shes pa'i yongs su shes pa des sdug bsngal gyi bden pa de gang zag la bdag med par yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni sems can du 'du shes pa las brtsams te phyi rol gyi sems can rnams la log par sgrub pa'i gnas yongs su🔽shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes pa'i yongs su shes pa des sdug bsngal gyi bden pa de gang zag la bdag med par yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni sems can du 'du shes pa las brtsams te phyi rol gyi sems can rnams la log par sgrub pa'i gnas yongs su shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The complete understanding of that truth of suffering as the selflessness of persons is called the complete understanding of the basis of the false practice in regard to external sentient beings, beginning with the conception of sentient beings.

original: des ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa las gang zag bdag med par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa las gang zag bdag med par bstan to //
translated: That is the complete understanding of the truth of suffering as the selflessness of persons.

original: nang la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'i gnas yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nang la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'i gnas yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The complete understanding of the basis of the absence of pride in regard to the internal is as follows.

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus pa gang zag med bzhin gang zag tu bdag tu lta ba'i mngon ba'i nga rgyal med kyang chos su nye bar 'dogs shing chos la bdag tu lta ba'i gnas ni
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus pa gang zag med bzhin gang zag tu bdag tu lta ba'i mngon ba'i nga rgyal med kyang chos su nye bar 'dogs shing chos la bdag tu lta ba'i gnas ni
translated: The five appropriated aggregates of the internal nature, included in the truth of suffering, are devoid of a person, but one views them as a self and a person.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus pa nyid yin pas bden pa shes pa'i yongs su shes pa des sdug bsngal gyi bden pa de la chos bdag med par yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni nang la mngon pa'i
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus pa nyid yin pas bden pa shes pa'i yongs su shes pa des sdug bsngal gyi bden pa de la chos bdag med par yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni nang la mngon pa'i
translated: Since the five appropriated aggregates are included in the truth of suffering, the thorough knowledge of the truth of suffering is the thorough knowledge of the selflessness of phenomena in the truth of suffering.

original: nga rgyal med pa'i gnas yongs su shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal med pa'i gnas yongs su shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That is called the thorough knowledge of the basis of the absence of manifest pride in the internal.

original: des ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la chos bdag med par shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la chos bdag med par shes pa bstan to //
translated: That explains the knowledge of the selflessness of phenomena in the truth of suffering.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid so sor rig pa dang / de la gang zag bdag med pa dang / chos bdag med par shes pa'i yongs su shes pa rnam pa gsum po bstan ma thag pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid so sor rig pa dang / de la gang zag bdag med pa dang / chos bdag med par shes pa'i yongs su shes pa rnam pa gsum po bstan ma thag pa la bya ste /
translated: The three aspects are the three types of thorough knowledge that were just explained: the discernment of the characteristics of the truth of suffering, the knowledge of the selflessness of persons in that, and the knowledge of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de gsum dngos po gcig tu bsdu'o //
analyzed: de gsum dngos po gcig tu bsdu'o //
translated: Those three are combined into one thing.

original: de'i 'og tu spang bar bya ba'i dngos po kun 'byung ba'i bden pa spang ba shes pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu spang bar bya ba'i dngos po kun 'byung ba'i bden pa spang ba shes pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Then, with the aim of revealing the knowledge of the abandonment of the truth of the origin of all things to be abandoned,

original: bsgom pa'i gnas kyi dngos po zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i gnas kyi dngos po zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he taught the thing that is the basis of meditation.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi bden pa'o //🔽de'i gnas ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi bden pa'o // de'i gnas ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa spang bar bya ste /
translated: The truth of the path is the basis of meditation.

original: de spang bar bya ba la gnas shing brten nas lam bsgom pa la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de spang bar bya ba la gnas shing brten nas lam bsgom pa la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The truth of the origin is the thing to be abandoned, because the path is cultivated in dependence on it, in order to abandon it.

original: de bas na kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus pa ma yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes su zin kyang da dung kun 'byung ba'i bden pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir kun 'byung ba'i bden pa de'i 'og🔽tu spang bar bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: de bas na kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus pa ma yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes su zin kyang da dung kun 'byung ba'i bden pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir kun 'byung ba'i bden pa de'i 'og tu spang bar bya ba yin pas /
translated: Therefore, since the truth of the origin is not included in the truth of suffering, even though the truth of suffering has already been fully understood, the truth of the origin is still to be abandoned, because it is connected to the truth of suffering.

original: de'i phyir des ni kun 'byung ba spangs bar bya ba shes pa'i @109b dngos po bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir des ni kun 'byung ba spangs bar bya ba shes pa'i @109b dngos po bstan to //
translated: Therefore, he taught the thing that is the knowledge of the abandonment of the origin.

original: de'i 'og tu mngon sum du bya ba'i dngos po 'gog pa'i bden pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mngon sum du bya ba'i dngos po 'gog pa'i bden pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Then, in order to teach the knowledge of the truth of cessation that is to be realized,

original: mngon du bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽mngon sum du bya ba ni mngon sum du bya ba'i don yin pas de mngon du byas na 'gog pa la mi skrag cing dga' ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir 'gog pa'i bden pa ni de'i 'og tu mngon du bya ba yin pas de'i phyir des na 'gog
analyzed: mngon du bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba gsungs te / mngon sum du bya ba ni mngon sum du bya ba'i don yin pas de mngon du byas na 'gog pa la mi skrag cing dga' ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir 'gog pa'i bden pa ni de'i 'og tu mngon du bya ba yin pas de'i phyir des na 'gog
translated: he said, “The thing to be realized.”

original: pa'i bden pa mngon sum du byas pa shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: pa'i bden pa mngon sum du byas pa shes pa bstan to //
translated: Since the meaning of “to be realized” is to be realized, when that is realized, one is not afraid of cessation and one fully takes up joy. Therefore, the truth of cessation is to be realized next. Therefore, he taught the knowledge of the truth of cessation.

original: de'i 'og tu bsgom par bya ba'i dngos po lam gyi bden pa bsgom pa shes pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsgom par bya ba'i dngos po lam gyi bden pa bsgom pa shes pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Then, in order to teach the knowledge of the meditation on the truth of the path that is the thing to be cultivated,

original: bsgom pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he said, “The thing to be cultivated.”

original: ji skad smos pa'i don gsum po dag bsgrub pa'i phyir lam goms par bya dgos pas na lam gyi bden pa ni de'i 'og tu bsgom par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir de ni lam gyi bde ba bsgom pa shes pa bstan te /🔽de ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa ji skad bstan pa de dag gis ni sa de dag na dmigs pa de dag la dmigs te skye ba'i sems gnas pa'i dngos po de'i ngo bo nyid bstan to /
analyzed: ji skad smos pa'i don gsum po dag bsgrub pa'i phyir lam goms par bya dgos pas na lam gyi bden pa ni de'i 'og tu bsgom par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir de ni lam gyi bde ba bsgom pa shes pa bstan te / de ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa ji skad bstan pa de dag gis ni sa de dag na dmigs pa de dag la dmigs te skye ba'i sems gnas pa'i dngos po de'i ngo bo nyid bstan to /
translated: The four noble truths are taught in this way.🔽The four noble truths are taught in this way.

original: de ltar sa de dag na dmigs pa de dag la dmigs te skye ba'i sems gnas pa'i dngos po 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de'i yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar sa de dag na dmigs pa de dag la dmigs te skye ba'i sems gnas pa'i dngos po 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de'i yan lag gang zhe na /

original: de'i yan lag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'i yan lag rnam pa brgyad de sbyor ba'i yan lag dang / rnam pa'i yan lag dang / dmigs pa'i yan lag dang / yid la byed pa'i yan lag dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi yan lag dang /
analyzed: de'i yan lag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'i yan lag rnam pa brgyad de sbyor ba'i yan lag dang / rnam pa'i yan lag dang / dmigs pa'i yan lag dang / yid la byed pa'i yan lag dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi yan lag dang /
translated: Its branches are the eight branches of the knowledge of the four noble truths: the branch of application, the branch of aspects, the branch of objects, the branch of mental attention, the branch of counteractives,

original: gnyen po'i yan lag dang / gnyen po'i gnas kyi yan lag dang / gnyen po'i bsgom pa las mi nyams pa'i thabs kyi yan lag ste dngos po re re dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyen po'i yan lag dang / gnyen po'i gnas kyi yan lag dang / gnyen po'i bsgom pa las mi nyams pa'i thabs kyi yan lag ste dngos po re re dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: the branch of the basis of counteractives, and the branch of the means of not falling away from the cultivation of counteractives.

original: de la dang po sbyor ba'i yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dang po sbyor ba'i yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: What is the branch of application?

original: de snying por bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de snying por bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: It is the thing that is its essence.

original: sems gnas pa'i dngos po 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de la sbyor ba'i yan lag ni de snying por bya ba'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: sems gnas pa'i dngos po 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de la sbyor ba'i yan lag ni de snying por bya ba'i dngos po yin no //
translated: The branch of application is the thing that is the essence of the knowledge of the four noble truths, the thing on which the mind rests.🔽What is the branch of aspects?

original: de yang gus pas sbyor ba'i sbyor ba dang rtag tu sbyor ba'i sbyor bas de snying por bya ba ste /
analyzed: de yang gus pas sbyor ba'i sbyor ba dang rtag tu sbyor ba'i sbyor bas de snying por bya ba ste /
translated: Moreover, one should make that the essence by means of the application of respectful application and the application of constant application.

original: de gus par sbyor @110a * //
analyzed: de gus par sbyor @110a * //
translated: Moreover, one should make that the essence by means of the application of devoted effort and the application of constant effort.

original: ba'i sbyor bas ni de chung mi za bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ba'i sbyor bas ni de chung mi za bar 'gyur /
translated: By the application of devoted effort, one does not waste it.🔽By the application of constant effort, one perfects it. Thus, by the application of non-waste and perfection, one should make that basis of mental stability the essence.

original: rtag tu sbyor ba'i ni de mthar phyin par 'gyur bas na de ltar chud mi za ba dang / mthar phyin pa'i sbyor bas sems gnas pa'i dngos po de snying par bya ba'i phyir des ni sbyor ba'i yan lag bstan to //
analyzed: rtag tu sbyor ba'i ni de mthar phyin par 'gyur bas na de ltar chud mi za ba dang / mthar phyin pa'i sbyor bas sems gnas pa'i dngos po de snying par bya ba'i phyir des ni sbyor ba'i yan lag bstan to //
translated: Thus, he explains the branch of application.

original: rnam pa'i yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa'i yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: What is the branch of aspects?

original: de'i rnam pa'i dngos po zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa'i dngos po zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: It is indicated by the words: “the entity of its aspects.”

original: sems gnas pa'i dngos po 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de'i rnam pa'i dngos po gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems gnas pa'i dngos po 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de'i rnam pa'i dngos po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the entity of the aspects of that entity of mental stability which has the nature of the knowledge of the four noble truths?

original: zhi gnas kyi rnam pa dang / lhag mthong gi rnam pa dang / zung du 'brel ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi rnam pa dang / lhag mthong gi rnam pa dang / zung du 'brel ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: They are the aspects of calm, the aspects of insight, and the aspects of their unity.

original: de la zhi gnas kyi rnam pa ni sems gnas pa dgu dang / stobs drug dang / yid la byed pa bzhi sngar bstan pa dag go //
analyzed: de la zhi gnas kyi rnam pa ni sems gnas pa dgu dang / stobs drug dang / yid la byed pa bzhi sngar bstan pa dag go //
translated: The aspect of serenity is the nine states of mind that are still, the six powers, and the four attentions, as previously explained.

original: zung du 'brel ba'i rnam pa ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyis 'dres par gyur te mnyam par zung du 'jug pa'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid yid la byed pa gang yin pa ste ;
analyzed: zung du 'brel ba'i rnam pa ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyis 'dres par gyur te mnyam par zung du 'jug pa'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid yid la byed pa gang yin pa ste ;
translated: The aspect of union is the attention that is the single-pointed mind of serenity and insight that has become a union, a mixture of the two.

original: de dag gis ni sems gnas pa'i dngos po de'i rnam pa'i yan lag bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni sems gnas pa'i dngos po de'i rnam pa'i yan lag bstan to //
translated: These explain the branch of the aspect of the object of meditation for mental stability.

original: dmigs pa'i yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: What is the branch of the object of meditation?

original: de'i dmigs pa'i dngos po zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa'i dngos po zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: It is indicated by the words “the object of meditation for that.”

original: sems gnas pa'i dngos po 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de'i rnam pa'i dngos po ji skad bstan pa de'i dmigs pa'i dngos po gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems gnas pa'i dngos po 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de'i rnam pa'i dngos po ji skad bstan pa de'i dmigs pa'i dngos po gang zhe na /
translated: The object of meditation for mental stability is the nature of the knowledge of the four noble truths. What is the object of meditation for the aspect of that object of meditation that has been explained?

original: zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i gzugs brnyan no //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i gzugs brnyan no //
translated: The object of meditation for serenity is a non-discursive image.

original: lhag mthong gi rnam pa'i dmigs pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan no //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi rnam pa'i dmigs pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan no //
translated: The meditative object of the aspect of insight is the conceptual image.

original: zung du 'brel ba'i rnam pa'i dmigs pa ni dngos po'i mtha' dang dgongs pa yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: zung du 'brel ba'i rnam pa'i dmigs pa ni dngos po'i mtha' dang dgongs pa yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: The meditative object of the aspect of union is the extreme of things and the fulfillment of the intention.

original: de dag gis ni sems gnas pa'i dngos po de'i dmigs pa'i yan lag bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni sems gnas pa'i dngos po de'i dmigs pa'i yan lag bstan to //
translated: These explain the limb of meditative object of that basis of mental stability.

original: yid la byed pa'i yan lag gan zhe na /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i yan lag gan zhe na /
translated: What is the limb of attention?

original: spangs pa dang ma spangs pa dpyod pa la mkhas pa'i dngos po zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: spangs pa dang ma spangs pa dpyod pa la mkhas pa'i dngos po zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: It is explained by the phrase “the basis of skill in investigating what is abandoned and what is not abandoned.”

original: sems gnas pa'i dngos po 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de'i yid la byed pa'i dngos po gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems gnas pa'i dngos po 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de'i yid la byed pa'i dngos po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the basis of attention to that basis of mental stability, the nature of the knowledge of the four noble truths?

original: yid la byed pa bdun po mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yid la byed pa dang / mos pa las byung ba'i yid la byed pa dang / rab tu dben pa'i yid la byed pa dang / dpyod pa'i @110b yid la byed pa dang / dga' ba sdud pa'i yid la byed pa dang /
analyzed: yid la byed pa bdun po mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yid la byed pa dang / mos pa las byung ba'i yid la byed pa dang / rab tu dben pa'i yid la byed pa dang / dpyod pa'i @110b yid la byed pa dang / dga' ba sdud pa'i yid la byed pa dang /
translated: The seven mental attentions are mental attention that individually discerns the characteristics of objects, mental attention arisen from aspiration, mental attention of isolation, mental attention of analysis, mental attention that gathers joy,

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i yid la byed pa thams cad yin mod kyi /
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i yid la byed pa thams cad yin mod kyi /
translated: mental attention of final training and mental attention that is the result of final training.

original: skabs 'dir ni gtso cher dpyod pa'i yid la byed pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni gtso cher dpyod pa'i yid la byed pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: However, in this context, mental attention of analysis is taught as the most important.🔽Thus the treatise Attainment of Knowledge states:

original: spangs pa dang ma spangs pa dpyod pa la mkhas pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba gsungs de /
analyzed: spangs pa dang ma spangs pa dpyod pa la mkhas pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba gsungs de /
translated: The object of expertise in discerning what is abandoned and not abandoned.

original: de yang bsgom pa'i lam thams cad la nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang ma spangs pa so sor brtags shing dpyad nas lam ji ltar thob pa goms par byed pa'i yid la byed pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de yang bsgom pa'i lam thams cad la nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang ma spangs pa so sor brtags shing dpyad nas lam ji ltar thob pa goms par byed pa'i yid la byed pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Moreover, mental attention that analyzes and discerns what is and is not abandoned on the entire path of meditation and that cultivates the path as it has been obtained is mental attention of analysis.

original: skabs 'dir mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa thams cad bsgom pa'i lam zhes bya ba'i sgras bsdus pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgom pa'i gnas skabs kyi dpyod pa'i yid la byed pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: skabs 'dir mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa thams cad bsgom pa'i lam zhes bya ba'i sgras bsdus pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgom pa'i gnas skabs kyi dpyod pa'i yid la byed pa dang sbyar te /
translated: In this context, the term “path of cultivation” includes all the stages of meditative equipoise. The mental attention of investigation is associated with the stage of cultivating the four bases of supernatural powers.

original: des ni sems gnas pa'i dngos po de'i yid la byed pa'i dngos po bstan to //
analyzed: des ni sems gnas pa'i dngos po de'i yid la byed pa'i dngos po bstan to //
translated: This shows the mental attention to the object of the thing that stabilizes the mind.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the branches that are adverse?

original: de la rnam par g-yeng ba'i dngos po zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de la rnam par g-yeng ba'i dngos po zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: They are shown by the phrase “the things that are distractions.”

original: sems gnas pa'i dngos 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'i dngos po de la rnam par g-yeng ba'i dngos po gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems gnas pa'i dngos 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'i dngos po de la rnam par g-yeng ba'i dngos po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the things that are distractions to the object of the thing that stabilizes the mind, i.e., the object of the knowledge of the four noble truths?

original: rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five kinds.

original: yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / phyi rol du sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang / nang du sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang / mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / phyi rol du sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang / nang du sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang / mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
translated: Distraction of mental orientation, distraction of external focus, distraction of internal focus, distraction of signs, and distraction of negative influences.

original: de dag gi rab tu dbye ba ni sngar 'phags pa byams pa'i le'ur rgya cher bstan pa bzhin te /
analyzed: de dag gi rab tu dbye ba ni sngar 'phags pa byams pa'i le'ur rgya cher bstan pa bzhin te /
translated: Their divisions are as taught extensively in the chapter on the noble Maitreya.

original: des ni sems gnas pa'i dngos po de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi yan lag bstan to //
analyzed: des ni sems gnas pa'i dngos po de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi yan lag bstan to //
translated: This teaches the branches that are discordant with the basis of mental stability.

original: gnyen po'i yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyen po'i yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the branches of antidotes?

original: de la rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i dngos po zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de la rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i dngos po zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: That is taught by the phrase “the basis of non-distraction.”

original: sems gnas pa'i dngos po 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de las rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i dngos po gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems gnas pa'i dngos po 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de las rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i dngos po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the basis of mental stability, the nature of knowledge of the four noble truths? It is the basis of non-distraction. What is that?

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i dngos po lnga po de nyid nye bar zhi bar 'gyur gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i dngos po lnga po de nyid nye bar zhi bar 'gyur gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the pacification of those five things that are the basis of distraction.

original: des ni sems gnas pa'i dngos po de las rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po yan lag bstan to //🔽gnyen po'i gnas kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: des ni sems gnas pa'i dngos po de las rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po yan lag bstan to // gnyen po'i gnas kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: This shows the branches of the antidote to distraction from the object of meditation.

original: rnam @111a * //
analyzed: rnam @111a * //
translated: What is the branch of the basis of the antidote?🔽It is shown by

original: par mi g-yeng ba'i gnas kyi dngos po zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: par mi g-yeng ba'i gnas kyi dngos po zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: the phrase “the basis of non-distraction.”

original: sems gnas pa'i dngos po 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de las rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i gnas kyi dngos po gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems gnas pa'i dngos po 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de las rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i gnas kyi dngos po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the basis of non-distraction from the object of meditation, the nature of knowledge of the four noble truths?

original: gcig tu zhi gnas bsgom pa rgyun chags su yid la byed pas bar chad med pa'i sems yid la byed pa dang / gcig tu lhag mthong bsgom pa rgyun chags su yid la byed pas sems kyi mtshan ma nyid yid la byad pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyis 'dres par gyur te mnyam par zung du 'jug pa sems rtse gcig pa nyid yid la byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gcig tu zhi gnas bsgom pa rgyun chags su yid la byed pas bar chad med pa'i sems yid la byed pa dang / gcig tu lhag mthong bsgom pa rgyun chags su yid la byed pas sems kyi mtshan ma nyid yid la byad pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyis 'dres par gyur te mnyam par zung du 'jug pa sems rtse gcig pa nyid yid la byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the mental attention of uninterrupted mind through continuous mental attention to the cultivation of serenity, the mental attention of the sign of mind through continuous mental attention to the cultivation of insight, and the mental attention of one-pointed mind through the union of serenity and insight in equipoise.

original: de dag gis ni sems gnas pa'i dngos po de las rnam par g-yeng ba'i dngos po de'i gnyen po rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i gnas kyi yan lag bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni sems gnas pa'i dngos po de las rnam par g-yeng ba'i dngos po de'i gnyen po rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i gnas kyi yan lag bstan to //
translated: These explain the branch of non-distraction, the antidote to the things that distract the mind from the things that stabilize the mind.

original: gnyen po bsgom pa las mi nyams pa'i thabs kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyen po bsgom pa las mi nyams pa'i thabs kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: What is the branch of the means of not degenerating from the cultivation of the antidotes?

original: bsgom pa las yongs su skyo ba'i sbyor ba bsal ba'i dngos po zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: bsgom pa las yongs su skyo ba'i sbyor ba bsal ba'i dngos po zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: It is indicated by the phrase “the thing that removes the application of complete weariness with cultivation.”

original: sems gnas pa'i dngos po 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de bsgom pa las yongs su sbyor ba'i sbyor ba ni gang /
analyzed: sems gnas pa'i dngos po 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de bsgom pa las yongs su sbyor ba'i sbyor ba ni gang /
translated: What is the thing that stabilizes the mind, the nature of knowing the four noble truths? What is the application of complete weariness with cultivating it?

original: de bsal ba'i dngos po ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: de bsal ba'i dngos po ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the thing that removes it?

original: de bsgom pa la yongs su skyo ba'i sbyor ba ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan yid la mi byed pa dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i dpe'i rgyu mtshan yid la mi byed pa dang / btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan yid la mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bsgom pa la yongs su skyo ba'i sbyor ba ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan yid la mi byed pa dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i dpe'i rgyu mtshan yid la mi byed pa dang / btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan yid la mi byed pa'o //
translated: The application of complete weariness with cultivating it is not attending to the sign of serenity, not attending to the sign of the example of full attention, and not attending to the sign of equanimity.

original: de bsal ba'i dngos po ni de dag yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bsal ba'i dngos po ni de dag yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The things that remove them are the mental attentions to those.

original: de la zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan ni gang /🔽rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan ni gang /
analyzed: de la zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan ni gang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan ni gang /
translated: What is the sign of calm?🔽What is the sign of exertion?

original: btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the sign of equanimity?

original: sems rgod pa'am rgod du dogs pa na kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i chos rnams dang / bar chad med pa'i sems de yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems rgod pa'am rgod du dogs pa na kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i chos rnams dang / bar chad med pa'i sems de yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //
translated: When the mind is excited or in danger of excitement, the mental attention to things conducive to the removal of excitement, and the mental attention to the signless mind, is called the sign of calm.

original: sems bying ngam bying du dogs pa na mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i chos rnams dang / sems kyi mtshan ma de yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems bying ngam bying du dogs pa na mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i chos rnams dang / sems kyi mtshan ma de yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //
translated: When the mind is lax or in danger of laxity, the mental attention to things conducive to the removal of laxity, and the mental attention to the sign of the mind, is called the sign of exertion.

original: zhi gnas la gcig tu nges pa'am /
analyzed: zhi gnas la gcig tu nges pa'am /
translated: Whether it is calm that is certain,

original: ltag mthong la gcig tu nges pa'am /
analyzed: ltag mthong la gcig tu nges pa'am /
translated: or whether it is insight that is certain,

original: zung du 'brel @111b ba'i lam yang rung ste /
analyzed: zung du 'brel @111b ba'i lam yang rung ste /
translated: or whether it is the path that unites the two,

original: de gnyi ga'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pas nye bar nyon mongs pa med pa la sems rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa na yid la byed pa na lhun gyis grub pa gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pas nye bar nyon mongs pa med pa la sems rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa na yid la byed pa na lhun gyis grub pa gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya ste /
translated: When the mind naturally engages in the absence of the secondary afflictions of both of those, and when it is spontaneous in its attention, that is called the reason for equanimity.

original: de dag gis ni sems gnas pa'i dngos po de las rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po rnam par mi g-yeng ba bsgom pa la mi nyams pa'i thabs kyi yan lag bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni sems gnas pa'i dngos po de las rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po rnam par mi g-yeng ba bsgom pa la mi nyams pa'i thabs kyi yan lag bstan to //
translated: Those explain the branch of the means of not degenerating the cultivation of non-distraction, which is the antidote to the distraction from the basis of mental stability.

original: de ltar dngos po bcu bzhis sems gnas pa'i dngos po de'i sa dang / dmigs pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / yan lag bstan pa de dag thams cad kyis ni sems gnas pa'i dngos po rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhis ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i lam bstan pa de nyid kyi gnas skabs rgya cher bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po bcu bzhis sems gnas pa'i dngos po de'i sa dang / dmigs pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / yan lag bstan pa de dag thams cad kyis ni sems gnas pa'i dngos po rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhis ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i lam bstan pa de nyid kyi gnas skabs rgya cher bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, by these fourteen topics, the basis of mental stability, the object of observation, the nature, and the branches are explained. All of those explain in detail the situation of the path that thoroughly refines samādhi through the four bases of magic power, which is the basis of mental stability.

original: dbang po lnga ni /
analyzed: dbang po lnga ni /
translated: The five faculties

original: bsgoms pa'i phan yon gyi dngos po zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i phan yon gyi dngos po zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The phrase “the benefits of meditation” indicates🔽this.

original: des ni mngon par rtogs par bya ba la sbyor ba'i lam bstan to //
analyzed: des ni mngon par rtogs par bya ba la sbyor ba'i lam bstan to //
translated: This passage explains the path of preparation that is applied to realization.

original: de la bsgom pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsgom pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgom pa'o //
translated: Meditation is the cultivation of the four bases of supernatural power.

original: de'i phan yon ni dbang po lnga skyes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phan yon ni dbang po lnga skyes pa ste /
translated: The benefits of that meditation are the arising of the five faculties.

original: de dag skyes pas mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i sbyor ba'i lam thob par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag skyes pas mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i sbyor ba'i lam thob par rig par bya'o //
translated: When they arise, one should understand that one has attained the path of preparation that leads to realization.

original: de la dbang po lnga po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dbang po lnga po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five faculties?

original: dad pa'i dbang po dang ; brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po dang ; brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
translated: They are the faculty of faith, the faculty of perseverance, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, and the faculty of wisdom.

original: de la rim pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la rim pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is their order?

original: de ltar gnas pa'i dngos po rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhis ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i lam thob cing ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa des nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal yang dag par bcom pa dang / de'i gnyen po'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par thob pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa'i dngos po rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhis ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i lam thob cing ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa des nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal yang dag par bcom pa dang / de'i gnyen po'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par thob pa dang /
translated: Thus, those who have attained the path that fully refines concentration through the four bases of supernormal power and who abide in concentration destroy latent afflictions and obtain complete perfection of concentration that is the antidote to those afflictions.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed zin nas /
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed zin nas /
translated: Having already generated the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation,

original: de'i gong du ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len chen po dang 'bring dang bral bar bya ba dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dro bar gyur ba dang rtse mo gnyis bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dbang po rnams kyis sbyong ba'i lam chung du yang dag par rtsom par byed de /
analyzed: de'i gong du ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len chen po dang 'bring dang bral bar bya ba dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dro bar gyur ba dang rtse mo gnyis bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dbang po rnams kyis sbyong ba'i lam chung du yang dag par rtsom par byed de /
translated: they correctly commence the path of training through the faculties in order to generate the two roots of virtue that are heat and summits which are conducive to penetrative insight and to be free of the signs of fully perfected concentration and of great and middling negative tendencies.

original: de yang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ji ltar thob pa'i ting @112a * //🔽nge 'dzin la gnas ting nge 'dzin la brten nas lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa ni dbang po lnga dag rim gyis skye zhing de dag gis nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge🔽ba'i rtsa ba dro bar gyur ba dang rtse mo zhes bya ba gnyis thob par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ji ltar thob pa'i ting @112a * // nge 'dzin la gnas ting nge 'dzin la brten nas lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa ni dbang po lnga dag rim gyis skye zhing de dag gis nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dro bar gyur ba dang rtse mo zhes bya ba gnyis thob par rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the five faculties are to be known as the roots of virtue called heat and summit, which are conducive to penetrative insight, and which arise in sequence, based on the meditative concentration of abiding in meditative concentration, which is attained through the four bases of supernatural powers.🔽🔽The meditative development of wisdom endowed with the training in the higher mind is the yoga.🔽

original: de yang dbang po lnga yang dmigs pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bur rig par bya ste /🔽de la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang dbang po lnga yang dmigs pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bur rig par bya ste / de la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: Moreover, the five faculties are to be known as the roots of the wholesome states that are conducive to penetrati

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rnams so //🔽ngo bo nyid gang zhe na ;
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rnams so // ngo bo nyid gang zhe na ;
translated: on, which are preceded by the four bases of supernormal power and are attained through the meditative development of the four bases of supernormal power.🔽The faculty of faith is the cause of the faculty of conviction.🔽The faculty of vigour is the cause of the faculty of perseverance.🔽The faculty of mindfulness is the cause of the faculty of mindfulness.

analyzed: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab bo //

original: grogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: grogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is a friend?

original: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: It is the mind and mental activities associated with them.

original: bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is cultivation?

original: dad pa'i dbang po ni bden pa rnams la mngon par yid ches pa'i tshul gyis bsgom mo //
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po ni bden pa rnams la mngon par yid ches pa'i tshul gyis bsgom mo //
translated: The faculty of faith is cultivated by the method of firm belief in the Truths.

original: brtson 'grus kyi dbang po ni mngon par yid ches pa skyes nas bde ba mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir spro ba'i tshul gyis brtson 'grus rtsom par bsgom mo //🔽dran pa'i dbang po ni brtson 'grus brtsams nas bden pa rnams la nye bar gnas pa'i dran pa mi brjed pa'i tshul gyis bsgom mo //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi dbang po ni mngon par yid ches pa skyes nas bde ba mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir spro ba'i tshul gyis brtson 'grus rtsom par bsgom mo // dran pa'i dbang po ni brtson 'grus brtsams nas bden pa rnams la nye bar gnas pa'i dran pa mi brjed pa'i tshul gyis bsgom mo //
translated: The faculty of vigor is cultivated by the method of exertion in order to realize happiness after the arising of firm belief.🔽The faculty of mindfulness is cultivated by the method of non-forgetting of the Truths after the exertion of vigor.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po ni bden pa rnams la nye bar gnas pa'i dran pa ma brjed pas sems rtse gcig pa'i tshul gyis bsgom mo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po ni bden pa rnams la nye bar gnas pa'i dran pa ma brjed pas sems rtse gcig pa'i tshul gyis bsgom mo //
translated: The faculty of concentration is cultivated by the method of one-pointedness of mind after the non-forgetting of the Truths by means of mindfulness.

original: shes rab kyi dbang po ni bden pa rnams la sems rtse gcig tu mnyam par gzhag nas chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i tshul gyis bsgom mo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang po ni bden pa rnams la sems rtse gcig tu mnyam par gzhag nas chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i tshul gyis bsgom mo //
translated: The faculty of wisdom is the cultivation of the truths by means of the discernment of phenomena, having become concentrated in the one-pointedness of mind.

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the result of cultivation?

original: bden pa rnams myur du rtogs pa dang dro bar 'gyur ba dang / rtse mo chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dag skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden pa rnams myur du rtogs pa dang dro bar 'gyur ba dang / rtse mo chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dag skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the rapid understanding of the truths, and the arising of the small, middling and great heats and summits.

original: de la dad pa'i dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dad pa'i dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the faculty of faith?

original: de ltar ting nge 'dzin la gnas ting nge 'dzin la brten nas lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa na /
analyzed: de ltar ting nge 'dzin la gnas ting nge 'dzin la brten nas lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa na /
translated: When, in this way, one abides in concentration and, on the basis of concentration, one practices the higher training of mind and the higher training in wisdom,

original: ston pa dang nyan thos gzhan dag gis rtogs pa la mngon par yid ches pa dang / rab tu dang ba dang dad pa gang yin pa de ni dad pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa dang nyan thos gzhan dag gis rtogs pa la mngon par yid ches pa dang / rab tu dang ba dang dad pa gang yin pa de ni dad pa'o //
translated: one has faith, full of confidence and serene, in the realization of the Master and of the other noble disciples.

original: de @112b ni dbang byed pa'i don gyis dad pa'i dbang po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de @112b ni dbang byed pa'i don gyis dad pa'i dbang po zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the faculty of faith, because of its controlling power.

original: gang la dbang byed ce na /
analyzed: gang la dbang byed ce na /
translated: What does it govern?

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos skye ba dang brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi dbang po la sogs pa skye ba la dbang byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos skye ba dang brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi dbang po la sogs pa skye ba la dbang byed pa yin no //
translated: It governs the arising of supramundane factors, of the faculties of vigor, concentration, and wisdom, etc.

original: brtson 'grus kyi dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the faculty of vigor?

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba'i yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi po dag ni 'dir brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba'i yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi po dag ni 'dir brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: The four right efforts of application for the abandonment of the defilements to be abandoned by insight are called vigor here.

original: de yang dbang byed pa'i don gyis brtson 'grus kyi dbang po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de yang dbang byed pa'i don gyis brtson 'grus kyi dbang po zhes bya ste /
translated: And since it governs, it is called the faculty of vigor.

original: gang la dbang byed ce na /
analyzed: gang la dbang byed ce na /
translated: What does it govern?

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos skye ba dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi dbang po la sogs pa skye ba la dbang byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos skye ba dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi dbang po la sogs pa skye ba la dbang byed pa yin no //
translated: It governs the arising of supramundane factors, of the faculties of mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom, etc.

original: dran pa'i dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: dran pa'i dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the faculty of mindfulness?

original: phyin ci log ma lus par sdong ba'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po dag ni 'dir dran pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log ma lus par sdong ba'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po dag ni 'dir dran pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness are called mindfulness here because they are the basis for the entry into the path, since they are the basis for the elimination of all errors.

original: de yang dbang byed pa'i don gyis dran pa'i dbang po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de yang dbang byed pa'i don gyis dran pa'i dbang po zhes bya ste /
translated: And it is called the faculty of mindfulness because it has the meaning of controlling power.

original: gang la dbang byed ce na /
analyzed: gang la dbang byed ce na /
translated: With regard to what does it have controlling power?

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos skye ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi dbang po la sogs pa skye ba la dbang byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos skye ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi dbang po la sogs pa skye ba la dbang byed pa yin no //
translated: It has controlling power with regard to the arising of supramundane dharmas and the arising of the faculties of concentration and wisdom, etc.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the faculty of concentration?

original: phyir mi 'ong ba nyid du sbyor ba las byung ba'i bsam gtan bzhi po dag ni 'dir ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba nyid du sbyor ba las byung ba'i bsam gtan bzhi po dag ni 'dir ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: The four concentrations that are the result of practice leading to the state of non-returning are called concentration here.

original: de yang dbang po byed pa'i don gyis ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de yang dbang po byed pa'i don gyis ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po zhes bya ste /
translated: And it is called the faculty of concentration because it has the meaning of controlling power.

original: gang la dbang byed ce na /
analyzed: gang la dbang byed ce na /
translated: With regard to what does it have controlling power?

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos skye ba dang / shes rab kyi dbang po la sogs pa skye ba la dbang byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos skye ba dang / shes rab kyi dbang po la sogs pa skye ba la dbang byed pa yin no //
translated: It is the faculty of understanding that has the power with regard to the arising of supramundane factors and the arising of the faculty of understanding.

original: shes rab kyi dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the faculty of understanding?

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag mngon par rtogs par bya ba dang / dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur ba'i bden pa shes pa dag ni 'dir shes rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag mngon par rtogs par bya ba dang / dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur ba'i bden pa shes pa dag ni 'dir shes rab ces bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the truths which is applied to the realization of the four noble truths and to the acquisition of the fruits of the religious life is called understanding.

original: de yang dbang byed pa'i don gyis shes rab kyi dbang po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de yang dbang byed pa'i don gyis shes rab kyi dbang po zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called the faculty of understanding because it has the sense of controlling power.

original: gang la dbang byed ce na /
analyzed: gang la dbang byed ce na /
translated: With regard to what does it have controlling power?

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos skye ba la dbang byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos skye ba la dbang byed pa yin no //
translated: It has controlling power with regard to the arising of supramundane factors.

original: dbang po lnga ni de dag gi don dang rnam par gzhag pa dang rab tu dbye ba bstan te /
analyzed: dbang po lnga ni de dag gi don dang rnam par gzhag pa dang rab tu dbye ba bstan te /
translated: The meaning, the arrangement and the classification of the five faculties have been explained.

original: de la dbang po lnga'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dbang po lnga'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the five faculties?

original: dbang byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: dbang byed pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of controlling power.
What is the arrangement?

original: zhig yongs su bstan pa'i don du dbang byed ce na /🔽gzhi dang de la chos de dang de dag la gtso bor yongs su bstan pa'i don du dbang byed do //🔽de la dbang po lnga'i rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhig yongs su bstan pa'i don du dbang byed ce na / gzhi dang de la chos de dang de dag la gtso bor yongs su bstan pa'i don du dbang byed do // de la dbang po lnga'i rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: The five faculties are presented in order to demonstrate the five kinds of mastery: mastery in the purification of mundane states, mastery in the purification of supramundane states, mastery in the antidotes to the afflictions, mastery in the liberation of the body, and mastery in the liberation of the mind.🔽Mastery in the purification of mundane states refers to mastery in the five kinds of superknowledge.🔽Mastery in the purification of supramundane states refers to mastery in the three vehicles.🔽Mastery in the antidotes to the afflictions refers to mastery in the four close mindfulnesses.

analyzed: de la dbang po lnga'i rab tu dbye ba ni dbang po lnga dag gis ci byed ce na /

analyzed: bde 'gror skye ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / dbang po de dag gi rjes su yod pa yin pa dang / de dag ni sems las byung bas bsdus pa yin pa dang / de dag ni 'dus byas yin pa dang ;
translated: They are the cause of birth in happy realms, the cause of completing the accumulations for nirvana, the cause of the existence of those faculties, the cause of their being subsumed by mental factors, the cause of their being conditioned,

original: de dag ni dge ba yin pa dang / de dag ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yin pa dang / de dag gi phyogs gcig ni rnam par smin pa med pa ma yin pa dang / de dag gi sa bon rnam par smin pa ma yin pa ma yin pa dang de dag nyid rnam par sbyin pa ma yin pa las skyes pa yin pa dang ;
analyzed: de dag ni dge ba yin pa dang / de dag ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yin pa dang / de dag gi phyogs gcig ni rnam par smin pa med pa ma yin pa dang / de dag gi sa bon rnam par smin pa ma yin pa ma yin pa dang de dag nyid rnam par sbyin pa ma yin pa las skyes pa yin pa dang ;
translated: the cause of their being virtuous, the cause of their having karmic maturation, the cause of their not being the karmic maturation of one part, the cause of their not being the seed of karmic maturation, and the cause of their arising from the cause of purification.

original: de dag ni khams gsum du gtogs pa yin pa dang / khams gsum du ma gtogs pa yang yin pa dang / sa tham cad dmigs pa yin pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa yang ma yin pa dang /

translated: They are included in the three realms, not included in the three realms, and are the focal objects of all levels. They are neither contaminated nor uncontaminated.

original: spang bar bya ba dang spang bar bya ba ma yin pa dang ; 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa rab tu dbye ba'o //

original: de dbang po de dag kun du bsten zhing goms par byas lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bzhi po dag las dro bar @113b gyur pa dang rtse mo chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po dag skyed🔽par byed do //

analyzed: de la dro bar gyur pa ni snang ba thob pa'i rtse mo ni snang ba mched pa ste /

original: dper na mes me'i bya ba byed par 'dod cing me don du gnyer ba'i mi la la zhig gis gtsub gtan gyi steng du gtsub shing gtsubs te mngon par gtsubs shing 'bad par byed /🔽sgrim par byed /

translated: Just as the fire that has arisen from the fire stick is the cause of the burning of the fuel, so too, the state of heat is the cause of the burning of the fuel of the defilements.

analyzed: de ltar dbang po lnga po de dag las /

original: des ni mngon par rtogs pa dang 'dres pa'i lam bstan to //
analyzed: des ni mngon par rtogs pa dang 'dres pa'i lam bstan to //
translated: This teaches the path that is mixed with realization.

original: de la de zhes bya ba ni dbang po'o //
analyzed: de la de zhes bya ba ni dbang po'o //
translated: Therein, “them” refers to the faculties.

original: brtan pa zhes bya ba ni stobs te dbang po de brtan zhing stobs su gyur pa na mngon par rtogs pa dang 'dres pa'i lam thob par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: brtan pa zhes bya ba ni stobs te dbang po de brtan zhing stobs su gyur pa na mngon par rtogs pa dang 'dres pa'i lam thob par rig par bya'o //
translated: “Stabilize” refers to the powers. When those faculties become stabilized and powerful, one should understand that one has attained the path that is mixed with realization.

original: de la stobs lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la stobs lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five powers?

original: dad pa'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / shes rab kyi stobs so //
analyzed: dad pa'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / shes rab kyi stobs so //
translated: They are the power of faith, the power of perseverance, the power of mindfulness, the power of concentration, and the power of wisdom.

original: de la rim pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la rim pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is their sequence?

original: de ltar bsgoms pa'i phan yon gyi dngos po dbang po lngas @114a * //
analyzed: de ltar bsgoms pa'i phan yon gyi dngos po dbang po lngas @114a * //
translated: The five faculties that are the things that benefit the cultivation of the path are called “powers” when they become overwhelming and crush their opposites.

original: mngon par rtogs par bya ba la sbyor ba'i lam thob pa des ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len chen po dang 'bring dang bral zhing nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dro bar gyur pa dang rtse🔽mo thob ste /

translated: Those who obtain the path of preparation that is applied to realization obtain the heat and peak roots of virtue that are conducive to penetrative insight and are free from great and medium stage negative tendencies that are signs of perfect concentration.

original: sbyor ba'i lam chung ngu dang 'bring yang dag par brtsams nas /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam chung ngu dang 'bring yang dag par brtsams nas /
translated: Having correctly begun the small and medium stages of the path of preparation,

original: de'i gong du yang ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len chung ngu dang 'bring dang bral bar bya ba dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bden pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa dang /
analyzed: de'i gong du yang ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len chung ngu dang 'bring dang bral bar bya ba dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bden pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa dang /
translated: they are free from small and medium stage negative tendencies that are signs of perfect concentration and they obtain the stage of acceptance that is in accordance with the four truths and the stage of the supreme mundane state that is in accordance with the four truths.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gnyis bskyed par bya ba'i phyir stobs rnams kyi sbyor ba'i lam chen po yang dag par brtson par byed par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gnyis bskyed par bya ba'i phyir stobs rnams kyi sbyor ba'i lam chen po yang dag par brtson par byed par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the great path of application of the powers is the correct effort to generate the two supreme mundane factors.

original: de la stobs lnga yang dmigs pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bus rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la stobs lnga yang dmigs pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bus rig par bya ste /
translated: The five powers should be understood in terms of object, nature, aid, cultivation, and result of cultivation.

original: dmigs pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa ni dbang po rnams ji lta ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa ni dbang po rnams ji lta ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The object, nature, and aid of the powers are to be understood as they are for the faculties.

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the result of cultivating the powers?

original: bden pa rnams myur du mngon par rtogs pa dang / bden pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po dang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden pa rnams myur du mngon par rtogs pa dang / bden pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po dang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the rapid realization of the truths, and the arising of the lesser, middling, and greater patience that conforms with the truths, and the supreme mundane factors.

original: de la dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi ting nge 'dzin ni sngar dbang po lnga'i skabs su bstan pa kho na dag yin no //
analyzed: de la dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi ting nge 'dzin ni sngar dbang po lnga'i skabs su bstan pa kho na dag yin no //
translated: Faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom are the same as the five faculties.

original: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de /
analyzed: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de /
translated: But there is a difference.

original: dbang po rnams la ni dbang byed pa'i don gyis rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: dbang po rnams la ni dbang byed pa'i don gyis rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The faculties are established by the meaning of predominance.

original: 'dir stobs rnams la ni de dag nyid brtan zhing stobs dang ldan pas mi choms pa'i don gyis stobs rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir stobs rnams la ni de dag nyid brtan zhing stobs dang ldan pas mi choms pa'i don gyis stobs rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: Here, the powers are the same as the faculties, but they are called powers because they are firm and strong, and cannot be overcome.

original: ci zhig gis mi choms she na /🔽de dag ni ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams dang mi 'dre zhing lha 'am bdud dam tshangs pa'am /
analyzed: ci zhig gis mi choms she na / de dag ni ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams dang mi 'dre zhing lha 'am bdud dam tshangs pa'am /
translated: By what are they not overcome?

original: su yang 'jig rten na chos dang mi mthun pas mi 'phrogs pa dang nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pas mi 'phrogs pas na de'i phyir mi choms pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: su yang 'jig rten na chos dang mi mthun pas mi 'phrogs pa dang nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pas mi 'phrogs pas na de'i phyir mi choms pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are not overcome by their opponents, such as lack of faith, etc., nor are they overcome by any god, demon, Brahma, or anyone else in the world, by any discordant factors, nor by any afflictive action. Therefore, they are called powers because they cannot be overcome.

original: de stobs de dag gis stobs dang ldan par gyur pas bdud kyi stobs thams cad las rnam par @114b rgyal bar byas te /
analyzed: de stobs de dag gis stobs dang ldan par gyur pas bdud kyi stobs thams cad las rnam par @114b rgyal bar byas te /
translated: Since he becomes powerful through those powers, he conquers all the powers of Mara.

original: zag pa rnams zad par bya ba'i phyir rab tu brtson par byed pas na de'i phyir stobs rnams zhes bya'o //🔽de stobs de dag kun du bsten zhing goms par byas lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhan gnyis po bden pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i dpe bzod pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po dang 'jig
analyzed: zag pa rnams zad par bya ba'i phyir rab tu brtson par byed pas na de'i phyir stobs rnams zhes bya'o // de stobs de dag kun du bsten zhing goms par byas lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhan gnyis po bden pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i dpe bzod pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po dang 'jig
translated: Since he strives to eliminate the contaminants, they are called powers.

original: rten pa'i chos kyi mchog skyed par byed do //
analyzed: rten pa'i chos kyi mchog skyed par byed do //
translated: Since he cultivates and frequently practices those powers, he generates two other roots of virtue that are conducive to penetration: the receptivity that is in conformity with the truth and the highest mundane factors.

original: de la bden pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa ni de kho na'i don gyis phyogs gcig la rjes su zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la bden pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa ni de kho na'i don gyis phyogs gcig la rjes su zhugs pa yin no //
translated: The receptivity that is in conformity with the truth is the entry into a portion of reality itself.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog ni bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog ni bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin te /
translated: The highest mundane factors are the uninterrupted meditative stabilization.

original: dper na me'i drod 'dod pa de nyid mngon par 'phel ba'i rtse mor byung ba na du ba 'thul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na me'i drod 'dod pa de nyid mngon par 'phel ba'i rtse mor byung ba na du ba 'thul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, when the heat of fire, which is desired, arises at the peak of its increase, smoke appears.

original: rgya cher mngon par 'phel bar byed pa na /
analyzed: rgya cher mngon par 'phel bar byed pa na /
translated: When it increases greatly,

original: me lce med pa'i me 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me lce med pa'i me 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: a smokeless fire arises.

original: de bzhin du ji ltar du ba 'thul ba de ltar ni bden pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa rnams blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar du ba 'thul ba de ltar ni bden pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa rnams blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the acceptances that conform with the truths should be seen as like the smoke.

original: ji ltar mngon par rgya cher 'phel bar gyur pa na me lce med pa'i me 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ltar ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog blta bar bya ste /

translated: The supreme mundane state should be seen as like the smokeless fire.

original: de ni skad cig gcig kho nar zad do //
analyzed: de ni skad cig gcig kho nar zad do //
translated: It lasts only one moment.

original: de la bden pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa thob pa ni brgya la yongs su nyams kyang ngan song du mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: de la bden pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa thob pa ni brgya la yongs su nyams kyang ngan song du mi 'gro ste /
translated: One who has attained the acceptances that conform with the truths will not go to the lower realms even if one regresses,

analyzed: bde 'gro'i las dang / nyon mongs pa thag bsrings pa'i phyir ro //
