original: sdug bsngal gsum dang rjes su 'brel bar ldan pa ni sdug bsngal nyid du lta ba yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum dang rjes su 'brel bar ldan pa ni sdug bsngal nyid du lta ba yin no //
translated: The view of the truth of suffering is the view of the three kinds of suffering and the three kinds of frustration.

original: de la bdag dang bdag gi dang bral bar lta ba ni stong pa nyid du lta ba yin no //
analyzed: de la bdag dang bdag gi dang bral bar lta ba ni stong pa nyid du lta ba yin no //
translated: The view of emptiness is the view of the absence of the self and what belongs to the self.

original: bdag dang bdag gi mtshan nyid med par lta ba ni bdag med pa nyid du lta ba yin te /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi mtshan nyid med par lta ba ni bdag med pa nyid du lta ba yin te /
translated: The view of the truth of selflessness is the view of the absence of the characteristics of the self and what belongs to the self.

original: bzhi po de dag ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam par lta ba go rims bzhin no ;
analyzed: bzhi po de dag ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam par lta ba go rims bzhin no ;
translated: These four views correspond to the aspects of impermanence, frustration, emptiness, and selflessness in the truth of suffering.

original: / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la rgyu dang kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang rkyen du lta ba gang yin pa de ni kun du sbyor bar byed par lta ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la rgyu dang kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang rkyen du lta ba gang yin pa de ni kun du sbyor bar byed par lta ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The view of the truth of the origin of suffering as cause, origin, successive causation, and condition is the view of the bond.

original: 'di ltar kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang kun du sbyor bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'di ltar kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang kun du sbyor bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because the truth of the origin of suffering is the cause of the truth of suffering, which is the defilement and the bond.

original: /'gog pa'i bden pa la 'gog pa dang zhi ba dang gya nom pa dang nges par 'byung bar lta ba gang yin pa de ni bral bar lta ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: /'gog pa'i bden pa la 'gog pa dang zhi ba dang gya nom pa dang nges par 'byung bar lta ba gang yin pa de ni bral bar lta ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The view that the truth of cessation is cessation, peace, excellence, and definitive release is the view of separation.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni nyon mongs pa dang phung po thams cad dang bral bas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni nyon mongs pa dang phung po thams cad dang bral bas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The truth of cessation is distinguished by being separated from all the defilements and aggregates.

original: lam gyi bden pa la lam @119b dang rigs pa dang sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin par lta ba gang yin pa de ni 'bral bar byed par lta ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa la lam @119b dang rigs pa dang sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin par lta ba gang yin pa de ni 'bral bar byed par lta ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The view that the truth of the path is the path, correctness, achievement, and definitive release is the view of separation.

original: 'di ltar lam gyi bden pa ni 'bral ba'i phyir 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar lam gyi bden pa ni 'bral ba'i phyir 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The truth of the path is the going of separation.

original: gang gis tshe sngar mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong ba dang bdag med par lta ba skye la ;
analyzed: gang gis tshe sngar mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong ba dang bdag med par lta ba skye la ;
translated: When the view of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness arises first,

original: phyis nad dang 'bras dang zug rngu dang sdig par lta ba skye bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe ci'i phyir nad la sogs pa ston ce na /
analyzed: phyis nad dang 'bras dang zug rngu dang sdig par lta ba skye bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe ci'i phyir nad la sogs pa ston ce na /
translated: and later the view of disease, abscess, arrow, and calamity arises, why is disease, etc. taught?

original: gang zag mthong ba'i lam thob pa la dgongs nas nad la sogs pa sngar ston te /
analyzed: gang zag mthong ba'i lam thob pa la dgongs nas nad la sogs pa sngar ston te /
translated: The above is stated with the intention of focusing on the person who has obtained the path of seeing.

original: 'di ltar slob ma mthong ba'i lam mthong ba ni lhag pa'i bsam pas phung po rnams la nad la sogs par lta la /
analyzed: 'di ltar slob ma mthong ba'i lam mthong ba ni lhag pa'i bsam pas phung po rnams la nad la sogs par lta la /
translated: Thus, the disciples who see the path of seeing view the aggregates as a disease and so on with superior intention.

original: de ltar lta ba de'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i kun du sbyor ba lhag ma rnams spang ba'i phyir gong du mi rtag pa la sogs par lta ba dag ces yongs su dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar lta ba de'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i kun du sbyor ba lhag ma rnams spang ba'i phyir gong du mi rtag pa la sogs par lta ba dag ces yongs su dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And since they view them in that way, their view of impermanence and so on is purified in order to abandon the remaining fetters to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs par lta ba de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs par lta ba de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That view of impermanence and so on is summarized as twofold:

original: nad la sogs par lta ba ma thob par thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nad la sogs par lta ba ma thob par thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: the view of impermanence and so on that is obtained in order to obtain the view of the aggregates as a disease and so on that has not been obtained.

original: sngar mi rtag pa la sogs par lta ba yongs su ma dag par ni tshogs kyi lam la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na so so'i skye bo rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sngar mi rtag pa la sogs par lta ba yongs su ma dag par ni tshogs kyi lam la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na so so'i skye bo rnams kyi'o //
translated: The view of impermanence and so on that is not purified is that of ordinary beings on the path of accumulation and so on.

original: nad la sogs pa'i lta ba thob pa'i phyir zhing 'byung ba dang / sems shin tu rnam par grol bar bya ba'i phyir nad la sogs par lta ba la brten pa yongs su dag pa ni mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na slob pa bzhi mthong ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: nad la sogs pa'i lta ba thob pa'i phyir zhing 'byung ba dang / sems shin tu rnam par grol bar bya ba'i phyir nad la sogs par lta ba la brten pa yongs su dag pa ni mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na slob pa bzhi mthong ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: The purification of the view of disease, etc. in order to liberate the mind completely is for the four learners in the state of the path of vision, etc.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba rnam pa bcu gcig po de dag la stong pa nyid dang bdag med pa gnyis ni rnam par thar ba'i sgo stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba rnam pa bcu gcig po de dag la stong pa nyid dang bdag med pa gnyis ni rnam par thar ba'i sgo stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa yin no //
translated: Of these eleven kinds of right view, the two views of emptiness and selflessness are the aspects of the emptiness gate of liberation.

original: lhag ma brgyad ni smon pa med pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma brgyad ni smon pa med pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: The remaining eight are the aspects of the wishless gate of liberation.

original: 'gag pa'i bden pa la bral bar lta ba gang yin pa gcig pu ni mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gag pa'i bden pa la bral bar lta ba gang yin pa gcig pu ni mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pa yin te /
translated: The one view of separation in regard to the truth of cessation is the aspect of the signless gate of liberation.

original: de ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: This is the analysis of right view.

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is right thought?

original: re zhig rnam par rtog pa dag las sems 'jug par 'gyur na /
analyzed: re zhig rnam par rtog pa dag las sems 'jug par 'gyur na /
translated: The mind engages in conceptual differentiation.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas nges par 'byung ba'i rtog pa dang gnod sems med pa'i rtog pa dang rnam par 'tshe ba med pa'i rtog pa dang de lta bu dang mthun pa'i rtog pa dag la yang dag par rtog @120a *🔽// par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas nges par 'byung ba'i rtog pa dang gnod sems med pa'i rtog pa dang rnam par 'tshe ba med pa'i rtog pa dang de lta bu dang mthun pa'i rtog pa dag la yang dag par rtog @120a * // par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the correct reflection on the thoughts of renunciation, non-violence, and non-harming, and on any other thoughts of the same kind, in accordance with that correct view.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag gang zhe na /
translated: What is right speech?

original: gal te gtam las sems 'jug par 'gyur na yang dag pa'i lta ba de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas yang dag pa'i rtog pa dge ba de dag gis kun nas bslang ba'i gtam chos dang ldan pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gal te gtam las sems 'jug par 'gyur na yang dag pa'i lta ba de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas yang dag pa'i rtog pa dge ba de dag gis kun nas bslang ba'i gtam chos dang ldan pa 'di lta ste /
translated: If speech is to be engaged in, then in accordance with that correct view, it is the correct reflection on the speech that is in conformity with the Dharma, which is inspired by those wholesome thoughts of right reflection, namely:

original: sems kyi sgrib pa spong ba dang mthun par 'gyur ba'i gtam mam /
analyzed: sems kyi sgrib pa spong ba dang mthun par 'gyur ba'i gtam mam /
translated: the speech that is in conformity with the abandonment of the obscurations of the mind;

original: tshul khrims kyi gtam mam /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi gtam mam /
translated: the speech on morality;

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi gtam mam /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi gtam mam /
translated: the speech on concentration;

original: shes rab kyi gtam mam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi gtam mam /
translated: the speech on wisdom;

original: rnam par grol ba'i gtam mam /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i gtam mam /
translated: the speech on liberation;

original: rnam par grol ba'i shes pa dang mthong ba'i gtam mam /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i shes pa dang mthong ba'i gtam mam /
translated: the speech on the knowledge and insight of liberation;

original: 'dod pa chung ba'i gtam mam /
analyzed: 'dod pa chung ba'i gtam mam /
translated: the teaching of fewness of wishes,

original: chog shes pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: chog shes pa'i gtam mam /
translated: the teaching of contentment,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gtam mam /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gtam mam /
translated: the teaching of freedom from attachment,

original: 'gog pa'i gtam mam /🔽mi stsogs pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i gtam mam / mi stsogs pa'i gtam mam /
translated: the teaching of cessation,🔽the teaching of non-proliferation,

original: 'du 'dzi med pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: 'du 'dzi med pa'i gtam mam /
translated: the teaching of solitude,

original: rkyen 'di pa gnyis kyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i gtam dag tshig 'bru 'byor ba dang / 'brel ba dang / rjes su mthun pa dang / rjes su 'phrod pa dang / thabs dang ldan pa dang / 'tsham pa dang mthun pa dang 'grus skyong gi yan lag gi tshogs dang ldan par zer ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen 'di pa gnyis kyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i gtam dag tshig 'bru 'byor ba dang / 'brel ba dang / rjes su mthun pa dang / rjes su 'phrod pa dang / thabs dang ldan pa dang / 'tsham pa dang mthun pa dang 'grus skyong gi yan lag gi tshogs dang ldan par zer ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: the teaching in conformity with the dependent origination of this and that condition, endowed with the collection of the limbs of eloquence, of well-formed words, of connection, of conformity, of appropriateness, of skillful means, of fitness, of conformity, and of perseverance.

original: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' gang zhe na /
translated: What is right action?

original: gal te las kyi mtha' la spyod par gyur na yang dag pa'i lta ba de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas 'gro ba dang ldog pa la shes bzhin du spyod par byed pa dang cung zad bltas pa dang rnam par bltas pa dang / bskum pa dang /
analyzed: gal te las kyi mtha' la spyod par gyur na yang dag pa'i lta ba de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas 'gro ba dang ldog pa la shes bzhin du spyod par byed pa dang cung zad bltas pa dang rnam par bltas pa dang / bskum pa dang /
translated: If one engages in activities, one engages in them with full awareness, in accordance with right view, when going out and coming back, when looking ahead and looking aside, when bending and stretching one’s limbs,

original: brkyang ba dang / snam sbyar dang / chos gos dang / lhung bzed dang bcas pa dang / zos pa dang / 'thungs pa dang / 'chos pa dang / myangs pa dang / song ba dang / sdod pa dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang /
analyzed: brkyang ba dang / snam sbyar dang / chos gos dang / lhung bzed dang bcas pa dang / zos pa dang / 'thungs pa dang / 'chos pa dang / myangs pa dang / song ba dang / sdod pa dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang /
translated: when bearing one’s double robe, Dharma robe, and alms bowl, when eating, drinking, chewing, and tasting, when going, standing, sitting, lying down,

original: mi nyal ba dang / smra ba dang / mi smra ba dang / gnyid kyi snyom pa bsang ba la yang shes bzhin du spyod par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi nyal ba dang / smra ba dang / mi smra ba dang / gnyid kyi snyom pa bsang ba la yang shes bzhin du spyod par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: waking up, speaking, remaining silent, and shaking off sleepiness.

original: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is right livelihood?

original: gal te 'tsho ba'i yo byad bsgrubs par gyur na yang dag pa'i lta ba de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal stan dang / nad kyi gos sman dang / yo byad dag chos kyis yongs su tshol bar byed cing log pas 'tsho bar @120b byed pa'i tshul 'chos dang /
analyzed: gal te 'tsho ba'i yo byad bsgrubs par gyur na yang dag pa'i lta ba de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal stan dang / nad kyi gos sman dang / yo byad dag chos kyis yongs su tshol bar byed cing log pas 'tsho bar @120b byed pa'i tshul 'chos dang /
translated: Even if he obtains requisites for living, he seeks robes, alms-food, bedding, seats, medicine for curing the sick, and implements for living through Dharma, not through wrong livelihood, and he abandons hypocrisy,

original: kha gsag dang / gzhogs slong dang / thob kyis 'jal ba dang / rnyed pas rnyed par byed 'dod pa ngag rnam par spang ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kha gsag dang / gzhogs slong dang / thob kyis 'jal ba dang / rnyed pas rnyed par byed 'dod pa ngag rnam par spang ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: flattery, hinting, expecting rewards, and desiring gain through gain.

original: de ltar spong ba yang dag par bsdus pa yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba de gsum ni des dang po kho nar mthong ba'i lam la zag pa med pa'i yid la byed pa thob pa na byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang lhan cig kho nar thob pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar spong ba yang dag par bsdus pa yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba de gsum ni des dang po kho nar mthong ba'i lam la zag pa med pa'i yid la byed pa thob pa na byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang lhan cig kho nar thob pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the three—right speech, right action, and right livelihood—which are included in abandonment, are obtained together with the limbs of enlightenment when the uncontaminated mental attention of the path of seeing is first obtained.

original: de dag ni 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the moral precepts that delight the noble ones.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni 'phags pa dam pa yang dag par spong ba rnams ci nas kyang bdag gis ngag gi nyes par spyad pa dang / lus kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / log pas 'tsho ba dag mi bya ba'i sdom pa de thob par bya'o zhes yun ring po nas dgyes pa dang sdug pa dang phangs pa dang thugs su 'thad par mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni 'phags pa dam pa yang dag par spong ba rnams ci nas kyang bdag gis ngag gi nyes par spyad pa dang / lus kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / log pas 'tsho ba dag mi bya ba'i sdom pa de thob par bya'o zhes yun ring po nas dgyes pa dang sdug pa dang phangs pa dang thugs su 'thad par mdzad pa yin te /
translated: Because the noble ones have long delighted in, loved, cherished, and approved of the vow not to engage in verbal misconduct, physical misconduct, and wrong livelihood.

original: de dag gis yun ring po nas dgyes pa dang sdug pa dang phangs pa dang thugs su 'thad pa mdzad pa gang yin pa de /
analyzed: de dag gis yun ring po nas dgyes pa dang sdug pa dang phangs pa dang thugs su 'thad pa mdzad pa gang yin pa de /
translated: Whatever the noble ones have long delighted in, loved, cherished, and approved of,

original: des de'i tshe na thob pas na de ni 'phags pa dgyes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des de'i tshe na thob pas na de ni 'phags pa dgyes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: that they obtain at that time. Therefore, it is called “that which delights the noble ones.”

original: de ltar 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims mngon par rtogs pa na shes bzhin du brdzun gyi tshig smra bar mi byed /
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims mngon par rtogs pa na shes bzhin du brdzun gyi tshig smra bar mi byed /
translated: Thus, when one realizes the moral precepts that delight the noble ones, one does not speak deceptively, knowingly.

original: bsams bzhin du srog chags kyi srog gcod par mi byed /
analyzed: bsams bzhin du srog chags kyi srog gcod par mi byed /
translated: He does not intentionally kill living beings.

original: ma byin par len par mi byed /
analyzed: ma byin par len par mi byed /
translated: He does not take what is not given.

original: 'dod pas log par g-yem par mi byed /🔽chos ma yin pas chos gos la sogs pa yongs su tshol bar mi byed pas na de ltar 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims de dag nyid kyi dbang du byas te bsgom pa'i lam gyi tshe ngag 'jug pa gang yin pa dang / lus kyi las gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod pas log par g-yem par mi byed / chos ma yin pas chos gos la sogs pa yongs su tshol bar mi byed pas na de ltar 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims de dag nyid kyi dbang du byas te bsgom pa'i lam gyi tshe ngag 'jug pa gang yin pa dang / lus kyi las gang yin pa dang /
translated: He does not engage in sexual misconduct.🔽He does not seek robes, etc. by improper means.

original: 'tsho ba gang yin pa de dag kyang yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba gang yin pa de dag kyang yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, in the context of the path of meditation, the speech, action, and livelihood of the noble ones that are based on those very moral precepts that please the noble ones are called right speech, right action, and right livelihood.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba gang zhe na /🔽yang dag pa'i lta ba dang rtog pa dang ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba dag la brten te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba gang zhe na /🔽yang dag pa'i lta ba dang rtog pa dang ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba dag la brten te /
translated: What is right effort?🔽It is the effort to abandon unwholesome states that have already arisen, to prevent unwholesome states that have not yet arisen from arising, to produce wholesome states that have not yet arisen, and to maintain, increase, develop, and perfect wholesome states that have already arisen.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la zhugs pa de'i kun du sbyor ba lhag ma rnams spang ba'i phyir chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub par byed pa na /🔽'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / rtsol ba dang / nges par 'byung bar byed pa dang / pha rol gnon @121a * //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la zhugs pa de'i kun du sbyor ba lhag ma rnams spang ba'i phyir chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub par byed pa na / 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / rtsol ba dang / nges par 'byung bar byed pa dang / pha rol gnon @121a * //
translated: When the person who has entered the path of cultivation is practicing the teaching in conformity with the teaching in order to abandon the remaining fetters,

original: par byed pa dang / mthu dang / rtsol ba dang / sems yang dag par rab tu 'dzin par byed pa dang / brtson 'grus gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: par byed pa dang / mthu dang / rtsol ba dang / sems yang dag par rab tu 'dzin par byed pa dang / brtson 'grus gang yin pa'o //
translated: it is the will, the effort, the exertion, the perseverance, the heroism, the resoluteness, the strength, the vigor, the mental firmness, and the effort that he puts forth.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is right mindfulness?

original: de ltar yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang ldan pa de'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'i dbang du byas nas phyin ci ma log par bsdus pa'i dran pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang ldan pa de'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'i dbang du byas nas phyin ci ma log par bsdus pa'i dran pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the correct application of mindfulness in regard to the four foundations of mindfulness of a person who is endowed with right effort.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is right concentration?

original: de ltar yang dag pa'i dran pa la brten nas phyin ci ma log pas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dran pa de la zhi gnas kyi sems gnas pa dgu dang stobs drug dang yid la byed pa bzhis 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa'i dran pa la brten nas phyin ci ma log pas yang dag par bsdus pa'i dran pa de la zhi gnas kyi sems gnas pa dgu dang stobs drug dang yid la byed pa bzhis 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Thus, based on right mindfulness, the mind that abides in serenity enters into right mindfulness, which is gathered by non-error, through the nine abidings of the mind, the six powers, and the four attentions.

original: de la sems gnas pa dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sems gnas pa dgu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the nine abidings of the mind?

original: sems nang kho nar 'jog par byed pa dang / yang dag par 'jog par byed pa dang / bsdus te 'jog par byed pa dang / nye bar 'jog par byed pa dang / dul bar byed pa dang / zhi bar byed pa dang / nye bar zhi bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: sems nang kho nar 'jog par byed pa dang / yang dag par 'jog par byed pa dang / bsdus te 'jog par byed pa dang / nye bar 'jog par byed pa dang / dul bar byed pa dang / zhi bar byed pa dang / nye bar zhi bar byed pa dang /
translated: Placing the mind within, correctly placing, placing with collection, placing with proximity, taming, pacifying, thoroughly pacifying,

original: rgyud gcig tu byed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin du byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud gcig tu byed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin du byed pa'o //
translated: unifying the continuum, and samadhi.

original: de la ji ltar na 'jog par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na 'jog par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one place the mind?

original: phyi rol gyi dmigs pa thams cad las yang dag par bsdus te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dmigs pa thams cad las yang dag par bsdus te /
translated: Having gathered all external objects,

original: rnam par mi g-yeng bar bya ba'i phyir dang po nang du nye bar gtod par byed pa gang yin pa de ni 'jog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi g-yeng bar bya ba'i phyir dang po nang du nye bar gtod par byed pa gang yin pa de ni 'jog par byed pa yin no //
translated: The first is the fixing of the mind, which is the fixing of the mind inwardly in order to avoid distraction.

original: ji ltar na yang dag par 'jog par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na yang dag par 'jog par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is there correct fixing?

original: dang po nye bar gtad pa'i sems gang yin pa de g-yo ba dang rags pa dang yang dag par mi gnas pa dang yongs su mi gnas par gyur pa na /
analyzed: dang po nye bar gtad pa'i sems gang yin pa de g-yo ba dang rags pa dang yang dag par mi gnas pa dang yongs su mi gnas par gyur pa na /
translated: When the mind that has been fixed becomes unsteady, gross, unquiet, and uncalm,

original: de dmigs pa de nyid la gtad pa'i tshul dang dang bar bya ba'i tshul gyis mngon par tshar bcad pa dang bcas pas 'phro bar mi byed cing mngon par g-yeng bar mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag par 'jog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dmigs pa de nyid la gtad pa'i tshul dang dang bar bya ba'i tshul gyis mngon par tshar bcad pa dang bcas pas 'phro bar mi byed cing mngon par g-yeng bar mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag par 'jog par byed pa yin no //
translated: then, by the method of directing the mind to that object and by the method of purifying it, one fixes it correctly by not allowing it to scatter and by not allowing it to become distracted.

original: ji ltar na bsdus te 'jog par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bsdus te 'jog par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is there collected fixing?

original: de ltar de'i sems gzhag pa dang yang dag par gzhag pa de gal te brjed ngas pas phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng bar gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar de'i sems gzhag pa dang yang dag par gzhag pa de gal te brjed ngas pas phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng bar gyur na /
translated: Thus, if his mind is placed and well-placed, but becomes distracted externally due to forgetfulness,

original: des yang phyir de nyid la sdud par byed do //
analyzed: des yang phyir de nyid la sdud par byed do //
translated: he again gathers it back in.

original: de ltar na bsdus te 'jog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bsdus te 'jog par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he is one who gathers and places.

original: ji ltar na nye bar 'jog par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na nye bar 'jog par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is he one who places near?

original: dang po kho @121b nar de lta de ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag ste /
analyzed: dang po kho @121b nar de lta de ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag ste /
translated: From the very beginning, he places mindfulness right there,

original: gnas shing sems de yang dag par 'jog par byed pa na /
analyzed: gnas shing sems de yang dag par 'jog par byed pa na /
translated: and when he is abiding and placing the mind well,

original: zhi gnas dang de'i sems de phyi rol du mi 'gro bar byed de /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang de'i sems de phyi rol du mi 'gro bar byed de /
translated: he makes śamatha and that mind not go externally.

original: de ltar na nye bar 'jog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na nye bar 'jog par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he is one who places near.

original: ji ltar na dul bar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dul bar byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is he one who tames?

original: gzugs dang ; sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i mchan ma dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / skyes pa dang / bud med kyi mtshan ma gang gis de'i sems rnam par g-yeng bar gyur na /
analyzed: gzugs dang ; sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i mchan ma dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / skyes pa dang / bud med kyi mtshan ma gang gis de'i sems rnam par g-yeng bar gyur na /
translated: the signs of form, sound, smell, taste, and tactility, and the signs of men and women,

original: de la des dang po nyid nas nyes dmigs kyi 'du shes bzung ba de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas mtshan ma de dag la de'i sems 'phror mi ster bar byed de /
analyzed: de la des dang po nyid nas nyes dmigs kyi 'du shes bzung ba de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas mtshan ma de dag la de'i sems 'phror mi ster bar byed de /
translated: he does not allow his mind to be distracted by those signs.

original: de ltar na dul bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dul bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he is one who tames.

original: ji ltar na zhi bar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na zhi bar byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is he one who pacifies?

original: 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa gang dag dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang dag gis de'i sems kun du 'khrugs par gyur na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa gang dag dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang dag gis de'i sems kun du 'khrugs par gyur na /
translated: When his mind is disturbed by any of the discursive thoughts such as the discursive thought of desire, etc., or by any of the secondary defilements such as the will to commit evil, etc.,

original: de la des dang po nyid nas nyes dmigs kyi 'du shes su bzung ba de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas rnam par rtog pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag la de'i sems 'phror mi ster bar byed de /
analyzed: de la des dang po nyid nas nyes dmigs kyi 'du shes su bzung ba de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas rnam par rtog pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag la de'i sems 'phror mi ster bar byed de /
translated: From the very beginning, he does not allow his mind to be distracted by those thoughts and secondary defilements, because he has taken hold of the idea of the disadvantages of those thoughts and secondary defilements.

original: de ltar na zhi bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na zhi bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus he pacifies them.

original: ji ltar na nye bar zhi bar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na nye bar zhi bar byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does he completely pacify them?

original: de brjed ngas pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de gnyis ka kun du 'byung bar gyur na /
analyzed: de brjed ngas pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de gnyis ka kun du 'byung bar gyur na /
translated: When both thoughts and secondary defilements arise because of his forgetfulness,

original: byung ngo cog dang du mi len cing spong bar byed de /
analyzed: byung ngo cog dang du mi len cing spong bar byed de /
translated: he does not accept them, but abandons them.

original: de ltar na nye bar zhi bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na nye bar zhi bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus he completely pacifies them.

original: ji ltar na rgyud gcig tu byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rgyud gcig tu byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does he unify his mind?

original: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas bar du chad pa med pa dang rgyun chags par ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyun la 'jog par byed de /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas bar du chad pa med pa dang rgyun chags par ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyun la 'jog par byed de /
translated: He places his mind in a continuous flow in concentration, without interruption, with effort.

original: de ltar na rgyud gcig tu byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyud gcig tu byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus he unifies his mind.

original: ji ltar na ting nge 'dzin du byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na ting nge 'dzin du byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one make the mind concentrated?🔽By the cause of repeated practice, one attains the path of spontaneous and natural engagement.

original: kun du bsten zhing goms par byas lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa dang rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i lam thob cing mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / lhun gyis grub pa de nyid kyis de'i sems de rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyun la 'jug @122a * //🔽bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun du bsten zhing goms par byas lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa dang rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i lam thob cing mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / lhun gyis grub pa de nyid kyis de'i sems de rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyun la 'jug @122a * // bar 'gyur te /
translated: By that very spontaneous and natural engagement, one's mind enters the stream of concentration free from distraction.

original: de ltar na ting nge 'dzin du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ting nge 'dzin du byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus one makes the mind concentrated.

original: de la stobs drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la stobs drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six forces?

original: thos pa'i stobs dang / bsam pa'i stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / shes bzhin gyi stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / yongs su 'dris pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: thos pa'i stobs dang / bsam pa'i stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / shes bzhin gyi stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / yongs su 'dris pa'i stobs so //
translated: The force of hearing, the force of reflection, the force of mindfulness, the force of vigilance, the force of striving, and the force of thorough familiarization.

original: stobs drug po de dag gis sems gnas pa dgu po de dag 'grub ste /
analyzed: stobs drug po de dag gis sems gnas pa dgu po de dag 'grub ste /
translated: These six forces accomplish the nine mental abidings.

original: de la thos pa'i stobs dang bsam pa'i stobs kyis ni re zhig thos pa gang yin pa dang bsam pa gang yin pa'i dbang du byas nas dang por kho nar sems dmigs pa la 'jog par byed pa dang de nyid la gtod pa'i tshul gyis yang dag par🔽'jog par byed do //🔽dran pa'i stobs kyis ni de ltar sems gtad pa la yang dag par sdud pa dang rnam par mi g-yeng par byed pas bsdus te 'jog nye bar 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: de la thos pa'i stobs dang bsam pa'i stobs kyis ni re zhig thos pa gang yin pa dang bsam pa gang yin pa'i dbang du byas nas dang por kho nar sems dmigs pa la 'jog par byed pa dang de nyid la gtod pa'i tshul gyis yang dag par 'jog par byed do // dran pa'i stobs kyis ni de ltar sems gtad pa la yang dag par sdud pa dang rnam par mi g-yeng par byed pas bsdus te 'jog nye bar 'jog par byed do //
translated: The power of hearing and the power of reflection first place the mind on the meditative object and correctly establish it on the meditative object by the method of directing the mind to that meditative object, in terms of what has been heard and what has been reflected upon.🔽The power of mindfulness, by collecting and establishing the mind that has been directed in that way, and by not being distracted, collects and establishes the mind, and closely establishes the mind.

original: shes bzhin gyi stobs kyis ni de nas rnam par rtog pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma dag la 'phro bar mi byed pas dul bar byed pa dang zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: shes bzhin gyi stobs kyis ni de nas rnam par rtog pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma dag la 'phro bar mi byed pas dul bar byed pa dang zhi bar byed do //
translated: The power of vigilance, by not scattering the mind to the signs of discursive thought and secondary defilement, tames the mind and pacifies the mind.

original: brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis ni de gnyi ga dang du mi len pa dang rgyun chags par ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyun la 'jog par byed pas zhi bar byed pa dang rgyun gcig tu byed do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis ni de gnyi ga dang du mi len pa dang rgyun chags par ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyun la 'jog par byed pas zhi bar byed pa dang rgyun gcig tu byed do //
translated: By the power of vigor, one does not accept either of those two, and one pacifies and makes them one flow by placing the mind in the flow of concentration.

original: yongs su 'dris par byed pa'i stobs kyis ni ting nge 'dzin du byed do ;
analyzed: yongs su 'dris par byed pa'i stobs kyis ni ting nge 'dzin du byed do ;
translated: By the power of thorough familiarity, one concentrates.

original: / de la yid la byed pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: / de la yid la byed pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four attentions?

original: bsgrims te 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa dang / skabs su 'chad cing 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa dang / skabs su 'chad pa med par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa dang / rtsol ba med par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrims te 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa dang / skabs su 'chad cing 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa dang / skabs su 'chad pa med par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa dang / rtsol ba med par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Attention that is tight, attention that is intermittent, attention that is uninterrupted, and attention that is effortless.

original: sems gnas pa dgu po de dag ni yid la byed pa de bzhis 'jug ste /
analyzed: sems gnas pa dgu po de dag ni yid la byed pa de bzhis 'jug ste /
translated: Those nine mental placements are engaged by those four attentions.

original: de la 'jog par byed pa dang yang dag par 'jog par byed pas ni bsgrims te 'jug pa'i yid la byed pas 'jug go //
analyzed: de la 'jog par byed pa dang yang dag par 'jog par byed pas ni bsgrims te 'jug pa'i yid la byed pas 'jug go //
translated: By the attention that is tight, one engages in the mental placement that is tight and the mental placement that is correct.

original: bsdus te 'jog par byed pa dang nye bar 'jog par byed pa dang dul bar byed pa dang zhi bar byed pa dang nye bar zhi bar byed pas ni skabs su 'chad cing 'jug pa'i yid la byed pas 'jug go //
analyzed: bsdus te 'jog par byed pa dang nye bar 'jog par byed pa dang dul bar byed pa dang zhi bar byed pa dang nye bar zhi bar byed pas ni skabs su 'chad cing 'jug pa'i yid la byed pas 'jug go //
translated: One enters by means of the mental attention that is interrupted and engaged, because one is engaged in the mental attention of collecting and placing, closely placing, taming, pacifying, and thoroughly pacifying.

original: rgyud gcig tu byed pa ni skabs su 'chad pa med par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pas 'jug go //
analyzed: rgyud gcig tu byed pa ni skabs su 'chad pa med par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pas 'jug go //
translated: One enters by means of the mental attention that is uninterrupted and engaged, because one is engaged in the mental attention of unifying the continuum.

original: ting nge 'dzin du byed pa'i rtsol ba med par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pas 'jug go //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du byed pa'i rtsol ba med par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pas 'jug go //
translated: One enters by means of the mental attention that is engaged without effort, because one is engaged in the mental attention of making it samādhi.

original: 'dir bsgom pa'i lam la ni @122b thams cad du yang sems gnas pa dgu las ting nge 'dzin du byed pa dang / stobs drug las yongs su 'dris pa'i stobs dang / yid la byed pa bzhi las rtsol ba med par 'jug pa yid la byed pa shas cher 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'dir bsgom pa'i lam la ni @122b thams cad du yang sems gnas pa dgu las ting nge 'dzin du byed pa dang / stobs drug las yongs su 'dris pa'i stobs dang / yid la byed pa bzhi las rtsol ba med par 'jug pa yid la byed pa shas cher 'jug ste /
translated: Here, on the path of cultivation, one enters by means of the mental attention that is engaged without effort, because one is engaged in the mental attention of making it samādhi and the power of thorough acquaintance, out of the six powers, and the mental attention that is engaged without effort, out of the four mental attentions.

original: de yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: This is the classification of right samādhi.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa de dag thams cad kyang mdor bsdu na rgyu ba'i tshe na bya ba dang / gnas pa'i tshe na bya ba ni de la yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba dag ni rgyu ba'i tshe na bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa de dag thams cad kyang mdor bsdu na rgyu ba'i tshe na bya ba dang / gnas pa'i tshe na bya ba ni de la yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba dag ni rgyu ba'i tshe na bya ba yin no //
translated: right speech, right action, and right livelihood.

original: gnas pa'i tshe na bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gnas pa'i tshe na bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The practice when one is staying still is twofold:

original: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong ngo //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong ngo //
translated: tranquility and insight.

original: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba rtog pa dang rtsol ba gang yin pa de ni lhag mthong yin no //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba rtog pa dang rtsol ba gang yin pa de ni lhag mthong yin no //
translated: Right view, thought, and effort are insight.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de ni zhi gnas yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de ni zhi gnas yin no //
translated: Right mindfulness and concentration are tranquility.

original: de ltar yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa la brten nas dus dus su zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom par byed pa de ni kun du sbyor ba ma lus par spangs pa mngon sum du byed cing 'bras bu'i mchog
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa la brten nas dus dus su zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom par byed pa de ni kun du sbyor ba ma lus par spangs pa mngon sum du byed cing 'bras bu'i mchog
translated: Thus, based on completely purifying right speech, right action and right livelihood, one meditates on serenity and insight from time to time and one directly realizes the complete abandonment of all fetters.🔽One also attains the supreme result of arhat.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyang thob par 'gyur bas brgyad po de dag ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyang thob par 'gyur bas brgyad po de dag ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag yin no //
translated: These eight are branches of the ārya path.

original: de la gang gi tshe 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phung po lnga po thams cad lam gyis bsdus pa yin pa de'i tshe ci'i phyir yang dag pa'i lta ba mngon du btang ba'i 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa lam gyi bden pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phung po lnga po thams cad lam gyis bsdus pa yin pa de'i tshe ci'i phyir yang dag pa'i lta ba mngon du btang ba'i 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa lam gyi bden pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: When all five transcendent paths are included in the path, why is the eightfold noble path that manifests right view called the truth of the path?

original: 'phags pa slob pa bzhi mthong ba rnams kyi bslab pa gsum gyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'phags pa slob pa bzhi mthong ba rnams kyi bslab pa gsum gyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is because it is the training of the four āryas who see the truth, from the perspective of the three trainings.

original: slob pa ni 'di ltar dus dus su lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yang slob par byed cing /
analyzed: slob pa ni 'di ltar dus dus su lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yang slob par byed cing /
translated: One in training trains in the higher training of superior morality from time to time,

original: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yang slob par byed /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yang slob par byed /
translated: trains in the higher training of superior mind,

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yang slob par byed la /
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yang slob par byed la /
translated: and trains in the higher training of superior wisdom.

original: bslab pa gsum ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yin pas de'i phyir lam gyi bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bslab pa gsum ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yin pas de'i phyir lam gyi bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the three trainings are the eightfold noble path, they are called the truth of path.

original: de la yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yin no //
translated: Right speech, right action and right livelihood are the higher training of superior morality.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yang dag pa'i chos kyi longs spyod dang yang dag pa'i zang zing gi longs spyod kyi dbang du byas pa'i rgyu gnyis kyis te /🔽yang dag pa'i ngag dang yang dag pa'i @123a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i chos kyi longs spyod dang yang dag pa'i zang zing gi longs spyod kyi dbang du byas pa'i rgyu gnyis kyis te / yang dag pa'i ngag dang yang dag pa'i @123a * //
translated: It is due to two causes: the enjoyment of the right Dharma and the enjoyment of right material things.

original: las kyi mtha' ni rtsa ba'i tshul khrims yin te /
analyzed: las kyi mtha' ni rtsa ba'i tshul khrims yin te /
translated: Right speech and right action are the root of morality.

original: tshul khrims ni chos kyi longs spyod thams cad kyi gzhi yin pas de gnyis kyi yang dag pa'i chos la longs spyod kyi dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni chos kyi longs spyod thams cad kyi gzhi yin pas de gnyis kyi yang dag pa'i chos la longs spyod kyi dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: Morality is the basis of all the enjoyments of the Dharma, so it is considered in terms of the enjoyment of the true Dharma of those two.

original: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni tshul 'chos pa la sogs pa log par 'tsho bar byed pa'i chos rnams la mi brten par chos gos la sogs pa yongs su tshol ba'i rtsa ba dang / gzhi yin pas de ni yang dag pa'i zang zing gi longs spyod kyi dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni tshul 'chos pa la sogs pa log par 'tsho bar byed pa'i chos rnams la mi brten par chos gos la sogs pa yongs su tshol ba'i rtsa ba dang / gzhi yin pas de ni yang dag pa'i zang zing gi longs spyod kyi dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: Right livelihood is the root and basis of seeking the Dharma robes and so on without relying on wrong livelihood, such as hypocrisy. It is considered in terms of the enjoyment of right material things.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang rtog pa ni rtsol ba dang lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang rtog pa ni rtsol ba dang lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yin no //
translated: Right view and thought are the higher trainings in effort and wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi lam gyis ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum yod la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi lam gyis ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum yod la /
translated: The path of wisdom exists in brief in three aspects.

original: de dag ni chos gsum po de dag gis yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos gsum po de dag gis yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are completed by those three dharmas.

original: chos kyi de kho na'i don rtogs par byed pa'i las kyi de kho na'i don rtogs nas /
analyzed: chos kyi de kho na'i don rtogs par byed pa'i las kyi de kho na'i don rtogs nas /
translated: The function of understanding the reality of the object of knowledge is the function of understanding the reality of action.

original: de nyid gzhan dag la ston par byed pa'i las dang kun du sbyor ba lhag ma rnams spangs pa'i phyir chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i las te /
analyzed: de nyid gzhan dag la ston par byed pa'i las dang kun du sbyor ba lhag ma rnams spangs pa'i phyir chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i las te /
translated: The function of teaching that reality to others is the function of practice in accordance with the teaching, because it eliminates the remaining fetters.

original: las de gsum ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang rtog pa dang rtsol ba dag gis go rims bzhin du yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las de gsum ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang rtog pa dang rtsol ba dag gis go rims bzhin du yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These three functions are completed respectively by right view, right thought, and right effort.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yin no //
translated: Right mindfulness and right concentration are the training in the higher mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis te /
translated: In two ways:

original: ngo bo nyid dang / rkyen gyis so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / rkyen gyis so //
translated: by nature and by condition.

original: de la yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni lhag pa'i sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni lhag pa'i sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: Among them, right concentration is the nature of the higher mind.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa ni rgyu bzhis lhag pa'i sems kyi rten gyi bya ba byed pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa ni rgyu bzhis lhag pa'i sems kyi rten gyi bya ba byed pa yin te /
translated: Right mindfulness is the support of the higher mind, because it performs the function of support in four ways.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po dag la sems dmigs pa la nye bar gtod par byed pa dang / dbang po'i sgo bsdam pa dang / shes bzhin du spyod pa dang / dang bar gyur ba'i gnas lta bu'i dran pa yid la byed pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes su mthun pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po dag la sems dmigs pa la nye bar gtod par byed pa dang / dbang po'i sgo bsdam pa dang / shes bzhin du spyod pa dang / dang bar gyur ba'i gnas lta bu'i dran pa yid la byed pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes su mthun pa dang /
translated: It is through the four close mindfulnesses, through focusing the mind on the object, through restraining the sense doors, through acting vigilantly, through the mindfulness that is like a delightful place, through the attention that is compatible with concentration,

original: sgrib pa'i gnyen po mi sdug pa la sogs pa yid la bya ba dag la lam la sgrib pa spong ba dang / rab tu dben pa'i zhi gnas dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma rtag tu byed pa dang gus par byed pa'i sbyor ba dag la mtshan ma yid la byed pa lan mang du byed pas so //
analyzed: sgrib pa'i gnyen po mi sdug pa la sogs pa yid la bya ba dag la lam la sgrib pa spong ba dang / rab tu dben pa'i zhi gnas dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma rtag tu byed pa dang gus par byed pa'i sbyor ba dag la mtshan ma yid la byed pa lan mang du byed pas so //

original: de ltar 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad po de dag ni rnam par dag pa nges par 'byin pa'i lam yin pas na 'phags pa'i @123b phyogs dang 'khor bsdu ba'i dngos po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad po de dag ni rnam par dag pa nges par 'byin pa'i lam yin pas na 'phags pa'i @123b phyogs dang 'khor bsdu ba'i dngos po zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, since these eight branches of the noble path are the pure path of definite release, they are called the side of enlightenment and the things that gather the accumulations.

original: de tsam gyis yang dag pa'i mtha' rtogs pas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de tsam gyis yang dag pa'i mtha' rtogs pas 'di lta ste /
translated: By merely realizing the limit of reality, one attains the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment of a buddha.

original: sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par thar bar bya ba'i phyir lam gyi yan lag rnams kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du rjes su thob par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par thar bar bya ba'i phyir lam gyi yan lag rnams kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du rjes su thob par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, in order to be completely liberated from all obscurations, one should understand that one subsequently attains unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment by means of the branches of the path.

original: gnyen po bsgoms pas rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: gnyen po bsgoms pas rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the words and so on of the classification of the cultivation of the antidotes is complete.🔽The classification of its result. The classification of the result of the cultivation of the antidotes is the classification of the result of the cultivation of the antidotes, which is the result of the cultivation of the antidotes, the gnosis and abandonment.

original: // / de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa ni gnyen po bsgom pas de'i 'bras bu ye shes dang spangs pa rnam par gzhag pa'o zhes smos pa la ye shes rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: // / de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa ni gnyen po bsgom pas de'i 'bras bu ye shes dang spangs pa rnam par gzhag pa'o zhes smos pa la ye shes rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification of gnosis?

original: de kho na rab tu rtogs pa'i dngos po zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de kho na rab tu rtogs pa'i dngos po zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The reality of the realization of thatness is taught by the line, “The reality of the realization of thatness.”

original: byang chub kyi phyogs bsgoms pa'i dbang gis 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam rnams la de kho na'i don rab tu rtogs pa'i shes pa ni de kho na nyid rab tu shes pa'i dngos po zhes bya ste de ni ye shes rnam par gzhag
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs bsgoms pa'i dbang gis 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam rnams la de kho na'i don rab tu rtogs pa'i shes pa ni de kho na nyid rab tu shes pa'i dngos po zhes bya ste de ni ye shes rnam par gzhag
translated: The knowledge that realizes the meaning of thatness on the mundane and supramundane paths through the power of cultivating the elements that lead to enlightenment is called “the reality of the realization of thatness.”

original: pa yin no //
analyzed: pa yin no //
translated: This is the presentation of wisdom.

original: de la de kho na'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de kho na'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of thatness?

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In brief, it is twofold:

original: ji ltar yod pa las brtsams te chos rnams kyi yang dag pa nyid gang yin pa dang / ji snyed yod pa las brtsams te chos rnams kyi thams cad nyid gang yin pa ste de ltar yang dag pa nyid dang thams cad nyid ni chos rnams kyi de kho na'i don mtha' dag yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa las brtsams te chos rnams kyi yang dag pa nyid gang yin pa dang / ji snyed yod pa las brtsams te chos rnams kyi thams cad nyid gang yin pa ste de ltar yang dag pa nyid dang thams cad nyid ni chos rnams kyi de kho na'i don mtha' dag yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: the reality of phenomena, which is based on how things exist, and the totality of phenomena, which is based on the extent to which things exist. Thus, reality and totality should be understood as the entirety of the meaning of thatness of phenomena.

original: de kho na'i don de yang rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de kho na'i don de yang rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: That meaning of thatness is also classified in four ways:

original: 'jig rten gyi grags pa'i de kho na dang / rigs pas grags pa'i de kho na'i don dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi grags pa'i de kho na dang / rigs pas grags pa'i de kho na'i don dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na'o //
translated: The reality of what is renowned in the world, the object of what is renowned through reasoning, the reality that is the domain of the consciousness that is purified of the afflictive obstructions, and the reality that is the domain of the consciousness that is purified of the obstructions to omniscience.

original: de la 'jig rten gyi grags pa'i de kho na gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten gyi grags pa'i de kho na gang zhe na /
translated: What is the reality of what is renowned in the world?

original: brda dang kun rdzob 'dris pa'i rjes su 'gro bas zhugs pa'i blos dngos po gang la 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi lta ba mtshungs par gyur ba 'jig rten thams cad kyi nges par mos pa'i spyod yul gcig nas gcig tu 'ongs pa'i ming gi rang gi rnam
analyzed: brda dang kun rdzob 'dris pa'i rjes su 'gro bas zhugs pa'i blos dngos po gang la 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi lta ba mtshungs par gyur ba 'jig rten thams cad kyi nges par mos pa'i spyod yul gcig nas gcig tu 'ongs pa'i ming gi rang gi rnam
translated: It is that object to which the mind that engages through following what is familiar with signs and conventions is directed, and with regard to which all worldly people have a similar view, the domain of the certain belief of all worldly people, the name of which has come down from one generation to the next.

original: par rtog pa la grags pa ma bsams ma dpyad ma brtags pa bzung dngos po gzugs she'am sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten gyi grags pa'i de kho na'o zhes bya'o //🔽rigs par grags pa'i @124a * //
analyzed: par rtog pa la grags pa ma bsams ma dpyad ma brtags pa bzung dngos po gzugs she'am sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten gyi grags pa'i de kho na'o zhes bya'o // rigs par grags pa'i @124a * //
translated: The “suchness that is renowned in the world” is that which is renowned in the world, not contemplated, not analyzed, not examined, and not investigated.

original: de kho na gang zhe na /🔽dam pa rigs pa'i don la mkhas pa mdzangs pa rtog ge'i dpyod pa dang ldan pa rtog ger rtogs pa'i sa'i rang gi spobs pa las byung ba so so'i skye bo dpyod pa'i rjes su dpyod pa la gnas pa rnams kyi shes pa shin tu rnam par phye
analyzed: de kho na gang zhe na / dam pa rigs pa'i don la mkhas pa mdzangs pa rtog ge'i dpyod pa dang ldan pa rtog ger rtogs pa'i sa'i rang gi spobs pa las byung ba so so'i skye bo dpyod pa'i rjes su dpyod pa la gnas pa rnams kyi shes pa shin tu rnam par phye
translated: What is the “suchness that is renowned in reasoning”?🔽The “suchness that is renowned in reasoning” is that which is known by the wise, the learned, the intelligent, those who analyze with reasoning, those who have the confidence of the stage of reasoning, ordinary beings who abide in the analysis of analysis, and whose knowledge is very clear,

original: ba rnam par nges pa'i spyod yul shes bya'i dngos po mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma la brten nas 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pas rab tu bsgrubs shing rnam par gzhag pa rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa
analyzed: ba rnam par nges pa'i spyod yul shes bya'i dngos po mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma la brten nas 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pas rab tu bsgrubs shing rnam par gzhag pa rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa
translated: whose domain is ascertained, and who rely on the valid cognitions of direct perception, inference, and reliable scripture. It is established and posited by the reasoning that establishes what is tenable, with regard to the entities that are objects of knowledge, whether in terms of their specific or general characteristics.

original: de ni rigs pas grags pa'i de kho na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rigs pas grags pa'i de kho na zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the reality that is renowned through reasoning.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na gang zhe na /
translated: What is the reality that is the domain of the knowledge that purifies the obscurations of the afflictions?

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zag pa med pa dang zag pa med pa thob par byed pa dang / zag pa med pa'i rdzas las thob pa 'jig rten pa'i shes pas spyod yul du bya ba 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na zhes ba'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zag pa med pa dang zag pa med pa thob par byed pa dang / zag pa med pa'i rdzas las thob pa 'jig rten pa'i shes pas spyod yul du bya ba 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na zhes ba'o //
translated: It is the four noble truths that are the domain of mundane knowledge, which is obtained from the substance of the uncontaminated and which causes the attainment of the uncontaminated of all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas. This is called the reality that is the domain of the knowledge that purifies the obscurations of the afflictions.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na gang zhe na /🔽chos thams cad brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid las brtsams te /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na gang zhe na /🔽chos thams cad brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid las brtsams te /
translated: What is the reality that is the domain of the knowledge that purifies the obscurations to that which needs to be known?🔽It is the domain of the knowledge that is the purification of the obscurations to that which needs to be known.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes chos bdag med pa la 'jug pa dang zhugs par gyur pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i tshig tu btags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par mi rtog pa dang mtshungs par spyod yul gyi
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes chos bdag med pa la 'jug pa dang zhugs par gyur pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i tshig tu btags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par mi rtog pa dang mtshungs par spyod yul gyi
translated: The object field of the wisdom of the bodhisattvas and the transcendent conquerors, which engages and has engaged the reality of the selflessness of phenomena, is the ultimate object of knowledge, which is the supreme, unsurpassed, and final object field of the wisdom of the buddhas, which is the nonconceptual reality that is designated by the words extremely pure.

original: yul du bya ba de bzhin mchog bla na med pa'i shes bya'i mthar thug pa gang yin pa de ni shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yul du bya ba de bzhin mchog bla na med pa'i shes bya'i mthar thug pa gang yin pa de ni shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na zhes bya ste /
translated: That is called the reality that is the object field of the wisdom that is the result of the meditation on the antidote.

original: de kho na de dag rab tu rtogs pa'i dngos po'i ye shes rnam par gzhag pa de ni gnyen po bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa gcig yin no //
analyzed: de kho na de dag rab tu rtogs pa'i dngos po'i ye shes rnam par gzhag pa de ni gnyen po bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa gcig yin no //
translated: The presentation of the wisdom that is the entity that fully realizes that reality is the one presentation of the result of the meditation on the antidote.

original: spangs pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: spangs pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the presentation of abandonment?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag par 'thob pa'i dngos po zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag par 'thob pa'i dngos po zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: It is indicated by the phrase “the entity that is the attainment of nirvana.”

original: byang chub kyi phyogs bsgoms pa'i dbang gis mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pa na de dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa zag pa med pa 'dus ma byas pa yang dag par thob @124b pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag par thob pa'i dngos
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs bsgoms pa'i dbang gis mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pa na de dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa zag pa med pa 'dus ma byas pa yang dag par thob @124b pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag par thob pa'i dngos
translated: When one abandons all the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing and the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of meditation through the power of cultivating the factors conducive to enlightenment, one obtains the uncontaminated, unconditioned nirvana that is the result of abandoning those afflictions.

original: po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: po zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the actual attainment of nirvana.

original: de ni spangs pa rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni spangs pa rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the presentation of abandonment.

original: de ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyud kyis yang dag par bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyud kyis yang dag par bsdus pa yin te /
translated: It is subsumed by the continuum of nirvana with and without remainder.

original: de yang gnyen po bsgoms pa de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa gcig yin no //
analyzed: de yang gnyen po bsgoms pa de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa gcig yin no //
translated: This is the single presentation of the result of cultivating the antidote.

original: de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the words of the presentation of its result and so on have been explained.

original: // / de la sbyor ba'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa ni gnyen po bsgom pa de la sbyor ba'i rgyu legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di la 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba rnam par gzhag pa'o zhes smos pa de la legs par gsungs pa'i chos
analyzed: // / de la sbyor ba'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa ni gnyen po bsgom pa de la sbyor ba'i rgyu legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di la 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba rnam par gzhag pa'o zhes smos pa de la legs par gsungs pa'i chos
translated: The cause of preparation is the mundane correct view that is well-described in this doctrine and discipline, which is the cause of preparation for cultivating the antidotes.

original: 'dul ba 'di la 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dul ba 'di la 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mundane correct view that is well-described in this doctrine and discipline?

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba 'di las phyi rol pa thams cad kyi yang dag pa'i lta ba dag las spyi bor gyur ba nyid kyi dngos po zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba 'di las phyi rol pa thams cad kyi yang dag pa'i lta ba dag las spyi bor gyur ba nyid kyi dngos po zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: It is taught by the phrase “the state of being the highest of all mundane correct views that are outside this well-described doctrine and discipline.”

original: de la legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung rab po //
analyzed: de la legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung rab po //
translated: Here, the “well-described doctrine and discipline” is the scriptures of the Well-Gone One.

original: de legs par gsungs pa'i zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos tshangs par spyod pa thog mar dge ba bar du dge ba tha mar dge ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de legs par gsungs pa'i zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos tshangs par spyod pa thog mar dge ba bar du dge ba tha mar dge ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase well-expounded refers to the sublime teaching, which is virtuous in the beginning, virtuous in the middle, and virtuous in the end.

original: chos 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: chos 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste /
translated: The phrase the Dharma and Vinaya refers to the eightfold noble path.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / rtog pa dang / rtsol ba dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin ni chos so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / rtog pa dang / rtsol ba dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin ni chos so //
translated: Right view, thought, effort, mindfulness, and concentration are the Dharma.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba ni 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba ni 'dul ba'o //
translated: Right speech, action, and livelihood are the Vinaya.

original: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya ba ni dang po sems bskyed pa nas bzung ste tshogs kyi lam dang sbyor ba'i lam thams cad la thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas bsdus pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba 'byin pa dang mchod sbyin dang las dang 'bras bu dang pha dang ma dang dgra bcom pa yod do zhes bya ba la sogs par lta ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya ba ni dang po sems bskyed pa nas bzung ste tshogs kyi lam dang sbyor ba'i lam thams cad la thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas bsdus pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba 'byin pa dang mchod sbyin dang las dang 'bras bu dang pha dang ma dang dgra bcom pa yod do zhes bya ba la sogs par lta ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The so-called mundane right view is the right view included in the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation and that are conducive to penetrativeness, from the beginning of the generation of the thought of awakening up to the entire path of accumulation and the path of preparation. It is the view that there is a sacrifice, an action, a result, a father, a mother, and an arhat, and so on.

original: 'di las phyi rol ba thams cad kyi yang dag pa'i lta ba dag las spyi bor gyur pa nyid kyis dngos po zhes bya la /🔽'di las phyi rol pa zhes bya ba ni bde @125a * //
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol ba thams cad kyi yang dag pa'i lta ba dag las spyi bor gyur pa nyid kyis dngos po zhes bya la / 'di las phyi rol pa zhes bya ba ni bde @125a * //
translated: It is called a thing because it is the highest of all the right views of those outside this,

original: bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa 'di las phyi rol pa mu stegs can dang 'jig rten pa gzhan dag go //
analyzed: bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa 'di las phyi rol pa mu stegs can dang 'jig rten pa gzhan dag go //
translated: Those outside this are the tīrthikas and others in the world who are outside this teaching of the Sugata.

original: de dag gi yang dag pa'i lta ba dag ni phyin ci log dang 'brel ba yin no //🔽de dag yi yang dag pa'i lta ba dag las spyi bo rgyur ba ni chos 'di ba'i 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba de ni lung las /
analyzed: de dag gi yang dag pa'i lta ba dag ni phyin ci log dang 'brel ba yin no // de dag yi yang dag pa'i lta ba dag las spyi bo rgyur ba ni chos 'di ba'i 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba de ni lung las /
translated: Their correct view is related to error.

original: 'jig rten pa yi yang dag lta /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi yang dag lta /
translated: The peak of their correct view is the mundane correct view of Dharma practitioners, because it is said in the scriptures:

original: chen po su la yod gyur pa //🔽de ni bskal pa stong rnams su //
analyzed: chen po su la yod gyur pa // de ni bskal pa stong rnams su //
translated: Those who possess the great🔽mundane correct view

original: ngan 'gror 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngan 'gror 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: will not go to lower rebirths

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: for a thousand eons.

original: de nyid bsgom pa de la bsgom pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de nyid bsgom pa de la bsgom pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: That is the cause of meditation on that.

original: de la sbyor ba'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /🔽// / de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par gzhag pa ni de la sbyor ba'i rgyu de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to / // / de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par gzhag pa ni de la sbyor ba'i rgyu de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni /
translated: The meaning of the words and so on that establish the cause of preparation have already been explained.🔽The presentation of its opposing factors is stated:

original: de mi bsgom pas yongs su nyams pa rnam par gzhag ste zhes smos pa las /
analyzed: de mi bsgom pas yongs su nyams pa rnam par gzhag ste zhes smos pa las /
translated: The presentation of degeneration through not meditating on that is the opposing factor to the cause of preparation.

original: de bsgom pas yongs su nyams pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de bsgom pas yongs su nyams pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the presentation of degeneration through meditating on that?

original: de mi bsgom pas yongs su nyams pa'i dngos po ste zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de mi bsgom pas yongs su nyams pa'i dngos po ste zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The phrase “one degenerates due to not cultivating that” teaches the second.

original: de zhes bya ba ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba de'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba de'o //
translated: The phrase “that” refers to the mundane right view of this well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya.

original: de mi bsgom pas ji ltar yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de mi bsgom pas ji ltar yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one degenerate due to not cultivating that?

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba ni mi bsgom pas yongs su nyams par 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba ni mi bsgom pas yongs su nyams par 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The text states, “One degenerates due to not cultivating that well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya.”

original: de la sbyor ba'i rgyu de mi bsgom pa ni ma thob pa'i nyams pas yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba'i rgyu de mi bsgom pa ni ma thob pa'i nyams pas yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In this context, not cultivating the cause of application is a degeneration due to the loss of what has not been obtained.

original: lta ba'i nyes pas ni ma yin no zhes bya bas ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di la lta ba'i nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba'i nyes pas ni ma yin no zhes bya bas ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di la lta ba'i nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The text states, “It is not due to a fault of view,” because this well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya is free of the fault of view.

original: de ltar na dngos po bzhi'am dgu'am nyi shu dgu po de dag gi dbang du mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnams kyi dngos po bsdu ba tsam gong du bstan pa de ni mdo sde yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po bzhi'am dgu'am nyi shu dgu po de dag gi dbang du mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnams kyi dngos po bsdu ba tsam gong du bstan pa de ni mdo sde yin te /
translated: Thus, the Sutra Pitaka is that which the Lord taught as a mere summary of the entities of phenomena, in terms of the four, nine, or twenty-nine entities.

original: gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis las /
analyzed: gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis las /
translated: From among the twelve branches of scripture,

original: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / tshugs su bcad pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde gang yin pa de ni nyan thos kyi mdo sde'i sde snod do //
analyzed: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / tshugs su bcad pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde gang yin pa de ni nyan thos kyi mdo sde'i sde snod do //
translated: the Sutra Pitaka is the Sutra, Geva, Vyakarana, Gatha, and Udana sections, which are the Sutra Pitaka of sravakas.

original: shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i sde gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i mdo sde'i sde snod do //
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i sde gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i mdo sde'i sde snod do //
translated: The Vaipulya and Adbhutadharma sections are the Sutra Pitaka of bodhisattvas.

original: skabs kha cig nas @125b ni gleng gzhi'i sde dang / gtan la phab par bstan pa'i sde ma gtogs pa gzhan bcu ni gnyis ka'i mdo sde'i sde snod do zhes kyang bshad do //
analyzed: skabs kha cig nas @125b ni gleng gzhi'i sde dang / gtan la phab par bstan pa'i sde ma gtogs pa gzhan bcu ni gnyis ka'i mdo sde'i sde snod do zhes kyang bshad do //
translated: In some contexts, it is explained that the ten sections except for Nidana and Avadana are the Sutra Pitaka of both sravakas and bodhisattvas.

original: de'i 'og tu 'dul ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'dul ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Then, in order to teach the characteristics of the Vinaya,

original: 'jam dpal ngas gang du nyan thos rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal ngas gang du nyan thos rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he said, “Mañjuśrī, I have taught the Vinaya for the śrāvakas and bodhisattvas.”

original: de la so sor thar pa'am zhes bya ba ni ris bdun po dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyis bsdus pa'i 'dul ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la so sor thar pa'am zhes bya ba ni ris bdun po dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyis bsdus pa'i 'dul ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: There, “prātimokṣa” refers to the Vinaya included in the seven groups of monks, nuns, male and female lay followers, and the morality of vows.

original: de yang 'dul ba bzhi po rnam par 'byed pa dang / gzhi dang / phran tshegs dang / dris lan las so sor thar ba'i mdo'i ma mo rgya cher brgyud de 'ongs pa de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i bsngags pa bstod pa yin no //
