analyzed: de yang 'dul ba bzhi po rnam par 'byed pa dang / gzhi dang / phran tshegs dang / dris lan las so sor thar ba'i mdo'i ma mo rgya cher brgyud de 'ongs pa de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i bsngags pa bstod pa yin no //
translated: That is the extensive lineage of the mother of the Sūtra of Individual Liberation, which comes from the four Vinayas: the Vibhaṅga, the Vastu, the Kṣudraka, and the Paripṛcchā. It is praised and extolled by the Tathāgata.

original: so sor thar ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni de rnam par 'byed pa ste //
analyzed: so sor thar ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni de rnam par 'byed pa ste //
translated: “Endowed with individual liberation” means possessing that.

original: de rnam par dbye na gzhi dang phran tshegs dang dris lan yang zhar las byung bas 'dul ba dum bu bzhi char yang yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnam par dbye na gzhi dang phran tshegs dang dris lan yang zhar las byung bas 'dul ba dum bu bzhi char yang yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If it is classified, it should be understood as the four parts of the Vinaya: the basic section, the miscellaneous section, the section on questions and answers, and the section on what arose from that.

original: de ni 'dul ba'i dngos po yin no zhes bya ba ni so sor thar ba dang ldan pa ni 'dul ba'i ma mo yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni 'dul ba'i dngos po yin no zhes bya ba ni so sor thar ba dang ldan pa ni 'dul ba'i ma mo yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is the substance of the Vinaya means that one who possesses the Pratimoksha is the mother of the Vinaya.

original: 'dul ba'i ma mo de yang mdor bsdu na don rnam pa bcu dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dul ba'i ma mo de yang mdor bsdu na don rnam pa bcu dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: That mother of the Vinaya, in brief, has ten topics.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: phan yon dang / sde tshan dang / sdud pa dang / rjes su spyod pa dang / mi mthun pa dang / mthun pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / yongs su shes pa dang / dad cing 'phel bar 'gyur ba dang / stobs so //
analyzed: phan yon dang / sde tshan dang / sdud pa dang / rjes su spyod pa dang / mi mthun pa dang / mthun pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / yongs su shes pa dang / dad cing 'phel bar 'gyur ba dang / stobs so //
translated: Benefits, categories, compilations, subsequent practices, disagreements, agreements, pacifications, thorough understandings, faith and increase, and power.

original: de la phan yon gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la phan yon gang zhe na /
translated: What are the benefits?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs nas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs nas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bcas pa ste /
translated: The Tathagata, having seen ten benefits, established the bases of training for the Shravakas in the Vinaya.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the ten?

original: dge 'dun bsdu ba'i phyir dang / dge 'dun legs par bya ba'i phyir dang ; dge 'dun bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / gnod mi bkur ba'i gang zag rnams tshar gcad pa'i phyir dang / ngo tsha shes pa rnams bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: dge 'dun bsdu ba'i phyir dang / dge 'dun legs par bya ba'i phyir dang ; dge 'dun bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / gnod mi bkur ba'i gang zag rnams tshar gcad pa'i phyir dang / ngo tsha shes pa rnams bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang /
translated: In order to gather the Saṅgha, in order to act well for the Saṅgha, in order to make the Saṅgha live comfortably, in order to subdue individuals who are not respectful, in order to make those who are ashamed live comfortably,

original: mngon par ma dad pa rnams mngon par dad par bya ba'i phyir dang / mngon @126a * //
analyzed: mngon par ma dad pa rnams mngon par dad par bya ba'i phyir dang / mngon @126a * //
translated: in order to make those who are not faithful become faithful,

original: par dad pa rnams phyir zhing dad par bya ba'i phyir dang / tshe 'di'i zag pa rnams bsdams pa'i phyir dang / tshe rabs phyi ma'i zag pa rnams gzhom pa'i phyir dang / nga'i tshangs par spyod pa skye bo mang po la phan par gyur pa lha dang mi rnams kyi bar la yang dag par rab tu bstan pa yun ring du gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: par dad pa rnams phyir zhing dad par bya ba'i phyir dang / tshe 'di'i zag pa rnams bsdams pa'i phyir dang / tshe rabs phyi ma'i zag pa rnams gzhom pa'i phyir dang / nga'i tshangs par spyod pa skye bo mang po la phan par gyur pa lha dang mi rnams kyi bar la yang dag par rab tu bstan pa yun ring du gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: in order to make those who are faithful increase their faith, in order to restrain the defilements of this life, in order to conquer the defilements of future lives, and in order to make my pure conduct, which benefits many beings, which is well-proclaimed among gods and humans, remain for a long time.

original: sde tshan gang zhe na /
analyzed: sde tshan gang zhe na /
translated: What are the categories?

original: ltung ba'i sde tshan lnga dang / ltung ba las bslang ba'i sde tshan bzhi ste /
analyzed: ltung ba'i sde tshan lnga dang / ltung ba las bslang ba'i sde tshan bzhi ste /
translated: There are five classes of downfalls and four classes of restoration from downfalls.

original: ltung ba'i sde tshan lnga ni pham pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dang / ltung byed dang / so sor bshags par bya ba dang / nyes byas te /
analyzed: ltung ba'i sde tshan lnga ni pham pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dang / ltung byed dang / so sor bshags par bya ba dang / nyes byas te /
translated: The five classes of downfalls are the class of defeats, the class of residual faults, the class of partially concordant with obscurations, the class of downfalls that must be individually confessed, and the class of wrong actions.

original: nyes pa sbom pa dang / spong ba'i ltung ba dang / ma nges pa dag ni de dag nyid du 'dus pas ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom pa dang / spong ba'i ltung ba dang / ma nges pa dag ni de dag nyid du 'dus pas ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The class of serious infractions, the class of downfalls that require relinquishment, and the class of undetermined offenses are included in these five classes, as appropriate.

original: ltung ba las bslang ba'i sde tshan bzhi ni pham pa ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i ltung ba'i sde tshan bzhi las bslang ba ste /
analyzed: ltung ba las bslang ba'i sde tshan bzhi ni pham pa ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i ltung ba'i sde tshan bzhi las bslang ba ste /
translated: The four classes of restoration from downfalls are the four classes of downfalls other than the class of defeats.

original: pham pa las kyang bslang ba yod mod kyi de ni gang zag gi bye brag tsam nyid las brten pa yin gyi /
analyzed: pham pa las kyang bslang ba yod mod kyi de ni gang zag gi bye brag tsam nyid las brten pa yin gyi /
translated: Although it is possible to be restored from a defeat, that is only in the case of an individual and not for all.

original: thams cad la khyad par med pa ma yin pas de'i phyir de las bslang ba'i sde tshan ni mgo gcig tu rnam par mi gzhag go /
analyzed: thams cad la khyad par med pa ma yin pas de'i phyir de las bslang ba'i sde tshan ni mgo gcig tu rnam par mi gzhag go /
translated: Since it is not a universal rule, it is not categorically stated that there is a class of restoration from downfalls.

original: sdud pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdud pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the summary?

original: 'dul ba sdud par byed pa'i chos lnga ste /
analyzed: 'dul ba sdud par byed pa'i chos lnga ste /
translated: 5. The five dharmas that are the basis of the Vinaya.

original: rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang / bcas pa dang / dgag pa dang / gnang ba dang / bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang / bcas pa dang / dgag pa dang / gnang ba dang / bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Natural offenses, offenses by decree, prohibitions, permissions, and obligations.

original: rjes su spyod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su spyod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is following?

original: 'dul ba'i rjes su spyod pa'i chos lnga ste /
analyzed: 'dul ba'i rjes su spyod pa'i chos lnga ste /
translated: The five dharmas that are the basis of the Vinaya.

original: gnas pa dang / gnas dang ; rten dang / longs spyod dang / las so //
analyzed: gnas pa dang / gnas dang ; rten dang / longs spyod dang / las so //
translated: Dwelling, dwelling place, support, enjoyment, and activity.

original: mi mthun pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is contrary?

original: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pa'i bslab pa dang mi mthun pa'i chos lnga ste /
analyzed: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pa'i bslab pa dang mi mthun pa'i chos lnga ste /
translated: The five dharmas that are contrary to the training of a monk who is zealous in the training of the Vinaya.

original: bar du gcod pa dang / dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs po dang / glen zhing nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / sngon gyi tshogs stobs chung ba'o //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa dang / dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs po dang / glen zhing nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / sngon gyi tshogs stobs chung ba'o //
translated: Obstructions, counterfeits of the true Dharma, bad friends, the abandonment of stupidity and defilements, and the weakness of the power of former roots of virtue.

original: mthun pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mthun pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is in conformity?

original: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pa'i bslab pa dang mthun pa'i chos lnga ste /
analyzed: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pa'i bslab pa dang mthun pa'i chos lnga ste /
translated: The five dharmas that are in conformity with the training of a monk who is zealous in the training of the Vinaya.

original: mi mthun pa lnga las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa lnga las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The opposite of the five contrary dharmas.

original: nye bar zhi ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is tranquility?

original: dge slong 'dul ba'i @126b bslab pa la brtson pa'i nye bar zhi ba dang dul ba dang zhi bar 'gyur ba'i chos lnga ste /
analyzed: dge slong 'dul ba'i @126b bslab pa la brtson pa'i nye bar zhi ba dang dul ba dang zhi bar 'gyur ba'i chos lnga ste /
translated: It is the five qualities of a monk who is intent on the training of the Vinaya:

original: nges shing 'grogs na bde ba nyid dang / spong ba dang / spong ba'i yan lag dang / bsnyen bkur dang / rtsod pa nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: nges shing 'grogs na bde ba nyid dang / spong ba dang / spong ba'i yan lag dang / bsnyen bkur dang / rtsod pa nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: tranquility, self-control, peace, certainty, and the ability to live in solitude.

original: yongs su shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is complete understanding?🔽It is the five things that a monk who is intent on the training of the Vinaya should understand:

original: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pas yongs su shes par bya ba dang / ltung ba yongs su shes par bya ba dang / gang zag yongs su shes par bya ba dang / rdzas yongs su shes par bya ba dang / gnod pa yongs su shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pas yongs su shes par bya ba dang / ltung ba yongs su shes par bya ba dang / gang zag yongs su shes par bya ba dang / rdzas yongs su shes par bya ba dang / gnod pa yongs su shes par bya ba'o //
translated: the offense, the person, the substance, the harm, and the purification.

original: dad cing 'phel bar 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: dad cing 'phel bar 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is faith?🔽It is the five things that a monk who is intent on the training of the Vinaya should have faith in:

original: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pa la ma dad pa rnams dad pa dang / dad pa rnams phyir zhing 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i chos lnga ste /
analyzed: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pa la ma dad pa rnams dad pa dang / dad pa rnams phyir zhing 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i chos lnga ste /
translated: The five qualities that cause those who lack faith in the monk who strives in the training of the Vinaya to develop faith and those who have faith to increase their faith are

original: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang / lta ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / phan tshun 'thab rtsod med pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang / lta ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / phan tshun 'thab rtsod med pa'o //
translated: perfect morality, perfect view, perfect conduct, perfect livelihood, and being free of mutual disputes.

original: stobs gang zhe na /
analyzed: stobs gang zhe na /
translated: What is power?

original: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pa'i yang dag pa'i sbyor ba rnam pa thams cad du phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba'i stobs lnga ste /
analyzed: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pa'i yang dag pa'i sbyor ba rnam pa thams cad du phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba'i stobs lnga ste /
translated: The five powers that cause the monk who strives in the training of the Vinaya to achieve complete perfection in all aspects of correct practice are

original: sbyor ba'i stobs dang / bsam pa'i stobs dang / rtogs pa'i stobs dang / shes pa'i stobs dang / gnas pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i stobs dang / bsam pa'i stobs dang / rtogs pa'i stobs dang / shes pa'i stobs dang / gnas pa'i stobs so //
translated: the power of application, the power of intention, the power of realization, the power of knowledge, and the power of abiding.

original: de ltar 'dul ba'i ma mo don bcu dang ldan pa bstan pa des ni 'dul ba'i ngo bo nyid bstan to /
analyzed: de ltar 'dul ba'i ma mo don bcu dang ldan pa bstan pa des ni 'dul ba'i ngo bo nyid bstan to /
translated: Thus, through this teaching that possesses ten topics of the Vinaya mother, the essence of the Vinaya is taught.

original: // / de'i 'og tu de'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu de'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Then, in order to teach its divisions,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis so sor rnam par thar ba dus bsdus par rig par bgyi lags zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis so sor rnam par thar ba dus bsdus par rig par bgyi lags zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: the Bhagavat said, “Bhagavat, the bodhisattvas should know the individual liberations in brief.”

original: 'jam dpal rnam pa bdun gyis te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jam dpal rnam pa bdun gyis te zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, in seven ways.”

original: yang dag par blang ba'i cho ga bstan pa zhes bya ba ni dang por gsum la skyabs su btang ba dang / dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa byin nas de'i 'og tu las bzhi po gsol ba'i las dang / gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las dang /
analyzed: yang dag par blang ba'i cho ga bstan pa zhes bya ba ni dang por gsum la skyabs su btang ba dang / dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa byin nas de'i 'og tu las bzhi po gsol ba'i las dang / gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las dang /
translated: The teaching of the rite of taking up is the first, having gone for refuge to the Three, and having given the vow of the lay practitioner, then after that, the rite of request and the rite of request and two,

original: gsol ba dang bzhi'i las dang / las gsum brjod pa'i las kyis rab tu byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba'i chos @127a * //
analyzed: gsol ba dang bzhi'i las dang / las gsum brjod pa'i las kyis rab tu byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba'i chos @127a * //
translated: the rite of request and four, and the rite of three recitations of the act, the teaching of the Dharma of going forth and full ordination.

original: bstan pa'o // pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i dngos po bstan pa zhes bya ba ni ltung ba'i sde tshan lnga'i dang po dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bstan pa'o // pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i dngos po bstan pa zhes bya ba ni ltung ba'i sde tshan lnga'i dang po dang sbyar ro //
translated: The teaching of the things that are like the grounds of defeat is to be applied to the first of the five classes of downfalls.

original: ltung ba'i gnas lta bu'i dngos po bstan pa zhes bya ba ni ltung ba'i sde tshan lnga'i tha ma bzhi dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ltung ba'i gnas lta bu'i dngos po bstan pa zhes bya ba ni ltung ba'i sde tshan lnga'i tha ma bzhi dang sbyar ro //
translated: The teaching on the things that are like the grounds for downfall should be understood as referring to the last four of the five classes of downfalls.

original: ltung ba'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: ltung ba'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The teaching on the nature of downfalls is threefold:

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ltung ba dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi ltung ba dang / ltung ba rnams kyi chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ltung ba dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi ltung ba dang / ltung ba rnams kyi chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: downfalls that are not afflictive, downfalls that are afflictive, and the small, medium, and great of the downfalls.

original: de la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ltung ba ni rgyu gnyis kyis 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ltung ba ni rgyu gnyis kyis 'byung ste /
translated: Downfalls that are not afflictive occur due to two causes:

original: mi shes pa dang / bag med pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa dang / bag med pa'o //
translated: ignorance and carelessness.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi ltung ba yang rgyu gnyis kyis 'byung ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi ltung ba yang rgyu gnyis kyis 'byung ste /
translated: Downfalls that are afflictive also occur due to two causes:

original: nyon mongs pa mang ba dang / ma gus pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mang ba dang / ma gus pa'o //
translated: an abundance of afflictions and disrespect.

original: ltung ba rnams kyi chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po ni rnam pa lngas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ltung ba rnams kyi chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po ni rnam pa lngas rig par bya ste /
translated: The small, medium, and great of the downfalls should be understood in terms of five aspects:

original: ngo bo nyid dang / byed pa dang / bsam pa dang / gzhi dang / tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / byed pa dang / bsam pa dang / gzhi dang / tshogs pa'o //
translated: Nature, action, attitude, basis, and collection.

original: de la ngo bo nyid las chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid ni pham pa ni ltung ba chen po yin no //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid las chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid ni pham pa ni ltung ba chen po yin no //
translated: Among them, the small, medium, and great natures are: the defeat is a great downfall.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma ni 'bring ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma ni 'bring ngo //
translated: The remainder in the order of the Saṅgha is medium.

original: de las gzhan pa ni ltung ba chung ngo //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni ltung ba chung ngo //
translated: The others are small downfalls.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang pham pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma rnams ni chen po yin /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang pham pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma rnams ni chen po yin /
translated: Another enumeration: the defeats and the remainders in the order of the Saṅgha are great.

original: ltung byed dang so sor bshags par bya ba rnams ni 'bring yin /
analyzed: ltung byed dang so sor bshags par bya ba rnams ni 'bring yin /
translated: The offenses requiring confession and the offenses requiring confession are medium.

original: nyes byas rnams ni chung ngu yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyes byas rnams ni chung ngu yin pa'o //
translated: The wrong actions are small.

original: byed pa las ni mi shes pas byas pa dang / bag med pas byas pa ni chung ngu yin /
analyzed: byed pa las ni mi shes pas byas pa dang / bag med pas byas pa ni chung ngu yin /
translated: From the action: that done through ignorance and that done through carelessness is small.

original: nyon mongs pa mang bas byas pa ni 'bring yin /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mang bas byas pa ni 'bring yin /
translated: That done through much affliction is medium.

original: ma gus pas byas pa ni chen po yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma gus pas byas pa ni chen po yin pa'o //
translated: That done through disrespect is great.

original: bsam ba las ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gis kun nas dkris pa chung ngus byas pa ni chung ngu yin /
analyzed: bsam ba las ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gis kun nas dkris pa chung ngus byas pa ni chung ngu yin /
translated: In terms of attitude, a downfall is small if it is committed with a small entanglement of attachment, aversion, or benighted ignorance.

original: 'bring gis byas pa ni 'bring yin /
analyzed: 'bring gis byas pa ni 'bring yin /
translated: If it is committed with a middling entanglement, it is middling.

original: chen pos byas pa ni chen po yin pa'o //
analyzed: chen pos byas pa ni chen po yin pa'o //
translated: If it is committed with a great entanglement, it is great.

original: gzhi las ni zhe sdang gis kun nas dkris pa mtshungs pas dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags bsams bzhin du bsad na ni ltung byed yin pas chung ba'am /🔽mir chags pa pha ma ma yin pa bsad na ni pham pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhi las ni zhe sdang gis kun nas dkris pa mtshungs pas dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags bsams bzhin du bsad na ni ltung byed yin pas chung ba'am / mir chags pa pha ma ma yin pa bsad na ni pham pa yin la /
translated: In terms of the basis, if you intentionally kill an animal, such as a bird, with a similar entanglement of aversion, it is a downfall that is small because it is a natural misdeed.

original: mtshams med pa ma yin pas 'bring /
analyzed: mtshams med pa ma yin pas 'bring /
translated: If you kill a human who is not your father or mother, it is a downfall that is middling because it is a downfall of abandoning the teaching, but it is not a heinous act.

original: pha ma bsad na ni pham pa yang yin la mtshams med pa yin pas che ba lta @127b bu'o ;
analyzed: pha ma bsad na ni pham pa yang yin la mtshams med pa yin pas che ba lta @127b bu'o ;
translated: If you kill your father or mother, it is a great downfall because it is a heinous act.

original: / stsogs ba las ni ltung ba gcig dang gnyis dang gsum nas lnga'i bar du byung yang chos bzhin du phyir mi byed pa de ni chung ngu yin /
analyzed: / stsogs ba las ni ltung ba gcig dang gnyis dang gsum nas lnga'i bar du byung yang chos bzhin du phyir mi byed pa de ni chung ngu yin /
translated: In terms of the number of downfalls, if you do not confess in accordance with the teaching one, two, three, up to five downfalls, it is a small downfall.

original: bcu'am nyi shu 'am sum cu 'am shes par bya nus pa'i bar du byung ba chos bzhin du phyir mi byed pa ni 'bring yin /
analyzed: bcu'am nyi shu 'am sum cu 'am shes par bya nus pa'i bar du byung ba chos bzhin du phyir mi byed pa ni 'bring yin /
translated: The medium is when one does not repeat the offense in accordance with the teaching, whether it is for ten, twenty, or thirty days, or for as long as one is able to know it.

original: ltung ba dpag tu med pa byung la bdag la ltung ba 'di snyed cig byung ngo zhes shes par mi nus pa de ni chen por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba dpag tu med pa byung la bdag la ltung ba 'di snyed cig byung ngo zhes shes par mi nus pa de ni chen por rig par bya'o //
translated: The great is when one has committed immeasurable offenses, but is not able to know, “I have committed so many offenses.”

original: ltung ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba rnam pa lnga kho nas ltung ba mi 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: ltung ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba rnam pa lnga kho nas ltung ba mi 'byung ba ste /
translated: The explanation of the nature of non-offenses is that offenses do not occur through only five kinds of actions:

original: dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams te gnas pa dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid dang / nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa dang / shes bzhin du spyod pa de ni bya ba gcig yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams te gnas pa dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid dang / nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa dang / shes bzhin du spyod pa de ni bya ba gcig yin no //
translated: Restraining the senses, knowing the proper amount of food, being diligent in practice without sleeping in the first and last periods of the night, and being mindful. That is one kind of action.

original: gzhan yang dge sbyong gi tshul shas cher lta ba dang ston pa dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la dad pa dang ; gus pa chen po dang kha na ma tho ba kun du spyod pas shas cher ngo tsha shes shing khrel yod pas zhugs pa de ni bya ba gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang dge sbyong gi tshul shas cher lta ba dang ston pa dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la dad pa dang ; gus pa chen po dang kha na ma tho ba kun du spyod pas shas cher ngo tsha shes shing khrel yod pas zhugs pa de ni bya ba gnyis pa yin no //
translated: Furthermore, the ascetic is greatly devoted to the view, to teaching, and to the spiritual companions. He is greatly ashamed and embarrassed by the performance of any misdeed. This is the second practice.

original: gzhan yang bya ba nyung ba dang don nyung ba dang las kyi mtha' nyung ba dang 'du 'dzi nyung ba de ni bya ba gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang bya ba nyung ba dang don nyung ba dang las kyi mtha' nyung ba dang 'du 'dzi nyung ba de ni bya ba gsum pa yin no //
translated: Furthermore, he has few activities, few concerns, few duties, and few distractions. This is the third practice.

original: gzhan yang khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba rnams dang mi 'dre bar gnas pa dang / bag yod par ltung ba dang ltung ba med pa la mkhas pa dang dge ba'i phyogs la gcig tu nges par byed pa de ni bya ba bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba rnams dang mi 'dre bar gnas pa dang / bag yod par ltung ba dang ltung ba med pa la mkhas pa dang dge ba'i phyogs la gcig tu nges par byed pa de ni bya ba bzhi pa yin no //
translated: Furthermore, he lives without mixing with householders and renunciates, and he is heedful, skilled in what is down-fall and what is not down-fall, and he is single-pointedly devoted to virtue. This is the fourth practice.

original: gzhan yang las dang po pa dang smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang tshor bas nyen pa de ni bya ba rnam pa lnga yin te /🔽bya ba lnga po de dag gi /
analyzed: gzhan yang las dang po pa dang smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang tshor bas nyen pa de ni bya ba rnam pa lnga yin te / bya ba lnga po de dag gi /
translated: Moreover, a beginner, one who is insane, one whose mind is disturbed, and one who is overwhelmed by pain, have five actions.

original: dang po nyid nas ltung ba mi 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dang po nyid nas ltung ba mi 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that from the very beginning, they do not commit a downfall through these five actions.

original: ltung ba las byung ba bstan pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu gsum gyis ltung ba las ldang ba ste /
analyzed: ltung ba las byung ba bstan pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu gsum gyis ltung ba las ldang ba ste /
translated: The explanation of rising from downfalls: One rises from downfalls through three causes.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: 'gyod pa lnga bskyed pa dang / yan lag lngas bsdus pa'i bag yod pa dang / rnam pa lngas 'gyod pa bsal ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa lnga bskyed pa dang / yan lag lngas bsdus pa'i bag yod pa dang / rnam pa lngas 'gyod pa bsal ba'o //
translated: They are: generating the five regrets, conscientiousness that is included in the five limbs, and dispelling regret through the five aspects.

original: de la 'gyod pa skyed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'gyod pa skyed pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is generating regret?

original: ltung ba gang yang rung ba zhig byung ba na bdag nyid la gzhi 'dis tshul khrims dag gis smad par 'gyur ro snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa dang / gzhan dang lha dag gis smad par 'gyur @128a * //
analyzed: ltung ba gang yang rung ba zhig byung ba na bdag nyid la gzhi 'dis tshul khrims dag gis smad par 'gyur ro snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa dang / gzhan dang lha dag gis smad par 'gyur @128a * //
translated: When any kind of downfall has occurred, one generates regret by thinking, “On the basis of this, I will be criticized by those with pure ethical discipline,” and “I will be criticized by others and by the gods.”

original: ro snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa dang / ston pa dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyis smad par 'gyur ro snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa dang / phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rnams su sdig pa can gyi mi bsngags pa grags pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ro snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa dang /
analyzed: ro snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa dang / ston pa dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyis smad par 'gyur ro snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa dang / phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rnams su sdig pa can gyi mi bsngags pa grags pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ro snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa dang /
translated: I will be despised by the Teacher and by my wise companions in the celibate life.🔽Evil reports will spread about me in all directions.

original: bdag lus zhig nas ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba rnams su skye bar gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag lus zhig nas ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba rnams su skye bar gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: I will be reborn in the states of woe.

original: yan lag lngas bsdus pa'i bag yod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag lngas bsdus pa'i bag yod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is heedfulness consisting of five members?

original: 'das pa'i dus la brten nas ltung ba byung ba gang yin pa de yang chos bzhin du byed pa la sngon gyi mtha' dang ldan pa'i bag yod pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus la brten nas ltung ba byung ba gang yin pa de yang chos bzhin du phyir byed pas phyi ma'i mtha' dang ldan pa'i bag yod pa dang /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la brten nas ltung ba byung ba gang yin pa de yang chos bzhin du byed pa la sngon gyi mtha' dang ldan pa'i bag yod pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus la brten nas ltung ba byung ba gang yin pa de yang chos bzhin du phyir byed pas phyi ma'i mtha' dang ldan pa'i bag yod pa dang /
translated: He is heedful in relation to the past in that he acts in accordance with the Dharma in regard to any downfalls that have occurred. He is heedful in relation to the future in that he acts in accordance with the Dharma in regard to any downfalls that may occur.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus la brten nas ltung ba byung ba gang yin pa de yang chos bzhin du phyir byed pas dbus kyi mtha' dang ldan pa'i bag yod pa dang / ltung ba ma byung ba'i snga rol nas phyis ltung ba mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir ji lta ji ltar spyad cing gnas na phyis ltung ba mi 'byung bar 'gyur ba de lta de ltar spyod cing gnas pas dus snga nas byas pa'i bag yod pa dang /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus la brten nas ltung ba byung ba gang yin pa de yang chos bzhin du phyir byed pas dbus kyi mtha' dang ldan pa'i bag yod pa dang / ltung ba ma byung ba'i snga rol nas phyis ltung ba mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir ji lta ji ltar spyad cing gnas na phyis ltung ba mi 'byung bar 'gyur ba de lta de ltar spyod cing gnas pas dus snga nas byas pa'i bag yod pa dang /
translated: He is heedful in relation to the present in that he acts in accordance with the Dharma in regard to any downfalls that may occur. He is heedful in advance in that he acts in such a way that downfalls do not occur.

original: 'phral du yang ci nas kyang ltung ba mi 'byung ba de ltar spyod cing gnas pas lhan cig spyod pa'i bag yod pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'phral du yang ci nas kyang ltung ba mi 'byung ba de ltar spyod cing gnas pas lhan cig spyod pa'i bag yod pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is also endowed with the conscientiousness of a companion, in that he acts and lives in such a way that he will not incur a downfall.

original: rnam pa lngas 'gyod pa bsal ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa lngas 'gyod pa bsal ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the removal of regret?🔽It is the removal of regret by thinking that there is an occasion to rise up from a downfall by means of the teaching of the Dharma with its bases and its renunciation, which was taught by the Lord.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhi dang bcas nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa'i chos bstan pas ltung ba las ldang ba'i skabs yod do snyam nas 'gyod pa sel bar byed pa dang / mi shes pa dang bag med pa dang / nyon mongs pa mang ba dang ma gus pa gang gis ltung ba byung ba mi shes pa nas ma gus pa'i bar de ni spangs shing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhi dang bcas nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa'i chos bstan pas ltung ba las ldang ba'i skabs yod do snyam nas 'gyod pa sel bar byed pa dang / mi shes pa dang bag med pa dang / nyon mongs pa mang ba dang ma gus pa gang gis ltung ba byung ba mi shes pa nas ma gus pa'i bar de ni spangs shing /
translated: It is the removal of regret by thinking that one has not committed a downfall, because one has abandoned the causes of a downfall, which are ignorance, carelessness, many desires, and disrespect.

original: shes pa nas gus pa'i bar de ni yang dag par skyes so snyam nas 'gyod pa sel bar byed pa dang / mi shes pa dang ltung ba mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir bsam pa thag pa nas sems skyes so snyam nas 'gyod pa sel bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: shes pa nas gus pa'i bar de ni yang dag par skyes so snyam nas 'gyod pa sel bar byed pa dang / mi shes pa dang ltung ba mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir bsam pa thag pa nas sems skyes so snyam nas 'gyod pa sel bar byed pa dang /
translated: One removes regret by thinking, I have generated the thought of awakening from the depths of my heart in order to not be ignorant and to not commit downfalls.🔽 One removes regret by thinking, I have confessed individually in the presence of learned practitioners of pure conduct.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa @128b mkhas pa rnams kyi mdun du so sor bshad zin to snyam nas 'gyod pa sel bar byed pa dang / bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba las rab tu byung nas bslab pa dang mi 'gal zhing 'gyod pa med pa gang yin pa de ni bdag la dge ba dang legs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa @128b mkhas pa rnams kyi mdun du so sor bshad zin to snyam nas 'gyod pa sel bar byed pa dang / bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba las rab tu byung nas bslab pa dang mi 'gal zhing 'gyod pa med pa gang yin pa de ni bdag la dge ba dang legs pa yin gyi /
translated: One removes regret by thinking, Whatever I have done that is virtuous and good, such as going forth in the well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya, not transgressing the precepts, and being free of regret, is virtuous and good for me.

original: bdag bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa'i rgyun sgrib pa'i gnas lta bu rnam grangs du mas bar du gcod par byed pa gang yin pa gsungs pa de mang du gnas shing dang du len par byed nas sel bar mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni bdag la🔽dge ba dang legs pa ma yin no snyam nas 'gyod pa sel bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: bdag bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa'i rgyun sgrib pa'i gnas lta bu rnam grangs du mas bar du gcod par byed pa gang yin pa gsungs pa de mang du gnas shing dang du len par byed nas sel bar mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni bdag la dge ba dang legs pa ma yin no snyam nas 'gyod pa sel bar byed pa ste /
translated: I will not abandon them, but will confess them and purify them.

original: rnam pa de dag gis ltung ba las ldang bar byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag gis ltung ba las ldang bar byed do //
translated: In this way, one rises from downfalls.🔽The treatise Attainment of Knowledge states:

original: sdom pa gtong ba bstan pas so zhes bya ba la rgyu dus ni dge slong gi sdom pa blangs kyang gtong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sdom pa gtong ba bstan pas so zhes bya ba la rgyu dus ni dge slong gi sdom pa blangs kyang gtong bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “What is the time of the cause? It is when one has taken the vows of a fully ordained monk, but then gives them up.”

original: mdor bsdu na rgyu lnga ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rgyu lnga ste /
translated: In brief, there are five causes:

original: bslab pa'i gzhi 'bul ba dang / ltung ba'i rtsa ba lhag par spyod pa dang / mtshan nub cing mtshan gnyis skyes pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa dang / rigs mthun pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi 'bul ba dang / ltung ba'i rtsa ba lhag par spyod pa dang / mtshan nub cing mtshan gnyis skyes pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa dang / rigs mthun pa spangs pa'o //
translated: offering back the bases of training, engaging in the root of a downfall, the disappearance of the male organ and the appearance of two organs, severing the roots of virtue, and abandoning those of the same type.

original: dam pa'i chos rab tu rnam par zhig pa dam pa'i chos nub cing dge slong gi sdom pa blang ba ni blang du med la sngar blangs pa ni yongs su mi gtong bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos rab tu rnam par zhig pa dam pa'i chos nub cing dge slong gi sdom pa blang ba ni blang du med la sngar blangs pa ni yongs su mi gtong bar rig par bya'o //
translated: When the true Dharma has completely disappeared, when the true Dharma has declined, the bhiksu vows are not to be received, and those previously received are not to be relinquished.

original: dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa ni mi mthun pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa dang / rigs mthun pa spangs pas gtong bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa ni mi mthun pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa dang / rigs mthun pa spangs pas gtong bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The upasaka vows are to be understood as relinquished by the arising of a contrary mind, by the severence of the roots of virtue, or by the rejection of the family.

original: dam pa'i chos nub pas ni dge slong gi sdom pa ji lta ba bzhin du dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa dang / dge bsnyen ma'i sdom pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nub pas ni dge slong gi sdom pa ji lta ba bzhin du dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa dang / dge bsnyen ma'i sdom pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as the bhiksu vows, so the upasaka vows and the upasika vows are to be understood as relinquished by the disappearance of the true Dharma.

original: bsnyen gnas pa'i sdom pa gtong ba ni nyi ma shar ba dang / gal te sems mi mthun pa bskyed pa dang / snga rol du rigs mthun pa spong zhing 'chi ba'i dus byed pa las khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: bsnyen gnas pa'i sdom pa gtong ba ni nyi ma shar ba dang / gal te sems mi mthun pa bskyed pa dang / snga rol du rigs mthun pa spong zhing 'chi ba'i dus byed pa las khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The upavása vows are to be understood as relinquished by the arising of the sun, or if a contrary mind arises, or if one rejects the family before the end of the day, or at the time of death.

original: de ltar 'dul ba'i ngo bo nyid dang rab tu dbye ba de dag ni lus dang ngag dang yid sdom zhing nyon mongs pa 'dul bar byed pas na 'dul ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'dul ba'i ngo bo nyid dang rab tu dbye ba de dag ni lus dang ngag dang yid sdom zhing nyon mongs pa 'dul bar byed pas na 'dul ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, the nature and classification of vinaya are called vinaya because they restrain body, speech and mind and subdue the afflictions.

original: gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis las /
analyzed: gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis las /
translated: The twelve branches of scripture are:

original: gleng gzhi'i sde dang / rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde dang / de lta bu byung ba'i sde dang / skyes pa'i rabs kyi sde dang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i sde dang / rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde dang / de lta bu byung ba'i sde dang / skyes pa'i rabs kyi sde dang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: the scriptural collection of discipline is the scriptural collection of vinaya, which is a collection of the words of the Buddha that is related to the three scriptural collections, the three trainings, the four truths, the four pairs of persons, the five paths, the six transcendent perfections, the seven riches of the noble ones, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, the ten powers and so on.🔽It is related to the twelve branches of scripture in some contexts,

original: skabs kha cig nas ni gleng gzhi'i sde nyi tshe dang sbyar ro zhes kyang bshad do /
analyzed: skabs kha cig nas ni gleng gzhi'i sde nyi tshe dang sbyar ro zhes kyang bshad do /
translated: but in some contexts it is related to just the nidana branch.

original: // / @129a * //  de'i 'og tu ma mo'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: // / @129a * //  de'i 'og tu ma mo'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in terms of teaching the characteristics of the mother,🔽it is said:

original: 'jam dpal ngas gang du mtshan nyid rnam pa bcu gcig bshad pa dang / rnam par phye ba dang bstan pa gang yin pa de ni ma mo zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal ngas gang du mtshan nyid rnam pa bcu gcig bshad pa dang / rnam par phye ba dang bstan pa gang yin pa de ni ma mo zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Manjushri, that which I have explained as the eleven characteristics and that which has been distinguished and taught is called the mother.

original: mdo sde dang 'dul ba ji skad bstan pa de dag gtan la phebs par byed la /
analyzed: mdo sde dang 'dul ba ji skad bstan pa de dag gtan la phebs par byed la /
translated: The Abhidharma is the Basket of the Mother, because it is the mother of the Sūtras and the Vinaya, since it determines the meaning of the teachings of the Sūtras and the Vinaya.

original: gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i sde thams cad ni ma mo zhes bya ba ste chos mngon pa'i sde snod kyang yin no //
analyzed: gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i sde thams cad ni ma mo zhes bya ba ste chos mngon pa'i sde snod kyang yin no //
translated: The Abhidharma is also called the Mother, because it is the Basket of the Mother, since it is the Basket which determines the meaning of the teachings of the Sūtras and the Vinaya.

original: de la mtshan nyid rnam pa bcu gcig gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid rnam pa bcu gcig gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: What are the eleven characteristics?

original: ma mo'i mtshan nyid bcu gcig gang yin pa de ni mtshan nyid lngar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma mo'i mtshan nyid bcu gcig gang yin pa de ni mtshan nyid lngar 'gyur te /
translated: The eleven characteristics of the Mother are included in five characteristics:

original: kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid dang / don dam pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis ni bstan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid dang / don dam pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis ni bstan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The two characteristics of the conventional and the ultimate are the characteristic of teaching.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams kyi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam pa'i mtshan nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid gsum ni yongs su rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams kyi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam pa'i mtshan nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid gsum ni yongs su rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The three characteristics of the object, aspect and nature of the factors of enlightenment are the characteristic of complete understanding.

original: de'i 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid dang / de myong ba'i rnam par bsnyad pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid dang / de myong ba'i rnam par bsnyad pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of its result and the characteristic of the description of its experience are the characteristics of its result.

original: de'i bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid gnyis ni de dag gi gegs dang phan 'dogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid gnyis ni de dag gi gegs dang phan 'dogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of the phenomena that obstruct it and the characteristic of the phenomena that are conducive to it are the characteristics of its obstacles and benefits.

original: de'i nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid dang ; phan yon gyi mtshan nyid gnyis ni de'i nyes pa dang yon tan gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid dang ; phan yon gyi mtshan nyid gnyis ni de'i nyes pa dang yon tan gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of its disadvantage and the characteristic of its benefit are the characteristics of its faults and qualities.

original: 'jam dpal de la kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal de la kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the characteristic of the conventional is threefold:

original: gang zag bstan pa dang / kun gdags pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa dang / chos rnams kyi byed pa dang g-yo ba dang las byed pa bstan par blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang zag bstan pa dang / kun gdags pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa dang / chos rnams kyi byed pa dang g-yo ba dang las byed pa bstan par blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: the teaching of the person, the teaching of the nature of designation, and the teaching of the activity, movement, and function of phenomena should be seen.

original: gang zag bstan pa zhes bya ba ni bdag dang sems can dang srog dang gang zag ces bya ba la sogs pa mu stegs can gyis bdag tu brjod pa'i rnam grangs lung las bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag bstan pa zhes bya ba ni bdag dang sems can dang srog dang gang zag ces bya ba la sogs pa mu stegs can gyis bdag tu brjod pa'i rnam grangs lung las bstan pa'o //
translated: The term “person” is a designation in the scriptures for the self, the sentient being, the life-force, the person, and so on, which are asserted as the self by the tīrthikas.

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas 'du byed kyi mtshan ma la ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam bye brag gi mtshan nyid du ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas 'du byed kyi mtshan ma la ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam bye brag gi mtshan nyid du ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The term “imaginary nature” is a designation for the object of conceptualization, which is a name or symbol that is posited as an essential or specific identity in relation to the representations of compounded phenomena, which are the bases of the imaginary nature.

original: chos rnams kyi byed pa dang g-yo ba dang las byed pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs te spyir na byed pa pos byed pas las kyi bya ba byed do zhes bstan pa @129b dag go //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi byed pa dang g-yo ba dang las byed pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs te spyir na byed pa pos byed pas las kyi bya ba byed do zhes bstan pa @129b dag go //
translated: The terms “activity,” “movement,” and “function” are synonyms for the activity, function, and performance of phenomena.

original: de dag thams cad ni glo bur du sgro btags pa yin gyi dngos su yod pa ma yin pas na kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni glo bur du sgro btags pa yin gyi dngos su yod pa ma yin pas na kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
translated: All of these are adventitious superimpositions and do not exist in reality. Therefore, they are called the “relative nature.”

original: de ni kun rdzob tu bstan pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob tu bstan pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: This is the characteristic of the conventional truth.

original: de la don dam pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun bstan pa yin par blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la don dam pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun bstan pa yin par blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The characteristic of the ultimate truth should be regarded as the seven kinds of reality.

original: de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun ni sngar 'phags pa byams pa'i le'ur byung ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyi dang / rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / log par sgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun ni sngar 'phags pa byams pa'i le'ur byung ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyi dang / rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / log par sgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid dang /
translated: The seven kinds of reality are the reality that occurs in the chapter on the noble Maitreya, the reality of characteristic, the reality of representation, the reality of abiding, the reality of error,

original: rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag par sgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid bstan pa dag go //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag par sgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid bstan pa dag go //
translated: the reality of purification, and the reality of right practice.

original: de dag ni de'i ngo bo nyid de de bzhin nyid bden pa yin pas na don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste de ni don dam par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni de'i ngo bo nyid de de bzhin nyid bden pa yin pas na don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste de ni don dam par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: These are its nature, its reality, and its truth. Therefore, it is called the characteristic of the ultimate truth. This is the characteristic of the ultimate truth.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ni shes bya'i dngos po rnam pa thams cad bstan pa yin par blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ni shes bya'i dngos po rnam pa thams cad bstan pa yin par blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The characteristic of the object should be seen as the teaching of all aspects of the thing that is to be known.

original: shes bya'i dngos po rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba ni sngar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi dmigs pa ji skad bstan pa dag yin te /
analyzed: shes bya'i dngos po rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba ni sngar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi dmigs pa ji skad bstan pa dag yin te /
translated: All aspects of the thing to be known are the objects of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, such as the applications of mindfulness, as previously explained.

original: de ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: This is the imagined characteristic of the factors of enlightenment.🔽The characteristic of the aspect should be seen as the teaching of the eight investigations.

original: rnam pa'i mtshan nyid ni brtag pa rnam pa brgyad bstan par blta bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni brtag pa rnam pa brgyad po de dag kyang sems kyi rnam pa tsam du zad pas rnam pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa'i mtshan nyid ni brtag pa rnam pa brgyad bstan par blta bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni brtag pa rnam pa brgyad po de dag kyang sems kyi rnam pa tsam du zad pas rnam pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
translated: Since those eight investigations are merely aspects of the mind, they are called the characteristic of the aspect.

original: de ni sems kyis brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni sems kyis brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: This is the characteristic of mental investigation.

original: brtag pa rnam pa brgyad gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brtag pa rnam pa brgyad gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: What are the eight investigations?

original: bden pa'i rnam pa yang bden pa'i sgo nas brtag gnas pa'i rnam pa yang gnas pa'i sgo nas brtag / skyon dang yon tan dang tshul dang 'jug pa dang rigs pa dang bsdus pa dang rgyas pa'i rnam pa yang de dag gi so so'i sgo nas de dag🔽nyid yin par brtag go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bden pa'i rnam pa yang bden pa'i sgo nas brtag gnas pa'i rnam pa yang gnas pa'i sgo nas brtag / skyon dang yon tan dang tshul dang 'jug pa dang rigs pa dang bsdus pa dang rgyas pa'i rnam pa yang de dag gi so so'i sgo nas de dag nyid yin par brtag go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The aspect of truth should be investigated from the point of view of truth, the aspect of abiding should be investigated from the point of view of abiding, the aspect of fault and virtue, the aspect of method, the aspect of engagement, the aspect of reasoning, the aspect of brief and extensive should be investigated from the point of view of each of them.🔽The aspect of reality should be investigated from the point of view of reality.🔽Here, truth is suchness.

original: de la bden pa ni de bzhin nyid gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sngar don dam pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la bden pa ni de bzhin nyid gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sngar don dam pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun bstan pa'o //
translated: The seven aspects of suchness, the characteristic of the ultimate, were previously explained.

original: gnas pa ni gang zag rnam par gzhag pa'am /
analyzed: gnas pa ni gang zag rnam par gzhag pa'am /
translated: Abiding is the establishment of the person,

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa'am /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa'am /
translated: or the establishment of the imagined nature,

original: mgo gcig dang @130a * //🔽rnam par dbye ba dang dris te lan gdab pa rnam par gzhag pa 'am /
analyzed: mgo gcig dang @130a * // rnam par dbye ba dang dris te lan gdab pa rnam par gzhag pa 'am /
translated: or the establishment of the single reply,🔽the establishment of the analytical reply,🔽or the establishment of the reply by question,🔽or the establishment of the reply by remaining silent,

original: gzhag pa rnam par gzhag pa'am /
analyzed: gzhag pa rnam par gzhag pa'am /
translated: or the establishment of the reply by distinguishing.

original: gsang ba dang rnam par dbye ba lan btab pa rnam par gzhag pa gar yin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gsang ba dang rnam par dbye ba lan btab pa rnam par gzhag pa gar yin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The answer by way of secret and the answer by way of analysis are the two kinds of answers.🔽The answer by way of secret is the answer by way of the imagined nature of the person, as previously explained in the chapter on the characteristics of the conventional.🔽The answer by way of analysis is the answer by way of the relative nature of the person, as previously explained in the chapter on the characteristics of the conventional.

original: gang zag rnam par gzhag pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni sngar kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skas su bshad pa bzhin no //🔽mgo gcig tu lan btab par rnam par gzhag ces bya ba ni sems can thams cad 'chi bar 'gyur ram zhes 'dri ba la thams cad 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes mgo gcig tu lan gdab pa lta bu la sogs pa'o //🔽rnam par dbye zhing lan gdab pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni shi ba thams cad skye bar 'gyur ram zhes 'dri ba la gang dag nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa de dag ni skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag rnam par gzhag pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni sngar kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skas su bshad pa bzhin no //🔽mgo gcig tu lan btab par rnam par gzhag ces bya ba ni sems can thams cad 'chi bar 'gyur ram zhes 'dri ba la thams cad 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes mgo gcig tu lan gdab pa lta bu la sogs pa'o //🔽rnam par dbye zhing lan gdab pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni shi ba thams cad skye bar 'gyur ram zhes 'dri ba la gang dag nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa de dag ni skye bar 'gyur ro //
