original: rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa'i sa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa dang / sems yod pa'i sa dang / sems med pa'i sa dang / thos pa las byung ba'i sa dang / bsam pa las byung ba'i sa dang /
analyzed: rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa'i sa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa dang / sems yod pa'i sa dang / sems med pa'i sa dang / thos pa las byung ba'i sa dang / bsam pa las byung ba'i sa dang /
translated: the stage of neither ideation nor non-ideation, the stage of concentration, the stage of non-concentration, the stage of the existence of mind, the stage of the non-existence of mind, the stage of what is derived from hearing, the stage of what is derived from pondering,

original: bsgom pa las byung ba'i sa dang ; nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang / phung po dang bcas pa'i sa dang / phung po med pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa las byung ba'i sa dang ; nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang / phung po dang bcas pa'i sa dang / phung po med pa'i sa'o //
translated: the stage of what is derived from cultivation, the stage of the śrāvakas, the stage of the pratyekabuddhas, the stage of the bodhisattvas, the stage with aggregates, and the stage without aggregates.

original: de'i bsdu ba bzhi ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa de'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba dang / gzhi bsdu ba dang / rnam grangs bsdu ba dang / rnam par bshad pa bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bsdu ba bzhi ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa de'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba dang / gzhi bsdu ba dang / rnam grangs bsdu ba dang / rnam par bshad pa bsdu ba'o //
translated: Its four compilations are the compilation of ascertainment of that stage of the practice of yoga, the compilation of the basis, the compilation of enumerations, and the compilation of explanations.

original: de gnyi ga bsdu ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga bsdu ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: The compilation of both of those is, in brief, of ten kinds.

original: bden pa'i mtshan nyid bshad pa dang / yongs su shes pa bshad pa dang / spang ba bshad pa dang / mngon du shes pa bshad pa dang / bsgom pa bshad pa dang / de dag nyid kyi rnam pa rab @133b tu dbye ba bshad pa dang /
analyzed: bden pa'i mtshan nyid bshad pa dang / yongs su shes pa bshad pa dang / spang ba bshad pa dang / mngon du shes pa bshad pa dang / bsgom pa bshad pa dang / de dag nyid kyi rnam pa rab @133b tu dbye ba bshad pa dang /
translated: the characteristics of the truths, complete understanding, abandonment, clear knowledge, meditation, the classification of those,

original: de dag nyid kyi gnas dang gnas pa'i 'brel ba bshad pa dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i bar du gcod pa'i chos bshad pa dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa rjes su mthun pa'i chos bshad pa dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa dang nyis dmigs dang phan yon bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi gnas dang gnas pa'i 'brel ba bshad pa dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i bar du gcod pa'i chos bshad pa dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa rjes su mthun pa'i chos bshad pa dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa dang nyis dmigs dang phan yon bshad pa ste /
translated: the relationship between the basis and what is based on it, the phenomena that are obstacles to complete understanding and so on, the phenomena that are conducive to complete understanding and so on, the object and benefit of complete understanding and so on.

original: de dag gis sde snod bsdu ba dang / ma mo bsdu ba de gnyis ka sdud par byed pas na gnyis ka bsdu ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis sde snod bsdu ba dang / ma mo bsdu ba de gnyis ka sdud par byed pas na gnyis ka bsdu ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it condenses both the collection of the scriptures and the collection of the mothers, it is called the collection of both.

original: yang mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa bcu gnyis yod de /
analyzed: yang mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa bcu gnyis yod de /
translated: In brief, there are twelve topics of explanation.

original: dngos po bshad pa dang / ming gi rnam grangs bshad pa dang / rang gi gzhung lugs brtag pa bshad pa dang / gzhan gyi gzhung lugs brtag pa bshad pa dang / drang ba'i don bshad pa dang / nges pa'i don bshad pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa bshad pa dang /
analyzed: dngos po bshad pa dang / ming gi rnam grangs bshad pa dang / rang gi gzhung lugs brtag pa bshad pa dang / gzhan gyi gzhung lugs brtag pa bshad pa dang / drang ba'i don bshad pa dang / nges pa'i don bshad pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa bshad pa dang /
translated: the explanation of the thing, the explanation of the synonyms, the explanation of our own system of tenets, the explanation of the systems of other schools, the explanation of the interpretable meaning, the explanation of the definitive meaning, the explanation of the conventional truth,

original: don dam pa'i bden pa bshad pa dang / gsang ba bshad pa dang / rnam par dbye ba bshad pa dang / lan gdab pa'i dngos po bshad pa dang / lan mi gdab pa'i dngos po bshad pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa bshad pa dang / gsang ba bshad pa dang / rnam par dbye ba bshad pa dang / lan gdab pa'i dngos po bshad pa dang / lan mi gdab pa'i dngos po bshad pa'o //
translated: the explanation of the ultimate truth, the explanation of the secret, the explanation of the divisions, the explanation of the things to be answered, and the explanation of the things not to be answered.

original: de la dngos po bshad pa ni gzugs la sogs pa dang mig la sogs pa'i chos rnams so sor bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la dngos po bshad pa ni gzugs la sogs pa dang mig la sogs pa'i chos rnams so sor bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the thing is the explanation of the individual dharmas such as form and such as eye.

original: ming gi rnam grangs bshad pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos bshad pa phung po dang khams dang skye mched rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang dbang po dang bden pa'i ming dang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa🔽la sogs pa'i ming dang gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa dang bstan du yod pa dang bstan du med pa dang thogs pa dang bcas pa dang thogs pa med pa la sogs pa'i ming gi rnam grangs dpag tu med pa dag rgya cher bshad pa gang
analyzed: ming gi rnam grangs bshad pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos bshad pa phung po dang khams dang skye mched rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang dbang po dang bden pa'i ming dang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i ming dang gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa dang bstan du yod pa dang bstan du med pa dang thogs pa dang bcas pa dang thogs pa med pa la sogs pa'i ming gi rnam grangs dpag tu med pa dag rgya cher bshad pa gang
translated: The explanation of synonyms is the extensive explanation of the immeasurable synonyms of the names of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, dependent origination, the possible and impossible, the faculties, the truths,🔽the close placements of mindfulness and so on, of the names of those that are physical and those that are not physical, those that are demonstrable and those that are not demonstrable, those that are impeded and those that are unimpeded and so on, which are explained by the Bhagavan buddhas.

original: yin pa'o // rang gi gzhung lugs brtag pa bshad pa ni rnam par bshad pa bsdu ba la brten nas mdo sde dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang lung du bstan pa'i sde la sogs pa bshad pa dang yang dag par bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yin pa'o // rang gi gzhung lugs brtag pa bshad pa ni rnam par bshad pa bsdu ba la brten nas mdo sde dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang lung du bstan pa'i sde la sogs pa bshad pa dang yang dag par bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The explanation of one’s own textual system is the explanation and correct explanation of the sūtras, the vyākaraṇa, the nidāna and so on, based on the Abhidharmakośa.

original: gzhan gyi gzhung lugs brtag pa bshad pa ni gtan tshigs kyi rigs pa rnam pa bdun la brten nas phas kyi rgo la ba tshar gcod pa dang rang gi sgra ba'i gzhung gzugs pa gang yin pa ste gtan tshigs kyi rigs pa rnam pa bdun ni 'di lta🔽ste / smra ba dang / smra ba'i zhal @134a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gzhung lugs brtag pa bshad pa ni gtan tshigs kyi rigs pa rnam pa bdun la brten nas phas kyi rgo la ba tshar gcod pa dang rang gi sgra ba'i gzhung gzugs pa gang yin pa ste gtan tshigs kyi rigs pa rnam pa bdun ni 'di lta ste / smra ba dang / smra ba'i zhal @134a * //
translated: The explanation of the examination of other systems is the refutation of opponents' arguments based on the seven types of logical reasoning and the establishment of one's own system. The seven types of logical reasoning are as follows:

original: che ba dang / smra ba'i gzhi dang / smra ba'i rgyan dang / smra ba chad pas gcad pa dang / smra ba las byung ba dang / smra ba gces smra ba la dgos pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: che ba dang / smra ba'i gzhi dang / smra ba'i rgyan dang / smra ba chad pas gcad pa dang / smra ba las byung ba dang / smra ba gces smra ba la dgos pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: 1) speech, 2) the speaker, 3) the basis of speech, 4) the ornament of speech, 5) the punishment of speech, 6) the result of speech, and 7) the cherished quality of speech.

original: drang ba'i chos bshad pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo'i sde dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang lung du bstan pa'i sde la sogs pa gang bshad pa don rnams rnam par ma phye ba drang bar bya dgos pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: drang ba'i chos bshad pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo'i sde dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang lung du bstan pa'i sde la sogs pa gang bshad pa don rnams rnam par ma phye ba drang bar bya dgos pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the interpretable teachings is that the teachings of the Bhagavat, such as the scriptural passages of the Sutra Pitaka, the Ge›ya Pitaka, and the Udaṇa Pitaka, are interpretable when their meaning is not analyzed and must be interpreted.

original: nges pa'i don bshad pa ni de las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i don bshad pa ni de las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
translated: The explanation of the ultimate should be understood in the opposite sense.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa bshad pa ni tshig gi lam gyis brjod pa gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa bshad pa ni tshig gi lam gyis brjod pa gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: The explanation of the conventional truth is any expression by means of the path of words.

original: ming dang 'du shes dang brjod pa'i dbang du bya ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ming dang 'du shes dang brjod pa'i dbang du bya ba 'di lta ste /
translated: It is the domain of name, conception, and expression, namely,

original: mtshan ma dang ming dang rnam par rtog pa gang ci yang rung ba bshad pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang ming dang rnam par rtog pa gang ci yang rung ba bshad pa'o //
translated: any indication, name, or conception whatsoever.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa bshad pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bshad pa dang de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang chos kyi dbyings bshad pa gang yin pa bshad pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa bshad pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bshad pa dang de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang chos kyi dbyings bshad pa gang yin pa bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the ultimate truth is any explanation of the four noble truths, of suchness, of the reality limit, and of the dharma-element.

original: gsang ba bshad pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsang ba bshad pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The explanation of the secret is as follows:

original: phal cher ni nyan thos kyi sde snod bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phal cher ni nyan thos kyi sde snod bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: For the most part, it is the explanation of the Sūtra-piṭaka.

original: rnam par phye ba bshad pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par phye ba bshad pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The explanation of the detailed is as follows:

original: phal cher ni theg pa chen po'i sde snod bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phal cher ni theg pa chen po'i sde snod bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: For the most part, it is the explanation of the Vinaya-piṭaka.

original: lan btab pa'i dngos po bshad pa ni chos kyi mdo bzhi po dag bshad pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lan btab pa'i dngos po bshad pa ni chos kyi mdo bzhi po dag bshad pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The explanation of the things to be answered is the explanation of the four summaries of the Dharma:

original: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa zhes bya ba nas mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa dag bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa zhes bya ba nas mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa dag bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: all conditioned things are impermanent, all contaminated things are suffering, all phenomena are empty and selfless, and nirvana is peace.🔽The explanation of the things not to be answered is that when asked, “Is the world permanent?” one does not answer, “That is not to be answered.”

original: lan mi gdab pa'i dngos po bshad pa ni 'jig rten rtag gam zhes dris nas de ni bdag gis lan ma btab po zhes smra zhing lan 'debs par mi byed pa dang / de bzhin 'ongs pa shi phan chad yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin nam zhes bya ba'i bar du lan mi gdab pa'i dngos po bcu bzhir dris na de ni bdag gis lan btab po zhes smra zhing lan 'debs par mi byed pa gang yin
analyzed: lan mi gdab pa'i dngos po bshad pa ni 'jig rten rtag gam zhes dris nas de ni bdag gis lan ma btab po zhes smra zhing lan 'debs par mi byed pa dang / de bzhin 'ongs pa shi phan chad yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin nam zhes bya ba'i bar du lan mi gdab pa'i dngos po bcu bzhir dris na de ni bdag gis lan btab po zhes smra zhing lan 'debs par mi byed pa gang yin
translated: Similarly, when asked, “Does the Tathagata exist after death?” one does not answer, “That is not to be answered.”

original: pa'o // de la lan mi 'debs pa'i dngos po bshad pa ni rgyu rnam pa bzhis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: pa'o // de la lan mi 'debs pa'i dngos po bshad pa ni rgyu rnam pa bzhis rig par bya ste /
translated: The explanation of the things not to be answered should be understood through four reasons.

original: med pa'i phyir lan mi gdab pa yang yod de /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir lan mi gdab pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also a type of question to which one should not reply because it is meaningless.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: ci bdag phung po rnams dang gzhan nam gzhan ma yin nam rtag gam mi rtag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ci bdag phung po rnams dang gzhan nam gzhan ma yin nam rtag gam mi rtag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Is the self the same as the aggregates or different from them? Is it permanent or impermanent?”

original: don dang mi ldan pa'i phyir lan mi 'debs pa yang yod de /
analyzed: don dang mi ldan pa'i phyir lan mi 'debs pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also a type of question to which one should not reply because it is pointless.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: shing sha ba'i lo ma'i dpe'i mdo las /
analyzed: shing sha ba'i lo ma'i dpe'i mdo las /
translated: in the Sutra of the Parable of the Log,

original: ngas ni @134b 'di snyed cig mngon par rtogs par thugs su chud kyang ma bstan te /
analyzed: ngas ni @134b 'di snyed cig mngon par rtogs par thugs su chud kyang ma bstan te /
translated: “Although I have understood this much, I have not taught it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos de dag don dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos de dag don dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Because those teachings are not meaningful.”

original: zag pa'i phyir lan mi 'debs pa yang yod de /
analyzed: zag pa'i phyir lan mi 'debs pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also a type of question to which one should not reply because it is defiled.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: bdag yod dam zhes 'dren phung po rnams la bdag tu 'dzin par gyur tam /
analyzed: bdag yod dam zhes 'dren phung po rnams la bdag tu 'dzin par gyur tam /
translated: “Does the self exist?”

original: phung po rnams la don gzhan du gyur pa yod pa 'dzin na mi rung bas lan mi 'debs pa dang / bdag med dam zhes 'dri na skyes bu'i tha snyad la skur ba 'debs sam 'dzin par gyur na mi rung bas lan mi 'debs pa dang /
analyzed: phung po rnams la don gzhan du gyur pa yod pa 'dzin na mi rung bas lan mi 'debs pa dang / bdag med dam zhes 'dri na skyes bu'i tha snyad la skur ba 'debs sam 'dzin par gyur na mi rung bas lan mi 'debs pa dang /
translated: If one asks whether the self is different from the aggregates, it is improper to reply that it is not different, and if one asks whether the self is not nonexistent, it is improper to reply that it is not existent.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin 'ongs pa shi phan chad yod dam zhes bya ba nas yod pa'ang ma yin med pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar du 'dri na zab pa'i phyir lan mi 'debs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin 'ongs pa shi phan chad yod dam zhes bya ba nas yod pa'ang ma yin med pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar du 'dri na zab pa'i phyir lan mi 'debs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Similarly, if one asks whether the Tathāgata exists after death, or whether he both exists and does not exist after death, or whether he neither exists nor does not exist after death, it is improper to reply, because it is profound.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa las lan mi 'debs pa yang yod de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa las lan mi 'debs pa yang yod de / 'di lta ste /
translated: There is also no reply to the question of the characteristics of reality.

original: chos de dag lan gzhan nam gzhan ma yin zhes 'dri na /
analyzed: chos de dag lan gzhan nam gzhan ma yin zhes 'dri na /
translated: If one asks whether those phenomena are other or not other,

original: lan mi 'debs pa lta bu ste 'di ltar mtshan nyid de ni gzhan pa nyid kyang ma yin gzhan pa ma yin par rnam par gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lan mi 'debs pa lta bu ste 'di ltar mtshan nyid de ni gzhan pa nyid kyang ma yin gzhan pa ma yin par rnam par gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there is no reply, because those characteristics are neither other nor not other.

original: gzhan yang lan mi gdab pa'i dngos po bshad pa ni rgyu rnam pa bzhis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang lan mi gdab pa'i dngos po bshad pa ni rgyu rnam pa bzhis rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the things that are not to be answered are to be understood through four kinds of causes:

original: mu stegs can rnams kyis bshad pa yin pa'i phyir dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir dang / don dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dang / rtsod pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa 'ba' zhig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams kyis bshad pa yin pa'i phyir dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir dang / don dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dang / rtsod pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa 'ba' zhig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are explained by the tīrthikas, because they are not in accordance with the truth, because they are not meaningful, and because they are only the basis for debate.

original: mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the avoidance of the two extremes?

original: der ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug tu blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: der ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug tu blta bar bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be seen as sixfold:

original: yod pa ma yin pa la sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' rnam par spang ba dang / yod pa la skul pa 'debs pa'i mtha' rnam par spang ba dang / rtag par 'dzin pa'i mtha' rnam par spang ba dang / chad par 'dzin pa'i mtha' rnam par spang pa dang /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa la sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' rnam par spang ba dang / yod pa la skul pa 'debs pa'i mtha' rnam par spang ba dang / rtag par 'dzin pa'i mtha' rnam par spang ba dang / chad par 'dzin pa'i mtha' rnam par spang pa dang /
translated: the avoidance of the extreme of superimposition in regard to what does not exist, the avoidance of the extreme of denial in regard to what does exist, the avoidance of the extreme of grasping permanence, the avoidance of the extreme of grasping annihilation, the avoidance of the extreme of the view of self, and the avoidance of the extreme of the view of the reality of the self.

original: 'dod pa'i bsod nams la sbyor ba'i mtha' rnam par spang ba dang / bdag nyid ngal bar sbyor ba'i mtha' rnam par spang ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i bsod nams la sbyor ba'i mtha' rnam par spang ba dang / bdag nyid ngal bar sbyor ba'i mtha' rnam par spang ba'o //
translated: The extreme of application to the pleasures of desire is avoided, and the extreme of application to self-mortification is avoided.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is inconceivable?

original: mdor bsdu na bsam gyis mi khyab pa drug ste /🔽bdag la sems pa dang / sems can la sems pa dang / 'jig rten la sems pa dang / sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa la sems pa dang / bsam gtan @135a * //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na bsam gyis mi khyab pa drug ste / bdag la sems pa dang / sems can la sems pa dang / 'jig rten la sems pa dang / sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa la sems pa dang / bsam gtan @135a * //
translated: In brief, it is sixfold:

original: pa rnams kyi bsam gtan pa'i yul dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi yul lo //
analyzed: pa rnams kyi bsam gtan pa'i yul dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi yul lo //
translated: the inconceivable nature of the world, the inconceivable nature of the maturation of sentient beings’ karma, the inconceivable nature of the meditative absorptions of the contemplatives, the inconceivable nature of the domain of the Buddhas, the inconceivable nature of the spiritual gene, and the inconceivable nature of the Tathāgata’s gnosis.

original: de la bdag la sems pa dang / sems can la sems pa dang / 'jig rten la sems pa ni lta ba la brten na ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de la bdag la sems pa dang / sems can la sems pa dang / 'jig rten la sems pa ni lta ba la brten na ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag yin no //
translated: The inconceivable nature of the world, the inconceivable nature of the maturation of sentient beings’ karma, and the inconceivable nature of the meditative absorptions of the contemplatives are inconceivable only in dependence on views.

original: de la bdag la sems pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas 'di snyam du sems te ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur tam zhes bya ba la sogs par sems pa'o //🔽sems can la nges pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas 'di snyam du sems te ;
analyzed: de la bdag la sems pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas 'di snyam du sems te ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur tam zhes bya ba la sogs par sems pa'o // sems can la nges pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas 'di snyam du sems te ;
translated: The mind that is concerned with the self is the thought that occurs to someone who is based on the view of the transitory collection, Did I exist in the past? and so on.

original: sems can gang las byung sems can byed pa po su yin sems can gang gi bar du 'gro sems can gang gi bar du 'gag par 'gyur snyam du sems pa'o //🔽'jig rten la sems pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: sems can gang las byung sems can byed pa po su yin sems can gang gi bar du 'gro sems can gang gi bar du 'gag par 'gyur snyam du sems pa'o // 'jig rten la sems pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The mind that is concerned with sentient beings is the thought that occurs to someone who is based on the view of the transitory collection, From what do sentient beings arise? Who is the creator of sentient beings? To what end do sentient beings go? To what end do sentient beings cease?

original: 'jig rten rtag go zhes bya ba la sogs par sems pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rtag go zhes bya ba la sogs par sems pa'o //
translated: The mind that is concerned with the world is the thought that occurs to someone who is based on the view of the transitory collection, The world is eternal and so on.

original: yang de dag ni chos nyid las brtsams nas kyang 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yang de dag ni chos nyid las brtsams nas kyang 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Moreover, they think in this way in terms of reality itself: What is the world?

original: bdag gi chos nyid dang sems can gyi chos nyid dang 'jig rten gyi chos nyid 'di ci las de ltar byung snyam du bsam zhing chos nyid kyi rigs pa kho nas mi 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi chos nyid dang sems can gyi chos nyid dang 'jig rten gyi chos nyid 'di ci las de ltar byung snyam du bsam zhing chos nyid kyi rigs pa kho nas mi 'jug pa yin te /
translated: One should reflect, From what do the reality of myself, the reality of sentient beings, and the reality of the world arise? One should not engage in this reflection by means of the principle of reality alone.

original: de'i phyir yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas la sems pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas la sems pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called reflection on the inconceivable.

original: sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa la sems pa ni rnam pa bzhis bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa la sems pa ni rnam pa bzhis bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin te /
translated: Reflection on the maturation of sentient beings' karma is inconceivable in four ways:

original: gnas dang / dngos po dang / rgyu dang / rnam par smin pa las so //
analyzed: gnas dang / dngos po dang / rgyu dang / rnam par smin pa las so //
translated: in terms of place, entity, cause, and maturation.

original: bsam gtan pa rnams kyi bsam gtan pa'i yul ni rnam pa gsum gyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan pa rnams kyi bsam gtan pa'i yul ni rnam pa gsum gyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin te /
translated: The object of meditation of meditators is inconceivable in three ways:

original: de bzhin nyid zab pa'i don dang dbang sgyur ba dang zag pa zad pa'i dbyings yang dag par 'grub pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid zab pa'i don dang dbang sgyur ba dang zag pa zad pa'i dbyings yang dag par 'grub pas so //
translated: in terms of the profound meaning of suchness, mastery, and the attainment of the realm of the extinction of defilements.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi yul ni rnam pa lngas bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi yul ni rnam pa lngas bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin te /
translated: The object of buddhas is inconceivable in five ways:

original: ji skad bstan pa rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid dang / gzhan gnyis te sgrib pa med pa dang / sems can gyi don gyi bya ba mdzad pas so //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid dang / gzhan gnyis te sgrib pa med pa dang / sems can gyi don gyi bya ba mdzad pas so //
translated: These three kinds of teaching and two others, namely, the absence of obscurations and the performance of the work of benefiting beings, are the six kinds of teaching.

original: dgongs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dgongs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the intention?

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcu drug ste /🔽yang dag par ston pa'i dgongs pa dang / 'dun pa bzlog pa'i dgongs pa dang / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug @135b pa'i dgongs pa dang yang dag par gzengs bstod pa'i dgongs pa dang yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad pa'i dgongs pa dang /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcu drug ste / yang dag par ston pa'i dgongs pa dang / 'dun pa bzlog pa'i dgongs pa dang / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug @135b pa'i dgongs pa dang yang dag par gzengs bstod pa'i dgongs pa dang yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad pa'i dgongs pa dang /
translated: In brief, it is of sixteen kinds.🔽The intention to reveal, the intention to avert desire, the intention to engage in correct practice, the intention to encourage, the intention to delight,

original: gzud pa'i dgongs pa dang / the tshom gcad pa'i dgongs pa dang / yongs su smin par bya ba'i dgongs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin du bya ba'i dgongs pa dang / rnam par grol bar bya ba'i dgongs pa dang / don gzhan dang 'brel ba'i dgongs pa dang /
analyzed: gzud pa'i dgongs pa dang / the tshom gcad pa'i dgongs pa dang / yongs su smin par bya ba'i dgongs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin du bya ba'i dgongs pa dang / rnam par grol bar bya ba'i dgongs pa dang / don gzhan dang 'brel ba'i dgongs pa dang /
translated: the intention to introduce, the intention to resolve doubts, the intention to ripen, the intention to concentrate, the intention to liberate, the intention to relate to another meaning,

original: rtogs par byed pa rnams la kha na ma tho ba med pa'i dgongs pa dang / mchog tu dga' ba bskyed pa'i dgongs pa dang / smra ba po la nyan pa rnams rin po cher bskyed pa'i dgongs pa dang / chos kyi tshul 'jug pa'i dgongs pa dang /
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa rnams la kha na ma tho ba med pa'i dgongs pa dang / mchog tu dga' ba bskyed pa'i dgongs pa dang / smra ba po la nyan pa rnams rin po cher bskyed pa'i dgongs pa dang / chos kyi tshul 'jug pa'i dgongs pa dang /
translated: the intention of being irreproachable in the eyes of those who understand; the intention of producing the highest joy; the intention of producing the jewel-like listener in the speaker; the intention of entering into the way of the Dharma;

original: dge ba mang bar bya ba'i dgongs pa dang / mtshan ma thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba mang bar bya ba'i dgongs pa dang / mtshan ma thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: the intention of producing much virtue; and the intention of overcoming all signs.

original: de la mtha' gnyis spang ba'i tshul gyis de kho na'i don gyi tshul khong du chud na thob par bya ba'i don thob pa'o //
analyzed: de la mtha' gnyis spang ba'i tshul gyis de kho na'i don gyi tshul khong du chud na thob par bya ba'i don thob pa'o //
translated: When one has understood the way of reality by avoiding the two extremes, one has attained the goal to be attained.

original: de kho na'i don gyi tshul khong du chud pa'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa ni rnam par lngar rig par bya ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de kho na'i don gyi tshul khong du chud pa'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa ni rnam par lngar rig par bya ste /🔽'di lta ste /
translated: The entry into the faultless understanding of the way of reality should be known as fivefold.

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa dang / 'dod chags dang shes cher bral ba'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi skyon med pa la 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa dang / 'dod chags dang shes cher bral ba'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi skyon med pa la 'jug pa dang /
translated: entering the faultless state without being free from passion, entering the faultless state with a great deal of freedom from passion, entering the faultless state with freedom from passion, entering the faultless state of a pratyekabuddha,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: and entering the faultless state of a bodhisattva.

original: thob par bya ba'i don thob na de las gzhan pa'i thob ba'i tshul yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul gyis de khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i don thob na de las gzhan pa'i thob ba'i tshul yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul gyis de khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: When one has attained the goal to be attained, one should understand that the way of attaining the other is inconceivable.

original: bshad pa'i tshul thams cad ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dgongs pa'i tshul gyis ci rigs par khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bshad pa'i tshul thams cad ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dgongs pa'i tshul gyis ci rigs par khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: All the ways of teaching are to be understood as the way of the intention of the Lord Buddhas, as is appropriate.

original: 'jug pa ni dus gsum dang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum dang rkyen bzhi po dag go zhes bya ba ni gang du 'jug pa dang ji ltar 'jug pa dang gang gis 'jug pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni dus gsum dang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum dang rkyen bzhi po dag go zhes bya ba ni gang du 'jug pa dang ji ltar 'jug pa dang gang gis 'jug pa bstan to //
translated: The engagement is the three times, the three characteristics of the conditioned, and the four conditions. This teaches where it engages, how it engages, and what it engages.🔽The reasoning should be understood as fourfold. This mentions the synonyms of reasoning, which is the power of all phenomena.

original: rigs pa ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste zhes bya ba ni chos so cog gi dbang byed pa rigs pa'i rnam grangs smos pa 'jig rten na rgyal po dag bdag gi rigs su ci 'dod pa'i ngag gi dbang phyug gis 'grub pa bzhin du chos so
analyzed: rigs pa ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste zhes bya ba ni chos so cog gi dbang byed pa rigs pa'i rnam grangs smos pa 'jig rten na rgyal po dag bdag gi rigs su ci 'dod pa'i ngag gi dbang phyug gis 'grub pa bzhin du chos so
translated: Just as in the world, kings accomplish whatever they desire with the power of their own lineage,

original: cog la bdag gi phyogs su gzung ba yang ji ltar 'dod par rig pa'i dbang gis 'grub ste /🔽chos thams cad kyi rgyal po lta ba'i rigs zhes bya ba chos kyi rjes su @136a * //
analyzed: cog la bdag gi phyogs su gzung ba yang ji ltar 'dod par rig pa'i dbang gis 'grub ste / chos thams cad kyi rgyal po lta ba'i rigs zhes bya ba chos kyi rjes su @136a * //
translated: in the same way, one can accomplish whatever one desires with the power of knowledge regarding all phenomena as one's own position.🔽The four reasonings are mentioned as the king of all phenomena, the lineage of views,

original: gsungs pa'i rigs pa bzhi brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa'i rigs pa bzhi brjod pa'o //
translated: and the four reasonings that are taught as the followers of the Dharma.

original: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa'o zhes bya ba la rigs pa de bzhi'i phyogs tsam zhig mdor brjod na /
analyzed: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa'o zhes bya ba la rigs pa de bzhi'i phyogs tsam zhig mdor brjod na /
translated: The principle of dependence, the principle of efficacy, the principle of logical possibility, and the principle of reality.

original: ltos pa'i rigs pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ltos pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ltos pa'i rigs pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ltos pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The principle of dependence is the teaching of the relation of cause and effect of things.

original: bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi bya ba byed pa'i las bstan pa yin no //🔽'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa zhes bya ba ni tshad ma gsum gyi 'thad pas so sor don sgrub pa'i rigs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi bya ba byed pa'i las bstan pa yin no // 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa zhes bya ba ni tshad ma gsum gyi 'thad pas so sor don sgrub pa'i rigs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The principle of efficacy is the teaching of the function of things.🔽The principle of logical possibility is the teaching of the logical possibility of things by means of the three kinds of logical possibility.

original: chos nyid kyi rigs pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid so sor nges pa'i chos nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rigs pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid so sor nges pa'i chos nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: The principle of reality is the teaching of the reality of the specific characteristics of the possible and the impossible.

original: de la ltos pa'i rigs pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltos pa'i rigs pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of the principle of dependence?

original: de la ltos pa'i rigs pa ni 'du byed rnams 'byung ba dang rjes su tha snyad btags pa'i rgyu gang dag yin pa dang rkyen gang dag yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la ltos pa'i rigs pa ni 'du byed rnams 'byung ba dang rjes su tha snyad btags pa'i rgyu gang dag yin pa dang rkyen gang dag yin pa ste /
translated: The principle of dependence is the causes and conditions that are the reason for the occurrence of formations and the subsequent designation of them.🔽This is the principle of dependence.

original: de ni ltos pa'i rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te 'du byed rnams 'byung ba dang rjes su tha snyad gdags pa la rang dbang med de /
analyzed: de ni ltos pa'i rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te 'du byed rnams 'byung ba dang rjes su tha snyad gdags pa la rang dbang med de /
translated: The occurrence of formations and the subsequent designation of them are not independent.

original: rgyu dang rkyen du nges pa'i tshogs pa la ltos shing 'byung ba dang rjes su tha snyad 'dogs dgos pas de dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ltos pa bstan pa ni ltos pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen du nges pa'i tshogs pa la ltos shing 'byung ba dang rjes su tha snyad 'dogs dgos pas de dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ltos pa bstan pa ni ltos pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They must occur and be designated in dependence on the assembly of causes and conditions that are ascertained. Therefore, the teaching of the dependence of those causes and results is called the principle of dependence.

original: de la 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of formations:

original: phyi dang nang gi 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi 'du byed rnams so //
translated: outer and inner formations.

original: de la gzugs nas chos kyi bar gyi khams drug ni phyi'i 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: de la gzugs nas chos kyi bar gyi khams drug ni phyi'i 'du byed rnams so //
translated: The six elements from form to mental objects are outer formations.

original: mig gi dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar ni nang gi 'du byed rnams te /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar ni nang gi 'du byed rnams te /
translated: The eye faculty element and the eye consciousness element up to the mind faculty element and the mind consciousness element are internal compositional factors.

original: de dag gi 'jig rten pa'i lo tog la sogs pa lung ma bstan pa'i dngos po thams cad dang nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi dngos po thams cad dang byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos
analyzed: de dag gi 'jig rten pa'i lo tog la sogs pa lung ma bstan pa'i dngos po thams cad dang nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi dngos po thams cad dang byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos
translated: The world of those is all the neutral things such as crops, etc., and all the things characterized by affliction such as karma and birth, and all the things characterized by purification such as the factors of enlightenment, etc.

original: la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi dngos po thams cad ci rigs par bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi dngos po thams cad ci rigs par bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as being included in the appropriate categories.

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni gang ma byung ba gdod 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni gang ma byung ba gdod 'byung ba'o //
translated: Origination means that which did not exist before and now exists.

original: rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid dam bye @136b brag gi rnam pa ming dang brdar btags pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid dam bye @136b brag gi rnam pa ming dang brdar btags pa'o //
translated: Designation means that things are designated by names and signs in terms of their nature or their specific attributes.

original: de dag kyang 'dra ba la ltos te mi 'dra ba'i cha yod pa dang gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'dra ba la ltos te mi 'dra ba'i cha yod pa dang gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, they are twofold: that which has a part that is dissimilar in dependence on a similar part,🔽and that which has a part that is similar in dependence on a dissimilar part.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba ni dbang phyug dam pa'i mnga' bdag dpal lha btsan byang chub rdzu 'phrul gyis mdzad pa bka' yang dag pa'i tshad ma las 'byung ba bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba ni dbang phyug dam pa'i mnga' bdag dpal lha btsan byang chub rdzu 'phrul gyis mdzad pa bka' yang dag pa'i tshad ma las 'byung ba bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The characteristics and divisions of these should be understood in accordance with the authentic valid cognition of the words of the glorious Lha btsan Byang chub rdzul phrul, the lord of the supreme lord of the powerful ones.

original: rgyu gang dag yin pa dang / rkyen gang dag yin pa ste zhes bya ba ni 'du byed byung ba dang rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i 'bras bu de dag 'byung ba dang rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i tshe na rgyu dang rkyen de dag la ltos par bya ba yin pas ltos pa'i rigs🔽pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu gang dag yin pa dang / rkyen gang dag yin pa ste zhes bya ba ni 'du byed byung ba dang rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i 'bras bu de dag 'byung ba dang rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i tshe na rgyu dang rkyen de dag la ltos par bya ba yin pas ltos pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba bstan to //
translated: The phrase those that are causes and those that are conditions indicates that when the effects of the arising of formations and the subsequent designation arise and are designated, they should be seen as dependent on those causes and conditions. Therefore, it is called the principle of dependence.

original: de la 'du byed rnams 'byung ba dang rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu dang rkyen ni gang dag yin /
analyzed: de la 'du byed rnams 'byung ba dang rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu dang rkyen ni gang dag yin /
translated: What are the causes and conditions for the arising of formations and the subsequent designation?

original: rgyu dang rkyen de dag la ltos te byung ba dang rjes su tha snyad btags pa'i 'bras bu ni gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen de dag la ltos te byung ba dang rjes su tha snyad btags pa'i 'bras bu ni gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: What are the effects that arise in dependence on those causes and conditions and are designated in relation to them?

original: rgyu bcu dang / rkyen bzhi dang / 'bras bu lnga ste ;
analyzed: rgyu bcu dang / rkyen bzhi dang / 'bras bu lnga ste ;
translated: There are ten causes, four conditions, and five effects.

original: de la rgyu bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rgyu bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten causes?

original: rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu dang / ltos pa'i rgyu dang / 'phen pa'i rgyu dang / mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu dang / yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu dang / 'dren pa'i rgyu dang / so sor nges pa'i rgyu dang / lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang /
analyzed: rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu dang / ltos pa'i rgyu dang / 'phen pa'i rgyu dang / mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu dang / yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu dang / 'dren pa'i rgyu dang / so sor nges pa'i rgyu dang / lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang /
translated: They are the cause of designation, the cause of dependence, the projecting cause, the actualizing cause, the cause of possession, the leading cause, the determining cause, the co-operating cause,

original: mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang / mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang / mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: the counteractive cause, and the non-counteractive cause.

original: de la rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa rgyu lhag ma dgu ni 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de la rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa rgyu lhag ma dgu ni 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Except for the cause of designation, the remaining nine causes are the productive cause.

original: de la yang mi mthun pa'i rgyu ni mi mthun pa med par gyur na 'byung ba'i rgyu yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la yang mi mthun pa'i rgyu ni mi mthun pa med par gyur na 'byung ba'i rgyu yin par sbyar ro //
translated: And the counteractive cause is the productive cause when it becomes non-counteractive.

original: rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu nyid ni rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu nyid ni rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The cause of the designation is the cause of the designation.

original: de la rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of the designation?

original: chos thams cad kyi ming dang ming sngon du 'gro ba'i 'du shes dang 'du shes sngon du 'gro ba'i brjod pa gang yin pa de ni chos de dang de dag gi rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ming dang ming sngon du 'gro ba'i 'du shes dang 'du shes sngon du 'gro ba'i brjod pa gang yin pa de ni chos de dang de dag gi rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: It is the name of all things, the perception preceded by the name, and the expression preceded by the perception.

original: ltos pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: ltos pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of dependence?

original: gzhi gang la ltos shing rgyu gang gis dngos po gang la 'dod pa dang len par gyur pa de ni de'i ltos pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gzhi gang la ltos shing rgyu gang gis dngos po gang la 'dod pa dang len par gyur pa de ni de'i ltos pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: It is the cause of the desire and the attachment of a thing in dependence on a basis.

original: 'phen pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'phen pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the projecting cause?

original: sa bon ni rang gi 'bras bu tha ma'i bar gyi 'phen pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sa bon ni rang gi 'bras bu tha ma'i bar gyi 'phen pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The seed is the projecting cause of its fruit up to the last moment of the actual entities of existence.

original: mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu gang zhe na //🔽sa bon de nyid rang gi 'bras bu mngon par 'grub @137a * //
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu gang zhe na // sa bon de nyid rang gi 'bras bu mngon par 'grub @137a * //
translated: What is the cause of production?

original: pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The seed is the cause of the production of its fruit.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of support?

original: sa bon ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa rkyen rnams ni yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sa bon ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa rkyen rnams ni yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: All the conditions, with the exception of the seed, are the cause of support.

original: 'dren pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dren pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of guidance?

original: sa bon las grub pa'i 'bras bu de ni sa bon gyis 'phangs pa'i 'bras bu phyi ma'i 'dren pa'i rgyu yin no ;
analyzed: sa bon las grub pa'i 'bras bu de ni sa bon gyis 'phangs pa'i 'bras bu phyi ma'i 'dren pa'i rgyu yin no ;
translated: The seed is the cause of guidance of the future fruit projected by the seed.

original: / so sor nges pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: / so sor nges pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of specification?

original: chos rnam pa sna tshogs rnam pa tha dad pa'i rang rang gi rgyu so sor nges pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: chos rnam pa sna tshogs rnam pa tha dad pa'i rang rang gi rgyu so sor nges pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause of specification is the cause of the various different natures of the various different elements.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of association?

original: ltos pa'i rgyu dang 'phen pa'i rgyu dang mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu dang yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu dang 'dren pa'i rgyu dang so sor nges pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: ltos pa'i rgyu dang 'phen pa'i rgyu dang mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu dang yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu dang 'dren pa'i rgyu dang so sor nges pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The totality of the causes, namely, the cause of reliance, the projecting cause, the actualizing cause, the supporting cause, the guiding cause and the specifying cause, is the associated cause.

original: mi mthun pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of opposition?

original: skye ba la sogs pa la bar du gcod pa'i rgyu ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa la bar du gcod pa'i rgyu ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause that obstructs arising, etc. is the counteragent cause.

original: mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the non-counteragent cause?

original: skye ba la sogs pa la bar du gcod pa med pa'i rgyu ni mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa la bar du gcod pa med pa'i rgyu ni mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause that does not obstruct arising, etc. is the non-counteragent cause.🔽These ten causes are the causes for the correct arising and the conventional expression of all things, whether mundane or transcendent, whether pure or impure.

original: rgyu bcu po de dag ni nang dang phyi'i 'du byed 'jig rten pa'i lo tog la sogs pa lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po thams cad dang nyon mongs pa dang las dang / skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi dngos po thams cad dang /
analyzed: rgyu bcu po de dag ni nang dang phyi'i 'du byed 'jig rten pa'i lo tog la sogs pa lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po thams cad dang nyon mongs pa dang las dang / skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi dngos po thams cad dang /
translated: The ten causes are the causes for the correct arising and the conventional expression of all things, whether mundane or transcendent, whether pure or impure.🔽Mundane things are the internal and external formations, such as the crops.🔽All things that are impure are those that have the characteristic of affliction, such as karma and birth.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi dngos po thams cad phyin ci ma log par 'byung ba dang rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi dngos po thams cad phyin ci ma log par 'byung ba dang rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: All things that are pure are those that have the characteristic of purification, such as the factors of enlightenment.

original: de la rgyu bcu po de dag gis 'jig rten pa'i lo tog la sogs pa lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po thams cad ji ltar 'byung zhing rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed ce na /
analyzed: de la rgyu bcu po de dag gis 'jig rten pa'i lo tog la sogs pa lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po thams cad ji ltar 'byung zhing rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed ce na /
translated: How do these ten causes give rise to and designate all neutral things such as worldly crops?

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na 'bru'i grangs su gtogs pa'i lo tog gang gis 'jig rten 'dir byed pa gang yin pa de dag gi ming du 'du shes dang tshig tu brjod pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na 'bru'i grangs su gtogs pa'i lo tog gang gis 'jig rten 'dir byed pa gang yin pa de dag gi ming du 'du shes dang tshig tu brjod pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: In the world, crops belonging to the class of grains are designated by various names, ideas, and expressions, such as🔽barley, rice, wheat, sesame, and beans.

original: nas dang 'bras dang s'a lu dang gro dang til dang sran ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de dag gi tha snyad nas la sogs pa khyer de shog thogs shog zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: nas dang 'bras dang s'a lu dang gro dang til dang sran ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de dag gi tha snyad nas la sogs pa khyer de shog thogs shog zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The names and so on are the causes for designating the conventions “Bring the barley,” “Bring the rice,” and so on.

original: bkres pa dang skom pa dang nyam chung ba dang lus gnas par bya ba la ltos pa dang kham gyi zas myang bar bya ba @137b la ltos nas nas la sogs pa de dag 'dod pa dang tsho la ba dang len pa dang longs spyod par byed pa
analyzed: bkres pa dang skom pa dang nyam chung ba dang lus gnas par bya ba la ltos pa dang kham gyi zas myang bar bya ba @137b la ltos nas nas la sogs pa de dag 'dod pa dang tsho la ba dang len pa dang longs spyod par byed pa
translated: They desire, seek, take up, and enjoy barley, etc., in dependence on hunger, thirst, weakness, and the need to maintain the body, and in dependence on the need to experience oral food.

original: 'di ni de dag gi ltos pa'i rgyu yin no //🔽nas la sogs pa'i rang rang gi sa bon gang dang gang la lo tog gang dang gang 'byung ba'i sa bon de ni de'i 'phen pa'i rgyu yin no //🔽sa bon de ni myu gu de'i mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de dag gi ltos pa'i rgyu yin no // nas la sogs pa'i rang rang gi sa bon gang dang gang la lo tog gang dang gang 'byung ba'i sa bon de ni de'i 'phen pa'i rgyu yin no // sa bon de ni myu gu de'i mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: This is the causal condition of barley, etc.🔽The seed of barley, etc., is the projecting cause of the barley, etc.,🔽because the seed of barley, etc., is the cause of the production of the sprout.

original: sa dang char ba la sogs pa'i rkyen las myu gu 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ni de'i yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sa dang char ba la sogs pa'i rkyen las myu gu 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ni de'i yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The conditions such as earth and water that cause the sprout to arise are the supporting cause of the sprout.

original: myu gu dang sdong bu dang lo ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i rgyun de ni lo tog de 'grub pa dang yongs su smin pa'i 'dren pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: myu gu dang sdong bu dang lo ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i rgyun de ni lo tog de 'grub pa dang yongs su smin pa'i 'dren pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The series of sprouts, stems, leaves, etc. , which is the continuation of the first seed, is the leading cause of the production and maturation of the crop.

original: nas kyi sa bon las kyang nas kyi myu gu dang nas kyi lo tog 'byung bar 'gyur gyi gzhan ma yin la 'bru gzhan dag las kyang de bzhin pa de ni de dag gi so sor nges pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: nas kyi sa bon las kyang nas kyi myu gu dang nas kyi lo tog 'byung bar 'gyur gyi gzhan ma yin la 'bru gzhan dag las kyang de bzhin pa de ni de dag gi so sor nges pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: From the seed of barley, there arises the sprout of barley, the stem of barley, the leaf of barley, etc. , and finally the ear of barley which produces barley seeds. From other seeds, other sprouts. This is the specific cause.

original: ltos pa'i rgyu nas bzung ste so sor nges pa'i rgyu la thug pa'i bar gyi rgyu drug po de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni lo tog de 'grub pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: ltos pa'i rgyu nas bzung ste so sor nges pa'i rgyu la thug pa'i bar gyi rgyu drug po de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni lo tog de 'grub pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The six causes, from the supporting cause to the specific cause, taken together, are the co-operating causes of the crop.

original: ser ba dang lo tog la gnod pa 'byung ba la sogs pa bar du gcod pa rnams ni de'i mi mthun pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: ser ba dang lo tog la gnod pa 'byung ba la sogs pa bar du gcod pa rnams ni de'i mi mthun pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Hail, frost, wind, rain, etc. , are the adverse causes of the crop.

original: de dag med de bar du gcod pa med pa ni mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de dag med de bar du gcod pa med pa ni mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The absence of hail, frost, etc. , is the non-adverse cause.

original: de ltar rgyu bcu po de dag gis 'bru bsdus pa rnams la ji bzhin du de las gzhan pa'i 'jig rten pa'i lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po dag la yang ci rigs par sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu bcu po de dag gis 'bru bsdus pa rnams la ji bzhin du de las gzhan pa'i 'jig rten pa'i lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po dag la yang ci rigs par sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: As such, one should understand that these ten causes are to be applied in the appropriate manner to all other mundane neutral things, just as they are to the collection of grains.

original: de la rgyu bcu po de dag gis nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi dngos po thams cad ji ltar 'byung zhing rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed ce na /
analyzed: de la rgyu bcu po de dag gis nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi dngos po thams cad ji ltar 'byung zhing rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed ce na /
translated: How do these ten causes give rise to and impute the aspects of affliction, karma, and birth that are characterized by the thoroughly afflicted?

original: 'di ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba thams cad kyi ming dang 'du shes dang tshig tu brjod pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba thams cad kyi ming dang 'du shes dang tshig tu brjod pa 'di lta ste /
translated: All the names, conceptions, and expressions that are used for all that is dependently arisen are as follows.

original: ma rig pa dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs las rgyas pa rga shi dang mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa zhes bya ba'i bar de ni re zhig kun nas🔽nyon mongs pa'i tha snyad ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs las rgyas pa rga shi dang mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa zhes bya ba'i bar de ni re zhig kun nas nyon mongs pa'i tha snyad ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas /
translated: From ignorance, formations, consciousness, name and form, up to the expansion of aging and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, dejection, and strife, this is the conventional designation of the afflictions.

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin no //🔽bde ba la sogs @138a * //
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin no // bde ba la sogs @138a * //
translated: From ignorance as a condition, formations, up to birth as a condition, aging and death, and so on, are the causes of subsequent conventional designations.

original: pa'i rgyu yul myong ba la ltos nas srid pa'i yan lag 'di dag 'jug pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa de'i ltos pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: pa'i rgyu yul myong ba la ltos nas srid pa'i yan lag 'di dag 'jug pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa de'i ltos pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause of pleasure and so on depends on the experience of objects. The engagement of these limbs of existence is the dependent cause of those afflictions.

original: tshe 'di la skye shi 'byung ba'i ma rig pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi sa bon gang dag yin pa de dag ni skye ba gzhan gyi skye ba dang rga shi'i 'phen pa'i rgyu yin no //🔽ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rang rang gi sa bon ni mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no //🔽skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten pa dang dam pa'i chos ma yin pa thos pa dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / sngon goms pa'i 'phen pa ni ma rig pa la sogs pa dag 'byung ba'i yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin no //
