translated: The co-operating cause of the purification of birth is the six causes, beginning with the causal and ending with the specific, all of which are included in the co-operating cause of the purification of birth.🔽The co-operating cause of the

original: rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa dang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad do //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa dang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad do //
translated: The concordant cause is the practice of the Dharma and all the elements leading to enlightenment.

original: mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyu ni ji skad bstan pa'i chos 'di dag nyid med pa dang bral ba nyid de /
analyzed: mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyu ni ji skad bstan pa'i chos 'di dag nyid med pa dang bral ba nyid de /
translated: The absence of counteragent is the absence of the very things that are taught, and their separation.

original: de ltar rgyu bcu po de dag gis sems can thams cad kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu bcu po de dag gis sems can thams cad kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, all the defilement of all beings should be understood through these ten causes.

original: de la rgyu bcu po de dag gis byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi dngos po thams cad ji ltar 'byung zhing rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed ce na /
analyzed: de la rgyu bcu po de dag gis byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi dngos po thams cad ji ltar 'byung zhing rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed ce na /
translated: How do all the things that are elements of purification, such as the elements leading to enlightenment, arise and become conventionally denominated through these ten causes?

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi chos thams cad 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa la ming dang 'du shes dang tshig tu brjod pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi chos thams cad 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa la ming dang 'du shes dang tshig tu brjod pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The cessation of all things that are elements of purification, which is nirvana, is expressed in name, concept, and word as follows:

original: dran pa nye bar @138b gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ba nas /🔽skye ba 'gags pas rga shi 'gag ces bya ba'i bar de dag dang ; de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni rnam par byang ba'i rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar @138b gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ba nas / skye ba 'gags pas rga shi 'gag ces bya ba'i bar de dag dang ; de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni rnam par byang ba'i rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, the eightfold noble path, and the twelve links of dependent origination, from “through the cessation of ignorance, the karmic processes cease” up to “through the cessation of birth, aging, death, and so on cease,”🔽and all that is similar to this is the cause of conventional expressions in relation to purification.

original: 'du byed kyi nyes dmigs la ltos nas rnam par byang ba tshol ba dang rnam par byang ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang rnam par byang ba yongs su grub pa gang yin pa de ni de'i ltos pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi nyes dmigs la ltos nas rnam par byang ba tshol ba dang rnam par byang ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang rnam par byang ba yongs su grub pa gang yin pa de ni de'i ltos pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause of dependence is the search for purification, the possession of purification, and the accomplishment of purification in relation to the disadvantages of the karmic processes.

original: gang zag rigs la gnas pa'i rigs dang ldan pa phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings thob pa'i sngon du 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni rnam par byang ba 'phen pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gang zag rigs la gnas pa'i rigs dang ldan pa phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings thob pa'i sngon du 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni rnam par byang ba 'phen pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause of projecting purification is that which precedes the attainment of the realm of nirvana with and without remainder by those who are endowed with the potential, who are endowed with the potential of the person who is situated in the lineage.

original: rigs kyis bsdus pa zag pa med pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi sa bon de dag ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos de dag gi mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyis bsdus pa zag pa med pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi sa bon de dag ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos de dag gi mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause of actualizing purification is the lineage that is included in the lineage of the uncontaminated factors that contribute to enlightenment, which is the seed of those factors that contribute to enlightenment.

original: skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la bya ba dang / sngon dbang po yongs su smin par byas pa ni rnam par byang ba'i yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la bya ba dang / sngon dbang po yongs su smin par byas pa ni rnam par byang ba'i yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause of maintaining purification is reliance on holy persons, listening to the true Dharma, proper reflection, and the ripening of the faculties in the past.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rang gi sa bon las mngon par 'grub pa de dag ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi rim gyis 'dren pa'i rgyu yin no //🔽nyan thos kyi rigs gang yin pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs gang yin pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rang gi sa bon las mngon par 'grub pa de dag ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi rim gyis 'dren pa'i rgyu yin no // nyan thos kyi rigs gang yin pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs gang yin pa ni /
translated: The factors of enlightenment, which are produced from their own seeds, are the cause of leading gradually to the realm of nirvana with and without remainder.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba dang / theg pa chen po'i rigs ni theg pa chen pos yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba de ni rnam par byang ba'i so sor nges pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba dang / theg pa chen po'i rigs ni theg pa chen pos yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba de ni rnam par byang ba'i so sor nges pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause of purification is the cause of the definite separation of the three vehicles, i.e., those of the sravaka lineage who attain nirvana by the sravaka vehicle, those of the pratyekabuddha lineage who attain nirvana by the pratyekabuddha vehicle, and those of the Mahayana lineage who attain nirvana by the Mahayana.

original: ltos pa'i rgyu nas bzung ste /
analyzed: ltos pa'i rgyu nas bzung ste /
translated: The cause of dependence is from the beginningless beginning.

original: so sor nges pa'i rgyu la thug pa'i bar gyi rgyu drug po de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni rnam par byang ba'i lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin no //🔽rigs dang mi ldan pa dang sangs rgyas rnams mi 'byung ba dang / mi khom par skye ba dang / skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos ma @139a * //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i rgyu la thug pa'i bar gyi rgyu drug po de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni rnam par byang ba'i lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin no // rigs dang mi ldan pa dang sangs rgyas rnams mi 'byung ba dang / mi khom par skye ba dang / skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos ma @139a * //
translated: The six causes, from the special cause down to the cause consisting of the absence of error, are the co-operating causes of purification.

original: yin pa nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / log par sgrub pa ni rnam par byang ba'i mi mthun pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: yin pa nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / log par sgrub pa ni rnam par byang ba'i mi mthun pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The absence of the spiritual lineage, the non-appearance of the Buddhas, birth in the states of existence which are unfavourable to the appearance of the Buddhas, reliance on a bad friend, listening to the teachings of a bad doctrine, incorrect mental application, and false practice are the counteractive causes of purification.

original: mi mthun pa'i rgyu de nyid med pa dang bral ba nyid gang yin pa de ni mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i rgyu de nyid med pa dang bral ba nyid gang yin pa de ni mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The absence of the counteractive causes is the cause consisting of the absence of counteractive forces.

original: de ltar rgyu bcu po de dag ni lung du ma bstan pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu bcu po de dag ni lung du ma bstan pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rgyu yin te /
translated: Thus, these ten causes are the causes of all the factors of the unobscured non-defined and of the defiled.

original: 'das pa'i dus na byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is that which has occurred in the past and will occur in the future.

original: lung du ma bstan pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rgyu gzhan ni 'di las gong na yang med la 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rgyu gzhan ni 'di las gong na yang med la 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: There is no other cause of the afflicted and the purified that is higher or greater than this.

original: rgyu bcu po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rgyu gnyis kyis bsdus te /🔽bskyed pa'i rgyu dang thabs kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: rgyu bcu po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rgyu gnyis kyis bsdus te / bskyed pa'i rgyu dang thabs kyi rgyu'o //
translated: These ten causes are included in two causes:🔽the productive cause and the instrumental cause.

original: de la 'phen pa'i rgyu dang mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu gnyis ni bskyed pa'i rgyu yin /
analyzed: de la 'phen pa'i rgyu dang mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu gnyis ni bskyed pa'i rgyu yin /
translated: The propelling cause and the establishing cause are the productive cause.

original: rgyu lhag ma brgyad ni thabs kyi rgyu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu lhag ma brgyad ni thabs kyi rgyu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The remaining eight causes should be understood as the instrumental cause.

original: de la rkyen bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rkyen bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four conditions?

original: rgyu'i rkyen dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang ; dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen no //
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang ; dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen no //
translated: The causal condition, the immediately preceding condition, the object as condition, and the dominant condition.

original: rkyen bzhi po de dag ni 'du byed rnams 'byung ba dang rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rkyen du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rkyen bzhi po de dag ni 'du byed rnams 'byung ba dang rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rkyen du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: These four conditions are applied as appropriate to the arising of formations and to the subsequent designation of conventions.

original: de la rgyu'i rkyen gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rgyu'i rkyen gang zhe na /
translated: What is the causal condition?

original: sa bon thams cad pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the consciousness of the store-consciousness which contains all the seeds.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po dag la yang 'phen ba'i rgyu dang mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyur grags pa thams cad ni rgyu'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po dag la yang 'phen ba'i rgyu dang mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyur grags pa thams cad ni rgyu'i rkyen yin no //
translated: All the causes which are known in regard to external things, as the cause of projection and the cause of actualization, are causal conditions.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen gang zhe na /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen gang zhe na /
translated: What is the condition as immediate antecedent?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos gang dag gi mjug thogs su sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos gang dag 'byung ba de dag ni de dag gi de ma thag pa'i rkyen zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos gang dag gi mjug thogs su sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos gang dag 'byung ba de dag ni de dag gi de ma thag pa'i rkyen zhes bya'o //
translated: The condition as immediate antecedent should be understood as the immediately past mind and mental activities of those which arise subsequently.

original: rnam par shes pa drug po 'gags ma thag pa gang yin pa de dag ni rnam par shes pa drug po gang dag de'i mjug thogs su skye ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug po 'gags ma thag pa gang yin pa de dag ni rnam par shes pa drug po gang dag de'i mjug thogs su skye ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin te /
translated: The six kinds of consciousness which have just ceased are the condition as immediate antecedent for the six kinds of consciousness which arise subsequently.

original: de dag ni 'gags ma thag pa'i yid la yid ces bya ba dang / yid kyi skye mched ces bya ba dang / yid kyi khams zhes bya bar yang gdags so //
analyzed: de dag ni 'gags ma thag pa'i yid la yid ces bya ba dang / yid kyi skye mched ces bya ba dang / yid kyi khams zhes bya bar yang gdags so //
translated: The mind that has just ceased is called the immediately preceding condition of the mind that has arisen.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen gang zhe na /
translated: What is the object condition?

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga po dag ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gi dmigs pa'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga po dag ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gi dmigs pa'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The five objects, form, etc., are the object condition of the five consciousnesses.

original: nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched bcu gnyis po thams cad ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched bcu gnyis po thams cad ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen yin no //
translated: All twelve sense bases, internal and external, are the object condition of the mental consciousness.

original: bdag po'i @139b rkyen gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdag po'i @139b rkyen gang zhe na /
translated: What is the dominant condition?

original: mig la sogs pa skye mched lhan cig byung ba rnams ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa skye mched lhan cig byung ba rnams ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The eye sense base, etc., which have arisen together, are the dominant condition of the visual consciousness, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa rnams dmigs pa la gtod par byed pa'i yid la byed pa yang rnam par shes pa rnams kyi bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams dmigs pa la gtod par byed pa'i yid la byed pa yang rnam par shes pa rnams kyi bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
translated: Attention that directs the consciousnesses to their objects is also the dominant condition of the consciousnesses.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos lhan cig byung ba rnams kyang gcig gi bdag po'i rkyen gcig yin pas bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos lhan cig byung ba rnams kyang gcig gi bdag po'i rkyen gcig yin pas bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The mind and mental factors that arise together are the dominant condition of each other.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las sngon byas pa rnams dang phyis 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa rnam par smin par 'gyur ba ni bdag po'i rkyen no //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las sngon byas pa rnams dang phyis 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa rnam par smin par 'gyur ba ni bdag po'i rkyen no //
translated: The former wholesome and unwholesome actions are the dominant condition of the subsequent desirable and undesirable results.

original: zhing dang lud dang tshul sogs pa ni lo tog mngon par 'grub pa'i bdag po'i rkyen no //
analyzed: zhing dang lud dang tshul sogs pa ni lo tog mngon par 'grub pa'i bdag po'i rkyen no //
translated: The field, manure, method, etc. are the dominant condition for the production of crops.

original: bzo shes pa dang bzo'i las dang de dag ni 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang las kyi gnas dang de dag mngon par 'grub pa'i bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: bzo shes pa dang bzo'i las dang de dag ni 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang las kyi gnas dang de dag mngon par 'grub pa'i bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The knowledge of crafts, the craft itself, and the craft-person are the dominant condition for the production of worldly crafts.

original: de la rgyu'i rkyen ni rgyu yang yin rkyen yang yin te /
analyzed: de la rgyu'i rkyen ni rgyu yang yin rkyen yang yin te /
translated: Among these, the causal condition is both a cause and a condition.

original: bskyed pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: It is the generating cause.

original: de la gzhan gyi rkyen gsum po dag ni rkyen kho na yin gyi rgyu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi rkyen gsum po dag ni rkyen kho na yin gyi rgyu ni ma yin te /
translated: Among these, the other three conditions are only conditions, not causes.

original: thabs kyi yin no //
analyzed: thabs kyi yin no //
translated: They are the instrumental cause.

original: de yang bdag po'i rkyen ni gtso cher thabs kyi rgyu thams cad yin no //
analyzed: de yang bdag po'i rkyen ni gtso cher thabs kyi rgyu thams cad yin no //
translated: The dominant condition is the cause of the method, for the most part.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang dmigs pa'i rkyen ni yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyus bsdus pa'i sgo nas thabs kyi rgyu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang dmigs pa'i rkyen ni yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyus bsdus pa'i sgo nas thabs kyi rgyu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The immediately preceding condition and the objective condition are the cause of the method, in terms of the cause of retention.

original: de la 'bras bu lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five results?

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu dang / skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu dang / skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result of evolution, the result of natural out-flow, the result of freedom, the result of human action, and the dominant result.

original: 'du byed 'byung ba dang rjes su tha snyad btags pa'i 'bras bu de dag dang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'du byed 'byung ba dang rjes su tha snyad btags pa'i 'bras bu de dag dang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: The results of the arising of the formative forces and of the designation of the conventional should be connected with these, as is appropriate.

original: de la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the result of evolution?

original: mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa ngan song rnams su rnam par smin par 'gyur ba dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa bde 'gro rnams su rnam par smin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa ngan song rnams su rnam par smin par 'gyur ba dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa bde 'gro rnams su rnam par smin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The ripened effect of non-virtuous actions is to be reborn in the lower realms. The ripened effect of virtuous contaminated actions is to be reborn in the higher realms.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the effect similar to the cause?

original: mi dge ba la goms pas mi dge ba la dga' zhing mi dge ba mang bar gnas pa dang dge ba la goms pas dge ba la dga' zhing dge ba mang bar gnas pa dang / sngon gyi las dang mthun par phyis 'bras bu rjes su mthun pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba la goms pas mi dge ba la dga' zhing mi dge ba mang bar gnas pa dang dge ba la goms pas dge ba la dga' zhing dge ba mang bar gnas pa dang / sngon gyi las dang mthun par phyis 'bras bu rjes su mthun pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: By being accustomed to non-virtue, one delights in non-virtue and abides in non-virtue. By being accustomed to virtue, one delights in virtue and abides in virtue. The effect that is similar to the cause is the later effect that is in accordance with the previous action.

original: @140a * // bral ba'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: @140a * // bral ba'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the effect of separation?

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pas nyon mongs pa 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni bral ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pas nyon mongs pa 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni bral ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The effect of separation is the cessation of the afflictions by means of the eightfold noble path.

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /🔽la la tshe 'di nyid la bzo dang las kyi gnas gang yang rung ba la brten nas skyes bu byed pas yang na ni zhing rmod dam /🔽yang na tshong byed dam /🔽yang na rgyal po'i zha 'bring byed dam /
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na / la la tshe 'di nyid la bzo dang las kyi gnas gang yang rung ba la brten nas skyes bu byed pas yang na ni zhing rmod dam / yang na tshong byed dam / yang na rgyal po'i zha 'bring byed dam /
translated: What is the effect of human action?

original: yi ge dang rtsis dang shod 'god pa la bgrang ba dang lag rtsis kyis lo tog la sogs pa dang rnyed pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mngon par sgrub pa gang yin pa de ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: yi ge dang rtsis dang shod 'god pa la bgrang ba dang lag rtsis kyis lo tog la sogs pa dang rnyed pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mngon par sgrub pa gang yin pa de ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: In this very life, by means of human action, based on any kind of craft or occupation, one obtains the fruit of human action, namely, the result of agriculture, commerce, or service to the king, or the result of calculation, writing, or the counting of syllables.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the effect of dominance?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi dbang po'i bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi dbang po'i bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The visual consciousness is the effect of dominance of the eye faculty.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar yang yid kyi dbang po'i bar gyi bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar yang yid kyi dbang po'i bar gyi bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The mental consciousness is the effect of dominance of the mental faculty.

original: de bzhin du srog dang ma bral ba ni srog gi dbang po'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du srog dang ma bral ba ni srog gi dbang po'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Similarly, the life faculty is the effect of dominance of the life faculty.

original: de bzhin du dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis po thams cad kyi so so'i dbang gis 'bras bu gang grub pa de ni bdag po'i 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis po thams cad kyi so so'i dbang gis 'bras bu gang grub pa de ni bdag po'i 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: So too, the result of the dominant condition should be understood as the result established by the power of each of the twenty two faculties.

original: de ltar 'du byed 'byung ba dang rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i 'bras bu lnga po de dag 'byung ba dang rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i tshe na rgyu bcu po dang rkyen bzhi po de dag la ltos par bya ba yin pas de ni ltos pa'i rigs🔽pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'du byed 'byung ba dang rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i 'bras bu lnga po de dag 'byung ba dang rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i tshe na rgyu bcu po dang rkyen bzhi po de dag la ltos par bya ba yin pas de ni ltos pa'i rigs pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since these five results of the arising of formation and the conventional designation of arising arise in dependence on the ten causes and four conditions, this is the principle of dependence.

original: bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /🔽chos rnams thob pa'am /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na / chos rnams thob pa'am /
translated: What is the principle of the performance of function?🔽The causes and conditions that are the performance of function of the attainment of phenomena

original: skyes pa rnams las byed par 'gyur ba'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / rkyen gang yin pa de dag ni bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: skyes pa rnams las byed par 'gyur ba'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / rkyen gang yin pa de dag ni bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: and the performance of function of those that have arisen are the principle of the performance of function.

original: de la thob pa'am 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni byed pa'i bye brag nyid yin te /
analyzed: de la thob pa'am 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni byed pa'i bye brag nyid yin te /
translated: Attainment or establishment is a specific type of function.

original: gtso bo yin pa'i phyir so sor smos so //
analyzed: gtso bo yin pa'i phyir so sor smos so //
translated: They are mentioned separately because they are the most important.

original: de la thob pa ni rnyed pa dang ldan pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de la thob pa ni rnyed pa dang ldan pa la bya ste /
translated: Obtainment is the acquisition and possession of something.

original: de yang sa bon tsam du rgyu thob pa dang / 'bras bu ngo bo thob pa dang gnyis so //
analyzed: de yang sa bon tsam du rgyu thob pa dang / 'bras bu ngo bo thob pa dang gnyis so //
translated: It is twofold: the obtainment of the cause, which is merely a seed, and the obtainment of the result, which is the nature itself.

original: de la sa bon tsam du rgyu thob pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sa bon tsam du rgyu thob pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the obtainment of the cause, which is merely a seed?

original: 'phags pa'i sa dang 'bras bu thob pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / lha dang mi'i bde ba 'thob par 'gyur ba'i bsod nams byas pa dang / ngan 'gro'i sdug bsnal myong bar 'gyur ba'i sdig pa byas pa dang lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu mthun pa dang de dag gi sa bon bag chags dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i sa dang 'bras bu thob pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / lha dang mi'i bde ba 'thob par 'gyur ba'i bsod nams byas pa dang / ngan 'gro'i sdug bsnal myong bar 'gyur ba'i sdig pa byas pa dang lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu mthun pa dang de dag gi sa bon bag chags dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is the possession of the seeds of the roots of virtue that obtain the ārya levels and results, the merit that obtains the happiness of gods and humans, the sin that obtains the experience of the suffering of lower rebirths, and the seeds of those neutral causes and their habitual tendencies.

original: 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid thob pa gang @140b zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid thob pa gang @140b zhe na /
translated: What is the obtainment of the result, which is the nature itself?

original: de dag gi 'bras bu mngon du thob pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu mngon du thob pa yin te /
translated: It is the actual obtainment of those results.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang sa dang 'bras bu mngon sum du thob pa'am /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang sa dang 'bras bu mngon sum du thob pa'am /
translated: It is the actual obtainment of nirvāṇa, the levels, and the results.

original: bsod nams kyi 'bras bu thob pa'am /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi 'bras bu thob pa'am /
translated: It is the obtainment of the results of merit.

original: sdig pa'i 'bras bu myong ba'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i 'bras bu myong ba'o //
translated: It is the experience of the result of evil.

original: 'grub pa ni gang gis dngos por red pa las kyang don gyi mtha' yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin te ;
analyzed: 'grub pa ni gang gis dngos por red pa las kyang don gyi mtha' yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin te ;
translated: Accomplishment is that by which the end of an object is completed, even from a thing that is not accomplished.

original: dper na myu gu las sdong bu'am 'bras bu smin pa'i bar du de la gnod pa bsrung zhing phan pa bsdu ba'i nan tan gyis rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dper na myu gu las sdong bu'am 'bras bu smin pa'i bar du de la gnod pa bsrung zhing phan pa bsdu ba'i nan tan gyis rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: For example, by the earnest practice of protecting from harm and gathering what is beneficial, one accomplishes the sprout, the trunk, and so on up to the ripening of the fruit.

original: myu gu la ji lta ba bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i chos la mgo 'byung ba rnams mthar phyin par bsgrubs pa dang / 'phags pa'i sa thob pas gong nas gong ma'i sa yongs su 'grub par byed pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: myu gu la ji lta ba bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i chos la mgo 'byung ba rnams mthar phyin par bsgrubs pa dang / 'phags pa'i sa thob pas gong nas gong ma'i sa yongs su 'grub par byed pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as with the sprout, one accomplishes the completion of the worldly dharmas that arise from the head, and one accomplishes the higher and higher stages by attaining the stages of the noble ones.🔽It is the performance of the function of those that have arisen.

original: skyes pa rnams las byed par 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba ni skyes pa rnams kyis thob pa'i bya ba'am 'grub pa'i bya ba gang yin pa byed pa ste /
analyzed: skyes pa rnams las byed par 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba ni skyes pa rnams kyis thob pa'i bya ba'am 'grub pa'i bya ba gang yin pa byed pa ste /
translated: It is the performance of the function of those that have arisen, the function of those that have been attained, or the function of those that have been accomplished.

original: dngos por yod pa de dag ji srid du rgyun yod pa de srid du bya ba byed pa yod de /
analyzed: dngos por yod pa de dag ji srid du rgyun yod pa de srid du bya ba byed pa yod de /
translated: As long as the continuum of those existing things exists, the function exists.

original: dper na shing lcug mal sogs par skyes phyin chad lcug ma ni bcing ba'i las byed /
analyzed: dper na shing lcug mal sogs par skyes phyin chad lcug ma ni bcing ba'i las byed /
translated: For example, once a plant such as a vine is born, the vine functions to bind,

original: sdong po ni ka ba'i las byed me tog ni rgyan gyi las byed /🔽lo tog ni dkri ba'i las byed /
analyzed: sdong po ni ka ba'i las byed me tog ni rgyan gyi las byed / lo tog ni dkri ba'i las byed /
translated: the trunk functions as a pillar, the flowers function as ornaments,🔽the fruit functions as a garland,

original: 'bras bu ni 'greng ba'i las byed /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni 'greng ba'i las byed /
translated: and the leaves function as a parasol.🔽Similarly, the noble Dharma benefits sentient beings by means of the specific functions of each stage.

original: 'phags pa'i chos las rang rang gi sa'i byed brag gis sems can la phan 'dogs pa yang thabs kyi sgo tha dad pa nas so so'i lam la 'jog pa la sogs pa chos gang gi rgyur nges pa de'i 'bras bu so sor skyed pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos las rang rang gi sa'i byed brag gis sems can la phan 'dogs pa yang thabs kyi sgo tha dad pa nas so so'i lam la 'jog pa la sogs pa chos gang gi rgyur nges pa de'i 'bras bu so sor skyed pa dang /
translated: Whatever Dharma is ascertained as the cause of a particular path, such as establishing one on one's path by means of a different door of method, it will generate its individual result.

original: dbang po drug shes pa dang bcas pa rang rang gi yul du nges pa la 'jug pa dang / bya la sogs pa ni 'phur /
analyzed: dbang po drug shes pa dang bcas pa rang rang gi yul du nges pa la 'jug pa dang / bya la sogs pa ni 'phur /
translated: The six sense faculties together with consciousness engage their individual objects with certainty. Birds fly,

original: nya la sogs pa ni rgyal /
analyzed: nya la sogs pa ni rgyal /
translated: fish swim,

original: phyug la sogs pa ni rgyug pa dang / 'di lta bu'i tshul gyis dngos po so sor mthu ci yod pas gang la gang rigs pa'i bya ba byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phyug la sogs pa ni rgyug pa dang / 'di lta bu'i tshul gyis dngos po so sor mthu ci yod pas gang la gang rigs pa'i bya ba byed pa yin no //
translated: and cattle run. In this way, each thing functions according to its individual power, performing whatever function is appropriate.

original: rgyu gang dag yin pa dang rkyen gang dag yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni gang byed pa'i yan lag tu gtogs pa gzhir gyur pa dag yin te /
analyzed: rgyu gang dag yin pa dang rkyen gang dag yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni gang byed pa'i yan lag tu gtogs pa gzhir gyur pa dag yin te /
translated: They are the bases that are included in the branches of action.

original: rgyu bcu dang rkyen bzhi gong du smos pa rnams yin no ;
analyzed: rgyu bcu dang rkyen bzhi gong du smos pa rnams yin no ;
translated: The ten causes and four conditions mentioned above are included in the branches of action.🔽The function of phenomena is explained in this way.

original: / de ltar chos rnams kyi bya ba byed pa'i las bstan pa gang yin pa de ni bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: / de ltar chos rnams kyi bya ba byed pa'i las bstan pa gang yin pa de ni bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The reason for this is that the principle of the performance of function is applied to this explanation.

original: 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /🔽so so'i shes pa dang bshad pa dang / smras pa'i don sgrub pa dang / legs par khong du chud par @141a * //
analyzed: 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na / so so'i shes pa dang bshad pa dang / smras pa'i don sgrub pa dang / legs par khong du chud par @141a * //
translated: What is the principle of proof by logical reasoning?🔽The causes and conditions that are the means of establishing, explaining, and proving the meaning of what is said, and the means of causing a thorough understanding of it,

original: bya ba'i rgyu gang dag yin pa dang / rkyen gang dag yin pa de ni 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bya ba'i rgyu gang dag yin pa dang / rkyen gang dag yin pa de ni 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: are the principle of proof by logical reasoning.

original: 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa zhes bya ba ni tshad ma gsum mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang yid ches pa'i lung gi 'thad pas so so'i don bsgrub pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa zhes bya ba ni tshad ma gsum mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang yid ches pa'i lung gi 'thad pas so so'i don bsgrub pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The so-called “reasoning of tenable proof” is the demonstration of the tenability of each of the three valid cognitions—direct perception, inference, and authoritative testimony—in establishing their respective objects.

original: de la tshad ma gsum po mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang yid ches pa'i lung gi don ni /
analyzed: de la tshad ma gsum po mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang yid ches pa'i lung gi don ni /
translated: The meaning of the three valid cognitions—direct perception, inference, and authoritative testimony—

original: so so'i shes pa'i don dang / bshad pa dang / smras pa'i don ces bya ba dang / go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: so so'i shes pa'i don dang / bshad pa dang / smras pa'i don ces bya ba dang / go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: is respectively called “the object of individual knowledge,” “the object of explanation,” and “the object of statement,” and they are to be connected in order.

original: de dag kyang mngon sum gyi don dang lkog tu gyur pa'i don dang / shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don dang / go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang mngon sum gyi don dang lkog tu gyur pa'i don dang / shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don dang / go rims bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, they are respectively the object of direct perception, the object of indirect perception, and the object of extremely indirect perception.

original: de la so so'i don zhes bya ba la so so'i shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la so so'i don zhes bya ba la so so'i shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: With regard to the so-called “object of individual knowledge,” what is individual knowledge?

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma bzhi po dbang po'i shes pa dang / yid kyi shes pa dang / rang rig pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa so so'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma bzhi po dbang po'i shes pa dang / yid kyi shes pa dang / rang rig pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa so so'i shes pa'o //
translated: The four types of direct perception—sense consciousness, mental consciousness, reflexive awareness, and the consciousness of a yogin—are individual knowledge.

original: don zhes bya ba so so'i shes pa'i yul te /
analyzed: don zhes bya ba so so'i shes pa'i yul te /
translated: The object is the object of individual cognition.

original: mngon sum gyi chad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi chad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The object of direct perception is the object of direct perception, included by its own characteristic.

original: bshad pa'i don zhes bya ba la bshad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bshad pa'i don zhes bya ba la bshad pa gang zhe na /
translated: The object of explanation is as follows: What is explanation?

original: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma gnyis po rang gi don du rjes su dpag pa dang gzhan gyi don du rjes su dpag pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa'am smra ba po gzhan dag gis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma gnyis po rang gi don du rjes su dpag pa dang gzhan gyi don du rjes su dpag pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa'am smra ba po gzhan dag gis bshad pa'o //
translated: The two inferential valid cognitions, inference for oneself and inference for others, explained by the Bhagavan Buddha or explained by other teachers.

original: don zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i yul te /
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i yul te /
translated: The object is the object of explanation.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul lkog tu gyur ba'i don spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul lkog tu gyur ba'i don spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The object of inferential valid cognition is the object of the general characteristic of the hidden.

original: smras pa'i don ces bya ba la smras pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa'i don ces bya ba la smras pa gang zhe na /
translated: The object of statement is as follows: What is statement?

original: yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma gnyis po de ston pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa dang / des bstan pa'i lung la tshig 'gal ba med pa gtan la dbab par bstan pa thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma gnyis po de ston pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa dang / des bstan pa'i lung la tshig 'gal ba med pa gtan la dbab par bstan pa thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa'o //
translated: The two valid cognitions of scripture that inspire confidence are the omniscience of the teacher and the absence of contradiction in the scriptures that he taught.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gsungs pa'i yul te yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i yul shin tu lkog tu gyur ba'i don rab dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gsungs pa'i yul te yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i yul shin tu lkog tu gyur ba'i don rab dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The object is the domain of what is taught, which is the extremely obscure object that is the domain of the valid cognition of scripture that inspires confidence, and it is subsumed by the characteristics of the individual and general natures.

original: sgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par bya ba zhes bya ba ni tshad ma gsum po de dag kho na bzhin yin gyi gzhan du ma yin par tshad ma gsum gyi 'thad pas rab tu bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par bya ba zhes bya ba ni tshad ma gsum po de dag kho na bzhin yin gyi gzhan du ma yin par tshad ma gsum gyi 'thad pas rab tu bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The establishment and the proper understanding are just those three valid cognitions and not others, and they are well established by the reasoning of the three valid cognitions.

original: legs par khong du chud par bya zhes bya ba ni don de dag gzhan gyis ji ltar ma log pa yang dag pa'i don nyid du go @141b bar bya'o //
analyzed: legs par khong du chud par bya zhes bya ba ni don de dag gzhan gyis ji ltar ma log pa yang dag pa'i don nyid du go @141b bar bya'o //
translated: The proper understanding is that others should understand those objects in a way that is unmistaken and in accordance with reality.

original: rgyu gang dag yin pa dang rkyen gang dag yin pa zhes bya ba la tshad ma gsum po de dag gi don gsum po de dag sgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i rgyu dang rkyen gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gang dag yin pa dang rkyen gang dag yin pa zhes bya ba la tshad ma gsum po de dag gi don gsum po de dag sgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i rgyu dang rkyen gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: What are the causes and conditions for establishing and comprehending the three objects of the three means of valid knowledge?

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i don sgrub pa dang / legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i rgyu dang rkyen ni mngon sum la log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi bsal bas ma nor bar shes pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i don sgrub pa dang / legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i rgyu dang rkyen ni mngon sum la log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi bsal bas ma nor bar shes pa ste /
translated: The causes and conditions for establishing and comprehending the object of direct perception are the non-erroneous cognition that eliminates the four misconceptions about direct perception.

original: log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four misconceptions?

original: grangs la log par rtog pa dang / rang gi ngo bo la log par rtog pa dang / spyod yul la log par rtog pa dang / 'bras bu la log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: grangs la log par rtog pa dang / rang gi ngo bo la log par rtog pa dang / spyod yul la log par rtog pa dang / 'bras bu la log par rtog pa'o //
translated: They are the misconception about number, the misconception about intrinsic nature, the misconception about the domain, and the misconception about the result.

original: de la grangs la log par rtog pa ni kha cig ni tshad ma gcig / kha cig ni gsum /
analyzed: de la grangs la log par rtog pa ni kha cig ni tshad ma gcig / kha cig ni gsum /
translated: The misconception about number is when some think that there is one means of valid knowledge, some think there are three,

original: kha cig ni bzhi /
analyzed: kha cig ni bzhi /
translated: some think there are four,

original: kha cig ni drug tu rtog pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni drug tu rtog pa'o //
translated: and some think there are six.

original: de bsal ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de bsal ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the refutation of that?

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Right knowledge is of two kinds:🔽perception and inference.

original: mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa'o zhes bya bas mngon sum rnam pa bzhi po dbang po'i shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / rang rig pa dang / rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa'o zhes bya bas mngon sum rnam pa bzhi po dbang po'i shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / rang rig pa dang / rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, the four kinds of perception are indicated: the perception of the senses, the mental perception, the self-cognition, and the perception of the yogin.

original: rang gi ngo bo la log par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la log par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There is a false conception about the nature of perception.

original: kha cig ni mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / kha cig ni rnam par rtog pa med par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / kha cig ni rnam par rtog pa med par rtog pa'o //
translated: Some think that perception is conceptual, and some think that it is non-conceptual.

original: de bsal ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de bsal ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the refutation of that?🔽Perception is free from conceptual construction and is non-erroneous.

original: mngon sum ni rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul ba'o zhes bya bas mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid rtog pa med pa dang ma 'khrul pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum ni rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul ba'o zhes bya bas mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid rtog pa med pa dang ma 'khrul pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, the definition of perception is indicated as being free from conceptual construction and non-erroneous.

original: spyod yul la log par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: spyod yul la log par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There is a false conception about the domain of perception.

original: kha cig ni mngon sum spyod yul rang gi mtshan nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni mngon sum spyod yul rang gi mtshan nyid kho na'o //
translated: Some think that the domain of perception is only the particular.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i spyod yul ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kho na'o zhes bya ba brjod la gzhan dag ni gzhan du brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i spyod yul ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kho na'o zhes bya ba brjod la gzhan dag ni gzhan du brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: The domain of inference is only the general characteristic.

original: de bsal ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de bsal ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the refutation of that?🔽The domain of that perception is the particular characteristic.

original: mngon sum de'i yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin te zhes bya bas mngon sum gyi tshad ma bstan pa gang yin pa de'i yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin par blta bar bya'i spyi'i mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum de'i yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin te zhes bya bas mngon sum gyi tshad ma bstan pa gang yin pa de'i yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin par blta bar bya'i spyi'i mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: The domain of that perception which is the valid cognition of perception is only the particular characteristic, not the general characteristic.

original: spyi ni dngos po med pa yin pa dang mngon sum du ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: spyi ni dngos po med pa yin pa dang mngon sum du ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The general characteristic is a non-entity, and perception is the apprehension of the nature of an entity.

original: 'bras bu la log par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu la log par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There is a misconception about the result,

original: kha cig ni tshad ma las 'bras bu tha dad par khas len la /
analyzed: kha cig ni tshad ma las 'bras bu tha dad par khas len la /
translated: because some accept the result as different from the valid cognition,

original: kha cig ni tha dad pa ma yin par khas len pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni tha dad pa ma yin par khas len pa lta bu'o //
translated: and some accept it as non-different.

original: de bsal ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de bsal ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the refutation of that?

original: mngon sum gyi @142a * //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi @142a * //
translated: The result of perception is the ascertainment of the object.

original: shes pa de nyid tshad ma'i 'bras bu ste zhes bya bas mngon sum gyi shes pa de nyid tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin gyi /
analyzed: shes pa de nyid tshad ma'i 'bras bu ste zhes bya bas mngon sum gyi shes pa de nyid tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin gyi /
translated: This teaches that the cognition of direct perception itself is the result of valid cognition,

original: mngon sum las gud na tshad ma'i 'bras bu med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum las gud na tshad ma'i 'bras bu med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and that there is no result of valid cognition apart from direct perception.

original: de ltar na de lta bu'i log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi bsal bas //
analyzed: de ltar na de lta bu'i log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi bsal bas //
translated: Thus, having eliminated those four kinds of misconceptions in this way,

original: rnam pa thams cad du mngon sum gyi tshad ma ma nor ba yang dag pa'i shes pa rang gi ngo bo bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mngon sum gyi tshad ma ma nor ba yang dag pa'i shes pa rang gi ngo bo bstan pa yin te /
translated: the nature of non-erroneous, correct direct perception, which is a valid cognition in every respect, is taught.

original: de ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i 'thad pas bsgrub pa'i rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i 'thad pas bsgrub pa'i rigs pa yin no //
translated: This is the reasoning that establishes direct perception as a valid cognition.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i don bsgrub pa dang legs par khon du chud par bya ba'i rgyu dang rkyen yang rjes su dpag pa la log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi bsal ba ma nor ba shes pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i don bsgrub pa dang legs par khon du chud par bya ba'i rgyu dang rkyen yang rjes su dpag pa la log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi bsal ba ma nor ba shes pa ste /
translated: The cause and condition for properly understanding and establishing the meaning of inferential valid cognition is the non-erroneous knowledge that eliminates the four kinds of misconceptions regarding inference.

original: grangs la log par rtog pa ni snga ma kho na bzhin no //
analyzed: grangs la log par rtog pa ni snga ma kho na bzhin no //
translated: The misconception regarding number is the same as before.

original: de la bsal ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bsal ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is elimination?

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Right knowledge is of two kinds:🔽direct perception and inference.

original: mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa'o zhes bya bas rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gnyis po rang gi don du rjes su dpag pa dang / gzhan gyi don du rjes su dpag pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa'o zhes bya bas rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gnyis po rang gi don du rjes su dpag pa dang / gzhan gyi don du rjes su dpag pa bstan pa ste /
translated: Inference is of two kinds: inference for oneself and inference for another.

original: gang gis rtogs par 'gyur ba'i de ni rang gi don yin la /
analyzed: gang gis rtogs par 'gyur ba'i de ni rang gi don yin la /
translated: The former is the means of understanding,

original: gang gis gzhan la go bar byed pa de ni gzhan gyi don yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis gzhan la go bar byed pa de ni gzhan gyi don yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: while the latter is the means of making others understand.

original: rang gi ngo bo la log par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la log par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The misconception of the nature of inference is as follows:

original: kha cig rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid tshul gsum gyi rtags las gzhan du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid tshul gsum gyi rtags las gzhan du rtog pa'o //
translated: Some think that the definition of inference as a means of valid knowledge is a reason having the three marks, but different from that.

original: de bsal ba gang zhe na //
analyzed: de bsal ba gang zhe na //
translated: What is the removal of that?

original: rjes su dpag pa tshul gsum pa nyid kyis rtag pa rjes su dpag par bya bar la yod pa nyid dang / mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul dang / rtags gsum po mi dmigs pa dang ;
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa tshul gsum pa nyid kyis rtag pa rjes su dpag par bya bar la yod pa nyid dang / mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul dang / rtags gsum po mi dmigs pa dang ;
translated: The three modes of inferential valid knowledge are: the presence of the reason in the subject, the forward pervasion, and the counter pervasion.🔽🔽The three reasons are nonobservation of a related object, nonobservation of a pervader, and observation of a contradictory object.🔽

original: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa dang / 'gal ba dang ma nges pa'i skyon gsum spangs pas rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa dang / 'gal ba dang ma nges pa'i skyon gsum spangs pas rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: Inference is defined as the valid cognition that is ascertained by the three modes, and it is taught that the three reasons—nonobservation, nature, and effect—are free from the three faults of being unestablished, contradictory, and uncertain.

original: spyod yul la log par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: spyod yul la log par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Misconception about the object of engagement is as follows.

original: kha cig rjes su dpag pa'i spyod yul spyi'i mtshan nyid las gzhan las gzhan du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig rjes su dpag pa'i spyod yul spyi'i mtshan nyid las gzhan las gzhan du rtog pa'o //
translated: Some conceive the object of engagement of inference to be other than the general characteristic.

original: de bsal ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de bsal ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the elimination of that?

original: gzhan ni spyi'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: gzhan ni spyi'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: The other is the general characteristic.

original: de'i rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin na zhes bya bas rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin na zhes bya bas rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kho na yin te /
translated: If it is the object of that inference, then the object of engagement of inference is only the general characteristic.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: because of the pervasion by the relation of invariable concomitance.

original: 'bras bu la log @142b par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu la log @142b par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The misconception of the result is as follows:

original: kha cig rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma las 'bras bu tha dad par khas len pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma las 'bras bu tha dad par khas len pa'o //
translated: Some accept the result as different from inference.

original: de la bsal ba gang zhe na //
analyzed: de la bsal ba gang zhe na //
translated: What is the refutation of that?

original: 'dir yang tshad ma'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa ni mngon sum dang 'dra'o zhes bya bas ji ltar mngon sum la shes pa de nyid tshad ma'i 'bras bur bshad pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa nyid tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te
analyzed: 'dir yang tshad ma'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa ni mngon sum dang 'dra'o zhes bya bas ji ltar mngon sum la shes pa de nyid tshad ma'i 'bras bur bshad pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa nyid tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te
translated: Here, the presentation of the result of valid knowledge is similar to that of perception. Just as the cognition itself is explained as the result of perception, so too here, the cognition of inference is the result of valid knowledge,

original: / don gtan la 'bebs pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / don gtan la 'bebs pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the nature of determining the object. This is taught.

original: de ltar na de lta bu'i log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi bsal bas /
analyzed: de ltar na de lta bu'i log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi bsal bas /
translated: Thus, by refuting those four types of misconceptions,

original: rnam pa thams cad du rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma ma nor bar yang dag pa'i shes pa'i shes bya'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma ma nor bar yang dag pa'i shes pa'i shes bya'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa yin te /
translated: In every way, the nature of the object of unmistaken, correct knowledge is taught by the valid knowledge of inference.

original: de'i rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yin no //
translated: The reasoning that proves that by the valid knowledge of inference is correct.

original: yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i don sgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i rgyu dang rkyen ni de ston par thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa de dang de la bstan pa'i lung la tshig 'gal ba med pas ma nor bar shes pa ste
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i don sgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i rgyu dang rkyen ni de ston par thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa de dang de la bstan pa'i lung la tshig 'gal ba med pas ma nor bar shes pa ste
translated: The reason and condition for proving the meaning of the valid knowledge of trustworthy scripture and for understanding it well is that the one who teaches it is omniscient. Since there is no contradiction in the words of the scripture that he teaches, it is unmistaken knowledge.

original: / de la de ston pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa ni 'og nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid lnga 'byung bas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: / de la de ston pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa ni 'og nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid lnga 'byung bas rig par bya'o //
translated: That the one who teaches it is omniscient should be understood from the five characteristics of omniscience that will be explained below.

original: de bstan pa'i lung la tshig 'gal ba med pa ni ji ltar mu stegs can dag gi gzhung las chos ma yin pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa rtsa ba las byung ba gangga'i nang du khrus byas pa 'byung ngo zhes zer ba dang / chos ni rnam par mi mtshe ba yin la /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i lung la tshig 'gal ba med pa ni ji ltar mu stegs can dag gi gzhung las chos ma yin pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa rtsa ba las byung ba gangga'i nang du khrus byas pa 'byung ngo zhes zer ba dang / chos ni rnam par mi mtshe ba yin la /
translated: The scriptures that teach that are free of contradictory words, unlike the texts of tīrthikas, who say, “Non-Dharma arises from the roots of attachment and so on, and one is purified by bathing in the Ganges,” and “Dharma is that which is not mixed.”

original: srog chags gsod pa'i mchod sbyin byas nas grol lo zhes zer ba la sogs pa lta bu ni tshig 'gal ba yin gyi /
analyzed: srog chags gsod pa'i mchod sbyin byas nas grol lo zhes zer ba la sogs pa lta bu ni tshig 'gal ba yin gyi /
translated: They say, for example, “One is liberated by performing a sacrifice in which one kills living beings.”

original: thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa'i lung las skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung la /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa'i lung las skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung la /
translated: The scriptures spoken by the Omniscient One state that the afflictions of birth arise from the cause of the afflictions and the karma of affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs na /
translated: If one abandons the afflictions and the karma of affliction,

original: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs mongs pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa dang / bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad gtan spangs pa'i gnas gyur pa ni 'phags pa'i lam bsgoms pas thob la /
analyzed: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs mongs pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa dang / bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad gtan spangs pa'i gnas gyur pa ni 'phags pa'i lam bsgoms pas thob la /
translated: and “The thoroughly afflicted arising of birth will arise.”🔽And: “The transformation that is the complete abandonment of all afflictions together with their traces is attained through cultivating the ārya path.”

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyis ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa la sogs @143a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyis ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa la sogs @143a * //
translated: And: “All afflictions are abandoned through the ārya path.”

original: pa lta bu ni lung la tshig 'gal ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: pa lta bu ni lung la tshig 'gal ba med pa yin no //
translated: Thus there is no contradiction in the words of the scriptures.

original: de ltar na de ston pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa dang / des bstan pa'i lung la tshig 'gal ba med pas rnam pa thams cad du yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma ma nor ba yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de ston pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa dang / des bstan pa'i lung la tshig 'gal ba med pas rnam pa thams cad du yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma ma nor ba yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, because the teacher is omniscient and because there is no contradiction in the words of the scriptures that he taught, the unmistaken, perfect knowledge that is the nature of the valid knowledge of scripture is taught in all ways.

original: de ni yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i 'thad pa bsgrubs pas bsgrub pa'i rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i 'thad pa bsgrubs pas bsgrub pa'i rigs pa yin no //
translated: This is the reasoning of proof that establishes the validity of the trustworthy scripture.

original: de la mngon sum dang rjes dpag dang yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma gsum po de dag gi don gsum po de dag sgrub pa dang / legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i rgyu dang rkyen ji ltar bstan pa de dag nyid kyang sngar rgyu bcu dang rkyen bzhi bstan pa dag gis ci rigs par bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: de la mngon sum dang rjes dpag dang yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma gsum po de dag gi don gsum po de dag sgrub pa dang / legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i rgyu dang rkyen ji ltar bstan pa de dag nyid kyang sngar rgyu bcu dang rkyen bzhi bstan pa dag gis ci rigs par bsdus pa yin te /
translated: The three valid cognitions of direct perception, inference, and trustworthy scripture are the three objects to be established and well understood. The causes and conditions that are taught for that are also included in the previously taught ten causes and four conditions, as appropriate.

original: de ni 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: That is called the reasoning of proof by tenability.

original: da 'di man chad ni 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa ji skad bstan pa de'i yan lag bstan to //
analyzed: da 'di man chad ni 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa ji skad bstan pa de'i yan lag bstan to //
translated: From here on, the branches of the reasoning of proof by tenability are taught.

original: de'i phyir yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, in brief, there are two types... and so on is stated.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: And that refers to the reasoning of proof by tenability.

original: yongs su dag pa dang yongs su ma dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshad ma'i yongs su dag pa dang ma dag pa'i bye brag bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa dang yongs su ma dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshad ma'i yongs su dag pa dang ma dag pa'i bye brag bstan pa yin te /
translated: The distinction between valid knowledge that is pure and that which is impure is taught.

original: bshad pa ni zhib tu 'og nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bshad pa ni zhib tu 'og nas 'byung ngo //
translated: The explanation will be given in detail later.

original: 'thad pas sgrub pa la de'i rgyu dang rkyen du gtogs pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa'i tshad mas 'jal ba ni don la mi 'khrul bar rtogs te /
analyzed: 'thad pas sgrub pa la de'i rgyu dang rkyen du gtogs pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa'i tshad mas 'jal ba ni don la mi 'khrul bar rtogs te /
translated: In terms of establishing something through reasoning, the valid knowledge that possesses the pure characteristics that are its causes and conditions comprehends its object without error.

original: bdag kyang yang dag pa'i lta ba la gnas shing gzhan yang yang dag pa'i lta ba la 'jog pas sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu mi ltung bar shes bzhin tshor ba bzhin du spyod do //
analyzed: bdag kyang yang dag pa'i lta ba la gnas shing gzhan yang yang dag pa'i lta ba la 'jog pas sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu mi ltung bar shes bzhin tshor ba bzhin du spyod do //
translated: Since one abides in the correct view and also establishes others in the correct view, one should understand that one will not fall into the hands of sinful friends and one should practice with introspection.

original: yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i mtshan mas 'jal ba'i don la 'khrul par dmigs te /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i mtshan mas 'jal ba'i don la 'khrul par dmigs te /
translated: The object comprehended by valid knowledge that possesses the characteristics of purity is observed to be nonerroneous.

original: bdag kyang log par lta ba la gnas shing gzhan yang log par lta ba la 'jog ste sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu song nas rmongs bzhin yengs bzhin spyod do //
analyzed: bdag kyang log par lta ba la gnas shing gzhan yang log par lta ba la 'jog ste sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu song nas rmongs bzhin yengs bzhin spyod do //
translated: I also abide in wrong views and establish others in wrong views. Having fallen into the hands of evil companions, I act while confused and distracted.

original: de lta bas na yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid bsten par bya zhing yongs su ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid spang bar bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten mkhyen pas kyang 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa ji skad bstan pa de'i yan lag 'di dag bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de lta bas na yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid bsten par bya zhing yongs su ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid spang bar bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten mkhyen pas kyang 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa ji skad bstan pa de'i yan lag 'di dag bka' stsal to //
translated: Therefore, in order to rely on the characteristics of complete purity and abandon the characteristics of impurity, the Knower of the World also taught these branches of the reasoning of proof by means of what is acceptable, as it was explained.

original: de la yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni lnga'o //
analyzed: de la yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni lnga'o //
translated: Here, the characteristics of complete purity are five,

original: yongs su ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni bdun no zhes bya ba ni grangs kyi @143b sdom pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni bdun no zhes bya ba ni grangs kyi @143b sdom pa bstan pa ste /
translated: and the characteristics of impurity are seven. This is the teaching of the summary of the enumeration.

original: ming bstan pa dang / bshad pa 'og nas 'byung ba go rims bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: ming bstan pa dang / bshad pa 'og nas 'byung ba go rims bzhin du bstan to //
translated: The names are taught and the explanation that will come below is taught in order.

original: de la yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid lnga po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid lnga po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five characteristics of complete purity?

original: de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de la gnas pa'i gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid dang / yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / lung shin tu rnam par dag pa gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni sngar so so'i shes pa dang /
analyzed: de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de la gnas pa'i gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid dang / yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / lung shin tu rnam par dag pa gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni sngar so so'i shes pa dang /
translated: The definition of direct perception is that which is characterized by the observation of that. The definition of the observation of the observation of that is the observation of that which abides there. The definition of the application of an example of one's type is the pure definition. The definition of the teaching of the ascertainment of the extremely pure scriptures is the pure definition.🔽The reasonings that are established by valid cognition are the causes and conditions that establish the meaning of the individual consciousnesses,

original: bshad pa dang / smras pa'i don sgrub pa dang / legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i rgyu gang dag yin pa dang rkyen gang dag yin pa de ni 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yin no zhes gsungs pas mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad

original: ma gsum gyi yul mngon sum shes pa'i so so'i shes pa'i yul lung dang tshad ma gzhan dag las bshad pa gang dang gang yin pa dag kyang bsdu'o //
analyzed: ma gsum gyi yul mngon sum shes pa'i so so'i shes pa'i yul lung dang tshad ma gzhan dag las bshad pa gang dang gang yin pa dag kyang bsdu'o //
translated: The objects of the three non-mistaken consciousnesses are the objects of the individual consciousnesses, and whatever is explained in the scriptures and treatises.

original: de ltar na mngon sum gyi tshad ma rnam pa bzhi po so so'i shes pa'i don de mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid rtog pa med pa dang ma 'khrul ba'i shes pas dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon sum gyi tshad ma rnam pa bzhi po so so'i shes pa'i don de mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid rtog pa med pa dang ma 'khrul ba'i shes pas dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Thus, the definition of direct valid cognition is that which is the object of the individual consciousnesses of the four types of direct valid cognition, and is observed by a non-conceptual and non-mistaken consciousness.

original: de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: This is the definition of direct observation.

original: tshig gi don ni bshad pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni bshad pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of the words should be connected as explained.

original: de'i 'og tu rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i tshul gsum po de dag la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag par bstan pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i tshul gsum po de dag la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag par bstan pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, the method of inferential valid cognition should be explained, which is the pure indication of the three modes that are based on direct observation, and the indication of the application of an example from one's own class.

original: de la rjes su dpag pa'i chos ni gang mngon sum gyi dmigs pa de'i rjes su 'jug pa'i blos de dang 'brel ba'i dngos po mngon sum gyi ma dmigs pa yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis ma bskal ba lkog tu gyur ba'i don la rjes su dpag🔽par bya ba yin pas /🔽'dir yang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa gnas pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid rtog
analyzed: de la rjes su dpag pa'i chos ni gang mngon sum gyi dmigs pa de'i rjes su 'jug pa'i blos de dang 'brel ba'i dngos po mngon sum gyi ma dmigs pa yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis ma bskal ba lkog tu gyur ba'i don la rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pas / 'dir yang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa gnas pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid rtog
translated: The object of inference is that which is related to the object of direct perception by a mind that engages the object of direct perception. The object of inference is a hidden object that is not observed by direct perception, not excluded by place, time, or nature.

original: pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa mngon sum du ma dmigs pa'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bshad pa'i don rjes @144a * //
analyzed: pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa mngon sum du ma dmigs pa'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bshad pa'i don rjes @144a * //
translated: Here, the subject of inference is established by the nonobservation of the object of the awareness of the property of the subject that is the means of affirmation. The object of the means of valid knowledge of direct perception is the object of direct perception that is subsumed by its own character. The definition of the means of valid knowledge of direct perception is the nonconceptual and nonmistaken direct perception that is free from🔽the conception of the object of the means of affirmation.

original: su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul lkog tu gyur pa'i don spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis ma bskal ba de nyid rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul lkog tu gyur pa'i don spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis ma bskal ba de nyid rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: The object of inference is that which is included in the definition of a universal object that is hidden from direct perception, and is not separated from space, time, or nature.

original: de'i rjes su dpag pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i rjes su dpag pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Inference is also of two kinds:

original: rang gi don rjes su dpag pa dang / gzhan gyi don rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don rjes su dpag pa dang / gzhan gyi don rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: inference for oneself and inference for others.

original: de la gang gi bdag nyid kyis rtogs par 'gyur ba de ni rang gi don yin la /
analyzed: de la gang gi bdag nyid kyis rtogs par 'gyur ba de ni rang gi don yin la /
translated: In this regard, that which is understood by oneself is for one’s own sake.

original: gang gis gzhan la go bar byed pa de ni gzhan gyi don yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis gzhan la go bar byed pa de ni gzhan gyi don yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: That which causes others to understand is to be understood as being for the sake of others.

original: de ltar rang dang gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa de'i mtshan nyid ni rjes su dpag par bya ba la tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags las bdag nyid kyis rtogs pa gang gzhan la go bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rang dang gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa de'i mtshan nyid ni rjes su dpag par bya ba la tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags las bdag nyid kyis rtogs pa gang gzhan la go bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the definition of inference for oneself and inference for others is that which, through a reason that has the three modes with regard to the object of inference, causes one to understand by oneself and causes others to understand.

original: tshul gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshul gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three modes?

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid dang / mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid dang / mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'o //
translated: The three modes are: existence in the object of inference, existence in similar instances, and non-existence in dissimilar instances.

original: rtags gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtags gang zhe na /
translated: What is a logical reason?

original: tshul gsum po dag ni rtags gsum kho na dang ldan te /
analyzed: tshul gsum po dag ni rtags gsum kho na dang ldan te /
translated: It is a logical reason that possesses the three modes.

original: mi dmigs pa dang / rang bzhin dang / 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa dang / rang bzhin dang / 'bras bu'o //
translated: The three modes are: non-observation, nature, and effect.

original: de la mi dmigs pa las ni dngos po med par rjes su dpag par bya /
analyzed: de la mi dmigs pa las ni dngos po med par rjes su dpag par bya /
translated: From non-observation, one infers non-existence.

original: rang bzhin las ni mi rtag pa dang skad cig ma nyid la sogs par rjes su dpag par bya /
