analyzed: rang bzhin las ni mi rtag pa dang skad cig ma nyid la sogs par rjes su dpag par bya /
translated: From nature, one infers impermanence, momentariness, and so on.

original: 'bras bu las ni rgyu rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu las ni rgyu rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: From effect, one infers cause.

original: de la tshul gsum gyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la tshul gsum gyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the definition of the three modes?

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: As for existence in the object of inference,

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni 'dir shes par 'dod pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i chos can la'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni 'dir shes par 'dod pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i chos can la'o //
translated: here, object of inference refers to the subject that possesses the specific property to be known.

original: yod pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dngos po med pa'am /🔽mi rtag pa'am /
analyzed: yod pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dngos po med pa'am / mi rtag pa'am /
translated: The term existent refers to the subject that is to be inferred.🔽The predicate of the probandum is either a nonentity, impermanent,🔽or

original: skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'am /
translated: “Existence” is the non-existence of the property to be established, such as impermanence, momentariness, etc.,

original: rgyu dang sgrub pa phyogs kyi chos mi dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: rgyu dang sgrub pa phyogs kyi chos mi dmigs pa'am /
translated: or the non-perception of the reason, the property of the subject,

original: rang bzhin nam /🔽'bras bu yod pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin nam / 'bras bu yod pa ste /
translated: or the nature,

original: des ni mig gis bzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ma grub pa bkag go //
analyzed: des ni mig gis bzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ma grub pa bkag go //
translated: or the effect, in the subject that is to be inferred.

original: nyid ces bya ba ni bsnan pa ste /
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba ni bsnan pa ste /
translated: “ Itself” is added.

original: des ni phyogs kyi phyogs gcig ma grub pa la sogs pa bsal lo //
analyzed: des ni phyogs kyi phyogs gcig ma grub pa la sogs pa bsal lo //
translated: This excludes the non-establishment of one part of the subject, etc.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid ces bya ba la mthun pa'i phyogs ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyi dang rang gi don dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid ces bya ba la mthun pa'i phyogs ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyi dang rang gi don dang mthun pa ste /
translated: “ Existence in the similar instance” means that the similar instance is the universal of the property to be established, which is consistent with one’s own meaning.

original: chos mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
analyzed: chos mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
translated: It is the example of the similar property.

original: yod pa zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs @144b de la bsgrub par bya ba'i phyogs spyi dang mthun par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos yod pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs @144b de la bsgrub par bya ba'i phyogs spyi dang mthun par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos yod pa ste /
translated: “Existence” is the presence of the property of the subject that is in accord with the universal of the probandum in the similar class.

original: des ni thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa bsal to //
analyzed: des ni thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa bsal to //
translated: This eliminates the uncommon inconclusive reason.

original: nyid ces bya ba ni bsnan pa ste des ni thun mong gi ma nges pa bsal to //
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba ni bsnan pa ste des ni thun mong gi ma nges pa bsal to //
translated: The word “itself” is an addition; it eliminates the common inconclusive reason.

original: gnyi ga smos pas ni 'gal ba bsal to //
analyzed: gnyi ga smos pas ni 'gal ba bsal to //
translated: The mention of both eliminates the contradictory reason.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa zhes bya ba la mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa de las gzhan pa de dang 'gal ba de med pa ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa zhes bya ba la mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa de las gzhan pa de dang 'gal ba de med pa ste /
translated: “The certainty of the absence in the dissimilar class” means that it is absent in that which is not dissimilar, that is, in that which is different from that and is contradictory to that.

original: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
translated: This is the example of the dissimilar property.

original: med pa zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs de la bsgrub par bya ba'i don dang / lkog tu gyur ba'i don dang / shin tu lkog tu gyur ba'i don rnam pa gsum po dag bsgrubs pa dang / legs par khung du chud par bya ba'i rgyu dang rkyen mngon sum la log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi bsal bas ma nor ba shes pa dang rjes su dpag ba la log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi bsal bas mngon par shes pa dang /
analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs de la bsgrub par bya ba'i don dang / lkog tu gyur ba'i don dang / shin tu lkog tu gyur ba'i don rnam pa gsum po dag bsgrubs pa dang / legs par khung du chud par bya ba'i rgyu dang rkyen mngon sum la log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi bsal bas ma nor ba shes pa dang rjes su dpag ba la log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi bsal bas mngon par shes pa dang /
translated: The three valid cognitions that are taught are: the direct valid cognition that is the elimination of the four misconceptions regarding the cause and condition of the non-erroneous consciousness that establishes the three kinds of objects of affirmation and the very hidden object, and the elimination of the four misconceptions regarding inference;🔽the inferential valid cognition that is the elimination of the four misconceptions regarding the omniscience of the teacher and the non-erroneous consciousness that is the elimination of the contradiction in the words of the scriptures of the teacher;🔽and the valid cognition of reality that is the elimination of the four misconceptions regarding the reasoning of proof.

original: de ston pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa dang / de ston pa'i lung la tshig 'gal ba med pas ma nor bar shes pa ni 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yin par bstan pa'i tshad ma gsum po de dag ni mtshan nyid lnga po 'di dag gis yongs su dag ste /
analyzed: de ston pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa dang / de ston pa'i lung la tshig 'gal ba med pas ma nor bar shes pa ni 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yin par bstan pa'i tshad ma gsum po de dag ni mtshan nyid lnga po 'di dag gis yongs su dag ste /
translated: These three valid cognitions are completely pure by means of these five characteristics.

original: tshad mar rung bar ston to //
analyzed: tshad mar rung bar ston to //
translated: They are taught to be suitable as valid cognition.

original: de la mngon sum gyi tshad ma ni de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag ste /
analyzed: de la mngon sum gyi tshad ma ni de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag ste /
translated: The valid knowledge of direct perception is pure by the definition of directly observing that,

original: tshad mar rung bar bstan to //
analyzed: tshad mar rung bar bstan to //
translated: and it is taught to be suitable as valid knowledge.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma ni de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma ni de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag ste /
translated: The valid knowledge of inference is pure by the definition of directly observing that which is based on it and by the definition of applying an example of its type,

original: tshad mar rung bar ston to //
analyzed: tshad mar rung bar ston to //
translated: and it is taught to be suitable as valid knowledge.

original: yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma gnyi ga yongs su dag ste /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma gnyi ga yongs su dag ste /
translated: By the definition of purity, both the valid knowledge of direct perception and the valid knowledge of inference are pure,

original: tshad mar rung bar ston to //
analyzed: tshad mar rung bar ston to //
translated: and it is taught that they are suitable as valid knowledge.

original: yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma ni lung shin tu rnam par dag par gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag ste /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma ni lung shin tu rnam par dag par gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag ste /
translated: The valid knowledge of trustworthy scripture is pure by the definition of being taught in a very pure scripture,

original: tshad mar rung bar ston to //
analyzed: tshad mar rung bar ston to //
translated: and it is taught to be suitable as valid knowledge.

original: de la dang po mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang / de'i la mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dang po mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang / de'i la mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The first is direct perception, and in order to teach that it is completely pure by the character of direct perception,

original: de la 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid 'jig rten na mngon sum du dmigs pa @145a * //
analyzed: de la 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid 'jig rten na mngon sum du dmigs pa @145a * //
translated: it is said: “In the world, the impermanence of all compounded things, the suffering of all compounded things, and the selflessness of all things are directly perceived.

original: dang ; de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dang ; de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Whatever is similar to that is the character of direct perception.”

original: de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: As for “the character of direct perception,”

original: de zhes bya ba ni so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa'i de'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa'i de'o //
translated: “that” refers to the object of individual knowledge, the object of direct perception, the object of direct perception that is included by its own character.

original: mngon sum du dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa'i de'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa'i de'o //
translated: The phrase “directly observable” means that the object of a particular cognition is the object of direct perception, and that object is subsumed within the intrinsic identity.

original: mngon sum du dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul bas mngon sum du dmigs so //
analyzed: mngon sum du dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul bas mngon sum du dmigs so //
translated: The phrase “directly observable” means that the object of a particular cognition is the object of direct perception, and that object is subsumed within the intrinsic identity. It is directly observable because it is free of conceptual thought and is non-erroneous.

original: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The phrase “its defining characteristic” means the defining characteristic of direct perception.

original: de mngon sum du dmigs pa rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul ba'i shes pa de nyid mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: de mngon sum du dmigs pa rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul ba'i shes pa de nyid mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid yin pa'o //
translated: That direct perception is directly observable, and that cognition which is free of conceptual thought and is non-erroneous is the defining characteristic of direct perception.

original: de ltar mngon sum gyi tshad ma ni de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid des yongs su dag ste /
analyzed: de ltar mngon sum gyi tshad ma ni de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid des yongs su dag ste /
translated: Thus, direct perception is completely pure by means of that defining characteristic of direct perception.

original: tshad mar rung la mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid de yang mtshan nyid kyi tshul gyis ngo bo nyid gcig par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshad mar rung la mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid de yang mtshan nyid kyi tshul gyis ngo bo nyid gcig par rig par bya'o //
translated: The valid cognition that is suitable as a valid cognition is the valid cognition of direct perception. The object that is directly perceived by that is the object of the valid cognition of direct perception. The object of the valid cognition of direct perception is included in the nature of the object that is directly perceived by the valid cognition of direct perception.

original: de la so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is the impermanence of all conditioned phenomena and so on.

original: de la 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dang 'jig pa dang chags pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dang 'jig pa dang chags pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among those, the impermanence of all conditioned phenomena is the characteristic of death, transmigration, birth, and destruction.

original: 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid ces bya ba ni nad la sogs ba sdug bsngal nyid du grub pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid ces bya ba ni nad la sogs ba sdug bsngal nyid du grub pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The suffering of all conditioned phenomena is the suffering that is established as illness and so on.

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa dag la rang dbang med pa nyid du grub pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa dag la rang dbang med pa nyid du grub pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The statement “all things are devoid of selfhood” means that pleasure, pain, etc. are not self-sufficient.

original: 'jig rten mngon sum du dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid ji skad bstan pa de dag ni 'jig rten na mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten mngon sum du dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid ji skad bstan pa de dag ni 'jig rten na mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement “the world perceives them” means that impermanence of all conditioned things, the suffering inherent in all conditioned things, and the selflessness of all things are perceived in the world.

original: 'o na 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa @145b nyid la sogs pa de dag mngon sum rnam pa bzhi po dbang po'i shes pa dang / yid kyi shes pa dang / rang rig pa dang / rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa gang gi yul yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa @145b nyid la sogs pa de dag mngon sum rnam pa bzhi po dbang po'i shes pa dang / yid kyi shes pa dang / rang rig pa dang / rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa gang gi yul yin zhe na /
translated: If impermanence of all conditioned things, etc. are perceived in the world, then are they the objects of the four types of direct perception, i.e., the sense consciousnesses, mental consciousness, self-awareness, or the consciousness of the yogi?

original: bzhi char gyi yul yin te ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: bzhi char gyi yul yin te ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: They are the objects of all four, as appropriate.

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / rang rig pa dang / rnal 'byor ba'i chos kyi spyi dang / sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos med pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / rang rig pa dang / rnal 'byor ba'i chos kyi spyi dang / sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos med pa ste /
translated: That which is similar to that is called the property of the object to be established.

original: des ni thun mong gi ma nges pa dang 'gal ba bstsal to //
analyzed: des ni thun mong gi ma nges pa dang 'gal ba bstsal to //
translated: This shows that the reason is not contradictory to the common locus of the property of the object to be established and the property of the proving subject.

original: nyid ces bya ba ni brnan pa ste /
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba ni brnan pa ste /
translated: The word “only” is an exclusion.

original: des ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la phyogs gcig yod pa'i ma nges pa spangs so ;
analyzed: des ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la phyogs gcig yod pa'i ma nges pa spangs so ;
translated: This excludes the uncertainty of the existence of a part of the counter-position.

original: / nges pa'o zhes bya ba ni mtha' mar smos pa'i phyir gsum char la la yang nges pa nyid rig par bya'o //
analyzed: / nges pa'o zhes bya ba ni mtha' mar smos pa'i phyir gsum char la la yang nges pa nyid rig par bya'o //
translated: The word “certainty” is at the end, so it should be understood to apply to all three.

original: tshul gsum po de dag ni rang gi tshad ma ji lta bu dag gis nges pa yin par gzung bar bya'i //
analyzed: tshul gsum po de dag ni rang gi tshad ma ji lta bu dag gis nges pa yin par gzung bar bya'i //
translated: These three modes should be understood as ascertained by their own valid cognitions.

original: gzhan du na ni rjes su dpag par bya ba la yid ches par bya bar mi nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni rjes su dpag par bya ba la yid ches par bya bar mi nus pa nyid do //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be possible to have confidence in the inferential object.

original: rtags gsum gyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtags gsum gyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What are the characteristics of the three reasons?

original: mi dmigs pa dang / rang bzhin dang / 'bras bu'o zhe bya ba la /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa dang / rang bzhin dang / 'bras bu'o zhe bya ba la /
translated: Non-apprehension, nature, and effect.

original: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag par bya ba ni dngos po med pa dang dngos po'i ngo bos rnam pa gnyis yin pa de'i phyir dngos po med pa sgrub pa dang dngos po bsgrub pa'i rtags kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag par bya ba ni dngos po med pa dang dngos po'i ngo bos rnam pa gnyis yin pa de'i phyir dngos po med pa sgrub pa dang dngos po bsgrub pa'i rtags kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Since the object to be inferred is twofold, either the non-existence of something or the nature of an existent thing, therefore the reason is also twofold: the reason proving the non-existence of something and the reason proving the existence of something.

original: de la mi dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa bsgrub pa'i rtags te /
analyzed: de la mi dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa bsgrub pa'i rtags te /
translated: Among them, non-apprehension is the reason proving the non-existence of something.

original: dgag pa'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: dgag pa'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: It is a reason of negation.

original: de yang med na mi 'byung mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: de yang med na mi 'byung mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba ste /
translated: And it is a relation of invariable concomitance.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can de la dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba'i dngos po mi dmigs pa'i rtags kyis dngos po med pa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can de la dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba'i dngos po mi dmigs pa'i rtags kyis dngos po med pa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: By the reason of the non-apprehension of a perceptible thing, the non-existence of that thing should be inferred in the subject to be inferred.

original: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu gnyis dngos po bsgrub pa'i rtags te /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu gnyis dngos po bsgrub pa'i rtags te /
translated: Nature and effect are the two reasons proving the existence of something.

original: dngos po'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: dngos po'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: They are reasons of affirmation.

original: de gnyis dang bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po dang tha dad pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po dang tha mi dad pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de gnyis dang bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po dang tha dad pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po dang tha mi dad pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: These two, together with the probandum, are of two types, according to whether they are different or not different from the probandum.

original: tha mi dad pa ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba ste /
translated: The non-different one is the relation of the probandum and the probans, which is characterized by the identity of the probandum and the probans.

original: rang bzhin gyi rtags so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi rtags so //
translated: This is the reason of nature.

original: tha dad pa ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa de las skyes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa de las skyes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba ste /
translated: The different one is the relation of the probandum and the probans, which is characterized by the fact that the probans is produced from the probandum.

original: 'bras bu'i rtags so //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rtags so //
translated: This is the reason of effect.

original: de dag ni re re la yan tshul gsum char yod pa lta bu'i tshul re re ba'am gnyis gnyis pa ni ma yin no //🔽de ltar tshul gsum @146a * //
analyzed: de dag ni re re la yan tshul gsum char yod pa lta bu'i tshul re re ba'am gnyis gnyis pa ni ma yin no // de ltar tshul gsum @146a * //
translated: Each of these has all three modes, but the modes are not in pairs.

original: dang ldan pa'i rtags de dag ni gtan tshigs kyi skyon gsum po ma grub pa dang / 'gal ba dang / ma des pa spangs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: dang ldan pa'i rtags de dag ni gtan tshigs kyi skyon gsum po ma grub pa dang / 'gal ba dang / ma des pa spangs pa yang yin te /
translated: The reason that has the three modes in this way is also free from the three faults of a reason: non-establishment, contradiction, and inconclusiveness.

original: 'di ltar rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul gyis rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dngos po med pa'am ma mi rtag pa dang skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'am rgyu sgrub par byed pa'i🔽phyogs kyi chos mi dmigs pa'am rang bzhin nam 'bras bu'i rtags yod pa nyid bstan pa'i gtan tshigs med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul gyis rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dngos po med pa'am ma mi rtag pa dang skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'am rgyu sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi dmigs pa'am rang bzhin nam 'bras bu'i rtags yod pa nyid bstan pa'i gtan tshigs med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa'am /
translated: Thus, in relation to the property of the subject that is to be inferred, the property to be proven is either a nonentity or it is impermanent, momentary and so on or it is the cause that is established.🔽The property of the subject that establishes the reason is either the nonobservation of a nonappearing object, the nature of the reason or the result of the reason.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid kyi tshul gyis rjes su 'gro ba dang mi mthun pa nyid phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul gyis ldog pa dang ldan pa de ni gzhi ma grub pa dang /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid kyi tshul gyis rjes su 'gro ba dang mi mthun pa nyid phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul gyis ldog pa dang ldan pa de ni gzhi ma grub pa dang /
translated: The relationship of the reason is either the nature of the reason being invariably related to the property of the subject or the nature of the reason being related to the property of the subject by the same nature.🔽The reason must be ascertained in the following way. It must be ascertained as existing in accordance with the mode of statement in similar instances and as not existing in accordance with the mode of statement in dissimilar instances.

original: rang la ma grub pa dang gzhan la ma grub pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ma grub pa'i skyon spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang la ma grub pa dang gzhan la ma grub pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ma grub pa'i skyon spangs pa yin no //
translated: Because there is no such thing as a reason that is not established for oneself or for the other party, the fault of nonestablishment is avoided.

original: sgrub par bya ba la sgrub par byed pa log par bsgrub pa'i 'gal ba med pa'i skyon spangs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: sgrub par bya ba la sgrub par byed pa log par bsgrub pa'i 'gal ba med pa'i skyon spangs pa yang yin no //
translated: And because there is no such thing as a reason that proves the opposite of the probandum, the fault of contradiction is avoided.

original: thun mong gi ma nges pa dang thun mongs ma yin pa'i ma nges pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa dang mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ma nges pa'i skyon spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: thun mong gi ma nges pa dang thun mongs ma yin pa'i ma nges pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa dang mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ma nges pa'i skyon spangs pa yin no //
translated: Because there is no such thing as a common or uncommon inconclusive reason, or a reason that is present in only a portion of the discordant cases or a reason that is present in only a portion of the concordant cases, the fault of inconclusiveness is avoided.

original: de ltar tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i rtags gtan tshigs kyi skyon ma grub pa dang 'gal ba dang ma nges pa spangs pa ni rjes su dpag pa gang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i rtags gtan tshigs kyi skyon ma grub pa dang 'gal ba dang ma nges pa spangs pa ni rjes su dpag pa gang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, when a reason that possesses the three modes is free from the faults of nonestablishment, contradiction, and inconclusiveness, then the property to be proven will be established.

original: de nyid rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de nyid rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: and that is the result of the inference-warrant.

original: de ltar rjes su dpag par bya ba la tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags las bdag nyid kyis rtogs pa dang gzhan la go bar bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su dpag par bya ba la tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags las bdag nyid kyis rtogs pa dang gzhan la go bar bya ba la /
translated: Thus, in the case of an inferential object, the evidence is trimodal, and one understands it oneself and makes it understood to others.

original: skabs 'dir rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba bstan to //🔽mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe la nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: skabs 'dir rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba bstan to // mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe la nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba bstan to //
translated: In this context, the mode of existence in the inferential object is taught as “the characteristic of direct perception of what is present there.”🔽The mode of existence in the similar class is taught as “the characteristic of application to an example of the same type.”

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du des pa'i tshul ni lung dang tshad ma gzhan dag las ni dngos su yang bstan //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du des pa'i tshul ni lung dang tshad ma gzhan dag las ni dngos su yang bstan //
translated: The mode of non-existence in the dissimilar class is taught as “the characteristic of non-observation of what is suitable to appear.”

original: skabs 'dir ni chos mthun pa'i dpe rjes su 'gro ba bstan pas //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni chos mthun pa'i dpe rjes su 'gro ba bstan pas //
translated: In this context, the pervasion of the similar class is taught.

original: chos mi mthun @146b pa'i dpe'i ldog pa zhar la 'grub pas bco ma ldan 'das kyis ngos su ma bstan te shes par 'dod na ni ci ris par sbyar te 'og tu bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun @146b pa'i dpe'i ldog pa zhar la 'grub pas bco ma ldan 'das kyis ngos su ma bstan te shes par 'dod na ni ci ris par sbyar te 'og tu bstan par bya'o //
translated: Since the opposite of the dissimilar example is established incidentally, the Lord did not teach it. If one wishes to understand it, one should apply it as it is taught below.

original: de la dang por rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dang por rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In that regard, in order to teach that the valid knowledge of inference is pure by the character of the direct perception of the basis,🔽the direct perception of the coarseness of impermanence in the context of the momentariness of all compounded phenomena, the existence of other worlds, and the nonexpiration of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma,

original: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma nyid dang / 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid dang // las dge ba dang mi dge ba chud mi za ba de la gnas pa'i mi rtag par rags pa nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma nyid dang / 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid dang // las dge ba dang mi dge ba chud mi za ba de la gnas pa'i mi rtag par rags pa nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: and

original: sems can sna tshogs las sna tshogs pa la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa dang ; sems can bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba las dge ba dang mi dge ba las gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: sems can sna tshogs las sna tshogs pa la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa dang ; sems can bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba las dge ba dang mi dge ba las gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: The direct perception of the various sentient beings abiding in the various actions, and the direct perception of the sentient beings abiding in virtue and non-virtue from happiness and suffering,

original: gang gis mngon sum du ma gyur pa las rjes su dpag par bya ba dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yi pa de ni de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gis mngon sum du ma gyur pa las rjes su dpag par bya ba dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yi pa de ni de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: and that which is to be inferred from that which is not directly perceived, and that which is similar to that, that is the characteristic of the direct perception of the abider there.

original: de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: Regarding that, the characteristic of the direct perception of the abider there,

original: de la zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can de la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can de la'o //
translated: there means in the subject to be inferred.

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos thams cad kyi chos mi dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos thams cad kyi chos mi dmigs pa'am /
translated: Abider means all the properties of the proof, the non-observation of the imperceptible,

original: rang bzhin nam 'bras bu'i rtags so //
analyzed: rang bzhin nam 'bras bu'i rtags so //
translated: or the sign of nature or effect.

original: so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa gnas pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa gnas pa'o //
translated: The object of one's own consciousness is the object of direct perception, which is included by its own character, and is present.

original: mngon sum du dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi dmigs pa'am //
analyzed: mngon sum du dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi dmigs pa'am //
translated: The phrase directly observed refers to the non-observation of the property of the position that is being proven,

original: rang bzhin nam 'bras bu'i rtags so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa gnas pa de mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul bas mngon sum du dmigs pa'o
analyzed: rang bzhin nam 'bras bu'i rtags so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa gnas pa de mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul bas mngon sum du dmigs pa'o
translated: or to a reason based on nature or effect. The object of one's own consciousness is the object of direct perception, which is included by its own character, and is present. That is the definition of direct perception. It is directly observed by a direct perception that is free from conceptuality and is non-erroneous.

original: // mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: // mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: The phrase definition of inference refers to the definition of inferential valid knowledge.

original: de ltar rjes su dpag par bya ba la tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mngon sum gyis mi dmigs pa rjes su dpag ste bdag nyid kyis rtogs pa dang / gzhan la go bar gyur pa nyid rjes su dpag ba'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rjes su dpag par bya ba la tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mngon sum gyis mi dmigs pa rjes su dpag ste bdag nyid kyis rtogs pa dang / gzhan la go bar gyur pa nyid rjes su dpag ba'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the definition of inference as a means of valid knowledge is that it is the understanding by oneself and the making known to others of the probandum, which is the property to be established by the trimodal logical reason, in regard to the object to be inferred.

original: de ltar na rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid des yongs su dag ste //
analyzed: de ltar na rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid des yongs su dag ste //
translated: Thus, that inference as a means of valid knowledge is purified by that characteristic of the perception of the basis.

original: tshad mar rung @147a * //
analyzed: tshad mar rung @147a * //
translated: It is suitable as a means of valid knowledge.

original: la rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid de yang mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid kyi tshul gyi ngo bo nyid gcig par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: la rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid de yang mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid kyi tshul gyi ngo bo nyid gcig par rig par bya'o //
translated: And that inference as a means of valid knowledge and that characteristic of the perception of the basis should be known to be of the same nature in the manner of characterized and characteristic.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can de la gnas pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mngon sum du dmigs pa'i rtags kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mngon sum gyis mi dmigs pa rjes su dpag par bya ba de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can de la gnas pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mngon sum du dmigs pa'i rtags kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mngon sum gyis mi dmigs pa rjes su dpag par bya ba de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the things to be inferred that are established by the evidence of the property of the subject that is perceived?🔽

original: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma nyid dang / 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid dang / las dge ba dang mi dge ba chud mi za ba zhes bya ba dag ste /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma nyid dang / 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid dang / las dge ba dang mi dge ba chud mi za ba zhes bya ba dag ste /
translated: What are the objects to be inferred, the presence of which in the subject is established by the evidence of perception of a property of the subject? They are: the impermanence of all compounded things, the existence of a world beyond, and the indestructibility of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: de dag ni bshad pa'i don rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul lkog tu gyur ba'i don spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni bshad pa'i don rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul lkog tu gyur ba'i don spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: These are the objects to be inferred, which are included in the definition of an object that is hidden, the domain of inferential valid cognition, as explained above.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mngon sum gyis ma dmigs pa rjes su dpag par bya ba de dag sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i rtags dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mngon sum gyis ma dmigs pa rjes su dpag par bya ba de dag sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i rtags dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the evidences by which the presence of these objects to be inferred, the presence of which in the subject is established by the evidence of perception of a property of the subject, is established by the evidence of perception of a property of the subject?

original: de la gnas pa'i mi rtag pa rags pa nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa dang / sems can sna tshogs las sna tshogs la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa dang / sems can bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba las dge ba dang /
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i mi rtag pa rags pa nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa dang / sems can sna tshogs las sna tshogs la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa dang / sems can bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba las dge ba dang /
translated: The first is the direct perception of the gross impermanence that exists there, the second is the direct perception of the various sentient beings abiding in various actions and the third is the direct perception of the various sentient beings abiding in various results.

original: mi dge ba la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba dag ste;/🔽de dag ni so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba dag ste;/ de dag ni so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The first is the direct perception of the gross impermanence that exists in that object. The second is the direct perception of the various sentient beings who exist in relation to various actions. The third is the direct perception of the virtuous and nonvirtuous actions in which happy and suffering sentient beings respectively engage.🔽These are the objects of individual knowledge that are the domain of direct valid knowledge and are subsumed by the objects of direct perception that are characterized by their own characteristics.

original: de ltar rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i sgo nas bsgrub
analyzed: de ltar rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i sgo nas bsgrub
translated: In this way, the property of the subject that is to be inferred is established by means of the direct perception of the property of the proving subject that is subsumed by the objects of direct perception that are characterized by their own characteristics and that exists in the subject.

original: par bya ba'i chos bshad pa'i don rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul lkog tu gyur pa'i don mi rtag pa'i tan nyid kyis bsdus pa de rjes su dpag par bya ste //
analyzed: par bya ba'i chos bshad pa'i don rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul lkog tu gyur pa'i don mi rtag pa'i tan nyid kyis bsdus pa de rjes su dpag par bya ste //
translated: The object of the inference-warrant that explains the meaning of the Dharma to be practiced is the hidden object included within the quality of impermanence. That should be inferred.🔽Regarding that, the evidence whatever is observed as abiding indicates that this Dharma to be proven, all compounded things are momentary, should be inferred.🔽Regarding that, the evidence whatever is observed as coarse impermanence indicates that this Dharma to be proven, all compounded things are momentary, should be inferred.

original: de la gnas pa nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin par zhes bya ba'i rtags 'dis ni 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma nyid ces bya ba bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'di rjes su dpag par bya'o //🔽de la dpag pa'i mi rtag par rags pa nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la gnas pa nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin par zhes bya ba'i rtags 'dis ni 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma nyid ces bya ba bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'di rjes su dpag par bya'o // de la dpag pa'i mi rtag par rags pa nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Regarding that, the evidence whatever is observed as coarse impermanence indicates that this Dharma to be proven, all compounded things are momentary, should be inferred.🔽Regarding that, the evidence whatever is observed as coarse impermanence indicates that this Dharma to be proven, all compounded things are momentary, should be inferred.🔽Regarding that, the evidence whatever is observed as coarse impermanence indicates that this Dharma to be proven, all compounded things are momentary, should be inferred.🔽Regarding that, the evidence whatever is observed as coarse impermanence indicates that this Dharma to be proven, all compounded things are momentary, should be inferred.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can @147b 'du byed kyi dngos po de la'o //🔽gnas pa'i mi rag pa rags pa nyid ces bya ba ni //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can @147b 'du byed kyi dngos po de la'o //🔽gnas pa'i mi rag pa rags pa nyid ces bya ba ni //
translated: Regarding that, the evidence whatever is observed as coarse impermanence indicates that this Dharma to be proven, all compounded things are momentary, should be inferred.🔽Regarding that, the evidence whatever is observed as coarse impermanence indicates that this Dharma to be proven, all compounded things are momentary, should be inferred.

original: skad cig la 'jig pa ma yin pa'i mi rtag pa la rags pa'i 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid de / de'i sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rang bzhin gyi rtags so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig la 'jig pa ma yin pa'i mi rtag pa la rags pa'i 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid de / de'i sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rang bzhin gyi rtags so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The property of the subject that proves that is the reason of nature that is the object of a cognition that is a valid cognition of direct perception, and the object of direct perception is included by its own character.🔽That which is directly observed is the property of the subject that proves that, the reason of nature that is the object of a cognition that is a valid cognition of direct perception, and the object of direct perception is included by its own character.

original: mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnag bzhin gyi rtags so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa de nyid mngon sum gyi tshad
analyzed: mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnag bzhin gyi rtags so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa de nyid mngon sum gyi tshad
translated: That is the definition of a valid cognition of direct perception.

original: ma'i mtshan nyid rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul bas mngon sum du dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: ma'i mtshan nyid rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul bas mngon sum du dmigs pa ste /
translated: It is directly observed by a valid cognition of direct perception that is free from conceptuality and non-mistaken.

original: de ltar sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnag bzhin gyis rtags mi rtag pa'i rags pa nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa de'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos skad cig ma nyid rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnag bzhin gyis rtags mi rtag pa'i rags pa nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa de'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos skad cig ma nyid rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: In this way, by the direct perception of the reason, the gross impermanence, which is the property of the subject that proves that, the property to be proven, momentariness, should be inferred.

original: de la skabs 'dir tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags dang ji ltar sbyar zhe na /
analyzed: de la skabs 'dir tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags dang ji ltar sbyar zhe na /
translated: In this context, how is the trimodal condition applied?

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba la sogs pa yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni de las zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba la sogs pa yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni de las zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The mode of existence of the object of inference and so on is indicated by “from that.”

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni chos can 'du byed kyi dngos po de la'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni chos can 'du byed kyi dngos po de la'o //
translated: “From that” refers to the object of inference, the subject, the entity of compounded things.

original: yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos can 'du byed kyi dngos po de la sgrub par byed pa'i chos skad cig ma nyid sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rang bzhin gyi rtags mi rtag pa rags pa nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa yod pa nyid de
analyzed: yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos can 'du byed kyi dngos po de la sgrub par byed pa'i chos skad cig ma nyid sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rang bzhin gyi rtags mi rtag pa rags pa nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa yod pa nyid de
translated: “Existence” refers to the existence of the property of the subject, momentariness, which is the probandum, in the subject, the entity of compounded things. It is the existence of the property of the subject, the reason of nature, the gross impermanence, which is the proof of that. It is the direct perception of that.

original: // de'i phyir chos can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: // de'i phyir chos can zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the subject.

original: skabs 'dir chos can de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dngos po med pa rgyu dang / sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi dmigs pa dang / 'bras bu'i rtags ni med do //
analyzed: skabs 'dir chos can de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dngos po med pa rgyu dang / sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi dmigs pa dang / 'bras bu'i rtags ni med do //
translated: In this context, there is no probandum, no property to be established, no reason consisting of effect, and no reason consisting of nonapprehension.

original: de bas na rjes su dpag pa nyid sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnag bzhin gyi rtags mi rtag pa rags pa nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa yod pa nyid de ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa de'i bdag gi mtshan nyid kyis 'brel
analyzed: de bas na rjes su dpag pa nyid sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnag bzhin gyi rtags mi rtag pa rags pa nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa yod pa nyid de ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa de'i bdag gi mtshan nyid kyis 'brel
translated: Therefore, the reason consisting of nature is the property of the subject, which is the means of proving the probandum. The reason consisting of nature is the direct apprehension of the property of the subject, impermanence, which is the probandum. It is the nature of the probandum and the property of the subject.

original: pa yin pas de'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa yin pas de'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the reason consisting of nature.

original: mthun pa'i phogs la yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni chos mthun pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phogs la yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni chos mthun pa'i dpe ste /
translated: The mode of existence in similar instances is the example of a similar property.

original: gang la mi rtag pa rags pa nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa de ni skad cig ma nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang la mi rtag pa rags pa nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa de ni skad cig ma nyid yin te /
translated: Whatever is directly apprehended as impermanent and gross is momentary.🔽For example, a pot.

original: dper na nang dang phyi rol gyi 'du byed rnams la 'jig rten thams cad la @148a * //
analyzed: dper na nang dang phyi rol gyi 'du byed rnams la 'jig rten thams cad la @148a * //
translated: For example, all worldly beings agree that inner and outer compounded phenomena are impermanent.

original: grags pa'i 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dmigs pa nye bar sbyar ba lta bus te /
analyzed: grags pa'i 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dmigs pa nye bar sbyar ba lta bus te /
translated: For example, the death and rebirth of inner and outer compounded phenomena are observed in terms of what is renowned to all worlds.

original: de ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs su 'og nas ston to /
analyzed: de ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs su 'og nas ston to /
translated: This is taught below in the section on the definition of the example of one’s own type.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ste /
translated: The way of ascertaining that the discordant class does not exist is the example of the discordant class.

original: de ni lung dang tshad ma gzhan dag las ni dngos su yang bstan //
analyzed: de ni lung dang tshad ma gzhan dag las ni dngos su yang bstan //
translated: That is directly taught in other scriptures and valid reasonings.

original: skabs 'dir ni chos mthun pa'i dpe rjes su 'gro ba bstan pas chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i ldog pa zhar la 'grub pas bcom ldan 'das kyis dngos po ma bstan te /
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni chos mthun pa'i dpe rjes su 'gro ba bstan pas chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i ldog pa zhar la 'grub pas bcom ldan 'das kyis dngos po ma bstan te /
translated: In this context, since the concordant example of concomitance is taught, the opposite of the discordant example is implicitly established. Therefore the Bhagavān did not teach it.

original: shes par 'dod na ni gang la mi rtag par gnas pa nyid mngon sum du mi dmigs pa de skad cig ma nyid ma yin te //
analyzed: shes par 'dod na ni gang la mi rtag par gnas pa nyid mngon sum du mi dmigs pa de skad cig ma nyid ma yin te //
translated: If one wishes to understand it, it is as follows: Whatever is not directly observed to be impermanent is not momentary.

original: dper na nam mkha' lta bu'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' lta bu'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: For example, it is like space.

original: de ltar tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin gyi rtags de ni gtan tshigs kyi skyon gsum po ma grub pa dang 'gal ba dang ma nges pa spangs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de ltar tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin gyi rtags de ni gtan tshigs kyi skyon gsum po ma grub pa dang 'gal ba dang ma nges pa spangs pa yang yin te /
translated: Thus, that evidence of nature that has the three modes is also free from the three faults of reasoning: it is not unestablished, it is not contradictory, and it is not indefinite.

original: 'di ltar rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul gyis chos can 'du byed kyi dngos po de la bsgrub par bya'i chos skad cig ma nyid sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos kyi rang bzhin gyi rtags mi rtag pa rags pa nyid mngon
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul gyis chos can 'du byed kyi dngos po de la bsgrub par bya'i chos skad cig ma nyid sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos kyi rang bzhin gyi rtags mi rtag pa rags pa nyid mngon
translated: In this way, the existence of the property of the subject, which is the property of the subject of the probandum, is established by the mode of existence in the inferential subject. The evidence of nature, the property of the subject, establishes the probandum, momentariness. The gross impermanence that is directly observed exists.

original: sum du dmigs pa yod pa nyid bstan pa'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid ki tshul gyis rjes su 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: sum du dmigs pa yod pa nyid bstan pa'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid ki tshul gyis rjes su 'gro ba dang /
translated: The evidence of nature that teaches existence is related by the definition of a relation that is the identity of the probandum and the proof. It is related by the mode of existence in the similar class.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul gyis ldog pa dang ldan pa de ni gzhi ma grub pa dang rang la ma grub pa dang gzhan la ma grub pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ma grub pa'i skyon spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul gyis ldog pa dang ldan pa de ni gzhi ma grub pa dang rang la ma grub pa dang gzhan la ma grub pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ma grub pa'i skyon spangs pa yin no //
translated: It is free from the fault of nonestablishment, because it is not the case that the reason is not established, not established for one or other of the parties, and so on.

original: bsgrub par bya ba las sgrub par byed pa log par byed pa'i 'gal ba med pa'i phyir 'gal ba'i skyon spangs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba las sgrub par byed pa log par byed pa'i 'gal ba med pa'i phyir 'gal ba'i skyon spangs pa yang yin no //
translated: It is also free from the fault of contradiction, because there is no contradiction in the pervasion that the reason is absent where the property to be proven is absent.🔽It is free from the fault of nonestablishment, because there is no nonestablishment, nonestablishment for one or other of the parties, and so on.🔽It is free from the fault of contradiction, because there is no contradiction in the pervasion that the reason is absent where the property to be proven is absent.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa dang thun mong gi ma nges pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa dang / mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ma nges pa'i skyon spangs pa yin //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa dang thun mong gi ma nges pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa dang / mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ma nges pa'i skyon spangs pa yin //
translated: It is free from the fault of nonestablishment, because there is no nonestablishment, nonestablishment for one or other of the parties, and so on.

original: sems can sna tshogs las sna tshogs la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i rtags 'dis ni 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid ces bya ba'i bsgrub par bya @148b pa'i ches 'di rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can sna tshogs las sna tshogs la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i rtags 'dis ni 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid ces bya ba'i bsgrub par bya @148b pa'i ches 'di rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: By this reason, “because various sentient beings are observed to engage in various actions,” one should infer the conclusion, “there is another world.”

original: sems can sna tshogs las sna tshogs la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sems can sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas tha dad pa'i bye brag la gnas pa'i sems can sna tshogs te /
analyzed: sems can sna tshogs las sna tshogs la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sems can sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas tha dad pa'i bye brag la gnas pa'i sems can sna tshogs te /
translated: “Various sentient beings are observed to engage in various actions” means that various sentient beings, who are different in terms of realm, migratory state, and birth, are observed to engage in various actions.

original: des ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can bstan to //
analyzed: des ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can bstan to //
translated: This indicates the subject of the inference.

original: las sna tshogs la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten mi la sogs pa 'greng ste 'gro ba dang / phyugs la sogs pa dud de 'gro ba dang / sbrul la sogs pa 'phye zhing 'gro ba dang / bya la sogs pa nam mkha' la lding pa dang /
analyzed: las sna tshogs la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten mi la sogs pa 'greng ste 'gro ba dang / phyugs la sogs pa dud de 'gro ba dang / sbrul la sogs pa 'phye zhing 'gro ba dang / bya la sogs pa nam mkha' la lding pa dang /
translated: “Abiding in various actions” means that humans and so on in the world walk upright, cattle walk bent over, snakes slither, birds fly in the sky,🔽fish swim in the water, and so on.

original: nya la sogs pa chu la 'phyo ba dang / de 'dra ba'i tshul gyis mi mthun pa sna tshogs pa ma bslabs par rang shes te rtsol ba dang / la la'i gnas ci la 'cha'/
analyzed: nya la sogs pa chu la 'phyo ba dang / de 'dra ba'i tshul gyis mi mthun pa sna tshogs pa ma bslabs par rang shes te rtsol ba dang / la la'i gnas ci la 'cha'/
translated: Without training, one knows naturally how to do various incompatible things, such as how to make effort, how some stay in one place,

original: la la'i zas su ci za /
analyzed: la la'i zas su ci za /
translated: what some eat,

original: la la'i yon tan ci yod //
analyzed: la la'i yon tan ci yod //
translated: what some’s good qualities are,

original: la la'i skyon ci la chags te /
analyzed: la la'i skyon ci la chags te /
translated: and what some’s faults are.

original: sna tshogs kyi spyod pa mi 'dra ba la sogs pa dang / skam la gnas pa ni chu'i gting du 'dug par mi bzod //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi spyod pa mi 'dra ba la sogs pa dang / skam la gnas pa ni chu'i gting du 'dug par mi bzod //
translated: There are various incompatible activities, such as those that live on dry land not being able to stay in the depths of the water,

original: chu la gnas pa ni skam la 'jug par mi bzod /
analyzed: chu la gnas pa ni skam la 'jug par mi bzod /
translated: those that live in the water not being able to go on dry land,

original: grang bas ni tshad khung mi thub pa /
analyzed: grang bas ni tshad khung mi thub pa /
translated: and those that cannot endure heat not being able to endure cold.

original: dros pas ni grang mo mi thub pa la sogs pa rang gi chos ma yin pa byed mi nus pa dang / de'i nang nas kyang la la ni bslabs na lobs pa dang bsgoms na goms su rung ba yang yod pa dang / la la ni bslabs kyang ma lobs la bsgoms kyang goms su mi rung ba yang yod pa dang /
analyzed: dros pas ni grang mo mi thub pa la sogs pa rang gi chos ma yin pa byed mi nus pa dang / de'i nang nas kyang la la ni bslabs na lobs pa dang bsgoms na goms su rung ba yang yod pa dang / la la ni bslabs kyang ma lobs la bsgoms kyang goms su mi rung ba yang yod pa dang /
translated: Some are capable of learning and becoming accustomed to something through training and meditation, while others are not capable of learning or becoming accustomed to something through training and meditation.🔽Some animals, such as elephants and horses, are stronger and faster than humans and can be used by humans, while others, such as mice and lice, are smaller than humans and bite them.

original: glang po che dang rta la sogs pa mi bas nyams rtsa la che la bad mgyogs pa yang mis bkol du rung ba dang lji ba dang shig la sogs pa mi bas chud ba yang mi la za ba dang / khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas tha dad pa nas skyes pa'i tshul mi mthun pa de lta bu la sogs pa sems can sna tshogs las sna tshos la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: glang po che dang rta la sogs pa mi bas nyams rtsa la che la bad mgyogs pa yang mis bkol du rung ba dang lji ba dang shig la sogs pa mi bas chud ba yang mi la za ba dang / khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas tha dad pa nas skyes pa'i tshul mi mthun pa de lta bu la sogs pa sems can sna tshogs las sna tshos la gnas pa ste /
translated: There are various types of sentient beings with different elements, rebirths, and birthplaces, and they engage in various actions.

original: des ni sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos 'bras bu'i rtags so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos 'bras bu'i rtags so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa bstan to //
translated: This indicates that the object of the awareness that is the evidence of effect, which is a property of the subject that proves the probandum, is an object of direct perception that is included within its own character.🔽That which is directly observed is the object of the awareness that is the evidence of effect, which is a property of the subject that proves the probandum. It is an object of direct perception that is included within its own character.

original: mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos 'bras bu'i rtags so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa de nyid kyi mngon sum gyi tshad🔽ma'i mtshan nyid rtog pa dang bral @149a * //
analyzed: mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos 'bras bu'i rtags so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa de nyid kyi mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid rtog pa dang bral @149a * //
translated: The definition of direct perception is

original: zhing ma 'khrul bas mngon sum du dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: zhing ma 'khrul bas mngon sum du dmigs pa ste /
translated: that which is free from conceptuality and non-mistaken.🔽That which is directly observed is the object of the awareness that is the evidence of effect, which is a property of the subject that proves the probandum. It is an object of direct perception that is included within its own character.

original: de ltar sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs chos 'bras bu'i rtags las sna tshogs la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa de'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'jig rten pha rol tshe snga ma yod pa nyid de rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs chos 'bras bu'i rtags las sna tshogs la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa de'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'jig rten pha rol tshe snga ma yod pa nyid de rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: In this way, the existence of the world beyond, the previous life, which is the property to be proven, should be inferred by means of the observation of the effect, the property of the subject, which is the various things, that proves it.

original: de la skabs 'dir tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags dang ji ltar sbyar zhe na /
analyzed: de la skabs 'dir tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags dang ji ltar sbyar zhe na /
translated: In this context, how is the three-mode reasoning applied?

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshig ni sems cad sna tshogs zhes bya bas bstan te rjes su dpag par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni chos can sems can sna tshogs la'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshig ni sems cad sna tshogs zhes bya bas bstan te rjes su dpag par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni chos can sems can sna tshogs la'o //
translated: The phrase “existence in the inferential object” is indicated by “various beings.” “Existence in the inferential object” means with respect to the subject, various beings.

original: yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos can sems can sna tshogs de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'jig rten pha rol tshe snga ma yod pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos 'bras bu'i rtags las sna tshogs las mngon sum du dmigs pa yod
analyzed: yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos can sems can sna tshogs de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'jig rten pha rol tshe snga ma yod pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos 'bras bu'i rtags las sna tshogs las mngon sum du dmigs pa yod
translated: “Existence” means that with respect to that subject, various beings, the existence of the world beyond, the previous life, which is the property to be proven, is proven by the observation of the effect, the property of the subject, which is the various things, that proves it.

original: pa yin de //
analyzed: pa yin de //
translated: The first is the cause of the second.🔽

original: de'i phyir chos can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos can zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the subject.

original: skabs 'dir chos can de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dngos po med pa dang mi rtag pa dang / skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa dang / sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos ni mi dmigs pa dang rang bzhin gyi rtags ni med do //🔽de bas na rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can sems can sna tshogs de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos 'bras bu'i rtags las sna tshogs la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'jig rten pha rol tshe snga
analyzed: skabs 'dir chos can de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dngos po med pa dang mi rtag pa dang / skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa dang / sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos ni mi dmigs pa dang rang bzhin gyi rtags ni med do // de bas na rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can sems can sna tshogs de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos 'bras bu'i rtags las sna tshogs la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'jig rten pha rol tshe snga
translated: In this context, the subject is not the property of the probandum, such as non-existence, impermanence, momentariness, etc., nor is it the property of the probandum, such as non-apprehension and the reason of essence.

original: ma yod pa nyid mngon sum gyi ma dmigs pa de yod pa nyid du rjes su dpag ste //
analyzed: ma yod pa nyid mngon sum gyi ma dmigs pa de yod pa nyid du rjes su dpag ste //
translated: Therefore, in that subject to be inferred, the various sentient beings, the property of the probandum, such as the existence of a past life in the next world, is not directly apprehended. The property of the probandum, such as the existence of a past life in the next world, is inferred from the existence of the reason of effect, which is the property of the probandum that is directly apprehended in the various [sentient beings].

original: de ltar chos can sems can sna tshogs de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'jig rten pha rol tshe snga ma yod pa nyid sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos 'bras bu'i rtags las sna tshogs la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa yod pa de nyid de
analyzed: de ltar chos can sems can sna tshogs de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'jig rten pha rol tshe snga ma yod pa nyid sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos 'bras bu'i rtags las sna tshogs la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa yod pa de nyid de
translated: The subject is the various sentient beings. The property to be established is the existence of a world beyond, that is, of a previous birth. The property of the subject that establishes this is the reason of effect. The existence of this reason is directly perceived in the various things.

original: ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa las skyes pa'i tshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yin pa de'i phyir 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa las skyes pa'i tshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yin pa de'i phyir 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs zhes bya'o //
translated: This reason is related to the property to be established by being its effect. Therefore, it is called a reason of effect.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa'i tshul ni chos mthun pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa'i tshul ni chos mthun pa'i dpe ste /
translated: The way in which the reason exists in the similar class is the example of a positive phenomenon.

original: gang las sna tshogs la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa de la ni 'jig rten pha rol yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang las sna tshogs la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa de la ni 'jig rten pha rol yod pa yin te /
translated: The existence of a world beyond is found in those things in which the reason of effect is directly perceived.

original: dper na nang dang phyir rol gyi 'du byed rnams la 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa'i skye ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal dmigs pa nye bar sbyar ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na nang dang phyir rol gyi 'du byed rnams la 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa'i skye ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal dmigs pa nye bar sbyar ba lta bu ste /
translated: For example, the arising of internal and external formations is perceived by everyone in the world.

original: de la rang gi @149b rigs kyi bde ba nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs su 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: de la rang gi @149b rigs kyi bde ba nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs su 'og nas ston to //
translated: The definition of the self-nature of the Buddha-essence is taught in the chapter on the “Application of the Bliss of One’s Own Family.”

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du des pa'i tshul ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ste //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du des pa'i tshul ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ste //
translated: The method of the non-existence of the Buddha-essence in the adverse side is the example of the dissimilar property.

original: de yang lung dang tshad ma gzhan dag las ni dngos su yang bstan //
analyzed: de yang lung dang tshad ma gzhan dag las ni dngos su yang bstan //
translated: And that is also taught directly in the scriptures and other valid cognitions.

original: skabs 'dir ni chos mthun pa'i dpes rjed su 'gro ba bstan pas chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i ldog pa zhar la 'grub pas bcom ldan 'das kyis ngos su ma bstan te /
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni chos mthun pa'i dpes rjed su 'gro ba bstan pas chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i ldog pa zhar la 'grub pas bcom ldan 'das kyis ngos su ma bstan te /
translated: In this chapter, the example of the similar property is taught, and the example of the dissimilar property is established by implication. Therefore, the Lord did not teach it directly.

original: shes par 'dod na ni gang la las sna tshogs gnas pa la mngon sum du mi dmigs pa de la ni 'jig rten pha rol med pa nyid de //
analyzed: shes par 'dod na ni gang la las sna tshogs gnas pa la mngon sum du mi dmigs pa de la ni 'jig rten pha rol med pa nyid de //
translated: If one wishes to know, it should be said that “where there is no direct perception of the various karmas that are present, there is no other world.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva lta bu'i zhes brjod par bya'o ;
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva lta bu'i zhes brjod par bya'o ;
translated: For example, it is like the horn of a rabbit.”

original: / de ltar tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu'i rtags de yang gtan tshigs kyi skyon gsum po ma grub pa dang 'gal ba dang ma nges pa spangs po yin te /
analyzed: / de ltar tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu'i rtags de yang gtan tshigs kyi skyon gsum po ma grub pa dang 'gal ba dang ma nges pa spangs po yin te /
translated: The effect-evidence, which is endowed with the three modes, is also free from the three faults of reasoning: nonestablishment, contradiction, and uncertainty.

original: snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: As before, it is to be applied as appropriate.

original: sems can bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang las dge ba dang mi dge ba la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i rtags 'dris ni las dge ba dang mi dge ba chud mi za ba zhes bya ba'i bsgrub par bya ba'i🔽chos 'di rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang las dge ba dang mi dge ba la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i rtags 'dris ni las dge ba dang mi dge ba chud mi za ba zhes bya ba'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'di rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: The evidence of acquaintance, “whatever is directly perceived as the abode of sentient beings’ pleasure, pain, virtue, and vice,” is to be inferred with regard to the probandum, “the nonexpiration of virtuous and vicious actions.”

original: sems can bde ba dang sdug bsngal las dge ba dang mi dge ba la gnas pa'i mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sems can bde ba dang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni skyid pa dang sdug pa la sogs pa'i bye brag yod
analyzed: sems can bde ba dang sdug bsngal las dge ba dang mi dge ba la gnas pa'i mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sems can bde ba dang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni skyid pa dang sdug pa la sogs pa'i bye brag yod
translated: “Whatever is directly perceived as the abode of sentient beings’ pleasure, pain, virtue, and vice” means that sentient beings have the distinction of pleasure and pain, virtue and vice, and so on.

original: pa ste / de ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can bstan to //
analyzed: pa ste / de ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can bstan to //
translated: This is the teaching of the subject to be inferred.

original: las dge ba dang mi dge ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni tshe snga ma'i las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal la gnas pa ste des ni sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs ki chos 'bras bu'i rtags
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni tshe snga ma'i las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal la gnas pa ste des ni sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs ki chos 'bras bu'i rtags
translated: Abiding in virtuous and nonvirtuous karma refers to abiding in the effects of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma from previous lives. This is the evidence of the effect that is a property of the subject.

original: so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa yin no /
analyzed: so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa yin no /
translated: The object of individual knowledge is the object of the valid knowledge of direct perception, which is the object of direct perception that is subsumed by its own character.

original: mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos 'bras bu'i rtags so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa de nyid mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid
analyzed: mngon sum du dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos 'bras bu'i rtags so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa de nyid mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid
translated: That which is directly observed is the evidence of the effect that is a property of the subject. That very object of the valid knowledge of direct perception that is subsumed by its own character is the definition of the valid knowledge of direct perception.

original: rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pas mngon sum du dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pas mngon sum du dmigs pa ste /
translated: It is directly observed by being free from conceptuality and free from error.

original: de ltar sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos 'bras bu'i rtags las dge ba dang @150a * //
analyzed: de ltar sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos 'bras bu'i rtags las dge ba dang @150a * //
translated: Thus, the property of the subject that establishes that is the reason of effect.

original: mi dge ba la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa de'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos las dge ba dang mi dge ba chud mi za bar de rjes su dpag par bya'o //
