analyzed: mi dge ba la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa de'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos las dge ba dang mi dge ba chud mi za bar de rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: Through the direct perception of the virtuous and nonvirtuous states, the property of the subject that is to be established is the nonexpiration of virtue and nonvirtue.

original: de la skabs 'dir tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags dang ji ltar sbyar zhe na rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni sems can bde ba dang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba bstan te /
analyzed: de la skabs 'dir tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags dang ji ltar sbyar zhe na rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni sems can bde ba dang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba bstan te /
translated: In this context, how is the trimodal condition applied to the reason? The trimodal condition of the presence in the object of inference is indicated by the words “sentient beings who are happy and suffering.”

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni chos can sems can bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba la'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni chos can sems can bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba la'o //
translated: “In the object of inference” refers to the subject, sentient beings who are happy and suffering.

original: yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos can sems can bde ba dang bsgrub bsngal ba de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos las dge ba dang mi dge ba chud mi za bar byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos 'bras bu'i rtags las dge ba dang mi dge ba la
analyzed: yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos can sems can bde ba dang bsgrub bsngal ba de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos las dge ba dang mi dge ba chud mi za bar byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos 'bras bu'i rtags las dge ba dang mi dge ba la
translated: The subject is the sentient beings who are happy or suffering. The property to be proven is the aspect of the property of the position that makes virtue and nonvirtue not go to waste.🔽

original: gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa yod pa nyid de de'i phyir chos can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa yod pa nyid de de'i phyir chos can zhes bya'o //
translated: “Existence” is the subject, the sentient being who is to be established as happy or unhappy. The property of the subject is the non-expiration of the virtuous and non-virtuous karma that is to be established. The property of the subject that is the evidence of the effect is the existence of the virtuous and non-virtuous karma that is directly perceived. Therefore, it is called the subject.

original: skabs 'dir yang chos can de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dngos po med pa dang mi rtag pa dang skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa dang sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi dmigs pa dang rang bzhin gyi rtags ni med do //
analyzed: skabs 'dir yang chos can de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dngos po med pa dang mi rtag pa dang skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa dang sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi dmigs pa dang rang bzhin gyi rtags ni med do //
translated: In this context, the property of the subject that is to be established is non-entityness, impermanence, momentariness, and so on. The property of the subject that is the evidence of non-observation and the evidence of nature do not exist.

original: de bas na rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can sems can bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos 'bras bu'i rtags las dge ba dang mi dge ba la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa de la bsgrub par bya
analyzed: de bas na rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can sems can bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos 'bras bu'i rtags las dge ba dang mi dge ba la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa de la bsgrub par bya
translated: Therefore, in the subject, sentient beings who are happy and suffering, the sign of the effect, the property of the subject, is the direct perception of the existence of virtue and nonvirtue.🔽The probandum is the nonexpiration of virtue and nonvirtue.

original: ba'i chos las dge ba dang mi dge ba chud mi za ba mngon sum gyis ma dmigs pa de chud mi za bar rjes su dpag ste /
analyzed: ba'i chos las dge ba dang mi dge ba chud mi za ba mngon sum gyis ma dmigs pa de chud mi za bar rjes su dpag ste /
translated: The nonexpiration of virtue and nonvirtue is inferred from the direct perception of the existence of virtue and nonvirtue.

original: de ltar chos can sems can la bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can las dge ba dang mi dge ba chud mi za bar sgrub par byed //
analyzed: de ltar chos can sems can la bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can las dge ba dang mi dge ba chud mi za bar sgrub par byed //
translated: Thus, in the subject, sentient beings who are happy and suffering, the nonexpiration of virtue and nonvirtue is established.🔽The sign of the effect, the property of the subject, is the direct perception of the existence of virtue and nonvirtue.

original: phyogs kyi chos 'bras bu'i rtags las dge ba dang mi dge ba la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa yod pa nyid de de yang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa de las skyes pa'i tshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yin pas //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos 'bras bu'i rtags las dge ba dang mi dge ba la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa yod pa nyid de de yang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa de las skyes pa'i tshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yin pas //
translated: That is the relation of the nature of the effect that arises from the probandum and the proof.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the reason of effect.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni chos mthun pa'i dpe ste //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni chos mthun pa'i dpe ste //
translated: The method of existence in the discordant side is the similar example.

original: gang la las dge ba dang mi dge ba la gnas pa'i mngon sum du dmigs pa de la ni las dge ba dang mi dge ba chud mi za ba ste /
analyzed: gang la las dge ba dang mi dge ba la gnas pa'i mngon sum du dmigs pa de la ni las dge ba dang mi dge ba chud mi za ba ste /
translated: In regard to that which is the perception of the virtuous and non-virtuous actions, there is the non-wastage of the virtuous and non-virtuous actions.🔽For example, in regard to the internal and external formations, the lack of independence which is renowned to all the worlds is perceived and applied.

original: dper na nang dang phyi rol gyi 'du byed rnams la 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa'i rang dbang med pa dmigs pa nye bar @150b sbyar ba dang phyi rol dag la yang 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa'i 'byor pa dang rgud pa dmigs pa nye ba🔽lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na nang dang phyi rol gyi 'du byed rnams la 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa'i rang dbang med pa dmigs pa nye bar @150b sbyar ba dang phyi rol dag la yang 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa'i 'byor pa dang rgud pa dmigs pa nye ba lta bu ste /
translated: And in regard to the external, the prosperity and decline which are renowned to all the worlds are perceived and applied.

original: de yang rang gi rigs kyi dpe nyi bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid nye bar bstan pa'i skabs su 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: de yang rang gi rigs kyi dpe nyi bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid nye bar bstan pa'i skabs su 'og nas ston to //
translated: That will be taught later in the section which demonstrates the characteristics of the application of the similar example of one's own type.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ste /
translated: The method of certainty of non-existence in the discordant side is the dissimilar example.

original: de yang lung dang tshad ma gzhan dag las ni dngos su yag bstan te /
analyzed: de yang lung dang tshad ma gzhan dag las ni dngos su yag bstan te /
translated: Moreover, the Buddha directly taught this in other scriptures and valid cognitions.

original: skabs 'dir ni chos mthun pa'i dpes rjes su 'gro ba bstan pas chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i ldog pa zhar la 'grub pas bcom ldan 'das kyis ma bstan te /
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni chos mthun pa'i dpes rjes su 'gro ba bstan pas chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i ldog pa zhar la 'grub pas bcom ldan 'das kyis ma bstan te /
translated: In this context, he did not teach it because the reverse of the example of a concordant quality is established by implication through teaching the forward mode of the example of a concordant quality.

original: shes par 'dod na ni gnag la las dge ba dang mi dge ba la gnas pa mngon sum du mi dmigs pa de la ni las dge ba dang mi dge ba chud mi za ba med de //
analyzed: shes par 'dod na ni gnag la las dge ba dang mi dge ba la gnas pa mngon sum du mi dmigs pa de la ni las dge ba dang mi dge ba chud mi za ba med de //
translated: If you wish to understand this, then in the case of a person who is black and who is seen not to be engaged in virtue or nonvirtue, the virtuous and nonvirtuous karma of that person does not perish.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog lta bu'i zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog lta bu'i zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: For example, it is like a sky flower.”

original: de ltar tshul gsum pa'i rtags dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu'i rtags de yag gtan tshigs kyi skyon ma grub pa dang 'gal ba dang ma nges pa spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar tshul gsum pa'i rtags dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu'i rtags de yag gtan tshigs kyi skyon ma grub pa dang 'gal ba dang ma nges pa spangs pa yin te /
translated: Thus the effect that possesses the three modes of a reason is a reason that is free of the faults of a reason, such as not being established, being contradictory, and being uncertain.

original: snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: As before, apply this as appropriate.

original: gang gis mngon sum du ma gyur pa la rjes su dpag par bya ba zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i don spyor bstan pa ste rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: gang gis mngon sum du ma gyur pa la rjes su dpag par bya ba zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i don spyor bstan pa ste rjes su dpag go //
translated: That which is not directly perceived is to be inferred is the statement of the meaning of inference and the application of inference. It is inferred.

original: phyogs ni gang mngon sum gyis dmigs pa de'i rjes su 'jug pa'i blo de dang 'brel ba'i dngos po mngon sum gyis ma dmigs pa yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis ma bskal ba lkog tu gyur ba'i don las rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no zhes
analyzed: phyogs ni gang mngon sum gyis dmigs pa de'i rjes su 'jug pa'i blo de dang 'brel ba'i dngos po mngon sum gyis ma dmigs pa yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis ma bskal ba lkog tu gyur ba'i don las rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no zhes
translated: The position is that which is directly perceived. The cognition that follows that is the cognition that is related to it. The thing that is not directly perceived, not separated from the object, time, and nature, is the hidden object. It is to be inferred.

original: ston te / gang gis zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa de dang bcas pa'i skyes su la bya'o //
analyzed: ston te / gang gis zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa de dang bcas pa'i skyes su la bya'o //
translated: It is taught that by which refers to the proof along with the subject.

original: mngon sum du ma gyur pa zhes bya ba sgrub pas bsgribs ba la bya'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du ma gyur pa zhes bya ba sgrub pas bsgribs ba la bya'o //
translated: That which is not directly perceived is obscured by the proof.

original: rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur ba'i don rtogs pa 'dod cing 'jal ba la bya ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur ba'i don rtogs pa 'dod cing 'jal ba la bya ste /
translated: Inference is the desire to understand and the measurement of the hidden object.

original: de la tshul gsum pa'i rtogs kyis rnag bzhin gyi don rjes su dpag pa ni snga ma bzhin ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la tshul gsum pa'i rtogs kyis rnag bzhin gyi don rjes su dpag pa ni snga ma bzhin ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: The inference of the meaning of the property of the subject by the trimodal reason is as before, as is fitting.🔽Whatever is similar to that is also like that.

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba la tshul gsum pa'i rtags dang rang bzhin gyi don rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid sngar bstan pa de lta bu dang mthun pa gzhan dag dang ci rigs🔽par sbyar te /
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba la tshul gsum pa'i rtags dang rang bzhin gyi don rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid sngar bstan pa de lta bu dang mthun pa gzhan dag dang ci rigs par sbyar te /
translated: Whatever is similar to the previously explained definition of the inference of the meaning of the property of the subject by the trimodal reason and natural reason in the object to be inferred is also like that, as is fitting.

original: de yang mi dmigs pa la dngos po med par rjes su dpag pa dang rang bzhin las mi rtag pa la sogs par rjes su dpag pa dang 'bras @151a * //
analyzed: de yang mi dmigs pa la dngos po med par rjes su dpag pa dang rang bzhin las mi rtag pa la sogs par rjes su dpag pa dang 'bras @151a * //
translated: That is also the inference of the nonexistence of a thing by nonobservation, the inference of impermanence from nature, and so on, and the inference of the cause from the effect.

original: bu las rgyu rjes su dpag pa thams cad du yang tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyis rang dang gzhan gyi don rjes su dpag par bya ste /
analyzed: bu las rgyu rjes su dpag pa thams cad du yang tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyis rang dang gzhan gyi don rjes su dpag par bya ste /
translated: In all cases, the meaning of the property of the subject is to be inferred by the trimodal reason for oneself and for others.

original: de la mi dmigs pa las dngos po med pa dang rjes su dpag par bya ba la tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags dang ji ltar sbyar zhe na /🔽rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni dper na phyogs kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig na bum pa med de /
analyzed: de la mi dmigs pa las dngos po med pa dang rjes su dpag par bya ba la tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags dang ji ltar sbyar zhe na / rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni dper na phyogs kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig na bum pa med de /
translated: How is the nonobservation of something that can be observed related to the sign that has the three modes in a logical reason that proves an imperceptible and an inference?

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs par gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs par gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: The mode of existence in an inference is like the following example: “A pot does not exist in some specific place because of not being observed although it can be observed.”

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni chos can bum pa med pa'i phyogs kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig na'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni chos can bum pa med pa'i phyogs kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig na'o //
translated: “In an inference” means that the subject, a pot, does not exist in some specific place.

original: yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos can bum pa med pa'i phyogs kyi bye brag de ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dngos po med pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi dmigs pa'i rtags mi dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i bum pa mi dmigs pa
analyzed: yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos can bum pa med pa'i phyogs kyi bye brag de ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dngos po med pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi dmigs pa'i rtags mi dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i bum pa mi dmigs pa
translated: “Existence” means that the subject, the nonexistence of a pot in some specific place, is the property of the subject in the proof of the probandum, nonentity, by the sign, the nonobservation of the nonobservation of a pot that can be observed.

original: yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: yod pa nyid de /
translated: It is existence.

original: de'i phyir chos can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos can zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the subject.

original: skabs 'dir chos de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang rgyu dang sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i rtags ni med do //
analyzed: skabs 'dir chos de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang rgyu dang sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i rtags ni med do //
translated: In this context, the property to be established, such as impermanence, and the property of the subject, such as the reason based on nature or effect, do not exist.

original: de bas na rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos bum pa med pa'i phyogs kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig na sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi dmigs pa'i rtags bum pa mngon du dmigs pa de las bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dngos po med pa nyid mngon
analyzed: de bas na rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos bum pa med pa'i phyogs kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig na sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi dmigs pa'i rtags bum pa mngon du dmigs pa de las bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dngos po med pa nyid mngon
translated: Therefore, in some specific place where the property to be inferred, the absence of a pot, exists, the property of the subject, the reason based on non-observation of a perceptible object, the non-observation of a pot, establishes the property to be established, the absence of a pot.

original: sum gyis ma dmigs pa de dngos po med pa nyid du rjes su dpag ste /
analyzed: sum gyis ma dmigs pa de dngos po med pa nyid du rjes su dpag ste /
translated: That non-observation by direct perception infers the absence of a pot.

original: de ltar chos can bum pa med pa'i phyogs kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dngos po med pa nyid sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi chos mi dmigs pa'i rtags bum pa med pa mngon sum du dmigs pa de nyid ni bsgrub par bya
analyzed: de ltar chos can bum pa med pa'i phyogs kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dngos po med pa nyid sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi chos mi dmigs pa'i rtags bum pa med pa mngon sum du dmigs pa de nyid ni bsgrub par bya
translated: Thus, in some specific places where the subject, the pot, does not exist, the evidence of non-observation of a non-object that proves the property of the probandum, the non-existence of the object, is directly observed.

original: ba dang sgrub par byed pa med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yin pas de'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ba dang sgrub par byed pa med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yin pas de'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs zhes bya'o //
translated: That very non-observation of the pot is the relation characterized by the invariable concomitance of the probandum and the proof. Therefore, it is called the reason of non-observation.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni chos mthun pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni chos mthun pa'i dpe ste /
translated: The mode of existence in the similar class is the example of the similar class.

original: phyogs kyi bye brag gang na dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i bum pa mi dmigs pa de na bum pa med de /
analyzed: phyogs kyi bye brag gang na dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i bum pa mi dmigs pa de na bum pa med de /
translated: In whatever specific place the non-observation of the pot that is an object of non-observation exists, there the pot does not exist.

original: dper na bar snang stong pa bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na bar snang stong pa bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: For example, it is like the empty space.

original: de yang rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs nas de lta bu dang mthun pa gang @151b yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ci rigs par ston to //
analyzed: de yang rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs nas de lta bu dang mthun pa gang @151b yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ci rigs par ston to //
translated: Moreover, the expression “whatever is similar to that” is used in the context of the definition of an example that is similar to the object to be inferred.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ste /
translated: The mode of ascertaining that the reason is absent in the discordant side is the example of the dissimilar class.

original: de yang lung dang tshad ma gzhan dag las ni dngos su yang bstan skabs 'dir ni chos mthun pa'i dpes rjes su 'gro bas bstan pa chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i ldog pa zhar la 'grub pas bcom ldan 'das kyis dngos su ma bstan te /
analyzed: de yang lung dang tshad ma gzhan dag las ni dngos su yang bstan skabs 'dir ni chos mthun pa'i dpes rjes su 'gro bas bstan pa chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i ldog pa zhar la 'grub pas bcom ldan 'das kyis dngos su ma bstan te /
translated: In the scriptures and other valid means of knowledge, this is directly taught. In this context, it is taught by the example of the similar class through concomitance, and the contraposition of the example of the dissimilar class is established incidentally. Therefore, it is not directly taught by the Blessed One.

original: shes par 'dod na ni phyogs bye brag gang na dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i bum pa dmigs pa de na bum pa yod de /
analyzed: shes par 'dod na ni phyogs bye brag gang na dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i bum pa dmigs pa de na bum pa yod de /
translated: If one wishes to understand, one should say: “Wherever the object to be perceived, the vase, is perceived, there the vase exists,

original: dper na dngul gzhong gi steng du rgun 'brum blugs pa bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na dngul gzhong gi steng du rgun 'brum blugs pa bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: just as, for example, when grapes are placed on a silver platter.”

original: de ltar tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i mi dmigs pa'i rtags de yang gtan tshigs kyi skyon gsum po ma grub pa dang 'gal ba dang ma nges pa spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i mi dmigs pa'i rtags de yang gtan tshigs kyi skyon gsum po ma grub pa dang 'gal ba dang ma nges pa spangs pa yin te /
translated: Such a reason that does not observe the three modes is free from the three faults of a reason: unestablished, contradictory, and inconclusive.

original: snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: As before, apply as appropriate.

original: de la rang bzhin las mi rtag pa la sogs par rjes su dpag par bya ba la tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags dang ji ltar sbyar zhe na /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin las mi rtag pa la sogs par rjes su dpag par bya ba la tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags dang ji ltar sbyar zhe na /
translated: How is the trimodal reason applied to the inference of impermanence and so on from the essence?

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni dper na sgra ni mi rtag pa ste byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni dper na sgra ni mi rtag pa ste byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: The mode of existence in the object of inference is, for example, “Sound is impermanent because it is produced.”

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni chos can sgra la'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni chos can sgra la'o //
translated: “In the object of inference” refers to the subject, sound.

original: yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos can sgra de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mi rtag pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rang bzhin gyi rtags byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos can sgra de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mi rtag pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rang bzhin gyi rtags byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yod pa nyid de /
translated: The term existence is the subject, sound, and the property to be established is impermanence. The property of the subject is the reason of nature, because of being produced.

original: de'i phyir chos can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos can zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the subject.

original: skabs 'dir yang chos can de bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dngos po med pa dang rgyu dang sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi dmigs pa dang dmigs pa dang 'bras bu'i rtags ni med do //
analyzed: skabs 'dir yang chos can de bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dngos po med pa dang rgyu dang sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi dmigs pa dang dmigs pa dang 'bras bu'i rtags ni med do //
translated: In this context, the subject, the property to be established, non-entity, cause, and the property of the subject, non-observation, observation, and effect, are not reasons.

original: de bas na rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can sgra de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rang bzhin gyi rtags byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba mngon sum du dmigs pa de las bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mi rtag pa nyid mngon sum gyis
analyzed: de bas na rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can sgra de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rang bzhin gyi rtags byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba mngon sum du dmigs pa de las bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mi rtag pa nyid mngon sum gyis
translated: Therefore, the subject to be inferred is sound. The property to be established is impermanence. The property of the subject is the reason of nature, because of being produced. This is directly observed. From that, the property to be established, impermanence, is not directly observed.

original: ma dmigs te mi rtag pa nyid du rjes su dpag ste /
analyzed: ma dmigs te mi rtag pa nyid du rjes su dpag ste /
translated: Impermanence is inferred.

original: de ltar chos can sgra de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mi rtag pa nyid sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rang bzhin gyi rtags byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba mngon sum du dmigs pa yod pa nyid de yang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed
analyzed: de ltar chos can sgra de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mi rtag pa nyid sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rang bzhin gyi rtags byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba mngon sum du dmigs pa yod pa nyid de yang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed
translated: Thus, in regard to the subject, sound, the attribute to be proven, impermanence, is proven by the attribute of the subject, the reason of nature, because of being produced. The direct perception that exists is the probandum and the proof.🔽

original: pa de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yin pas /
analyzed: pa de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yin pas /
translated: Thus, in regard to the subject, sound, the attribute to be established is impermanence, and the attribute of the position that establishes it is the reason of nature, “because of being produced.” The existence of the direct perception of that is the relation of the nature of the object to be established and the proof.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs zhes bya'o //🔽mthun @152a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs zhes bya'o // mthun @152a * //
translated: Therefore it is called a reason of nature.

original: pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni chos mthun pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni chos mthun pa'i dpe ste /
translated: The mode of existence in similar instances is the example of a similar class.

original: gang la byas pa yod pa de ni mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: gang la byas pa yod pa de ni mi rtag pa ste /
translated: Whatever is produced is impermanent,

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: like a pot.

original: de yang rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs nas de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya bas ci rigs par ston to //
analyzed: de yang rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs nas de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya bas ci rigs par ston to //
translated: That is taught by “whatever is similar to that” in the section that teaches the definition of applying an example of one’s own class.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ste /
translated: The mode of ascertaining that the reason does not exist in the discordant side is the dissimilar example.

original: de yang lung dang tshad ma gzhan dag las ni dngos su yang bstan /
analyzed: de yang lung dang tshad ma gzhan dag las ni dngos su yang bstan /
translated: That is also directly taught in other scriptures and valid cognitions.🔽In this context, the dissimilar example is implicitly established by teaching the forward mode of the similar example.

original: skabs 'dir ni mthun pa'i dpes rjes su 'gro ba bstan pas chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i ldog pa zhar la 'grub pas bcom ldan 'das kyis dngos su ma bstan te /🔽shes par 'dod na ni gang la byas pa med pa de ni rtag pa ste /
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni mthun pa'i dpes rjes su 'gro ba bstan pas chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i ldog pa zhar la 'grub pas bcom ldan 'das kyis dngos su ma bstan te / shes par 'dod na ni gang la byas pa med pa de ni rtag pa ste /
translated: Therefore the Lord did not teach it explicitly.

original: dper na 'dus ma byas lta bu'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na 'dus ma byas lta bu'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: If one wishes to understand it, one should say, “Whatever is without activity is permanent, like unconditioned space.”

original: de ltar tshul gsum dang ldan pa rang bzhin gyi rtags de yang gtan tshigs kyi skyon gsum po ma grub pa dang / 'gal ba dang / ma nges pa spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar tshul gsum dang ldan pa rang bzhin gyi rtags de yang gtan tshigs kyi skyon gsum po ma grub pa dang / 'gal ba dang / ma nges pa spangs pa yin te /
translated: That natural reason endowed with the three modes is free from the three faults of a reason: nonestablishment, contradiction, and inconclusiveness.

original: snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: As before, it is applied as appropriate.

original: de la 'bras bu las rgyu rjes su dpag par bya ba la /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu las rgyu rjes su dpag par bya ba la /
translated: In the inference of the cause from the effect,

original: tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags dang ji ltar sbyar zhe na /
analyzed: tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags dang ji ltar sbyar zhe na /
translated: How is the trimodal condition related to the reason?

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni dper na gang na du ba 'thul ba de na me yod do zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni dper na gang na du ba 'thul ba de na me yod do zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: The trimodal condition of existence in the inferential object is like the statement, “Where there is smoke, there is fire.”🔽“Existence in the inferential object” means that the subject, “where there is smoke,” is the subject of the statement, “where there is smoke, there is fire.”

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni chos can sa phyogs gang na du ba 'thul ba'i sa phyogs de na me yod pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos can phyogs gang na du ba 'thul ba'i sa phyogs de na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos me
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni chos can sa phyogs gang na du ba 'thul ba'i sa phyogs de na me yod pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos can phyogs gang na du ba 'thul ba'i sa phyogs de na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos me
translated: The subject, “where there is smoke,” is the subject of the statement, “where there is smoke, there is fire.”

original: grub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos 'bras bu'i rtags du ba 'thul ba mngon sum du dmigs pa yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: grub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos 'bras bu'i rtags du ba 'thul ba mngon sum du dmigs pa yod pa nyid de /
translated: The existence of the effect-evidence, “smoke,” which is the property of the subject, is directly perceived.

original: de'i phyir chos can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos can zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the subject.

original: skabs 'dir yang chos can de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dngos po med pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi dmigs pa dang rang bzhin gyi rtags ni med do //
analyzed: skabs 'dir yang chos can de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dngos po med pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi dmigs pa dang rang bzhin gyi rtags ni med do //
translated: In this context, there is no non-existent property to be established in that subject, nor is there an impermanent property, etc., nor is there an observation of a property of the subject that establishes it, nor is there a reason of nature.

original: de bas na rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can sa phyogs gang na du ba 'thul ba'i phyogs den sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos 'bras bu'i rtags du ba 'thul ba mngon sum du dmigs pa de las bsgrub par bya ba'i chos me mngon sum gyis
analyzed: de bas na rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can sa phyogs gang na du ba 'thul ba'i phyogs den sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos 'bras bu'i rtags du ba 'thul ba mngon sum du dmigs pa de las bsgrub par bya ba'i chos me mngon sum gyis
translated: Therefore, in the subject to be inferred, the place where smoke occurs, the property of the subject that establishes it, the occurrence of smoke as a reason of effect, is directly observed. From that, the property to be established, fire, is not directly observed.

original: ma dmigs pa @152b de yod pa nyid du rjes su dpag ste /
analyzed: ma dmigs pa @152b de yod pa nyid du rjes su dpag ste /
translated: That existence is inferred.

original: de ltar chos can sa phyogs gang na du ba 'thul ba'i sa phyogs de na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos me sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos 'bras bu'i rtags du pa 'thul ba mngon sum du dmigs pa yod pa nyid de yang bsgrub par bya ba dang
analyzed: de ltar chos can sa phyogs gang na du ba 'thul ba'i sa phyogs de na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos me sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos 'bras bu'i rtags du pa 'thul ba mngon sum du dmigs pa yod pa nyid de yang bsgrub par bya ba dang
translated: Thus, in any place where there is smoke, that place is the property of the subject that is the probandum, fire. The property of the subject that is the effect, the sign, is the direct observation of the existence of the smoke.

original: sgrub par byed pa de las skyes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yin pas de'i phyir 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa de las skyes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yin pas de'i phyir 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, because of the relationship of being produced from that, the probandum and the proof are related. Therefore, it is called a reason of effect.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni /
translated: The mode of existence in the similar class is

original: chos mthun pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: chos mthun pa'i dpe ste /
translated: the example of the similar class.

original: gang na du ba 'thul ba de na me yod de dper na tshad bang lta bu'o zhes bya ba de yang rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs nas de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya bas
analyzed: gang na du ba 'thul ba de na me yod de dper na tshad bang lta bu'o zhes bya ba de yang rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs nas de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya bas
translated: “ Wherever there is smoke, there is fire, like in a kitchen.” This is taught in the section on the definition of applying an example from one’s own class, “Whatever is like that . . .”

original: ci rigs par ston to //
analyzed: ci rigs par ston to //
translated: is taught as appropriate.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ste /
translated: The mode of ascertaining that the reason does not exist in a discordant object is the dissimilar example.

original: de yang lung dang tshad ma gzhan dag las ni dngos su yang bstan /
analyzed: de yang lung dang tshad ma gzhan dag las ni dngos su yang bstan /
translated: That is directly taught in other scriptures and valid knowledges.

original: skabs 'dir ni chos mthun pa'i dpes rjes su 'gro ba bstan pas chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i ldog pa zhar la 'grub pas bcom ldan 'das kyis dngos su ma bstan te /
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni chos mthun pa'i dpes rjes su 'gro ba bstan pas chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i ldog pa zhar la 'grub pas bcom ldan 'das kyis dngos su ma bstan te /
translated: In this context, since the forward pervasion is taught by the similar example, the reverse pervasion of the dissimilar example is established as a byproduct. Therefore the Bhagavat did not directly teach it.

original: shes par 'dod na ni gang du du ba mi 'thul ba de na me med de /
analyzed: shes par 'dod na ni gang du du ba mi 'thul ba de na me med de /
translated: If one wishes to know it, one should say, “Where there is no smoke, there is no fire,

original: dper na rdzing chen po lta bu'o zhes bya ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dper na rdzing chen po lta bu'o zhes bya ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: like a great lake.”

original: de ltar tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu'i rtags de yang gtan tshigs kyi skyon gsum po ma grub pa dang / 'gal ba dang / ma nges pa spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu'i rtags de yang gtan tshigs kyi skyon gsum po ma grub pa dang / 'gal ba dang / ma nges pa spangs pa yin te /
translated: That effect reason, which possesses the three modes, is also free of the three faults of a reason: nonestablishment, contradiction, and inconclusiveness.

original: snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: As before, apply as appropriate.

original: de ltar rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi dmigs pa'am rang bzhin nam 'bras bu'i rtags so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa gnas🔽pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid kyi rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul bas mngon sum du dmigs pa'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dngos po med pa'am mi rtag pa la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi dmigs pa'am rang bzhin nam 'bras bu'i rtags so so'i shes pa'i don mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa gnas pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid kyi rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul bas mngon sum du dmigs pa'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dngos po med pa'am mi rtag pa la sogs pa'am /
translated: Thus, in regard to that subject that is to be inferred, the object of direct perception that is the object of the reason of nature or effect that is the property of the subject of the proof is directly observed by nonerroneous direct perception free from conceptuality that is the definition of direct perception.

original: rgyu bshad pa'i don rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul lkog tu gyur pa'i don spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis ma bskal ba de rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid tshul @153a * //
analyzed: rgyu bshad pa'i don rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul lkog tu gyur pa'i don spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis ma bskal ba de rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid tshul @153a * //
translated: The object of the reason of nature or effect that is the property of the subject of the proof is either the nonexistence of a thing or impermanence and so on or the object of the reason of cause that is the object of inferential valid knowledge, which is the definition of an object of comprehension that is an object of inferential valid knowledge.

original: gsum pa nyid kyi rtags kyis rjes su dpag ste /
analyzed: gsum pa nyid kyi rtags kyis rjes su dpag ste /
translated: It is not separated from space, time, and nature, and it is inferred by the definition of inferential valid knowledge, which is a sign that has the three modes.

original: rang gis rtogs pa dang gzhan la go bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: rang gis rtogs pa dang gzhan la go bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Whatever is one's own realization and the understanding of others is the characteristic of the direct perception that abides in that.

original: tshig gi don ni gong du bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni gong du bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the words is as explained above.

original: de'i 'og tu rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: After that, in order to teach the purity by the characteristic of applying the example of one's own type to the valid knowledge of inference,

original: nang dang phyi rol gyi 'du byed rnams la 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa'i 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba mi dmigs pa nye bar sbyar ba dang / skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dmigs pa nye bar sbyar ba dang / rang dbang med pa dmigs pa nye bar sbyar ba dang /
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol gyi 'du byed rnams la 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa'i 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba mi dmigs pa nye bar sbyar ba dang / skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dmigs pa nye bar sbyar ba dang / rang dbang med pa dmigs pa nye bar sbyar ba dang /
translated: the non-observation of death and rebirth that is renowned to all worlds in relation to internal and external formations is applied, the observation of the suffering of birth and so on is applied, and the observation of lack of independence is applied.

original: phyi rol dag la yang 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa'i 'byor pa dang rgud pa dmigs pa nye bar sbyar ba dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe ste nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //🔽rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la rang gi zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul gyis rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can sgrub par
analyzed: phyi rol dag la yang 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa'i 'byor pa dang rgud pa dmigs pa nye bar sbyar ba dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe ste nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs so // rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la rang gi zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul gyis rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can sgrub par
translated: And in the case of external things, it is the application of the observation of the prosperity and adversity that is well known to the whole world. And that which is similar to that is the example of one's own class. This should be known as the definition of application.🔽As for the definition of the example of one's own class, one's own means that the existence of the property of the subject in the inferential subject is applied to the property of the subject in the probandum.

original: byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos yod pa nyid bstan pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos yod pa nyid bstan pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is the teaching of the existence of the property of the subject that establishes the probandum.

original: rigs kyi dpe zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul bstan pa de dang chos mthun pa'i dpe ste mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid kyi tshul gyis rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi dpe zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul bstan pa de dang chos mthun pa'i dpe ste mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid kyi tshul gyis rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The “example of the same type” is an example that has the same mode of being as that which is to be inferred. It is applied to the demonstration of the pervasion by the mode of being that exists in the similar class.

original: nye bar sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul bstan pa de dang chos mthun pa'i dpe de 'dra bar sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul bstan pa de dang chos mthun pa'i dpe de 'dra bar sbyar ba'o //
translated: “Application” is the application of that example that has the same mode of being as that which is to be inferred.

original: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: “Definition” is the definition of inferential valid knowledge.

original: de ltar rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul bstan pa de mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i dpes rjes su 'gro ba nyid du grub na mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa yang zhar la 'grub pas de ni rjes su dpag pa'i tshad🔽ma'i mtshan nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul bstan pa de mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i dpes rjes su 'gro ba nyid du grub na mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa yang zhar la 'grub pas de ni rjes su dpag pa'i tshad🔽ma'i mtshan nyid yin pa'o //
translated: Thus, when the mode of being that exists in that which is to be inferred is demonstrated, if the pervasion is established by the example that exists in the similar class, the exclusion from the dissimilar class is also established as a matter of course. That is the definition of inferential valid knowledge.

original: de ltar na rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid des yongs su dag ste /
analyzed: de ltar na rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid des yongs su dag ste /
translated: Thus, inference as a valid means of knowledge is completely pure by virtue of the definition of applying an example from its own type.

original: tshad mar rung la rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar @153b pa'i mtshan nyid di yang mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid kyi tshul gyis ngo bo nyid gcig par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshad mar rung la rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar @153b pa'i mtshan nyid di yang mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid kyi tshul gyis ngo bo nyid gcig par rig par bya'o //
translated: Inference as a valid means of knowledge and the definition of applying an example from its own type are to be understood as having the same nature in terms of the definition and the definiendum.

original: de la 'dir rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i tshig bzhi smos pa la /

translated: Moreover, nonapprehension is the inference of nonexistence, nature is the inference of impermanence and so on, and effect is the inference of cause. The subject of the inference is a specific part of a place where a pot does not exist. The sign of nonapprehension of the property of the subject is the nonexistence of a pot.

original: mngon sum du dmigs pa de las bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dngos po med pa nyid mngon sum gyis ma dmigs pa de dngos po med pa nyid du rjes su dpag ste zhes bya ba'i chos mthun pa'i dpe ni phyogs kyi bye brag gang na dmigs pa'i rig

translated: The nonapprehension of the property of the subject, the nonexistence of a pot, is directly perceived. From that, the property to be proven, the nonexistence of the pot, is inferred by nonapprehension. The similar example is a specific part of a place where a pot is not apprehended.

original: byar gyur pa'i bum pa mi dmigs pa de bum pa med de dper na bar snang stong ba bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //

translated: In the case of the inference of impermanence from essence, the property of the subject in the probandum is sound, and the property of the position that proves it is the reason of essence, which is directly observed.

analyzed: lung zhes bya ba ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyis chos mthun par bstan pa'i lung ste /
translated: “authoritative texts” refers to the teachings in accord with the Dharma that are spoken by all the buddhas of the three times.

original: des ni rtogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni rtogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin par bstan to //
translated: This indicates that the Omniscient One is realized.

analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa gtan la dbab par bstan pa zhes bya ba ni rang gis tshad mar byas pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan la ;

translated: This teaches that there is no contradiction in the words of the scriptures that it teaches.

translated: The “characteristic” is the characteristic of the authoritative testimony of trustworthy words. The “authoritative testimony of trustworthy words” is that the teacher is omniscient and that there is no contradiction in the words of the scriptures that he taught.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni chos kyi phyag rgya gsum po rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa ston pas bstan pa yin te /

analyzed: de ltar na yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma ni lung shin tu rnam par dag pa gtan la dbab pa bstan pa'i mtshan nyid des yongs su dag ste tshad mar rung la /
translated: Thus, the valid testimony of trustworthy scripture is completely pure and suitable as a valid means of knowledge by means of the definition of the teaching of ascertainment of completely pure scripture.

original: yid ches pa'i lung la tshad ma dang lung shin tu rnam par dag pa gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid de yang mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi tshul gyis ngo bo nyid gcig par rig par bya'o //

translated: And the valid testimony of trustworthy scripture and the definition of the teaching of ascertainment of completely pure scripture are to be known as having the same nature by means of the definition and the mode of the definition.
