translated: The phrase such as 'nirvana is peace' indicates that the scriptures are characterized by the following:

original: de la mya ngan las 'das pa ni rnam pa gnyis te ;
analyzed: de la mya ngan las 'das pa ni rnam pa gnyis te ;
translated: Nirvana is of two types:

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'o //
translated: that which has the remainder of the aggregates and that which lacks the remainder of the aggregates.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni nyon mongs pa zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni nyon mongs pa zhi ba yin no //
translated: “Peace” is the peace of the afflictions in nirvana with remainder.

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni nyon mongs pa dang phung po zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni nyon mongs pa dang phung po zhi ba yin no //
translated: “ Cessation” is the peace of the afflictions and the aggregates in nirvana without remainder.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa de yang theg pa chen po dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa de yang theg pa chen po dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That nirvana is twofold in terms of the Mahayana and the vehicle of the śrāvakas.

original: de la theg pa chen po'i tshul ni chos thams cad gdod ma nas zhi bas rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das par khong du chud de /
analyzed: de la theg pa chen po'i tshul ni chos thams cad gdod ma nas zhi bas rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das par khong du chud de /
translated: In the Mahayana, nirvana is understood to be the primordial peace of all phenomena, their natural nirvana.

original: chos de dag kyang mya ngan las las bzlar med pas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag kyang mya ngan las las bzlar med pas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Since those phenomena are not turned into nirvana, nirvana is nonabiding.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i tshul ni sdug bsngal gyis skyo bar dmigs nas sdug bsngal zhi ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i tshul ni sdug bsngal gyis skyo bar dmigs nas sdug bsngal zhi ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: In the vehicle of the śrāvakas, nirvana is the peace of suffering, which is observed as a source of weariness.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa de yang drang ba'i don dang nges pa'i don gyi bye brag tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa de yang drang ba'i don dang nges pa'i don gyi bye brag tu shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the two kinds of scriptures should be understood as the distinction between the interpretable meaning and the definitive meaning.

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa'i gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis po dag las yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa'i don mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul🔽ma yin pa rang gi tshad mar bya ba gang dag bstan pa dag kyang bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa'i gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis po dag las yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa'i don mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul ma yin pa rang gi tshad mar bya ba gang dag bstan pa dag kyang bsdu ba'o //
translated: What is similar to that? means that the scriptures of the Omniscient One, which are included in the twelve branches of the scriptures, teach that one should make one's own valid cognition the object of one's own valid cognition, which is not the object of direct perception or inference, of meanings that are distant in terms of place, time, and nature.

original: de ltar gtan la dbab par bstan pa thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis po dag las yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal ba'i don mngon
analyzed: de ltar gtan la dbab par bstan pa thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis po dag las yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal ba'i don mngon
translated: What is similar to that? means that the scriptures of the Omniscient One, which are included in the twelve branches of the scriptures, teach that one should make one's own valid cognition the object of one's own valid cognition, which is not the object of direct perception or inference, of meanings that are distant in terms of place, time, and nature.

original: sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul ma yin pa rang gi tshad mar bya ba gang dag bstan pa de ni lung @157b shin tu rnam par dag pa'i gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul ma yin pa rang gi tshad mar bya ba gang dag bstan pa de ni lung @157b shin tu rnam par dag pa'i gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The teaching of those that are not the objects of valid knowledge based on direct perception or inference, but are to be known by one's own valid knowledge, is the characteristic of the teaching of the extremely pure scriptural tradition.

original: de ni smras pa'i don yid chas pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i yul shin tu lkog tu gyur ba'i don rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni smras pa'i don yid chas pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i yul shin tu lkog tu gyur ba'i don rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that this is the object of the extremely hidden meaning, which is the object of the valid knowledge of scriptural tradition that inspires confidence in the meaning that is expressed, and is included by the characteristics of the general and specific natures.

original: de lta bas na mtshan nyid lnga po de dag gis rigs pas brtags pa yongs su dag pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na mtshan nyid lnga po de dag gis rigs pas brtags pa yongs su dag pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the investigation by reasoning with those five characteristics is pure.

original: yongs su dag pa'i phyir bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid lnga po de dag gi mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i phyir bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid lnga po de dag gi mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: Because it is pure, it should be taught. This is the conclusion of those five characteristics of purity.

original: de la de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni so so'i shes pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa bsgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par bya ba de bsgrub par bya ba la mngon
analyzed: de la de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni so so'i shes pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul mngon sum gyi don rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa bsgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par bya ba de bsgrub par bya ba la mngon
translated: The object of direct perception, which is the object of direct perception that is the object of individual cognition, is included in the nature of the object of direct perception. The proof and the proper understanding of that are established by the valid cognition of direct perception.

original: sum gyi tshad ma'i rigs pas brtags pa yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: sum gyi tshad ma'i rigs pas brtags pa yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: The investigation by the reasoning of the valid cognition of direct perception is pure.

original: de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid kyis ni bshad pa'i don rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul lkog tu gyur ba'i don spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa sgrub pa dang legs par
analyzed: de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid kyis ni bshad pa'i don rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul lkog tu gyur ba'i don spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa sgrub pa dang legs par
translated: The object of inference, which is the object of the valid cognition of inference, is included in the nature of the universal of the hidden object. The proof and the proper understanding of that are established by the valid cognition of inference.

original: khong du chud par bya ba de grub par gyur pa rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i rigs pas brtags pa yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: khong du chud par bya ba de grub par gyur pa rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i rigs pas brtags pa yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: The investigation by the reasoning of the valid cognition of inference is pure.

original: yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni de gnyi ga'i don sgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par bya ba de grub par bya ba la tshad ma gnyi ga'i rigs pas brtags pa yongs su dag pa yin no //🔽lung shin tu rnam par dag pa gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni smras pa'i don yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i yul shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa sgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni de gnyi ga'i don sgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par bya ba de grub par bya ba la tshad ma gnyi ga'i rigs pas brtags pa yongs su dag pa yin no // lung shin tu rnam par dag pa gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni smras pa'i don yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i yul shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa sgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud
translated: By the character of complete purity, the establishment of the meaning of both of those, and the thorough understanding of them, is purified by the investigation with the reasoning of both authorities.

original: par bya ba de bsgrub par bya ba yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i rigs pas brtags pa yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: par bya ba de bsgrub par bya ba yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i rigs pas brtags pa yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: By the character of the teaching of the establishment of the extremely pure scriptures, the establishment of the meaning of the statement, the object of the authority of the scriptures that are believed, the extremely hidden meaning, is purified by the investigation with the reasoning of the authority of the scriptures that are believed.

original: de ltar yongs su dag pa'i phyir 'thad pas sgrub pa la de'i rgyu dang rkyen du gtogs pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa'i tshad mas 'jal ba ni don la mi 'khrul bar rtogs te /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su dag pa'i phyir 'thad pas sgrub pa la de'i rgyu dang rkyen du gtogs pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa'i tshad mas 'jal ba ni don la mi 'khrul bar rtogs te /
translated: Thus, because of being completely pure, the valid knowledge that comprehends the object without error is the evaluation of the reason proving that, which possesses the characteristic of being completely pure in terms of being included in the causes and conditions of that.

original: bdag kyang yang dag pa'i lta ba la gnas shing gzhan yang yang dag pa'i lta ba la 'jog pas sdig pa'i grogs po'i dbang du mi ltung bas shes bzhin tshor bzhin du spyod par 'gyur bas de ni bsten par @158a * //
analyzed: bdag kyang yang dag pa'i lta ba la gnas shing gzhan yang yang dag pa'i lta ba la 'jog pas sdig pa'i grogs po'i dbang du mi ltung bas shes bzhin tshor bzhin du spyod par 'gyur bas de ni bsten par @158a * //
translated: Since one also abides in the correct view and also establishes others in the correct view, one does not fall under the power of sinful friends.

original: bya'o ; / de ltar smras pa'i don yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma yul shin tu lkog tu gyur ba'i don rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa de sgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir rgyu dang rkyen ni de ston pa thams cad
analyzed: bya'o ; / de ltar smras pa'i don yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma yul shin tu lkog tu gyur ba'i don rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa de sgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir rgyu dang rkyen ni de ston pa thams cad
translated: Thus one should rely on the valid knowledge of scripture that is a source of confidence in the meaning of the statement, in order to prove and to comprehend well the object that is a very hidden phenomenon that is included in the characteristics of the general and specific natures.

original: mkhyen pa yin par des bstan pa'i lung la tshig 'gal ba med pa'o zhes smos pa la /
analyzed: mkhyen pa yin par des bstan pa'i lung la tshig 'gal ba med pa'o zhes smos pa la /
translated: The knowledge is indicated by the statement that the scriptures he taught are not contradictory.

original: nga 'dir de ston pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa dus rtogs par bgyi lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
analyzed: nga 'dir de ston pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa dus rtogs par bgyi lags zhes bya ba zhus so //
translated: Here, in order to indicate that he is omniscient, he asks, “Bhagavan, in how many ways should one understand the characteristics of an omniscient one?”

original: 'jam dpal lnga ste zhes bya ba la gang su yang rung ba zhig byung na 'jig rten du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sgra rnam par grags pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jam dpal lnga ste zhes bya ba la gang su yang rung ba zhig byung na 'jig rten du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sgra rnam par grags pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is fivefold. When anyone appears in the world, the sound of omniscience resounds.

original: gang su yang rung ba zhig byung na zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa bde bar gshegs pa 'jig rten mkhyen pa skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na
analyzed: gang su yang rung ba zhig byung na zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa bde bar gshegs pa 'jig rten mkhyen pa skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na
translated: “When anyone appears” means that a tathāgata, arhat, perfectly enlightened buddha, one with perfect knowledge and conduct, a sugata, knower of the world, an unsurpassed guide for those to be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a bhagavān appears.

original: med pa lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba yul dang dus dang yab yum dang rigs la dgongs te 'jig rten du 'byung ba ba'o //
analyzed: med pa lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba yul dang dus dang yab yum dang rigs la dgongs te 'jig rten du 'byung ba ba'o //
translated: The non-existent is the teacher of gods and humans, the Bhagavan Buddha, who appears in the world with the intention of place, time, father, mother, and lineage.

original: 'jig rten du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du rnam par grags pa zhes bya ba ni lung las /
analyzed: 'jig rten du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du rnam par grags pa zhes bya ba ni lung las /
translated: The statement renowned in the world as omniscient is from scripture, which says:

original: snyan pa'i ba dan 'jig rten gsum du grags //🔽zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: snyan pa'i ba dan 'jig rten gsum du grags // zhes gsungs pas /
translated: The banner of fame resounds in the three worlds.🔽Therefore, the Bhagavan is renowned as omniscient in all three worlds.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gsum po thams cad du thams cad mkhyen pa yin par grags pa dang 'jig rten pa'i rig byed las su gang bdag nyid glang po che dkar po mche ba drug par rim lam du bstan te skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yon tan
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gsum po thams cad du thams cad mkhyen pa yin par grags pa dang 'jig rten pa'i rig byed las su gang bdag nyid glang po che dkar po mche ba drug par rim lam du bstan te skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yon tan
translated: In the worldly Vedas, it is taught that the Bodhisattva, who was born as the white elephant with six tusks,

original: rgya mtsho dang ldan pa de ni 'jig rten du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sgra rnam par grags shing snying rje chen pos mi 'chi bar goms par rnam par dag pa brnyes te 'jig rten kun gyi phar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung bas mu stegs can dag la
analyzed: rgya mtsho dang ldan pa de ni 'jig rten du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sgra rnam par grags shing snying rje chen pos mi 'chi bar goms par rnam par dag pa brnyes te 'jig rten kun gyi phar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung bas mu stegs can dag la
translated: He is endowed with an ocean of merit, is renowned as omniscient in the world, and through great compassion, he attains the purification of immortality and becomes the father of the entire world.

original: thams cad mkhyen par grags pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gsum po kun du snyan pas khyab pa la bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen par grags pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gsum po kun du snyan pas khyab pa la bya'o //
translated: Thus, he is renowned as omniscient and so forth, and his fame pervades the three worlds.🔽He is endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the thirty-two marks of a great being?

original: zhabs shin tu gnas pa dang / phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa dang / sor mo ring ba dang zhabs kyi rting pa yangs pa dang / @158b phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa dang / phyag dang zhabs dra bas 'brel ba dang /🔽zhabs 'bar 'bur med pa dang / byin pa ri dags ae na ya'i lta bu dang / sku ma btud pa dang / mdoms kyi sba ba spubs su nub pa dang / shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa dang / sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa dang /
analyzed: zhabs shin tu gnas pa dang / phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa dang / sor mo ring ba dang zhabs kyi rting pa yangs pa dang / @158b phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa dang / phyag dang zhabs dra bas 'brel ba dang / zhabs 'bar 'bur med pa dang / byin pa ri dags ae na ya'i lta bu dang / sku ma btud pa dang / mdoms kyi sba ba spubs su nub pa dang / shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa dang / sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa dang /
translated: His feet are very steady, the soles of his hands and feet are marked with wheels, his fingers and toes are long, the heels of his feet are broad, his hands and feet are soft and youthful, his hands and feet are webbed,🔽his ankles are not protruding, his calves are like those of the enaya deer, his body is not bent, his sexual organ is concealed in a sheath, his body is as symmetrical as a nyagrodha tree, the hairs on his body point upward,

original: spu re re nas skyes shing g-yas su 'khyil pa dang / sku mdog gser 'dra zhing 'od 'do ma gang dang ldan pa dang / pags pa srab pa dang / bdun mtho ba dang / ro stod seng ge'i 'dra ba dang / dpung mgo legs par grub pa dang /
analyzed: spu re re nas skyes shing g-yas su 'khyil pa dang / sku mdog gser 'dra zhing 'od 'do ma gang dang ldan pa dang / pags pa srab pa dang / bdun mtho ba dang / ro stod seng ge'i 'dra ba dang / dpung mgo legs par grub pa dang /
translated: each hair grows separately and curls to the right, his body is golden colored and has a halo a fathom wide, his skin is smooth, he has seven prominent places, his torso is like a lion’s, his shoulders are well developed,

original: thal gong rgyas pa dang / sku che zhing ring ba dang / tshems bzhi bcu mnga' ba dang / tshems mnyam pa dang / tshems thags bzang ba dang / tshems shin tu dkar ba dang / 'gram pa seng ge'i 'dra ba dang / ljags ring zhing srab pa dang /
analyzed: thal gong rgyas pa dang / sku che zhing ring ba dang / tshems bzhi bcu mnga' ba dang / tshems mnyam pa dang / tshems thags bzang ba dang / tshems shin tu dkar ba dang / 'gram pa seng ge'i 'dra ba dang / ljags ring zhing srab pa dang /
translated: His shoulders are broad. His body is large and tall. He has forty teeth. His teeth are even. His teeth are set close together. His teeth are very white. His jaws are like those of a lion. His tongue is long and slender.

original: ro bro bar mkhyen pa dang / tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang / spyan mthon mthing dang / rdzi ma ba'i lta bu dang / dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa dang / smin mtshams kyi mdzod spu dung gi mdog 'dra ba la g-yas su 'khyil pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ro bro bar mkhyen pa dang / tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang / spyan mthon mthing dang / rdzi ma ba'i lta bu dang / dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa dang / smin mtshams kyi mdzod spu dung gi mdog 'dra ba la g-yas su 'khyil pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He has the knowledge of taste. He has a melodious voice like Brahma. His eyes are deep blue. His eyelashes are like those of an ox. He has a crown protrusion on his head. Between his eyebrows is a spiral of hair the color of a conch shell that curls to the right.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis po de dag gi rang rang gi mtshan nyid dang rgyu dang 'bras bu ston te /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis po de dag gi rang rang gi mtshan nyid dang rgyu dang 'bras bu ston te /
translated: The individual characteristics, causes, and results of each of these thirty-two marks of a great being are taught.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: They are explained in the Perfection of Wisdom sutras.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis po de dag rten gyi tshul gyis 'dzin zhing gzugs bzang po mdzes par byed pa'i dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yang zhar la rig par bya ste /🔽de la dpe byad bzang po drug cu ni mgur yan chad ma gtogs pa sku man chad du gtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis po de dag rten gyi tshul gyis 'dzin zhing gzugs bzang po mdzes par byed pa'i dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yang zhar la rig par bya ste / de la dpe byad bzang po drug cu ni mgur yan chad ma gtogs pa sku man chad du gtogs pa yin la /
translated: The thirty two marks of a great being are held by the body as a basis and the eighty minor marks of a beautiful body are also known as subsidiary marks.

original: nyi shu ni ma gur yan chad du gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyi shu ni ma gur yan chad du gtogs pa yin no //
translated: Sixty of the minor marks are on the body below the neck and twenty are on the body above the neck.

original: de la phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo nyi shu tshigs dang sor mo dang bcas pa dpe byad bzang po nyi shu dang / phyag dang zhabs gnyis dang lag ngar gnyis dang dpung pa gnyis dang mthil rgyab brgyad de phyag gnyis la bzhi dang zhabs gnyis la bzhi ste dpe byad bzang po brgyad dang /
analyzed: de la phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo nyi shu tshigs dang sor mo dang bcas pa dpe byad bzang po nyi shu dang / phyag dang zhabs gnyis dang lag ngar gnyis dang dpung pa gnyis dang mthil rgyab brgyad de phyag gnyis la bzhi dang zhabs gnyis la bzhi ste dpe byad bzang po brgyad dang /
translated: The twenty minor marks are the twenty fingers and toes with their joints. The eight minor marks are the two hands, two feet, two forearms and two upper arms, making four on each of the two sides.

original: long bu gnyis dang pus mo gnyis dang brla gnyis te rnam pa drug rgyas pa dpe byad bzang po drug dang phyag gi mkhrig ma gnyis dang lag gnyis dang dpung pa gnyis te rnam pa drug rgyas pa dpe byad bzang po drug dang / sta zur dpe byad bzang po gcig dang /🔽rked pa dpe @159a * //
analyzed: long bu gnyis dang pus mo gnyis dang brla gnyis te rnam pa drug rgyas pa dpe byad bzang po drug dang phyag gi mkhrig ma gnyis dang lag gnyis dang dpung pa gnyis te rnam pa drug rgyas pa dpe byad bzang po drug dang / sta zur dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / rked pa dpe @159a * //
translated: The six parts of the legs, the two ankles, two knees and two thighs, are the six excellent marks. The six parts of the arms, the two wrists, two elbows and two shoulders, are the six excellent marks.🔽The two sides of the torso are the two excellent marks.

original: byad bzang po gcig dang / 'bras bu gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / mdoms dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / rkub tshos gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / phyal dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / lte ba dpe byad bzang po gcig dang /
analyzed: byad bzang po gcig dang / 'bras bu gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / mdoms dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / rkub tshos gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / phyal dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / lte ba dpe byad bzang po gcig dang /
translated: The two buttocks are the two excellent marks. The genitals are the one excellent mark. The two parts of the anus are the two excellent marks. The abdomen is the one excellent mark. The navel is the one excellent mark.

original: rtsib logs gnyis dang / mchan khung gnyis dang nu ma gnyis bsdus pa dpe byad bzang po drug dang / brang dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / thugs ka dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / mgur dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / rgyab dpe byad bzang po gcig ste /
analyzed: rtsib logs gnyis dang / mchan khung gnyis dang nu ma gnyis bsdus pa dpe byad bzang po drug dang / brang dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / thugs ka dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / mgur dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / rgyab dpe byad bzang po gcig ste /
translated: The two sides, the two armpits, the two breasts, the chest, the heart, the throat, and the back are each one of the sixty marks.

original: dpe byad bzang po drug cu po de rnams ni ma gur yan chad ma gtogs pa sku man chad du gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po drug cu po de rnams ni ma gur yan chad ma gtogs pa sku man chad du gtogs pa yin no //
translated: These sixty marks are on the body from the crown of the head down to the feet.

original: tshems phreng ba gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / rkan 'thon kor dang bcas pa dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / sgros gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / mgur shin tu rgyas pa dpe byad bzang gcig dang / 'gram pa rgyas shing dbyibs legs pa dpe bzang po gnyis dang /
analyzed: tshems phreng ba gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / rkan 'thon kor dang bcas pa dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / sgros gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / mgur shin tu rgyas pa dpe byad bzang gcig dang / 'gram pa rgyas shing dbyibs legs pa dpe bzang po gnyis dang /
translated: The two rows of teeth, the palate, the two lips, the throat, the full cheeks, and the two jaws are each one of the sixty marks.

original: spyan gnyis 'thon kor dang bcas pa dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / smin ma gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / shangs kyi spubs gnyis dpe byad bzang gnyis te /
analyzed: spyan gnyis 'thon kor dang bcas pa dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / smin ma gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / shangs kyi spubs gnyis dpe byad bzang gnyis te /
translated: The two eyes with their corners are two of the excellent marks, the two eyebrows are two of the excellent marks, and the two nostrils are two of the excellent marks.

original: dbral ba dpe byad bzang gcig dang / spyan gyi grva gnyis dpe byad bzang po bzhi dang / dbu skra dang bcas pa dpe byad bzang po gcig ste /
analyzed: dbral ba dpe byad bzang gcig dang / spyan gyi grva gnyis dpe byad bzang po bzhi dang / dbu skra dang bcas pa dpe byad bzang po gcig ste /
translated: The forehead is one of the excellent marks, the two corners of the eyes are four of the excellent marks, and the hair of the head is one of the excellent marks.

original: dpe byad bzang po nyi shu po de dag nyid ni mgur yan chad du gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po nyi shu po de dag nyid ni mgur yan chad du gtogs pa yin no //
translated: These twenty excellent marks are included above the collar bone.

original: stobs bcus sems can thams cad kyi the tshom thams cad gcod pa zhes bya ba la stobs bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: stobs bcus sems can thams cad kyi the tshom thams cad gcod pa zhes bya ba la stobs bcu gang zhe na /
translated: The ten powers are the ten powers of the Buddha.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: the power of knowing the various dispositions of beings,🔽the power of knowing the various elements of beings,🔽the power of knowing the paths that lead everywhere,🔽the power of knowing one's own past lives,

original: mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: the power of knowing death, transmigration, and rebirth,

original: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
translated: and the power of knowing the exhaustion of defilements.

original: @159b mi 'jigs pa bzhis chos ston pas de'i tshig la phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis brgal du med cing brtsad du med pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la mi 'jigs pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: @159b mi 'jigs pa bzhis chos ston pas de'i tshig la phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis brgal du med cing brtsad du med pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la mi 'jigs pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four forms of fearlessness?

original: chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / zag pa thams cad zad par mkhyen pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / bar du gcod pa dang chos rnams gzhan du mi 'gyur bar nges pa'i lung bstan pa la mi 'jigs pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / zag pa thams cad zad par mkhyen pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / bar du gcod pa dang chos rnams gzhan du mi 'gyur bar nges pa'i lung bstan pa la mi 'jigs pa dang /
translated: The fearlessness of the complete and perfect realization of all phenomena, the fearlessness of the knowledge of the exhaustion of all taints, the fearlessness of the prediction that obstacles and phenomena will not change,

original: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad thob par 'gyur ba nges par 'byung ba'i lam de bzhin du 'gyur ba la mi 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad thob par 'gyur ba nges par 'byung ba'i lam de bzhin du 'gyur ba la mi 'jigs pa'o //
translated: and the fearlessness of the path that will definitely lead to the attainment of all perfections.🔽In whose Dharma and Vinaya do the eightfold noble paths and the four types of spiritual practitioners appear?

original: su'i chos 'dul ba la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa snang zhing dge sbyong bzhi snang ba yin te zhes bya ba la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: su'i chos 'dul ba la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa snang zhing dge sbyong bzhi snang ba yin te zhes bya ba la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the eightfold noble path?

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: and right concentration.

original: dge sbyong bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge sbyong bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four kinds of spiritual practitioners?

original: lam rgyal ba dang / lam ston pa dang / lam gyis 'tsho ba dang / lam sun par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lam rgyal ba dang / lam ston pa dang / lam gyis 'tsho ba dang / lam sun par byed pa'o //
translated: The one who has conquered the path, the one who teaches the path, the one who lives by the path, and the one who disparages the path.

original: de la lam rgyal ba ni bde bar gshegs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la lam rgyal ba ni bde bar gshegs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, the one who has conquered the path is the one who has gone to bliss.

original: lam ston pa ni chos smra ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lam ston pa ni chos smra ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The one who teaches the path is the one who speaks the Dharma.

original: lam gyis 'tsho ba ni legs par zhugs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyis 'tsho ba ni legs par zhugs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The one who lives by the path is the one who has entered well.

original: lam sun par byed pa gang yin pa ni log par zhugs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lam sun par byed pa gang yin pa ni log par zhugs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The one who disparages the path is the one who has entered wrongly.

original: de la bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug ma lus par zad pa rjes su brnyes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug ma lus par zad pa rjes su brnyes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The Well-Gone is the one who has attained the complete exhaustion of desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: chos smra ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug 'dul ba'i phyir chos ston pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos smra ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug 'dul ba'i phyir chos ston pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The Dharma Teacher is the one who teaches the Dharma in order to subdue desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: legs par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug btul ba'i phyir zhugs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: legs par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug btul ba'i phyir zhugs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The One Who Has Set Out Well is the one who has set out in order to subdue desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: log par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims 'tshal ba dang sdig pa'i chos gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: log par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims 'tshal ba dang sdig pa'i chos gang yin pa'o //
translated: The One Who Has Set Out Wrongly is the one who violates morality and has evil qualities.

original: gzhan yang slob pa dang mi slob dag ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dag las rnam pa rgyal ba'i phyir lam rgyal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang slob pa dang mi slob dag ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dag las rnam pa rgyal ba'i phyir lam rgyal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the learners and adepts are called the victorious path because they are victorious over the afflictions that are to be eliminated by the path of seeing and the path of cultivation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' @160a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' @160a * //
translated: The Tathāgata and the bodhisattvas

original: phyis byang chub kyi phyir 'jug pa dang nyan thos mdo sde 'dzin pa dang 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams dang gang dag brdar btags pa'i chos 'dul ba 'dzin zhing chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa de dag ni lam ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyis byang chub kyi phyir 'jug pa dang nyan thos mdo sde 'dzin pa dang 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams dang gang dag brdar btags pa'i chos 'dul ba 'dzin zhing chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa de dag ni lam ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: rules of the Dharma, are called “those who show the path.”🔽The power of ordinary beings who are engaged in virtue, who are🔽ashamed, who have remorse, who desire training, who strive for what

original: so so'i skye bo dge ba dag la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa ngo tsha ba dang ldan pa 'gyod pa dang ldan pa bslab pa 'dod pa ma thob pa thob par bya ba dang ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba dang mngon sum du ma byas pa mngon
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dge ba dag la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa ngo tsha ba dang ldan pa 'gyod pa dang ldan pa bslab pa 'dod pa ma thob pa thob par bya ba dang ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba dang mngon sum du ma byas pa mngon
translated: has not been attained, who strive for what has not been realized, and who🔽strive for what has not been actualized, up to the actualization of what

original: sum du bya ba'i phyir rab tu brtson pa mngon sum du ma byas pa mngon sum du bya ba'i bar gyi mthu gang dag yin pa de dag ni lam gyis 'tsho ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sum du bya ba'i phyir rab tu brtson pa mngon sum du ma byas pa mngon sum du bya ba'i bar gyi mthu gang dag yin pa de dag ni lam gyis 'tsho ba zhes bya ste /
translated: has not been actualized, is called “the livelihood of the path.”

original: de dag la drod yod pa'i phyir de dag 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi dbang po bskyed pa'i phyir ma shi zhing gson pa yin pas de'i phyir lam gyis 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la drod yod pa'i phyir de dag 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi dbang po bskyed pa'i phyir ma shi zhing gson pa yin pas de'i phyir lam gyis 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they have heat, they are alive, not dead, since they generate the faculty of noble wisdom. Therefore, they are called “living by the path.”

original: gang zag tshul khrims 'tshal pa sdig pa'i chos can nang rul pa phyir zags par gyur ba dge sbyong ma yin par dge sbyong du khas 'che ba tshangs par spyod pa ma yin par tshangs par spyod par khas 'che ba gang yin pa de ni lam sun par🔽byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang zag tshul khrims 'tshal pa sdig pa'i chos can nang rul pa phyir zags par gyur ba dge sbyong ma yin par dge sbyong du khas 'che ba tshangs par spyod pa ma yin par tshangs par spyod par khas 'che ba gang yin pa de ni lam sun par byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: “One who disparages the path” is a person who is a moralist, but has evil qualities, is rotten within, and has fallen away. He is not a spiritual practitioner, but claims to be a spiritual practitioner. He is not one who practices pure conduct, but claims to practice pure conduct. He is called “one who disparages the path”🔽because he disparages the path from the very beginning.

original: des ni lam gzhi dang po nas sun par bya ba'i phyir des na de lam bskyed par bya ba dang lam bstan pa yod cing med pa ma yin /
analyzed: des ni lam gzhi dang po nas sun par bya ba'i phyir des na de lam bskyed par bya ba dang lam bstan pa yod cing med pa ma yin /
translated: Since he disparages the path, he does not have the path that is to be generated, nor does he have the path that is to be revealed.

original: lam rtogs par bya yod cing med par bya ba ma yin pa na yang skal pa dang mthu med la snod du gyur pa ma yin pas na de'i phyir lam sun par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lam rtogs par bya yod cing med par bya ba ma yin pa na yang skal pa dang mthu med la snod du gyur pa ma yin pas na de'i phyir lam sun par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Although the path is to be realized and is not to be disparaged, he is not fortunate, is not powerful, and is not a suitable vessel. Therefore, he is called “one who disparages the path.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de dag las dgongs nas gang la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yod pa de la ni dag sbyong gi dngos po yang yod la dge sbyong gi bzhi ba'i bar yang yod kyi phas kyi rgol ba dag la ni dge sbyong dang
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de dag las dgongs nas gang la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yod pa de la ni dag sbyong gi dngos po yang yod la dge sbyong gi bzhi ba'i bar yang yod kyi phas kyi rgol ba dag la ni dge sbyong dang
translated: The Bhagavān also, intending those, said, “Where the eightfold noble path exists, there the eight factors of purification exist, up to the four fruits of asceticism exist. But the opponents are empty of ascetics

original: bram ze dag gis stong ngo //
analyzed: bram ze dag gis stong ngo //
translated: and brahmins.”

original: de bas na chos 'dul ba 'di la ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yang yod la dge sbyong bzhi yang yod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na chos 'dul ba 'di la ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yang yod la dge sbyong bzhi yang yod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, in this Dharma and Vinaya, the eightfold noble path exists, and the four ascetics exist.

original: de ltar na 'byung ba dang / mtshan dang / the tshom gcod pa dang ; brgal du med pa'i brtsad du med pa dang / dge sbyong dmigs pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid lngar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid lngar ji skad bstan pa de dag gi mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'byung ba dang / mtshan dang / the tshom gcod pa dang ; brgal du med pa'i brtsad du med pa dang / dge sbyong dmigs pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid lngar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid lngar ji skad bstan pa de dag gi mjug bsdu ba ste /
translated: Thus, the five characteristics of the omniscience of the ascetic should be known as: origination, marks, cutting off doubt, being unassailable and unarguable, and omniscience. This is the conclusion of the five characteristics of omniscience as they were taught.

original: go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: They should be applied in order.

original: des bstan pa'i lung la tshig @160b 'gal ba med pa ni sngar bstan pa bzhin te /
analyzed: des bstan pa'i lung la tshig @160b 'gal ba med pa ni sngar bstan pa bzhin te /
translated: The scriptures that he taught are free of contradiction, as was previously explained.

original: de ltar na smras pa'i don yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i yul shin tu lkog tu gyur ba'i don rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa de bsgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i rgyu dang rkyen ni de ston pa thams cad mkhyen
analyzed: de ltar na smras pa'i don yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i yul shin tu lkog tu gyur ba'i don rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa de bsgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i rgyu dang rkyen ni de ston pa thams cad mkhyen
translated: Thus, the cause and condition for establishing and comprehending the extremely obscure object of the valid knowledge of scripture, which is the meaning of the statements, is the omniscience of the teacher who teaches that.

original: pa yin pa dang / des bstan pa'i lung la tshig 'gal ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: pa yin pa dang / des bstan pa'i lung la tshig 'gal ba med pa yin no //
translated: And the scriptures that he taught are free of contradiction.

original: de lta bas na lung shin tu rnam par dag pa gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid ston pa yang thams cad mkhyen pa yin la thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid de lta bu yin par lung shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid las byung ba
analyzed: de lta bas na lung shin tu rnam par dag pa gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid ston pa yang thams cad mkhyen pa yin la thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid de lta bu yin par lung shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid las byung ba
translated: Therefore, the omniscience of the teacher is the characteristic of the teaching of the extremely pure scripture that is to be ascertained, and the characteristic of omniscience is like that, as it appears in the extremely pure scripture.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid dang lung gi mtshan nyid ni gcig la gcig ltos nas de gnyi ga khong du chud par 'gyur te de nyid yid ches pa'i lung gi tshang mas 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yin no //🔽de ltar na 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa de ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad mas mtshan nyid lnga po dag gis yongs su dag pa yin na zhes bya ba ni sngar so sor shes
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid dang lung gi mtshan nyid ni gcig la gcig ltos nas de gnyi ga khong du chud par 'gyur te de nyid yid ches pa'i lung gi tshang mas 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yin no // de ltar na 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa de ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad mas mtshan nyid lnga po dag gis yongs su dag pa yin na zhes bya ba ni sngar so sor shes
translated: The characteristics of omniscience and scriptural authority are mutually dependent, and both are understood. That itself is the reasoning of establishing through tenability, which is the collection of authoritative scriptures that are trustworthy.

original: pa dang bshad pa dang smras pa'i don sgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa dang bshad pa dang smras pa'i don sgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, that reasoning of establishing through tenability is pure with regard to the five characteristics through the valid cognition of direct perception, the valid cognition of inference, and the valid cognition of trustworthy scripture. This is because the five characteristics were previously individually understood, explained, and established, and their meaning was well comprehended.

original: rgyu gang dag yin pa dang rkyen gang dag yin pa de ni 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu gang dag yin pa dang rkyen gang dag yin pa de ni 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa ste /
translated: The causes and conditions are the reasoning of establishing through tenability.

original: de yang mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag par bstan pa de'i mjug bsdu ba ston to //
analyzed: de yang mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag par bstan pa de'i mjug bsdu ba ston to //
translated: And that is taught to be pure with the five characteristics. This teaches the summary of that.

original: de la de ltar na zhes bya ba ni sngar 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag par bstan pa de ltar na'o //🔽'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa de ni zhes bya ba ni sngar so so'i shes pa dang bshad pa dang / smras pa'i don sgrub pa dang / legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i rgyu gang dag yin pa dang rkyen gang dag yin pa de ni 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yin no zhes smos pa de'o //
analyzed: de la de ltar na zhes bya ba ni sngar 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa mtshan nyid lngas yongs su dag par bstan pa de ltar na'o // 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa de ni zhes bya ba ni sngar so so'i shes pa dang bshad pa dang / smras pa'i don sgrub pa dang / legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i rgyu gang dag yin pa dang rkyen gang dag yin pa de ni 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yin no zhes smos pa de'o //
translated: In this way means in the way that was previously taught as the reasoning of proof by means of the five characteristics.🔽As for that reasoning of proof by means of the five characteristics, it refers to what was said earlier: Those that are the causes and conditions for establishing the meaning of one's own understanding, explanation, and assertion, and for making it well understood, that is the reasoning of proof by means of the five characteristics.

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad mas mtshan nyid lnga po dag gis yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bya ba la mngon sum gyi tshad ma zhes bya ba ni sngar so so'i shes pa zhes
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad mas mtshan nyid lnga po dag gis yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bya ba la mngon sum gyi tshad ma zhes bya ba ni sngar so so'i shes pa zhes
translated: It is pure by means of the five characteristics by means of the valid cognition of direct perception, the valid cognition of inference, and the valid cognition of trustworthy scripture. As for the valid cognition of direct perception, it refers to what was said earlier: One's own understanding and the valid cognition of inference refers to what was said earlier: Explanation and the valid cognition of trustworthy scripture refers to what was said earlier: Assertion.

original: smos pa tshad ma bzhi po dbang po'i shes pa dang / yid kyi shes pa dang / rang rig pa'i shes pa dang / rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa so so'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: smos pa tshad ma bzhi po dbang po'i shes pa dang / yid kyi shes pa dang / rang rig pa'i shes pa dang / rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa so so'i shes pa'o //
translated: The four authorities mentioned are the sensory consciousnesses, the mental consciousness, the reflexive awareness consciousness, and the consciousnesses of individual yogins.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma zhes bya ba ni @161a * //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma zhes bya ba ni @161a * //
translated: The authority of inference is as follows.

original: sngar bshad pa zhes smos pa ste /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa zhes smos pa ste /
translated: It is as previously explained.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma gnyis po rang gi don du rjes su dpag pa dang gzhan gyi don du rjes su dpag pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bshad pa'am smra ba po gzhan dag gis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma gnyis po rang gi don du rjes su dpag pa dang gzhan gyi don du rjes su dpag pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bshad pa'am smra ba po gzhan dag gis bshad pa'o //
translated: The two kinds of inferential authority, inference for one’s own benefit and inference for the benefit of others, are explained by the Bhagavat Buddhas or by other teachers.🔽The authority of trustworthy scripture is as follows.

original: yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma zhes bya ba ni sngar smras pa zhes smos pa ste /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma zhes bya ba ni sngar smras pa zhes smos pa ste /
translated: It is as previously stated.

original: yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma gnyis po de ston pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa dang / des bstan pa'i lung gi tshig 'gal ba med pa gtan la phab pas ston pa thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma gnyis po de ston pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa dang / des bstan pa'i lung gi tshig 'gal ba med pa gtan la phab pas ston pa thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa'o //
translated: The two kinds of authority of trustworthy scripture are the scriptures of the omniscient Teacher and the scriptures of others.

original: 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa de ni tshad ma de gsum gyis yongs su dag pa yin //
analyzed: 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa de ni tshad ma de gsum gyis yongs su dag pa yin //
translated: The reasoning that proves by means of valid cognition is pure by means of these three valid cognitions.

original: tshad ma de gsum ni mtshan nyid lnga po dag gis yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bya ba sbyar te /
analyzed: tshad ma de gsum ni mtshan nyid lnga po dag gis yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bya ba sbyar te /
translated: These three valid cognitions are pure by means of the five characteristics.

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma so so'i shes pa'i don sgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi mngon sum la log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi bsal bas ma nor bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma so so'i shes pa'i don sgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi mngon sum la log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi bsal bas ma nor bar shes par bya ste /
translated: The valid cognition of direct perception is to be understood as unmistaken by means of eliminating the four misconceptions regarding the direct perception that is the cause and condition for accomplishing the object of individual knowledge.

original: de nyid mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: That is the pure reasoning that proves by means of the valid cognition of direct perception.

original: de mtshan nyid lnga po dag las gang gis yongs su dag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de mtshan nyid lnga po dag las gang gis yongs su dag pa yin zhe na /
translated: By which of the five characteristics is it pure?

original: de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag pa yin te /
analyzed: de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag pa yin te /
translated: It is pure by means of the characteristic of direct perception.

original: de ltar mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yongs su dag pa de ni de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yongs su dag pa de ni de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the pure reasoning that establishes by means of the valid knowledge of direct perception is pure by the definition of direct perception.

original: de gnyis kyang mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid kyi tshul gyis ngo bo gcig par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyang mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid kyi tshul gyis ngo bo gcig par rig par bya'o //
translated: And those two should be known to be of one nature in the manner of the basis of the characteristics and the characteristics.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma bshad pa'i don sgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i rgyu dang rkyen ni rjes su dpag pa la log par zhugs pa rnam pa bzhi bsal bas ma nor bar shes pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma bshad pa'i don sgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i rgyu dang rkyen ni rjes su dpag pa la log par zhugs pa rnam pa bzhi bsal bas ma nor bar shes pa ste /
translated: The cause and condition for explaining the valid knowledge of inference and for properly understanding the object to be established is unmistaken knowledge by way of eliminating the four kinds of erroneous engagement in inference.

original: de nyid rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: That itself is the pure reasoning that establishes by means of the valid knowledge of inference.

original: de mtshan nyid lnga po dag las gang gis yongs su dag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de mtshan nyid lnga po dag las gang gis yongs su dag pa yin zhe na /
translated: By which one of the five characteristics is it pure?

original: de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag pa yin te /
analyzed: de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag pa yin te /
translated: It is pure by the characteristic of the direct perception of its basis and by the characteristic of the application of an example of its type.

original: de ltar rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yongs su dag pa de ni de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar @161b sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag pa yin la
analyzed: de ltar rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yongs su dag pa de ni de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar @161b sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag pa yin la
translated: Thus, the pure reasoning that establishes by the validity of inference is pure by the characteristic of the direct perception of its basis and by the characteristic of the application of an example of its type.

original: / de dang de gnyis kyang mtshan gzhi dang / mtshan nyid kyi tshul gyis ngo bo nyid gcig par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: / de dang de gnyis kyang mtshan gzhi dang / mtshan nyid kyi tshul gyis ngo bo nyid gcig par rig par bya'o //
translated: And those two should be known as having the same nature by way of the characterized and the characteristic.

original: yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yongs su dag pa de gnyi ga yongs su dag pa yin te /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yongs su dag pa de gnyi ga yongs su dag pa yin te /
translated: By the characteristic of purity, both the pure reasoning that establishes by the validity of direct perception and the pure reasoning that establishes by the validity of inference are pure.

original: de yang gnyis dang mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid kyi tshul gyis ngo bo nyid gcig par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang gnyis dang mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid kyi tshul gyis ngo bo nyid gcig par rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be understood that the three are identical in nature in the manner of a basis and its attributes.

original: yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i smras pa'i don sgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir rgyu dang rkyen ni de ston pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa dang ; des bstan pa'i lung la tshig 'gal ba med pas ma nor bar shes pa ste /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i smras pa'i don sgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir rgyu dang rkyen ni de ston pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa dang ; des bstan pa'i lung la tshig 'gal ba med pas ma nor bar shes pa ste /
translated: The reason for the validity of the trustworthy scripture is that the teacher is omniscient and that the scripture he teaches is free of contradiction and thus is understood to be nonerroneous.

original: de nyid yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: This is the pure reasoning that establishes the validity of the trustworthy scripture.

original: de mtshan nyid lnga po dag las gang gis yongs su dag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de mtshan nyid lnga po dag las gang gis yongs su dag pa yin zhe na /
translated: From among the five characteristics, by which is it pure?

original: lung shin tu rnam par dag pa gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: lung shin tu rnam par dag pa gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: It is pure by the characteristic of the teaching of the very pure scripture.

original: de ltar yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yongs su dag pa de ni lung shin tu rnams par dag pa gtan la dbab par ston pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag pa yin la de gnyis dang mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid
analyzed: de ltar yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yongs su dag pa de ni lung shin tu rnams par dag pa gtan la dbab par ston pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su dag pa yin la de gnyis dang mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid
translated: Thus, the pure reasoning that establishes the pure scriptures that are the valid cognition of confidence is the pure teaching that reveals the ascertainment of the pure scriptures.

original: kyi tshul gyis ngo bo nyid gcig par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kyi tshul gyis ngo bo nyid gcig par rig par bya'o //
translated: The pure scriptures and the pure reasoning that establishes them are to be understood as having the same nature in terms of the relationship between the definition and the definiendum.

original: de la yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid lnga po de dag gi mtshan gzhi yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid lnga po de dag gi mtshan gzhi yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the pure basis of those five pure characteristics?

original: tshad ma gsum po dag ste /
analyzed: tshad ma gsum po dag ste /
translated: The three valid cognitions.

original: de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mtshan gzhi ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yongs su dag pa yin /
analyzed: de mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mtshan gzhi ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yongs su dag pa yin /
translated: The pure basis of the characteristic of direct perception is the pure reasoning that establishes the valid cognition of direct perception.

original: de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid kyi mtshan gzhi ni rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yongs su dag pa yin /🔽yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mtshan gzhi ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yongs su dag par ci rigs par lung shin tu rnam par dag pa gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid kyi
analyzed: de la gnas pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid kyi mtshan gzhi ni rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yongs su dag pa yin / yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mtshan gzhi ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yongs su dag par ci rigs par lung shin tu rnam par dag pa gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid kyi

original: mtshan gzhi ni yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yongs su dag @162a * //🔽pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan gzhi ni yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yongs su dag @162a * //🔽pa yin te /
