original: de ltar mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi dang mngon sum gyi tshad ma yongs su dag pa gsum po de dag gis rang rang gi don sgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par byed pa de ni 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi dang mngon sum gyi tshad ma yongs su dag pa gsum po de dag gis rang rang gi don sgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par byed pa de ni 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, these three—the definition, the basis of definition, and the valid knowledge of direct perception—are established in their own purpose and are well understood. This is called “the reasoning of tenable establishment.”

original: de la tshad ma ni ci'i phyir gsungs /
analyzed: de la tshad ma ni ci'i phyir gsungs /
translated: Why was valid knowledge taught?

original: tshad ma'i tshig gi don ni ci yin /
analyzed: tshad ma'i tshig gi don ni ci yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the term valid knowledge?

original: tshad ma gsum ni ci'i phyir gsungs she na /
analyzed: tshad ma gsum ni ci'i phyir gsungs she na /
translated: Why were the three types of valid knowledge taught?

original: 'jig rten na dus gsum gyi sems can dag tshad ma yin pa tshad mar ston cing tshad mar mi rung ba la tshad mar 'dzin pa byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba mkhyen nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten na dus gsum gyi sems can dag tshad ma yin pa tshad mar ston cing tshad mar mi rung ba la tshad mar 'dzin pa byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba mkhyen nas /
translated: The Buddha knew that in the world, sentient beings of the three times are valid knowledge, that they teach valid knowledge, and that it is possible that those who are not valid knowledge will be taken to be valid knowledge.

original: de dag gi log par lta ba'i dra ba bsal ba'i phyir tshad ma 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag gi log par lta ba'i dra ba bsal ba'i phyir tshad ma 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: In order to remove the web of their wrong views, he taught these valid knowledges.

original: tshad ma zhes bya ba ni ci ring thung sor la sogs pas gzhal ba dang / mang nyung bre la sogs pas gzhal ba dang / lci yang srad la sogs pas gzhal ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma zhes bya ba ni ci ring thung sor la sogs pas gzhal ba dang / mang nyung bre la sogs pas gzhal ba dang / lci yang srad la sogs pas gzhal ba lta bu yin no //
translated: A means of valid knowledge is that by which one understands an object, just as one understands length and shortness by means of a scale, one understands quantity by means of a bushel, and one understands weight by means of a scale.

original: tshad ma gsum du gsungs pa ni gzhal bya rnam par gsum yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshad ma gsum du gsungs pa ni gzhal bya rnam par gsum yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: The three means of valid knowledge are taught because there are three kinds of objects of valid knowledge.

original: gzhal bya rnam pa gsum ni gzhal bya mngon sum gyi don dang lkog tu gyur pa'i don dang / shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don to /
analyzed: gzhal bya rnam pa gsum ni gzhal bya mngon sum gyi don dang lkog tu gyur pa'i don dang / shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don to /
translated: The three kinds of objects of valid knowledge are the object of direct perception, the hidden object, and the very hidden object.

original: so so'i shes pa'i don dang bshad pa'i don dang gsungs pa'i don ces bya ba dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: so so'i shes pa'i don dang bshad pa'i don dang gsungs pa'i don ces bya ba dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are called the object of individual knowledge, the object of explanation, and the object of scripture, respectively.

original: de la mngon sum kyi don zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i dus dang / skad cig ma gcig dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa yul dang dus dang / rang bzhin gyis ma bskal ba'i yul lo //
analyzed: de la mngon sum kyi don zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i dus dang / skad cig ma gcig dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa yul dang dus dang / rang bzhin gyis ma bskal ba'i yul lo //
translated: The object of direct perception is the present time, a single moment, and an object not separated by place, time, or nature.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i don zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus dang / skad cig ma snga phyi'i rgyun dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul dang / dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal ba'i yul lo //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i don zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus dang / skad cig ma snga phyi'i rgyun dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul dang / dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal ba'i yul lo //
translated: The meaning that is hidden refers to the past, the future, the continuum of earlier and later moments, the object that is a universal characteristic, and the object that is separated by time and nature.

original: shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don zhes bya ba ni dus gsum dang / skad cig ma'i rgyud kyi rgyun dang / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa yul dang / dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal ba dang / ma bskal ba gnyi ga'i yul rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don zhes bya ba ni dus gsum dang / skad cig ma'i rgyud kyi rgyun dang / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa yul dang / dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal ba dang / ma bskal ba gnyi ga'i yul rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa'o //
translated: The meaning that is extremely hidden refers to the object that is not the domain of speculation, which is the object that is both separated and not separated by the three times, the continuum of the stream of moments, the object that is included in the universal characteristic and the particular characteristic, and the object that is separated and not separated by time and nature.

original: gzhal bya gsum 'jal ba'i tshad ma ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang yid ches pa'i lung dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhal bya gsum 'jal ba'i tshad ma ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang yid ches pa'i lung dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: The three types of objects of comprehension are evaluated by the three types of valid knowledge, respectively: direct perception, inference, and trustworthy scripture.

original: yongs su ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven types of characteristics that are impure?

original: de las gzhan dang mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de las gzhan dang mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / thams cad @162b mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid dang yongs su ma 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: de las gzhan dang mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de las gzhan dang mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / thams cad @162b mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi rigs kyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid dang yongs su ma 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: The definition of observation that is in accordance with something other than that, the definition of observation that is not in accordance with something other than that, the definition of observation that is in accordance with everything, the definition of observation that is not in accordance with everything, the definition of the application of an example of another type, the definition of complete mixing,🔽and the definition of a very impure scripture.

original: lung shin tu rnam par ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni sngar so so'i shes pa dang / bshad pa dang smras pa'i don sgrub pa dang / legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i rgyu gang dag yin pa de ni 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yin no zhes gsungs pas mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang /
analyzed: lung shin tu rnam par ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni sngar so so'i shes pa dang / bshad pa dang smras pa'i don sgrub pa dang / legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i rgyu gang dag yin pa de ni 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yin no zhes gsungs pas mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang /
translated: The reason for establishing the meaning of what was said and spoken about earlier and for bringing about a thorough understanding is called the reasoning of tenable establishment.”

original: yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma gsum gyis yul mngon sum gyi don dang shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don rnam pa gsum po dag sgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i rgyu dang rkyen mngon sum la log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma gsum gyis yul mngon sum gyi don dang shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don rnam pa gsum po dag sgrub pa dang legs par khong du chud par bya ba'i rgyu dang rkyen mngon sum la log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi
translated: The three validities of authoritative statements that inspire confidence are the causes and conditions for establishing and fully understanding the three topics: the directly perceptible meaning, the meaning that is slightly hidden, and the extremely hidden meaning.🔽The four misconceptions that are eliminated with regard to direct perception are as follows: (1) the misconception that direct perception is not a valid cognition, (2) the misconception that direct perception is not a valid cognition because it is not a valid cognition that is free from error, (3) the misconception that direct perception is not a valid cognition because it is not a valid cognition that is nondeceptive, and (4) the misconception that direct perception is not a valid cognition because it is not a valid cognition that is nonerroneous.🔽The four misconceptions that are eliminated with regard to inference are as follows: (1) the misconception that inference is not a valid cognition, (2) the misconception that inference is not a valid cognition because it is not a valid cognition that is free from error, (3) the misconception that inference is not a valid cognition because it is not a valid cognition that is nondeceptive, and (4) the misconception that inference is not a valid cognition because it is not a valid cognition that is nonerroneous.

original: bsal bas ma nor bar shes pa dang / rjes su dpag pas log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi bsal bas ma nor bar shes pa dang / de ston pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa dang ; des bstan pa'i lung la tshig 'gal ba med pas ma nor ba ni 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yin par bstan pa'i tshad ma gsum po de dag ni mtshan nyid lnga sngar bstan pa dag gis ni yongs su dag ste /
analyzed: bsal bas ma nor bar shes pa dang / rjes su dpag pas log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi bsal bas ma nor bar shes pa dang / de ston pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa dang ; des bstan pa'i lung la tshig 'gal ba med pas ma nor ba ni 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa yin par bstan pa'i tshad ma gsum po de dag ni mtshan nyid lnga sngar bstan pa dag gis ni yongs su dag ste /
translated: The three validities that teach these are completely pure because of the five characteristics that were taught above.

original: tshad mar rung gi mtshan nyid bdun po 'di dag gis yongs su ma dag ste tshad mar mi rung bar ston te /
analyzed: tshad mar rung gi mtshan nyid bdun po 'di dag gis yongs su ma dag ste tshad mar mi rung bar ston te /
translated: These seven characteristics of being suitable as valid cognition teach that if they are not completely pure, they are not suitable as valid cognition.

original: de la mngon sum gyi tshad ma ni sngar mngon sum la log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi bsal bas ma nor bar shes pa ji skad bstan pa de nyid kyis yongs su dag la /
analyzed: de la mngon sum gyi tshad ma ni sngar mngon sum la log par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi bsal bas ma nor bar shes pa ji skad bstan pa de nyid kyis yongs su dag la /
translated: As for direct perception, it is pure because the four misconceptions about direct perception have already been eliminated, and so it is understood without error, just as it has been explained.

original: de las bzlog pa yongs su ma dag pa yin pas 'dir de'i ma dag pa mtshan nyid bdun dang dmigs kyis sbyar ba ni med do //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa yongs su ma dag pa yin pas 'dir de'i ma dag pa mtshan nyid bdun dang dmigs kyis sbyar ba ni med do //
translated: Since it is the opposite of that, it is impure. Therefore, here there is no specific application of the seven characteristics of its impurity.

original: 'on kyang 'dir yongs su ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bdun las dang po bzhi'i nang nas chos can dang ma rtogs pa log par dmigs pa byung ngo cog ni mngon sum yongs su ma dag pa yin pa yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir yongs su ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bdun las dang po bzhi'i nang nas chos can dang ma rtogs pa log par dmigs pa byung ngo cog ni mngon sum yongs su ma dag pa yin pa yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: However, from among the seven characteristics of impurity, all that is included in the first four, the non-apprehension of the subject and the mistaken apprehension of the object, are direct perception that is impure. This should be understood as appropriate.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma ni tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags las rang dang gzhan gyi don du rjes su dpag pa yin pas de la gtan tshigs dang dpe'i skyon rnam pa du ma yod pas de dag ma bsal na rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid yongs
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma ni tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags las rang dang gzhan gyi don du rjes su dpag pa yin pas de la gtan tshigs dang dpe'i skyon rnam pa du ma yod pas de dag ma bsal na rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid yongs
translated: The valid knowledge of inference is the inference for one's own or others' sake from a reason that has the three modes. Since there are many faults of the reason and example in that, if they are not eliminated, the definition of inference is not completely pure.

original: su ma dag par bstan pa'i phyir 'dir gtso cher ston te /🔽rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid ma dag pa bzhi'i skyon ni 'dir yongs su ma @163a * //
analyzed: su ma dag par bstan pa'i phyir 'dir gtso cher ston te / rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid ma dag pa bzhi'i skyon ni 'dir yongs su ma @163a * //
translated: Therefore, it is mainly taught here.

original: dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang po drug gis ston to //
analyzed: dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang po drug gis ston to //
translated: The faults of the four impure definitions of inference are taught here by the first six characteristics of impurity.

original: yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid dang / mi mthun pa'i skyon ni 'dir lung shin tu rnam par ma dag pa bstan pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ston to //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid dang / mi mthun pa'i skyon ni 'dir lung shin tu rnam par ma dag pa bstan pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ston to //
translated: The definition and faults of the valid knowledge of trustworthy scripture are taught here by the characteristics of teaching extremely impure scripture.

original: de la rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags las rang dang gzhan gyi don du rjes su dpag pa la gtan tshigs kyi skyon gsum po ma grub pa dang 'gal ba dang ma nges pa zhes sngar smos pa la ma grub pa'i skyon
analyzed: de la rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags las rang dang gzhan gyi don du rjes su dpag pa la gtan tshigs kyi skyon gsum po ma grub pa dang 'gal ba dang ma nges pa zhes sngar smos pa la ma grub pa'i skyon
translated: Regarding inference, the three modes of a reason are: the property of the subject, the forward pervasion, and the reverse pervasion.🔽The fault of nonestablishment is🔽the fault of not accepting that the property of the subject exists in the object

original: ni rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul khas mi len cing phyogs kyi chos ma grub pa rnams la gzhi ma grub pa dang / rang la ma grub pa dang gzhan la ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon yod kyi /
analyzed: ni rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul khas mi len cing phyogs kyi chos ma grub pa rnams la gzhi ma grub pa dang / rang la ma grub pa dang gzhan la ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon yod kyi /
translated: to be inferred. For example, if the subject is not established, the reason is🔽said to be “unestablished.”🔽Here, the property of the subject is established because the property of

original: 'dir rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul khas len cing phyogs kyi chos grub pa rnams la med la /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul khas len cing phyogs kyi chos grub pa rnams la med la /
translated: the subject is accepted as existing in the object to be inferred.🔽The fault of contradiction is, for example, to prove the opposite of what

original: 'gal ba'i skyon yang sgrub par byed pa las bsgrub pa log par bsgrub par dper na sgra ni rtag pa ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i skyon yang sgrub par byed pa las bsgrub pa log par bsgrub par dper na sgra ni rtag pa ste /
translated: is to be proven, as in the case of proving that sound is permanent.

original: byas pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba dang / sgra ni mi rtag pa ste rtsol ba las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba lta bu dag la yod kyi /
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba dang / sgra ni mi rtag pa ste rtsol ba las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba lta bu dag la yod kyi /
translated: and “Sound is impermanent because it arises from effort.”

original: 'dir bsgrub par bya ba las log par sgrub par mi byed pa dag la med pas de'i phyir 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis ma grub pa dang 'gal ba'i skyon ni bka' ma stsal te /
analyzed: 'dir bsgrub par bya ba las log par sgrub par mi byed pa dag la med pas de'i phyir 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis ma grub pa dang 'gal ba'i skyon ni bka' ma stsal te /
translated: But in this context, the Lord Buddha did not state the faults of nonestablishment and contradiction, because they do not occur in correct reasons.

original: shes par 'dod na ni lung dang tshad ma gzhan dag las rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: shes par 'dod na ni lung dang tshad ma gzhan dag las rig par bya'o ;
translated: If you wish to know them, you should learn them from other scriptures and treatises.

original: /'dir ni ma nges pa'i skyon gyis gtan tshigs ltar snang ba dang dpe'i skyon gyis dpe ltar snang ba gtso cher bka' stsal te /
analyzed: /'dir ni ma nges pa'i skyon gyis gtan tshigs ltar snang ba dang dpe'i skyon gyis dpe ltar snang ba gtso cher bka' stsal te /
translated: Here, the Lord Buddha mainly stated the faults of inconclusive reasons and inconclusive examples.

original: de gnyis kyi bsgrub pa la gcig tu ma nges pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yongs su ma dag pa yin par ston to //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi bsgrub pa la gcig tu ma nges pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yongs su ma dag pa yin par ston to //
translated: He taught that inference is impure because the proofs of those two are not ascertained.

original: de la ma nges pa'i skyon gyis gtan tshigs ltar snang ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la ma nges pa'i skyon gyis gtan tshigs ltar snang ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The faults of inconclusive reasons are of four types.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa dang / mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa dang / thun mong gi ma nges pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa ste yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa dang / mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa dang / thun mong gi ma nges pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa ste yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: There are four kinds of unmixed characteristics, respectively: the unmixed characteristic that exists in one part of the discordant side, the unmixed characteristic that exists in one part of the similar side, the unmixed characteristic that is common, and the unmixed characteristic that is uncommon.

original: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the unmixed characteristic that exists in one part of the discordant side?

original: dper na sgra rtsol ba las 'byung bar sgrub pa dag gis sbyor ba'i tshig las 'di skad ces yang sgra 'di rtsol ba las 'byung ste mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na sgra rtsol ba las 'byung bar sgrub pa dag gis sbyor ba'i tshig las 'di skad ces yang sgra 'di rtsol ba las 'byung ste mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, when proving that sound is a product, the syllogism is stated as follows: “With regard to the subject, sound, it is a product because it is impermanent.”

original: gang dang gang na mi rtag pa de ni rtsol ba las 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang na mi rtag pa de ni rtsol ba las 'byung ste /
translated: Whatever is impermanent is a product,

original: chos mthun @163b pa'i dpe ni bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: chos mthun @163b pa'i dpe ni bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like a pot, which is a similar instance.

original: gang dang gang rtag pa de ni rtsol ba las mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang rtag pa de ni rtsol ba las mi 'byung ste /
translated: Whatever is permanent is not a product,🔽like space, which is a dissimilar instance.

original: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ni nam mkha' dang glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes zer ro //🔽de ltar rjes su dpag go cog ni tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags las rang dang gzhan gyi don rjes su dpag pa yin pas 'dir yang rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid dang / mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid dang /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ni nam mkha' dang glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes zer ro // de ltar rjes su dpag go cog ni tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags las rang dang gzhan gyi don rjes su dpag pa yin pas 'dir yang rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid dang / mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid dang /
translated: The example of a dissimilar instance is like space, lightning, a forest fire, and so on.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul dang sbyar dgos te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul dang sbyar dgos te /
translated: Thus, all inferences are inferences for oneself or for others from a reason that has the three modes. Therefore, here too, it is necessary to apply the three modes: existing in the object of inference, existing in similar instances, and not existing in dissimilar instances.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid ces bya ba la rjes su dpag par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can sgra la'o //
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid ces bya ba la rjes su dpag par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can sgra la'o //
translated: Here, “existing in the object of inference” means that the reason exists in the subject of the inference, sound.

original: yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can sgra de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos brtsal ba las 'byung ba sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can sgra de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos brtsal ba las 'byung ba sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yod pa nyid de /
translated: The term existence refers to the property of the subject that is to be inferred, sound, which is sought in the probandum. It is the property of the position that establishes the existence of the probandum, because it is impermanent.

original: de'i phyir chos can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos can zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the subject.

original: de ltar chos can de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de yod pa nyid yin pas rjes su dpag par bya ba yod pa nyid kyi tshul yang rung //
analyzed: de ltar chos can de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de yod pa nyid yin pas rjes su dpag par bya ba yod pa nyid kyi tshul yang rung //
translated: Thus, in that subject, the property of the position that establishes the probandum, because it is impermanent, exists. Therefore, the mode of existence of the probandum is suitable for inference.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid ces bya ba la mthun pa'i phyogs la zhes bya ba ni brtsal ba las 'byung ba de'i phyir mthun pa'i dpe bum pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid ces bya ba la mthun pa'i phyogs la zhes bya ba ni brtsal ba las 'byung ba de'i phyir mthun pa'i dpe bum pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: The term existence in the similar class means that which is sought in the similar class. Therefore, the similar example is a pot, etc.

original: yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni brtsal ba las byung ba de'i chos mthun pa'i dpe bum pa la sogs pa de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos brtsal ba las 'byung ba'i spyi dang sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yod
analyzed: yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni brtsal ba las byung ba de'i chos mthun pa'i dpe bum pa la sogs pa de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos brtsal ba las 'byung ba'i spyi dang sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yod
translated: The term “exists” is a term that arises from investigation. The example that is similar to that is a vase and so on. The property to be proven that arises from investigation is the universal. The property of the subject is “because it is impermanent.”

original: pa nyid de /
analyzed: pa nyid de /
translated: “Existence” is the existence of the universal of the property of the thesis that arises from searching and the existence of the sign that is the property of the subject, impermanence.

original: de'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of that, it is called the similar class.

original: de ltar mthun pa'i phyogs de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos brtsal ba las 'byung ba'i spyi dang sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yod pas mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid kyi tshul yang rung /
analyzed: de ltar mthun pa'i phyogs de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos brtsal ba las 'byung ba'i spyi dang sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yod pas mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid kyi tshul yang rung /
translated: Thus, in that similar class, the universal of the property of the thesis that arises from searching and the sign that is the property of the subject, impermanence, exist. Therefore, the mode of existence in the similar class is suitable.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa zhes bya ba la mi mthun pa'i phyogs la zhes bya ba ni brtsal ba las byung ba de'i chos mi mthun pa'i dpe nam mkha' dang glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa la'o //🔽med pa nyid du nges pa zhes bya ba ni brtsal ba las 'byung ba de'i chos mthun pa'i dpe nam mkha' dang glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos brtsal ba las 'byung @164a * //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa zhes bya ba la mi mthun pa'i phyogs la zhes bya ba ni brtsal ba las byung ba de'i chos mi mthun pa'i dpe nam mkha' dang glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa la'o // med pa nyid du nges pa zhes bya ba ni brtsal ba las 'byung ba de'i chos mthun pa'i dpe nam mkha' dang glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos brtsal ba las 'byung @164a * //
translated: “The ascertainment of the absence of the property of the counterexample” means that the example of the dissimilar class, such as space, lightning, and forest flowers, is ascertained as not having the property of the effect of the investigation.🔽“The ascertainment of the absence of the property of the counterexample” means that the example of the similar class, such as space, lightning, and forest flowers, is ascertained as not having the property of the probandum, which is the universal of the effect of the investigation.

original: ba'i spyi dang sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba med pa nyid du nges na ni de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de med pa nyid du
analyzed: ba'i spyi dang sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba med pa nyid du nges na ni de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de med pa nyid du
translated: If the absence of the property of the similar class is ascertained, then at that time the absence of the property of the counterexample is ascertained.

original: nges pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa nyid du nges pa zhes bya ba'i tshul yang rung bas gtan tshigs ma nges pa med pa'i phyir yongs su dag par 'gyur ba zhig na mi mthun pa'i phyogs de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi rtag pa'i
analyzed: nges pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa nyid du nges pa zhes bya ba'i tshul yang rung bas gtan tshigs ma nges pa med pa'i phyir yongs su dag par 'gyur ba zhig na mi mthun pa'i phyogs de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi rtag pa'i
translated: The mode called “certainty” is suitable because there is no uncertainty. Therefore, since there is no uncertainty in the reason, it would be pure.

original: phyir zhes bya ba de med pa nyid du ma nges te /
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba de med pa nyid du ma nges te /
translated: However, in the case of the opponent, the property of the subject, “because of impermanence,” is not ascertained to be nonexistent.🔽In this way, in the case of the opponent, the other part of the subject, space, is ascertained to be nonexistent, because the property of the subject, “because of impermanence,” is nonexistent.

original: 'di ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos nam mkha' la ni sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de med pa nyid du nges pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la med pa yin yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs
analyzed: 'di ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos nam mkha' la ni sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de med pa nyid du nges pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la med pa yin yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs
translated: Therefore, although the property of the subject is nonexistent in one part of the subject, the opponent,

original: cig shos glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yod pa nyid du nges pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos gcig par sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi rtag pa'i
analyzed: cig shos glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yod pa nyid du nges pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos gcig par sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi rtag pa'i
translated: The other is the property of the subject that proves sound is impermanent, because it is a product.

original: phyir zhes bya ba de yod pa de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba de yod pa de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The existence of that property of the subject that proves sound is impermanent, because it is a product, is called uncertain when it exists in one part of the discordant side.

original: de ni de las gzhan dang mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya bas ston to //
analyzed: de ni de las gzhan dang mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya bas ston to //
translated: That is taught by the phrase “it is observed to be similar to that.”

original: de la de las zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs gcig shos de las te /
analyzed: de la de las zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs gcig shos de las te /
translated: In that phrase, “that” refers to the other part of the concordant side.

original: dper na sgra brtsal ba las 'byung bar bsgrub pa dag gi brtsal ba las 'byung ba de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig shos dang nam mkha' lta bu de las so //
analyzed: dper na sgra brtsal ba las 'byung bar bsgrub pa dag gi brtsal ba las 'byung ba de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig shos dang nam mkha' lta bu de las so //
translated: For example, in the proof that sound is a product, the property of the subject that proves sound is a product, because it is audible, exists in one part of the discordant side, such as space.

original: gzhan dang zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos de las gzhan dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs cig shos dang ste /
analyzed: gzhan dang zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos de las gzhan dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs cig shos dang ste /
translated: “Other than that” refers to the other part of the discordant side.

original: dper na sgra brtsal ba las 'byung bar bsgrub pa dag gi brtsal ba las 'byung ba de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos nam mkha' de las gzhan pa brtsal ba las 'byung ba de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos glog dang nags kyi me🔽tog la sogs pa lta bu dang ngo ;
analyzed: dper na sgra brtsal ba las 'byung bar bsgrub pa dag gi brtsal ba las 'byung ba de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos nam mkha' de las gzhan pa brtsal ba las 'byung ba de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa lta bu dang ngo ;
translated: For example, in the proof that sound is a product, the other part of the discordant side is space. Other than that, the other part of the discordant side is lightning, forest fire, and so on.

original: / mthun par dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos de las sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos de yod pa'i phyogs /
analyzed: / mthun par dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos de las sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos de yod pa'i phyogs /
translated: “Observation of the concordant” refers to the presence of the property of the proving subject in the other part of the discordant side.

original: dper na sgra brtsal ba las 'byung bar bsgrub pa dag gi brtsal ba las byung ba de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos glog dang nags kyi me @164b tog la sogs pa de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya
analyzed: dper na sgra brtsal ba las 'byung bar bsgrub pa dag gi brtsal ba las byung ba de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos glog dang nags kyi me @164b tog la sogs pa de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya
translated: For example, in the proof that sound is a product, the occurrence of product is in the dissimilar class of lightning and the flame of a lamp, etc.

original: ba de yod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ba de yod pa lta bu'o //
translated: The property of the subject, “because of impermanence,” exists in that.

original: de ltar na de las gzhan dang mthun par dmigs pa zhes bya ba de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de las gzhan dang mthun par dmigs pa zhes bya ba de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, that which is called “observation of what is similar to it” is to be understood as the uncertainty that exists in one part of the dissimilar class.

original: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: The definition is the definition of a correct inference.

original: des na de ni tshad mar mi rung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: des na de ni tshad mar mi rung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is to be understood as valid knowledge.

original: de la mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the uncertainty that exists in one part of the similar class?

original: dper na sgra brtsal ba las mi 'byung bar bsgrub pa dag gi gtan tshigs lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na sgra brtsal ba las mi 'byung bar bsgrub pa dag gi gtan tshigs lta bu ste /
translated: For example, it is like the reason in the proof that sound is not produced by effort.

original: de yang sgra ni brtsal ba las mi 'byung ste rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang sgra ni brtsal ba las mi 'byung ste rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Sound is not produced by effort because it is permanent.

original: chos mthun pa'i dpe ni nam mkha' dang / glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos mthun pa'i dpe ni nam mkha' dang / glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa'o //
translated: The example that is similar in properties is space, lightning, a forest fire, and so on.

original: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ni bum pa la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ni bum pa la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The example that is dissimilar in properties is a pot and so on.

original: de la yang rjes su dpag go cog ni tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags rang dang gzhan gyi don du rjes su dpag pa yin pas /
analyzed: de la yang rjes su dpag go cog ni tshul gsum pa nyid kyi rtags rang dang gzhan gyi don du rjes su dpag pa yin pas /
translated: In that regard, all inferences are reasons that have the three modes, and they are inferences for oneself and for others.

original: 'dir yang rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid dang / mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul dang sbyar dgos te /
analyzed: 'dir yang rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid dang / mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul dang sbyar dgos te /
translated: Therefore, here too, it is necessary to apply the three modes: existing in the object of inference, existing in the similar class, and not existing in the dissimilar class.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can sgra la'o //
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can sgra la'o //
translated: Here, “existing in the object of inference” means existing in the subject of the object of inference, sound.

original: yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can sgra de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yod pa gcig la grub pa de'i phyir
analyzed: yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can sgra de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yod pa gcig la grub pa de'i phyir
translated: “Existence” is the property of the subject that is to be inferred, sound, which is not found by searching for the property to be established. The property of the subject that is the proof is “because of being permanent.” That exists in one place.🔽Therefore,

original: chos can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos can zhes bya ste /
translated: it is called the “property of the subject.”

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul rung bas kyang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can sgra de la bsgrub par bya ba'i brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yod
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kyi tshul rung bas kyang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos can sgra de la bsgrub par bya ba'i brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yod
translated: The mode of existence in the object to be inferred is also suitable. The property of the subject that is the proof is “because of being permanent.” That exists in the object to be inferred, sound, which is not found by searching for the property to be established.

original: par gcig la ma grub pas 'dir rjes su dpag par bya ba las yod pa nyid kyi tshul yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: par gcig la ma grub pas 'dir rjes su dpag par bya ba las yod pa nyid kyi tshul yang mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not established in one place. Therefore, here the mode of existence in the object to be inferred is also not suitable.🔽“The certainty of nonexistence in the discordant side” is as follows. The discordant side is

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa zhes bya ba la mi mthun pa'i phyogs la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa zhes bya ba la mi mthun pa'i phyogs la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase certainty that it does not exist in the discordant class means that the inferential valid knowledge that is produced in the continuum of a person who has engaged in such reasoning does not conceive the subject, the body, as being the self.

original: brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba de'i chos mi mthun pa'i dpe bum pa la sogs pa la'o //🔽med pa nyid du nges pa zhes bya ba ni brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba de'i chos mi mthun pa'i dpe bum pa la sogs pa de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos brtsal ba las @165a * //
analyzed: brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba de'i chos mi mthun pa'i dpe bum pa la sogs pa la'o // med pa nyid du nges pa zhes bya ba ni brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba de'i chos mi mthun pa'i dpe bum pa la sogs pa de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos brtsal ba las @165a * //
translated: The example of a vase, etc. is the dissimilar instance of that which does not occur through seeking.

original: mi 'byung ba'i spyi dang sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de med pa nyid du nges pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'byung ba'i spyi dang sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de med pa nyid du nges pa ste /
translated: The ascertainment of non-existence is the ascertainment of the non-existence of the probandum, i.e. the universal of that which does not occur through seeking, and the property of the subject, i.e. permanence, in that dissimilar instance, the vase, etc.

original: de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the dissimilar instance.

original: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba'i spyi dang sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de med pa nyid du nges par mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges
analyzed: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba'i spyi dang sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de med pa nyid du nges par mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges
translated: Thus, in that dissimilar instance, the ascertainment of the non-existence of the probandum, i.e. the universal of that which does not occur through seeking, and the property of the subject, i.e. permanence, is the ascertainment of non-existence in the dissimilar instance.

original: par mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul ni mthun pa'i phyogs la zhes bya ba ni brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba las mi 'byung ba de'i chos mthun pa'i dpe nam mkha' dang glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: par mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul ni mthun pa'i phyogs la zhes bya ba ni brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba las mi 'byung ba de'i chos mthun pa'i dpe nam mkha' dang glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa la'o //
translated: The mode of ascertaining that the reason does not exist in the discordant class is as follows: “In the concordant class” means that the reason does not occur in the absence of the property of the subject. The concordant example is space, lightning, and forest flowers, etc.

original: yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba de'i chos mthun pa'i dpe nam mkha' dang glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba'i spyi dang sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi
analyzed: yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba de'i chos mthun pa'i dpe nam mkha' dang glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba'i spyi dang sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi
translated: “Existence” means that the reason does not occur in the absence of the property of the subject. The concordant example is space, lightning, and forest flowers, etc.🔽In that, the property of the subject, which is the absence of occurrence due to investigation, and the reason, “because of being permanent,” exist.

original: chos rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yod pa nyid yin na ni de'i tshe mthun pa'i phyogs de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yod pa nyid yin pas mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid ces bya ba'i tshul rung
analyzed: chos rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yod pa nyid yin na ni de'i tshe mthun pa'i phyogs de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yod pa nyid yin pas mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid ces bya ba'i tshul rung
translated: If existence exists, then at that time, the reason, “because of being permanent,” which is the property of the subject, exists in the concordant class. Therefore, the mode called “existence in the concordant class” is suitable.

original: ba zhig na mthun pa'i phyogs de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yod pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: ba zhig na mthun pa'i phyogs de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yod pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: But in the other similar class, the reason, “because of being permanent,” does not exist.

original: 'di ltar mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yod pa nyid ma yin pas mthun pa'i phyogs gcig la med pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yod pa nyid ma yin pas mthun pa'i phyogs gcig la med pa nyid yin la /
translated: Thus, in the other similar class, lightning, a forest fire, and so on, the reason, “because of being permanent,” does not exist. Therefore, the reason does not exist in one similar class.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos nam mkha' la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yod pa nyid tsam du zad pas mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos nam mkha' la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yod pa nyid tsam du zad pas mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba
translated: But in the other similar class, space, the reason, “because of being permanent,” merely exists. Therefore, the reason, “because of being permanent,” exists in one similar class.

original: de yod pa de ni mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de yod pa de ni mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That is called “uncertain with respect to one similar class.”

original: de ni de las gzhan dang mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ston to //
analyzed: de ni de las gzhan dang mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ston to //
translated: It is called the “characteristic of the observation of the dissimilar.”

original: de la de las zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs cig shos de las te /
analyzed: de la de las zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs cig shos de las te /
translated: In that regard, “from that” means from the other part of the similar class.

original: dper na sgrub pa brtsal ba las mi 'byung bar bsgrub pa dag gi brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba de'i mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos nam mkha' lta bu de las so //
analyzed: dper na sgrub pa brtsal ba las mi 'byung bar bsgrub pa dag gi brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba de'i mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos nam mkha' lta bu de las so //
translated: For example, in the proof that sound is not a product, “not a product” is the property of the subject. The other part of the similar class is like space.

original: gzhan dang @165b zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos de las gzhan pa mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos dang ste /
analyzed: gzhan dang @165b zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos de las gzhan pa mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos dang ste /
translated: “ Dissimilar” means from the other part of the similar class.

original: dper na sgra brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba de'i mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos nam mkha' de las gzhan pa brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba de'i mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa lta bu dang ngo //
analyzed: dper na sgra brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba de'i mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos nam mkha' de las gzhan pa brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba de'i mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa lta bu dang ngo //
translated: For example, in the proof that sound is not a product, “not a product” is the property of the subject. The other part of the similar class is like space. The dissimilar is like lightning, a forest fire, and so on.

original: mi mthun pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos de yod pa'i don to //🔽dper na sgra la brtsal ba las mi 'byung bar bsgrub pa dag gi brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba de'i tshe mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos cig shos glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa de las sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rtogs pa'i phyir bya
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos de la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos de yod pa'i don to // dper na sgra la brtsal ba las mi 'byung bar bsgrub pa dag gi brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba de'i tshe mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos cig shos glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa de las sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos rtogs pa'i phyir bya
translated: The meaning of “observation of a dissimilar instance” is that the property of the proving subject is present in the dissimilar instance of the similar class.

original: ba de med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ba de med pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in the proof that sound is not a product of effort, the dissimilar instance is lightning and a forest fire, etc. Because the property of the proving subject, being a product of effort, is present in those, the property of the probandum, being impermanent, is also present in them.

original: phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos de med par grub na mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa zhar la 'grub pas /
analyzed: phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos de med par grub na mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa zhar la 'grub pas /
translated: If the property of the proving subject is established as absent in one instance of the dissimilar class, then its presence in one instance of the similar class is established as a matter of course.

original: de'i phyir de la gzhan dang mi mthun par dmigs pa zhes bya ba de ni mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la gzhan dang mi mthun par dmigs pa zhes bya ba de ni mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the observation of something dissimilar in that respect is known to be an uncertain reason in regard to one instance of the similar class.

original: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa yongs su ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa yongs su ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: The so-called “definition” is the definition of an impure inference.

original: des na de yang tshad mar mi rung bar rig par bya'o //🔽yang rnam pa gzhan du na mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa ni de las gzhan dang mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya bas bstan la /
analyzed: des na de yang tshad mar mi rung bar rig par bya'o // yang rnam pa gzhan du na mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa ni de las gzhan dang mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya bas bstan la /
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that that is not a valid means of cognition.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa ni de las gzhan dang mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya bas bstan par yang sbyar du rung ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa ni de las gzhan dang mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya bas bstan par yang sbyar du rung ste /
translated: Moreover, it is also suitable to apply the other mode of explanation, where the uncertainty that exists in one part of the concordant side is taught by the definition of “observation of something concordant with that,” and the uncertainty that exists in one part of the discordant side is taught by the definition of “observation of something discordant with that.”

original: de la mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa de las gzhan dang mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang sbyar na /
analyzed: de la mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa'i ma nges pa de las gzhan dang mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang sbyar na /
translated: In that regard, if the uncertainty that exists in one part of the concordant side is applied to the definition of “observation of something concordant with that,”

original: de las zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig shos de las te /
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig shos de las te /
translated: “that” refers to the other part of the concordant side.

original: dper na sgra brtsal ba las mi 'byung bar bsgrub pa dag gi brtsal ba las mi 'byung ba de'i mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs cig shos glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa lta bu de la'o //
